subject: Re: Project Definition Submission guidelines
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly verify your Project group details in the attached sheet. You are also required to submit a brief abstract (technical summary) of your project, highlighting the functional
content:
*Dear Students,*

Kindly verify your Project group details in the attached sheet. You are
also required to submit a *brief abstract (technical summary)* of your
project, highlighting the *functional requirements* and *scope of the
system*.

*Deadline:* 19/06/2025
*Sheet Link: *
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16K9ulh_90nuF2H7UUqBfSTLwqdW4plw_Yif38ylSTwQ/edit?usp=sharing

Please refer to your *respective semester and branch sheet*, and enter the
abstract in *Column G*.

>>> On Fri, Jun 13, 2025 at 5:17â€¯PM Parth Goel <parthgoel.ce@charusat.ac.in>
>>> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Dear Sir/Madam,
>>>>
>>>> The following key points were discussed in todayâ€™s project coordination
>>>> meeting with Pravin Sir (Offline) and Ashish Sir (Online):
>>>>
>>>>    1. *Deadline Discipline*
>>>>       - From upcoming task allocation, students should be made aware
>>>>       of the importance of meeting deadlines and completing tasks on time. You
>>>>       should start reporting of students before deadline.
>>>>    2. *Internal and External Guide Allocation*
>>>>       - External guides will be assigned to students for their
>>>>       projects. A list of external guides along with their respective domains
>>>>       will be shared shortly.
>>>>       - Internal Guide allocation should be done based on the domain
>>>>       expertise and competency of the faculty. *Do not wait for the
>>>>       external guide list, share internal guide as per the deadline.*
>>>>       External guide can be given at later stage.
>>>>    3. *Periodic Reporting and Documentation*
>>>>       - Students are required to report periodically to both their
>>>>       internal and external guides.
>>>>       - A proper record of communication and progress must be
>>>>       maintained in a physical project file by the students, including:
>>>>          - A *logbook*
>>>>          - *Weekly reports* signed and dated by the internal guide
>>>>          - *Email copies* of communication with the external guide
>>>>       4. *Project Review Schedule and Rubrics*
>>>>       - Share the *project review examination dates* with students in
>>>>       advance.
>>>>       - The evaluation committee are requested to prepare *assessment
>>>>       rubrics* at least *two weeks before* each review and share the
>>>>       same with students in coordination with project coordinators.
>>>>       - Reviews should align with the month-wise expected project
>>>>       progress. The complexity of tasks and expectations should gradually
>>>>       increase with each review (e.g., Review 1 < Review 2).
>>>>       - For *7th semester students*, as the project carries higher
>>>>       credits, the tasks and their rubrics must appropriately emphasize this
>>>>       aspect.
>>>>       - If available, *external guides may also attend* the project
>>>>       reviews.
>>>>
>>>> As per the email dated *21st May 2025*, with the subject *"Project
>>>> Timeline and Key Activities for A.Y. 2025â€“26 (5th & 7th Semester)"*,
>>>> you are kindly requested to:
>>>>
>>>>    - Share the *guide allocation list* with the students
>>>>    - Proceed with further steps as per the above-discussed points
>>>>    - Conduct a meeting with students *within the next 3 working days*
>>>>    to explain the importance of above guidelines
>>>>
>>>> Thank you.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>

subject: Invitation to Participate in Online Quiz on 11th International Day of Yoga â€“ Organized by NSS-PDPIAS Unit
snippet: Dear All, Warm Greetings! On the occasion of the 11th International Day of Yoga, the NSS Unit of PDPIAS is organising an Online Quiz to spread awareness about the ancient Indian practice of Yoga and
content:
Dear All,

Warm Greetings!

On the occasion of the *11th International Day of Yoga*, the *NSS Unit of
PDPIAS* is organising an *Online Quiz* to spread awareness about the
ancient Indian practice of Yoga and its significance in our daily lives.

We invite all students, faculties, staff and CHARUSAT family members to
participate in this engaging and informative quiz enthusiastically.

*Date:* 17th June 2025
*Mode:* Online
*Quiz Link:* https://forms.gle/Pvc3gGbRbmEGZC6k6
*Time: *10:00 AM to 03:00 PM

*E-certificates* will be provided to all participants on or before June 19,
2025, via email.

The quiz aims to promote the importance of Yoga for physical and mental
well-being and to honour the spirit of this global celebration.

Let us come together and celebrate *Yoga for harmony and peace*.

For any queries, please contact: Dr. Rajesh V. Savalia, M. 94292 22899

-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“ 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26
ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
ğŸ” What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
ğŸ’¡ Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

ğŸ”— Student Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
ğŸ”— General IEEE Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
ğŸ§© Available Branches

   1. Main Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)

ğŸ“Œ Positions Available

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEEâ€™s mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.
ğŸ“ How to Apply

Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
and an interview later on.

ğŸ“‹ Apply Now
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

subject: Fwd: Call for Student Mentees - IEEE IAYPC Career Mentoring Program 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Please explore the opportunity for a better technical career provided by IEEE. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dr. Chengappa Munjandira <chengappa.mr@ieee.org> Date:
content:
Dear Students,

Please explore the opportunity for a better technical career provided by
IEEE.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Chengappa Munjandira <chengappa.mr@ieee.org>
Date: Sun, Jun 15, 2025 at 9:57â€¯AM
Subject: Call for Student Mentees - IEEE IAYPC Career Mentoring Program 2025
To:


If you are having trouble reading this message, click here
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=lDU9uOgEmixhTa4mlx4L_85jSNTo6kEPdkeVZWXuQQOrb0uD8aVexOLfb2q9fLbF80ztjbUPF8nQJWrX8wDieQ~~&t=LjRDIquXJkTX64XoXS9OwQ~~>
for the web version.

Dear IEEE Members,



Greetings from the IEEE India Council Industry-Academia Young Professionals
Committee (IAYPC) 2025.

We are happy to announce the launch of the *Career Mentoring Program (CMP)*
for pre-final and final-year undergraduate students from CSE, IT, ECE, EEE,
and allied engineering branches. If you are eager to plan your career
smartly, gain exposure to industry insights, and grow your professional
network â€” this is the opportunity for you!

*CMP 2025 Program Objective*

The Career Mentoring Program (CMP) is a structured initiative aimed at
providing personalized guidance and mentorship to students by pairing them
with experienced academic and industry professionals. The goal is to help
students make informed career decisions, explore global opportunities, and
build a mind-set for continuous learning and leadership. Through one-on-one
interactions, expert talks, mock interviews, and skill-building workshops,
the program fosters holistic development and industry readiness.

*ğŸŒŸ** Program Highlights*

ğŸ’¡ One-on-One Mentorship with Industry and Academic Experts

ğŸ“ Career Planning & Higher Studies Guidance

ğŸ“¢ Expert Sessions, Tech Talks, Capsule Courses

ğŸ§  Mock Interviews & Upskilling Workshops

ğŸ“ˆ Personalized Monthly Reviews and Feedback

ğŸ“ƒ Certificate from IEEE India Council upon Completion

ğŸ… Special Recognition for Outstanding Mentees



*Eligibility Criteria*

Pre-final or final-year B.E./B.Tech. students

Disciplines: CSE, IT, ECE, EEE, or related fields

Willingness to commit 7â€“8 hours per month for mentoring activities

ğŸ“… *Important Dates*

Application Deadline: 20 June 2025

Induction Meeting: 18 July 2025

Program Duration: 21 July â€“ 30 November 2025

ğŸ’° *Registration Fee*

IEEE Members: â‚¹500 + GST

Non-IEEE Members: â‚¹650 + GST

(Proof of payment will be required during form submission)

ğŸ“ *Apply Now*

Seats are limited and applications will be processed on a first-come,
first-served basis.

ğŸ”— Fill out the form here: https://ieeeindiacouncil.org/iaypc-2025/
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=Py1UpWwRTFgjJ-sNwPEyXAdSoHOXJn1DSi4yTCv6e4zJgDg22uJ1xsSsLvONz0gy6UcdLrI4m8EnZWxGOJKjuQ~~&t=LjRDIquXJkTX64XoXS9OwQ~~>



For any queries, feel free to connect with the program coordinators:

*Dr. R. Suganya (VIT) email: suganya.ramamoorthy@vit.ac.in
<suganya.ramamoorthy@vit.ac.in>*

*Dr. Nisha G K (MBCET) email: nisha.gk@mbcet.ac.in <nisha.gk@mbcet.ac.in>*



Join us in this transformative journey to shape your future with clarity,
confidence, and competence. Let your career take a leap with guidance from
the best in the field. We invite you to join us and please share this
information with others who may benefit from it.



Please find the attached flyer and for more updates follow us on LinkedIn
handle: IAYPC 2025 (
https://www.linkedin.com/company/ieee-india-council-industry-academia-young-professional-committee/
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=ZF9lgMLdk6My9nd1JVwxseO94rCszSsA2EK2i1EX_phhMTV0pBLLzy4B0AHM1lFLTgE3W1kGgPj2TmNoOrQ01w~~&t=LjRDIquXJkTX64XoXS9OwQ~~>
)

Warm regards,

*TEAM IAYPC 2025*


Dr. Ruchika Gupta, Chandigarh University (Convener)

Dr. Mansi Subhedar, PHCET (Co-Convener)

Dr. Anand Raje, IIFON (Co-Convener)

Dr. John Jose, IIT Guwahati (Advisor)

Dr. Chengappa Munjandira, (Vice Chair Industry Relations IC)
India Council : https://ieeeindiacouncil.org
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=4AZDhidz6uEMLVlZXFpgtO42xWFhYXakfTAMqUD6yq-25f3ciJYEd6Ef_hv0u1RQYSQNbePdM3IcF3kFkEkI1A~~&t=LjRDIquXJkTX64XoXS9OwQ~~>
------------------------------
Manage your IEEE Communication Preferences at the IEEE Privacy Portal
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=RZ01EKEcNmVLVTpL_c46pRS1eA64h3mdaa6xyaLkACRt3XDCty-v5IrfOFIa6LS3sptI7YcWwUTi3tqOzloRhg~~&t=LjRDIquXJkTX64XoXS9OwQ~~>




-- 



*Warm regards,*
*Dhruv Rupapara*
Chair â€“ IEEE CASS Student Chapter
(Gujarat's First Ever Established Chapter)
IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
Gujarat Section, Region 10
Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering,
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT),
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT), Changa â€“ 388421
------------------------------

*Appreciate your timeâ€”have a wonderful day!**Wishing you a productive and
positive day ahead.*

subject: Lovable is free to use this weekend!
snippet: Hey, we have some exciting news: Lovable is free to use this weekend Lovable is free for everyone over this weekend, starting now until Sunday 15th of June 23:59 CET! During this time, credits will not
content:
Lovable Logo

Hey, we have some exciting news:

-----------------------------------
Lovable is free to use this weekend
-----------------------------------

Lovable is free for everyone over this weekend, starting now until Sunday 15th of June 23:59 CET!

During this time, credits will not be deducted when making prompts.

There might be rate limits during high demand, where paid users get prioritized access.

Start building for free: lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev/ )

---------------
The AI Showdown
---------------

The reason Lovable is free this weekend is because we've partnered with OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google to host The AI Showdown: a public comparison of the worldâ€™s leading AI models.

During The AI Showdown, for the first time, you will be able to easily switch what AI model to power Lovable.

During the weekend we're hosting two competitions:

* Content challenge ($25,000 prize): Create the best content focused on comparing the capabilities of the models inside Lovable.
* Build challenge ($40,000 prize): A build challenge to showcase what each model can create inside Lovable.

You can participate and follow the live model comparison dashboard at: aishowdown.lovable.app ( https://aishowdown.lovable.app/ )

Learn more about The AI Showdown here ( https://x.com/lovable_dev/status/1933643500727222322 ).

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Lovable Logo

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

Unsubscribe ( http://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTmjgoDAK2XqAOsl6gDAZdtXrT336xfhnb1FbYHig== )

subject: Learn how to build apps with the MERN Stack [Free 4-hour course on Full Stack JavaScript]
snippet: Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time: 1. Learn how to build your own full-stack JavaScript apps. freeCodeCamp just published a comprehensive course on the
content:
Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time:

1. Learn how to build your own full-stack JavaScript apps. freeCodeCamp just published a comprehensive course on the popular MERN Stack. MERN stands for MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js. These are the key tools that a lot of modern web apps use, including freeCodeCamp's platform itself. You'll learn how to build your user interface, handle data routing, and even rate-limit your back end API â€“ so you can stop your app from getting overwhelmed by all those bots out there that are scraping the web for LLM training data. (4 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-the-mern-stack-in-2025/

2. Learn MLOps by building your own system that can run sentiment analysis on YouTube videos. The emerging field of ML Ops is a hybrid of Machine Learning and System Administration (AKA Ops). This comprehensive course will give you a solid project-oriented intro to MLOps. You'll learn about Data Preprocessing, AI Model Benchmarking, Hyperparameter Tuning, Ensemble Techniques and more. (3 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-mlops-by-creating-a-youtube-sentiment-analyzer/

3. On this week's freeCodeCamp podcast, I interview former CTO and prolific programming teacher Hitesh Choudhary. He shares lessons he's learned from personally mentoring dozens of software engineers over the years. He also talks about India's higher education system. And he gives tons of tips for managing your time as a developer. I had a blast learning from Hitesh and I think you will, too. (1 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/from-electrical-engineering-student-to-cto-with-hitesh-choudhary-podcast-175/

4. freeCodeCamp published a new handbook on the emerging architecture paradigm of Micro Frontends. You'll learn why this approach is gaining so much steam among software engineers. This handbook will teach you all about Module Federation, Cross-Window Messaging, the Shadow DOM, and more. (full-length handbook): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/complete-micro-frontends-guide/

5. And we published a handbook on Apple's code signing process. If you want to publish mobile apps in the Apple store, this handbook is a real lifesaver. It would have saved freeCodeCamp's team a ton of time when we were publishing the freeCodeCamp iOS app. We're going to publish a lot more hyper-specific handbooks like this in the future to make developers' lives a bit easier. Bookmark this and you can come back to it when you're ready to publish your first app. (full-length handbook): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/apple-code-signing-handbook/

I've had a great time learning so much this week, and I hope you're learning a ton, too. The world is changing fast â€“ both for better and for worse. It's perhaps more important than ever that you and I be able to adapt to all these changes. The freeCodeCamp community has got your back, and we're going to help you keep up with these new developments. I encourage you to return the favor by supporting our charity and our mission: https://www.freecodecamp.org/donate

Quote of the Week: 
â€œYou will not get opportunities unless you prove yourself first. And for proving yourself, there is no hiring manager coming to your door and saying, â€˜Hey, please build something for me.â€™ You have to prove it by contributing to open source.â€ â€” Software Engineer and programming teacher Hitesh Choudhary, on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

Until next week, happy coding.

-- Quincy Larson

Teacher and founder of freeCodeCamp.org

If these aren't worth your time, you can turn them off: https://www.freecodecamp.org/ue/7uPiOikwLHMaXKgByb7Pv

content:

IT362 Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Information Technology  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/Nzg2NDIxNTAwMDEz?email%3Dd24dit079@charusat.edu.in&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

Overview of course objectives, expectations, and grading.


    -
    Lecture: The history of Artificial Intelligence â€“ key milestones and  
developments.

    -
    Activity: Class discussion on modern AI applications students are  
familiar with.






    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Understanding AI problems (e.g., problem-solving, perception, language  
understanding).

    -
    Overview of common AI techniques (search, logic, knowledge  
representation).






Activity: Interactive quiz on AI techniques.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Applications in healthcare, finance, autonomous systems, and more.

    -
    Strong AI vs Weak AI â€“ Key differences and real-world examples.






Lab Activity: Identify whether given AI scenarios represent Strong or Weak  
AI.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Understanding the Turing Test and its significance.

    -
    The concept of Rationality in AI systems.






Activity: Role-playing the Turing Test with mock scenarios.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Ethics of AI â€“ Bias, accountability, and decision-making.

    -
    Ensuring safety in AI systems.






Group Discussion: Debate on "Should AI have ethical guidelines?"







    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Understanding Breadth-First Search (BFS) and Depth-First Search (DFS).

    -
    Use cases and limitations of these algorithms.






Lab Activity: Implement BFS and DFS in Python.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Concept and application of Generate and Test Algorithm.






Lab Activity: Solve simple puzzles using the Generate and Test approach.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Hill Climbing Algorithm â€“ Steps and variants.

    -
    Introduction to Simulated Annealing â€“ Concept and advantages.






Lab Activity: Comparison of Hill Climbing and Simulated Annealing through  
implementation.



**

    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    A* Algorithm â€“ Heuristic search explained.

    -
    AO* Algorithm â€“ Decision-making in AND-OR graphs.






Lab Activity: Implement A* to find the shortest path in a maze.





    -
    -
    Lecture:

    -
    Introduction to game-playing AI.

    -
    Minimax Algorithm â€“ Concept and implementation in a two-player game.






Lab Activity: Build a simple tic-tac-toe game using Minimax Algorithm.

subject: Invitation to participate in 11th International Yoga Day - Online Debate Competition organized byÂ IIIMÂ NSSÂ Cell
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!! To celebrate the 11th International Yoga Day, Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an Online Debate competition on
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!!

To celebrate the *11th International Yoga Day,* Indukaka Ipcowala Institute
of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an *Online Debate competition*
 on *June 20, 2025 (Friday).*



*Online Debate Competition â€“ Event Details:*

*Date:* June 20, 2025
*Time:* 10:30 AM Onward
*Theme:* Yoga for One Earth, One Health* (Topics to be provided one hour
prior to the scheduled start of the competition)*

*Registration Process:*
Interested participants are requested to register latest by *June 19,
2025* *till
12 PM* using the following link: https://forms.gle/Qzf1YCSnSnDxqFX68

*Online Debate Format:*
*The structure and flow of the debate will be determined based on the total
number of registered participants. Topics will be shared with participants
one hour prior to the competition.*

*Proposed Rounds:*

   1. *Preliminary Round:*
      - Each participant will speak for 3 minutes, either *for* or
*against* the
      motion.
      - Top-performing speakers from the preliminary round will advance to
      the final round.
   2. *Final Round (Crossfire & Closing Statement):*
      - A crossfire round will be conducted, where the selected
      participants will engage in a Q&A session with each other and the judges.
      - Each finalist will then present a 1-minute closing statement.

*Judging Criteria:*

   - Content & Knowledge
   - Delivery & Clarity
   - Rebuttal & Defence
   - Engagement & Time Adherence

*Certificates:*


   - Winners will be awarded 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes.
   - All participants will receive a Certificate of Participation.


Together let's make this International Yoga Day memorable. We look forward
to your cooperation at this extraordinary
International Yoga Day Celebration.



Please contact* IIIM NSS Coordinators: *Dr. Poonam Amrutia (+91 94295
58484); Mr. Brijesh Patel (+91 97370 23027) for further details.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Re: Research Project Contribution
snippet: Dear Student Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification model
content:
Dear Student

Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
our academic email classification model.

As promised, your data will be used strictly for academic purposes, and
only informational emails will be processed. Your contribution will also be
acknowledged in our final presentation/report.

To make the process simple, weâ€™ve prepared a Google Drive folder containing:

A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox.

A short instruction video explaining exactly how to run the script safely
and securely.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing


The video is inside the same folder, titled â€œEmail Extraction
Instructions.mp4â€.


The link to provide the extracted emails is given below

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
Please go through the video before running the script. If you have any
doubts or face any issues at any step, feel free to reach out to us â€” we're
more than happy to help!

Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
project. Your support means a lot to us!

Warm regards,
Vansh Malani â€“ 23DCS056
James Dhandhukiya â€“ 23DCS023
Jugvi Desai â€“ 23DCS021

snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! A calm mind and strong body being from YOGA. Interested one's can apply, more details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From:
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

A calm mind and strong body being from YOGA. Interested one's can apply,
more details are in trailing mail.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Coordinator NSS Cell - CHARUSAT <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 11:49â€¯AM
Subject: ğŸŒ¿ Invitation to Participate in Yogya 2025 â€“ University-Level
Online Yoga Competition | International Yoga Day Celebration
To: <family@charusat.edu.in>, Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in
>
Cc: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Faculty Members and Students,*

Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell!

On the occasion of *International Yoga Day 2025*, we are delighted to
announce *â€œYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challengeâ€*, a university-level
online yoga competition organized by *NSS ARIP* (Ashok & Rita Patel
Institute of Physiotherapy) under the *CHARUSAT NSS Cell*, in collaboration
with the PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SECTION.

This event is an opportunity to showcase your passion for yoga, creativity,
and mindfulness while celebrating the spirit of health and harmony.
[image: âœ¨] Themes for Yogya 2025

   1. Yoga for the Mindful Generation
   2. Breathe In Positivity, Breathe Out Stress
   3. Stretch to Destress
   4. Unity in Diversity â€“ Yoga Beyond Borders
   5. Unplug to Connect: Digital Detox through Yoga

[image: ğŸ§˜] Participation Guidelines

   - Submit a 1â€“2 minute video demonstrating 3â€“5 yoga asanas.
   - Choose any one theme and express it through your flow.
   - Top 10 participants will be invited to perform live in the final round via
   an online platform. (Zoom or Google Meet)
   - Entries will be judged on technique, flow, creativity, and thematic
   expression.

[image: ğŸ“…] Key Dates

   - Last Date for Registration & Submission: 16/06/2025
   - Final Round (Live via online platform): 19/06/2025 (Timings will be
   communicated - preferably evening around  6:00 pm)
   - Result Announcement: 20/06/2025

[image: ğŸ†] Awards & Recognition

   -

   Best Yoga Performer (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Most Creative Flow (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Best Video Setup (Student and Faculty)

[image: ğŸ“œ] E-certificates will be awarded to all participants.


[image: ğŸ“¥] Register & Upload Your Video Here:
https://forms.gle/s7enhcCicAPNZ8N99


For any queries, feel free to contact:

   - Dr. Shreya Swami (PT) â€“ +91-6353651313 - shreyaswami.phy@charusat.ac.in
   - Dr. Disha Shah (PT) â€“ +91-9974790312 â€“ dishashah.phy@charusat.ac.in

We warmly invite all students and faculty members to participate in this
celebration of health, balance, and inner strength. Letâ€™s bend, breathe,
and belong â€” together !!

*Jay Hind !!*
CHARUSAT NSS Cell !!
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*



-- 
Thanks & Regards,



-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

Dear All
You are requested to circulate the below email received from i-Create,
Gujarat, to all interested students , faculty for startup and innovations.


Subject: ProtoQuik Launchpad, Cohort 1: Robotics from iCreate

I am reaching out to you to introduce *ProtoQuik Launchpad, Cohort 1*:
*Robotics*, and seeking your help to identify and attract high-potential
teams and innovators. It would be immensely helpful if you could share the
attached outreach material with your network of students, alumni,
faculty-led startups, or affiliated incubation centers. More details are
available in the attached brochure and webpage:
https://protoquik.icreate.org.in/

This one-of-a-kind programme is designed to help students, innovators and
startups bridge the critical *TRL-4 to TRL-7 gap* â€“ often referred to as
the â€œ*Valley of Death*â€. Through a *fully sponsored* and intensive
*30-day* journey,
selected participants will gain:
âœ… Up to â‚¹200K prototyping support
âœ… Opportunity to pitch for funding from a â‚¹20 Million pool
âœ… Expert-led sessions & one-on-one mentoring
âœ… Support to refine your prototype into an MVP
âœ… Access to mentors, designers, vendors & suppliers
âœ… Full access to iCreate's labs & fabrication facilities
âœ… Networking with investors, startups, and industry leaders
âœ… Pilot deployment opportunities & public showcases

All program benefits are fully sponsored (worth â‚¹500K), including lodging
and boarding.

The first cohort is exclusively for *robotics *startups and innovators,
especially those working on solutions in areas such as autonomous mobility,
underwater systems, vertical climbing robots, snake bots for search &
rescue, and more.

*Program Duration: *01 â€“ 31 July 2025
*Location*: iCreate Campus
*Applications close on*: 15 June 2025

We believe this programme aligns well with the national vision to
strengthen Indiaâ€™s Deep Tech and robotics innovation ecosystem. Your
support in spreading the word would go a long way in making this initiative
a success.

Please feel free to reach out if you need any more information or if you'd
like to nominate specific candidates or teams.

Kind regards,
Hiren Yadav



*Hiren Yadav*

*Team Marketing & Outreach*

 *Campus:* Opp. Kensville Golf Club & Resort, Off Bavla Rajkot Highway, Deo
Dholera Village, Ahmedabad 382240

*City Office:* 1st Floor, GMDC Building, 132 Ft Ring Road, Vastrapur,
Ahmedabad 380052
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/132+Ft+Ring+Road,+Vastrapur,+Ahmedabad+380052?entry=gmail&source=g>

--

content:
On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 4:43â€¯PM Abcd Efg <efg5726@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Kevin,
>
> Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The *World
> Hackathon* is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers,
> designers, and innovators like you to participate.
>
> This virtual event brings together brilliant minds from around the globe
> to collaborate, learn, and build groundbreaking solutions. Whether you're a
> seasoned hacker or new to hackathons, the World Hackathon offers an
> incredible opportunity to:
>
>    - *Solve real-world problems:* Work on challenging tracks and develop
>    solutions that can make a real impact.
>    - *Collaborate internationally:* Team up with participants from
>    diverse backgrounds and expand your network.
>    - *Learn and grow:* Access workshops, mentorship, and resources to
>    enhance your skills.
>    - *Win exciting prizes:* Compete for recognition and rewards.
>
> ------------------------------
>
> *Event Details:*
>
>    - *Website:* https://world-hackathon.devpost.com/
>    - *Registration Deadline:* 14-06-2025
>    - *Event Dates:* 14-06-2025 TO 20-06-2025
>
> ------------------------------
>
> Ready to make your mark? Visit our Devpost page to learn more about the
> challenges, rules, and how to register.
>
> We can't wait to see what you'll create!
>
> Best regards,
>
> The World Hackathon Team

subject: Request for Email Data Contribution â€“ Research Acknowledgment Included
snippet: Dear fellow student, We hope you're doing well. We are a group of students working on a research project focused on analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model that can
content:
*Dear fellow student,*

We hope you're doing well.

We are a group of students working on a research project focused on
analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model
that can automatically classify academic emails â€” such as faculty
announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship
opportunities.

We are reaching out to a few *handpicked students*, and we believe your
contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. As
a token of appreciation, all contributors will be *acknowledged in our
final research presentation/report*.

Please rest assured:

Â·       Your data will be used *strictly for academic and research
 purposes*.

Â·        We are only interested in academic/informational emails, *not
personal content*.

Â·        *No data will be collected without your clear consent*, and we
will *explain the data extraction process in detail* if you agree to help.

If you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach
out. We truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led
research a success!

*Note:* Please reach out to us if you agree by 15th June 2025.



Warm regards,

Vansh Malani, 23DCS056

James Dhandhukiya, 23DCS023

Jugvi Desai, 23DCS021

NEW CAREER PATH 

Build experiences that put users first


UX Designers work at the intersection of design, product, and engineering to 
create intuitive, accessible sites and apps. Whether youâ€™re starting a new 
career, launching a business, or looking to collaborate better with your 
coworkers, our newUX Designer 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/ux-designer-career-path?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=curriculum25_uxdesign_careerpath&utm_content=announcement_text>
 career path offers step-by-step guidance for solving real problems through

<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/ux-designer-career-path?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=curriculum25_uxdesign_careerpath&utm_content=announcement__img3>

subject: Join the World Hackathon and Innovate Globally!
snippet: Hi Kevin, Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The World Hackathon is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers, designers, and innovators like you to
content:
Hi Kevin,

Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The *World
Hackathon* is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers,
designers, and innovators like you to participate.

This virtual event brings together brilliant minds from around the globe to
collaborate, learn, and build groundbreaking solutions. Whether you're a
seasoned hacker or new to hackathons, the World Hackathon offers an
incredible opportunity to:

   - *Solve real-world problems:* Work on challenging tracks and develop
   solutions that can make a real impact.
   - *Collaborate internationally:* Team up with participants from diverse
   backgrounds and expand your network.
   - *Learn and grow:* Access workshops, mentorship, and resources to
   enhance your skills.
   - *Win exciting prizes:* Compete for recognition and rewards.

------------------------------

*Event Details:*

   - *Website:* https://world-hackathon.devpost.com/
   - *Registration Deadline:* 14-06-2025
   - *Event Dates:* 14-06-2025 TO 20-06-2025

------------------------------

Ready to make your mark? Visit our Devpost page to learn more about the
challenges, rules, and how to register.

We can't wait to see what you'll create!

Best regards,

The World Hackathon Team
[image: imagy-image.jpg]

subject: Embrace Harmony: Yoga & Nature Session
snippet: Dear All, As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations, CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental
content:
Dear All,

As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations,
CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events
promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental consciousness.

Join us for our special "Yoga & Nature" Session, designed to connect your
well-being with the serenity of the outdoors.

*Event Details:*

   - *What:* "Yoga & Nature" Session
   - *When:* June 16th to June 20th, 2025
   - *Time:* 5:30 PM to 6:45 PM daily
   - *Where:* Centre Lawn, CHARUSAT Campus

This session offers a unique opportunity to experience the profound
benefits of Yoga amidst nature, aligning with this year's IDY theme: "Yoga
for One Earth, One Health." Let's come together to foster holistic
well-being and environmental sustainability.

*Kindly confirm your registration by clicking on:  *
https://forms.gle/qoQfRvsiWWLv1Kmy7

*Who can attend:* All CHARUSAT students, faculty, staff, and the wider
community are welcome!

Please bring: Your own yoga mat and a water bottle.

E-Certificates will be provided to all participants.

Let's celebrate the spirit of Yoga and its connection to our planet. We
look forward to seeing you there!

*For more information, please contact:*
Dr.Pritesh Patel
-- 
Assistant Director of Physical Education and Sports
CHARUSAT Physical Education and Sports Section
(A constituent of CHARUSAT)
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, GOI*
*Accredited with Centre of Excellence by GOG*
Landline No: 02697-265036
Mobile : -- 97142 96999

--

subject: Supa Update May 2025
snippet: Supabase Update â€” May 2025 Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in ğŸ‘‹ Here's everything that happened with Supabase in the last month: Take the Survey: State of Startups 2025 Take the Survey: State of
content:
()

*****************************
Supabase Update â€” May 2025
*****************************

Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in,

Hereâ€™s everything that happened with Supabase in the last month:

## Take the Survey: State of Startups 2025

Take our survey and tell us how youâ€™re building in 2025. Everyone who completes the survey gets a free t-shirt. Supply your startup name, and thereâ€™s a chance weâ€™ll mention it in the final report, too.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-take-survey-startups-may2025-zqby)]

## New Supabase Dashboard homepage

Weâ€™ve simplified the Supabase Dashboard homepage so you can identify important actions easier.

[[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-supabase-dashboard-update-may2025-6btg)]

## Figma Make supports Supabase

At the CONFIG conference, Figma announced Figma Make with support for Supabase.

[[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-figma-make-supabase-may2025-7kjy)]

## Index Advisor

You can now create an index with one click from the â€œindex advisorâ€ section

[[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-index-advisor-create-may2025-4nt9)]

## Quick Product Announcements

- Sort tables directly from column headers. [[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-sort-tables-headers-may2025-3oa4)]
- Copy table definitions from within the Supabase Dashboard [[Twitter](https://x.com/dshukertjr/status/1928436481473056914)]
- Sign in with Solana now available. [[Docs](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-web3)]

## Made with Supabase

- Backlog.rip is a free and open-source library manager for video games. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-backlog-rip-library-may2025-41ue)] [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-backlog-rip-library-may2025-yuos)]
- SuperKit  A modern, lightweight starter kit for Next.js with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-superkit-nextjs-tailwind-may2025-5dlw)] [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-superkit-next-typescript-may2025-ts8i)]
- SikumAI is an application designed specifically for Israeli students, transforming their study materials into interactive quizzes. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-sikumai-israeli-quizzes-may2025-l7v7)] [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-sikumai-israel-quizzes-may2025-zm6p)]
- Gentle Task Companion - A gentle, privacy-focused task and mood companion app. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-gentle-task-app-may2025-fzyv)] [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-gentle-task-app-may2025-fx6c)]
- Krea_ai - real-time and interactive image generation in the browser, the easiest way to generate with AI. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-krea-ai-image-gen-may2025-uekc)]
- Pression is a print-inspired publishing web app. Create your own magazines & newspapers and be their editor. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-pression-publishing-app-may2025-ixwf)]
- Spike.news - aggregating the news from around the web every minute. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-spike-news-aggregation-may2025-30nh)]

## Community Highlights

- Translate the error codes of Supabase auth, realtime, storage, and database interactions into 8 languages [[Repo](https://supabase.link/repo-supabase-error-translator-may2025-qj3n)]
- n8n: Build Your Personalized RAG AI Agent (Gemini x Superbase x Google Drive) [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-n8n-rag-ai-agent-may2025-7utq)]
- Build a Natural Language SQL Chatbot with n8n, Supabase & OpenAI [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-natural-language-sql-may2025-xyit)]
- Learn to Ghiblify images with OpenAIâ€™s image generation API and Supabase Edge Functions [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-learn-ghiblify-images-may2025-0ab1)]
- Why Supabase Is the Future of Backend Development â€” Explained | FrontPage [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-supabase-backend-future-may2025-3hdf)]
- Build an Automated Web Scraper Using Supabase Edge Functions [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-automated-web-scraper-may2025-2uef)]
- Supabase UI Library: The Game-Changer for Fast Web Development [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-supabase-ui-library-may2025-w8ga)]

## Weâ€™re Hiring

Come join one of the fastest-growing open source projects ever ğŸ¤—

- [Site Reliability Engineer - Postgres](https://supabase.link/job-sitereliabilityengineer-postgres-may2025-wl7b)
- [Postgres Tools Manager](https://supabase.link/job-postgrestoolsmanager-may2025-55lp)
- [Product manager](https://supabase.link/job-productmanager-may2025-21nx)
- [Customer Solution Architect (US time zones)](https://supabase.link/job-customersolutionarchitectustimezones-may2025-edep)

[[See all our open roles](https://supabase.link/seeallouropenroles-were-hiring-join-us-may2025-1rio)]

## âš ï¸ Baking hot meme zone âš ï¸

subject: Learn university-level chemistry [Free 35-hour freeCodeCamp course]
snippet: Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time: 1. freeCodeCamp just published our first-ever chemistry course. Over the years we've published hundreds of courses on
content:
Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time:

1. freeCodeCamp just published our first-ever chemistry course. Over the years we've published hundreds of courses on math and computer science, and we're gradually adding other academic subjects as well. This is an excellent starting point for beginners, and a great refresher for folks who want to get back into learning chemistry. Chad, the instructor, has taught chemistry for more than 15 years. He'll teach you the absolute basics of matter, chemical bonding, and scientific notation. Then you'll dive into more intermediate topics like thermodynamics, kinetics, and electrochemistry. (35 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/general-chemistry-college-course/

2. Learn low-level game development by building your own Candy Crush-style match-3 video game using the C programming language. That's right â€“ instead of using a powerful game engine like Unreal or Unity 3D, you're going to use some of the most fundamental tools imaginable. You'll implement the core game logic, detect player input, and even add bursts of animation using the Raylib graphics library. This is a fun way to spend an afternoon while getting reps with the world's most widely run language. (1 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/c-game-development-with-raylib/

3. On this week's podcast, I interview software engineer and O'reilly programming book author Joe Attardi about the many changes he's seen during his 21 years in industry. He talks about how AI tools are changing development, and how he thinks devs with a strong foundation in computer science are best positioned to fully leverage these tools. Joe's one chill, humble dude. I had a blast learning from him. And I think you will, too. (1 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-to-survive-in-tech-when-everythings-changing-w-21-year-veteran-dev-joe-attardi-podcast-174/

4. freeCodeCamp published a couple handbooks this week, too. This first one will teach you how to build your own AI agents using open source tools like LangChain and LangGraph. You'll learn about automation workflows, agent loops, multi-agent collaboration, and more. (full-length handbook): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/the-open-source-llm-agent-handbook/

5. And this second handbook will take you on a deep dive into the world of Front End Monitoring. You'll learn how to collect performance data, error data, user behavior data, then make sense of these insights through modern reporting tools. If you're serious about leveling up your full stack development skills, I think you'll find this to be well worth reading. (full-length handbook): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/the-front-end-monitoring-handbook/

The freeCodeCamp community is shipping so many things this month, including tons of new interactive React curriculum coursework. We're working hard to teach you core skills alongside emerging tools. You can get involved by joining the 11,321 kind folks who support our charity's mission each month: https://www.freecodecamp.org/donate

Quote of the Week: â€œComputer Science fundamentals are more important than ever. As a software engineer, I want to understand things. I donâ€™t like just taking stuff at face value. I want to know why it works and whatâ€™s going on behind the scenes.â€ â€”  21-year industry veteran Joe Attardi on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

Until next week, happy coding.

-- Quincy Larson

Teacher and founder of freeCodeCamp.org

If these aren't worth your time, you can turn them off: https://www.freecodecamp.org/ue/7uPiOikwLHMaXKgByb7Pv

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Deepti Pillai <deepti@sstarsfoundation.org>
Date: Fri, Jun 6, 2025 at 9:30â€¯AM
Subject: Invitation to Nominate Girl Students for WWT All India Women-Only
Hackathon 2025
To: Professor <atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Professor *

I hope this message finds you well.

I am Dr. Deepti Pillai, formerly with CodeChef and currently serving as
Director â€“ Community at *Shooting Stars Foundation*, a non-profit committed
to advancing access to STEM education and entrepreneurship for underserved
communities.

We are delighted to invite your *girl students* to participate in the
upcoming
*WWT All India Women-Only Hackathon 2025*, organized in partnership with *World
Wide Technology*, a leading US-based IT services company.
Hackathon Highlights:

   -

   *Open to all women college students* (any stream, any year)
   -

   *Theme:* *AI for Financial Inclusion of Women â€“ Economic Empowerment &
   Financial Literacy*
   -

   *Mode:* Online
   -

   *Team Event:* 4â€“6 members (*No team? No problem â€” weâ€™ll help form one!*)
   -

   *Prizes Worth â‚¹3,00,000 (1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th prizes -
   50K/35K/25/15K/10K). A*ll top 25 teams standing a chance to win a
   minimum of â‚¹5,000
   -

   *Hackathon Date:* Sunday, July 13, 2025
   -

   *Last Date to Register: June 30, 2025*
   -

   *Registration Link:* www.starhacks.org/wwthackathon2025
   <https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org//l/8ohqkV3IvFMrSSAZLmbOXg/1L3mRYYlKvNT1EbrEAqOBw/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>

We would be truly grateful if you could share this opportunity with your
students or circulate it through your department WhatsApp/email groups. *A
brochure is attached* for easy sharing.
Institutional Recognition:

The college/university with the *highest number of active women
participants* will receive a *special mention* on our social media and in
exclusive communications to our corporate partners â€” celebrating your
commitment to promoting gender diversity in tech.

Your encouragement could make a life-changing difference for your students,
empowering them to innovate, collaborate, and grow in a real-world setting.

Please feel free to reach out for any queries.



With warm regards
*Dr. Deepti Pillai*
*Shooting Stars Foundation*
*Bengaluru, India*

Meet Container 42â€”not just a box, but a fully connected device powered by IoT, AI, real-time analytics, and cybersecurity.

subject: Lovable Update â€“ June 4th
snippet: Lovable Update â€” June 4th Hey, In the last 2 weeks we've done a bunch of improvements to Lovable! This is what's new: Security Review Our new security reviewer uses AI to analyze your app for
content:
Lovable Logo

******************
Lovable Update â€”
June 4th
******************

Hey,

In the last 2 weeks we've done a bunch of improvements to Lovable!

This is what's new:

---------------
Security Review
---------------

Security Review

Our new security reviewer uses AI to analyze your app for security vulnerabilities and recommends a plan to address them.

--------------------------------------
Warnings if you put an API key in chat
--------------------------------------

Warnings if you put an API key in chat

Previously, people would sometimes ask Lovable to hardcode API secrets into their app, which posed a major security risk as those secrets could be easily leaked. We now block around 1200 private API keys from being directly inserted in code per day.

All API keys should be stored as a secret in Supabase via our special in-chat form.

----------------------------------
Filtering of own and team projects
----------------------------------

Filtering of own and team projects

Improved project discoverability with new filtering options to easily find and manage your projects.

------------------------------------
Categorization of community projects
------------------------------------

Categorization of community projects

Categorization to community projects to make it easier to discover projects by the community.

You can now also see the amount of remixes each project has.

------------------------
Visualize back-end flows
------------------------

Visualize back-end flows

Chat mode can now render Mermaid diagrams to help visualize your app's back-end logic and structure (ask for it to chart things to trigger this).

------------------
Other Improvements
------------------

* Added voice mode functionality - simply speak your ideas and have them automatically converted to text for faster development.
* Auto-configure redirect URLs for Supabase Auth integration - no more manual configuration needed for a more seamless authentication setup.
* Added in-product feedback system - click the thumbs down button when edits cause issues to help us improve Lovable's AI for everyone.
* Introduced smart nudges to guide you to Chat Mode when debugging issues that need conversational help.

-----------------------------
Join the livestream tomorrow!
-----------------------------

Join the livestream tomorrow!

Join us tomorrow (5th June) live where we'll build a voice-first onboarding experience that replaces boring forms with natural AI conversationsâ€”complete with 11Labs.

Register here: https://lu.ma/qco640yb

That's all for now, please let us know how we could make Lovable better here ( https://feedback.lovable.dev/ ).

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Lovable Logo

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

Unsubscribe ( http://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTmjgoDAK2XqAOsl6gDAZc7gm_DsLVr7SJf8WrqeA== )

June 2025











Congrats grads!


Itâ€™s graduation season, a time for thinking about the future. For someone 
starting their career in tech, that could mean pursuing any variety of paths, 
from AI Engineer to UX Designer. Of course, you donâ€™t need to have just 
graduated to be open to new possibilities. Now's a great time to enroll in a 
career path, start a new project, or attend an event â€” read on for inspiration 
as you consider what step you'll take next.

â€Œ


Hereâ€™s to new beginnings,

The Codecademy Team







NEW CAREER PATH 




 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/ux-designer-career-path?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=hero_ux_designer_cp_img>




Become a UX Designer


UX design isnâ€™t just about creating nice-looking apps or websites. For 
businesses, a great user experience means more satisfied customers, and for 
individuals it means usable, accessible products. In our new UX Designer career 
path, youâ€™ll learn the foundations of UX design including user research, 
wireframing, and interaction design, then apply them through hands-on projects 
using industry-standard tools.


Learn more 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/ux-designer-career-path?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=hero_ux_designer_cp_cta>






NEW COURSES 



 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/ux-design-career-preparedness?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=course_ux_design_img>

UX Designer Career Preparedness


Grow your career in UX design with advanced Figma techniques and 
cross-functional collaboration skills. Plus, design your own wireframes and 
interactive prototypes for your portfolio site.


Start course 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/ux-design-career-preparedness?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=course_ux_design_cta>

 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/build-deep-learning-models-pytorch?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=course_pytorch_img>

Build Deep Learning Models with PyTorch


Get step-by-step guidance for working with PyTorch, one of Pythonâ€™s most 
popular deep learning frameworks. Develop the skills you'll need to build, 
train, and deploy neural networks for machine learning applications.


Start skill path 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/build-deep-learning-models-pytorch?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=june_2025_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=course_pytorch_cta>






UPCOMING EVENTS

Register now

Introducing Codecademyâ€™s UX Designer Career Path

Students save 35% on Codecademy Pro


On break from classes? Keep learning with Codecademy Pro Student â€” eligible 
college and high school students can get complete access to our interactive 
curriculum for over 35% off the regular price.


Learn more

AI Engineers are in demand across most industries, but what exactly does an AI

Read now

subject: ğŸš€ What's new in Replit: Sonnet 4, Security, & more
snippet: May was an a-may-zing month for updates at Replit: Sonnet 4.0, safe vibe coding, new integrations, visual edits & more! Tuesday, June 3, 2025 May was an a-may-zing month for updates at Replit. ...
content:
May was an a-may-zing month for updates at Replit: Sonnet 4.0, safe vibe 
coding, new integrations, visual edits & more!



 <https://replit.com>



Tuesday, June 3, 2025


May was an a-may-zing month for updates at Replit.

... Ok, Iâ€™ll show myself out. If this is the last email you get from me, that 
pun finally did me in.

But seriously, it was a big month. We shipped a ton of features you wonâ€™t want 
to miss. Check them out and let us know what you think.

May's updates include:


 * Sonnet 4.0 in Agent: We're shipping the latest and greatest models on day-1
 * Safe vibe coding: Security Scan, checkpoint improvements, Replit Auth
 * New integrations: Build with Notion, PayPal, and Google Analytics
 * Visual edits: Bringing you a new, improved editing experience

and much, much more!




ğŸ†• Sonnet 4 in Agent



Replit Agent is now powered by Claude Sonnet 4.0.

 We partnered with Anthropic to bring you the latest & greatest Sonnet the 
same day as the release. You'll notice improved Agent performance and speed. âœŒï¸


ğŸ”’Safe Vibe Coding


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o76diiNCJwA>

This month, we dialed in safety.

 We now prevent accidental pasting of API keys into Agent chat and warn about 
sensitive data. We've also introduced comprehensiveSecurity Scans 
<https://docs.replit.com/replit-workspace/workspace-features/security-scanner#security-scanner>
 for your entire Agent project to find and report potential vulnerabilities in 
realtime thanks to Semgrep.

 Last, but definitely not least, Auth 
<https://docs.replit.com/replit-workspace/replit-auth#replit-auth> is out for 
all users to quickly add log-in to your apps, securely. Check out the launch 
video above for all the deets ğŸ”


ğŸ¤ Notion + Replit


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOYqTONf07o>

Our new Notion integration is live! You can now build Apps with Replit that 
push or pull data from Notion.

That means you can build a completely customized blog with Notion pages as 
data or a workout tracker that outputs data to a Notion DB.

 You can dive-in with our interactive tutorial above. You can also follow 
along in our docshere 
<https://docs.replit.com/tutorials/build-a-notion-powered-website>.


ğŸ–Œï¸ Visual Editor



We've revamped our visual editor.

 The Visual Editor lets you select elements in your app's preview and edit 
them directly. You can change text right from the preview, adjust styles like 
padding and colors with simple controls, and see all changes instantly.

When you're done, your code updates automatically, saving you time and effort. 
Learn more in ourdocs. 
<https://docs.replit.com/replitai/visual-editor#visual-editor> 


ğŸ“Œ Other new features


 * Enhanced Checkpoints & Time Travel: Agent checkpoints just got a whole lot 
betterâ€”you can now view an entire history of your checkpoints in Agent.Time 
Travel <https://x.com/_jzhao/status/1923095488527548622> means you can see a 
preview of your app at any point in time
 * PayPal & Google Analytics Agent integrations: Add PayPal checkout and GA to 
your Agent apps in seconds. Learn more about our Agent Integrationshere 
<https://docs.replit.com/replitai/integrations#paypal>
 * Enterprise and teams: Protected development previews for secure iteration, 
viewer seats for broader team collaboration, & advanced seat management (SCIM)
 * Performance improvements: Backend performance and reliability improvements, 
bringing faster Agent responses. 90% of Agent responses are now 90% faster
 * Extended preview times: Previews are now active for a default 10 minutes 
when navigating away from your appsâ€”this is up from our previous 20 seconds
 * Auth gets even better: We've made Auth 
<https://docs.replit.com/replit-workspace/replit-auth#replit-auth> available to 
all usersâ€”add login to your apps in seconds ask Agent "add auth" or "add login"

 You can also find weekly updates in our Changelog! 
<https://docs.replit.com/updates>


ğŸ“¹ Videos & tutorials


 I've been shipping tutorials weekly on my channel 
<https://www.youtube.com/@mattpalmer> and the Replit YouTube 
<https://www.youtube.com/@replit>. Here are some highlights from this month:




 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2v5Fs7Xr11Y>

End-to-end vibe coding: Follow along for an end-to-end tutorial on building 
and deploying a map of parks in San Francisco. Follow along in our docshere. 
<https://docs.replit.com/tutorials/vibe-coding-101>


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FepR-sBZKCo>

Get started with Auth: Go from zero to Auth-hero with our tutorial on adding 
users to your apps.


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


We're excited to keep bringing you the latest and greatest in vibe coding, but 
also thesafest and most secure.

You'll notice those as a big theme in our updatesâ€”we're continuously moving to 
a "secure-by-default" model where you can focus on building... and we'll handle 
the rest.

Keep creating apps, I can't wait to see what y'all build next. 

Matt <https://www.youtube.com/@mattpalmer> @ Replit

 <https://www.youtube.com/@mattpalmer>

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it> 
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw>  
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>



Sent by Replit

1001 E Hillsdale Blvd, Suite 400, Foster City, CA 94404 


Unsubscribe here 
<https://links.replit.com/s/u/J7R1rFdqZb47YV1rmcHyL0uqvLMZwtXqR4ed_0CD_xkl8ffpWNK9Efj4NjB833MLvcaidZ3YbxxlV-g2nxg5zKTdyoivRvJXTAmmYnn-NaMVsoROuCltjjZBNaxeYdvUFhB_3V5qxB5xxdnC2kNLP1F4r5NQ9tgqyOG8mG17bzgGOcv-xuLmay5CqglogCohFktGAga-ATAUjVVj/p6FTpSM6i5Ccmf2nhbwUocFq0O1Z4orU/9>

subject: Learn Python for Data Science [Free 17-hour course for beginners]
snippet: Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time: 1. freeCodeCamp just published a full course to help you learn Python for Data Science. This beginner's course covers
content:
Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time:

1. freeCodeCamp just published a full course to help you learn Python for Data Science. This beginner's course covers popular Python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn. First you'll learn how to configure your development environment. Then you'll dive in and practice key skills like Data Extraction, Dataframe Concatenation, Data Visualization, and even some basic Machine Learning. (17 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-python-for-data-science-full-course

2. freeCodeCamp also published a full-length handbook that you can read right in your browser on the emerging field of Agentic AI Systems. Agents can go out and attempt tasks in the real world for you. Think of a shopping agent that knows your shoe size and preferences, and tries to find you the best deal on bowling shoes. You'll also learn how these systems use planning and goal setting rather than predefined actions. You can code along at home with the handbook and by the end of it, you'll have your own simple Python and LangChain-powered agent. (full-length handbook): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/the-agentic-ai-handbook/

3. On this week's podcast I interview a senior dev who was just laid off last week at Microsoft, and he walks us through everything. He has nerves of steel and seems totally unfazed by his coming job search. He talks about the role that both long-term planning and daily trail running have played in giving him resilience. It's clear to me that he's taken the time to prepare himself and his family for just about anything. (1 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/laid-off-but-not-afraid-with-x-senior-microsoft-dev-mackevin-fey-podcast-173/

4. If you're traveling this summer, you might benefit from reading this guide on how attackers most commonly use technology to exploit travelers. You'll learn how to defend yourself against fake wi-fi networks, phony travel sites, shady SIM card vendors, ATM skimming, and more. (10 minute read): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-attackers-target-travelers-and-how-to-defend-yourself/

5. Learn how to run an inexpensive Raspberry Pi computer in â€œHeadless Modeâ€. Instead of functioning like a traditional computer with a keyboard, mouse, and screen, you can set up your Pi to perform tasks in the background, then access it remotely through a network protocol like Secure Shell (SSH). This way you can have a dedicated home automation server or a surveillance system. This tutorial will walk you through everything you need to know to get your headless server online. (20 minute read): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-to-use-your-raspberry-pi-headlessly-with-vs-code-and-ssh/

These are just a few of the open source learning resources the global freeCodeCamp community published this week. We're all working hard to increase the amount of learning people do, so that we can all be prepared to navigate this wild period in human history. Please consider joining the 11,331 kind folks who support our charity and our mission: https://www.freecodecamp.org/donate

Quote of the Week: â€œOne of the things I love about computers is there are so many different rungs on the ladder of abstraction. And each layer has its own interesting challenges. When I moved from Intel to Microsoft, I went from very low-level hardware-adjacent development to cloud development at internet scale. But everything I had learned earlier helped me ramp up quickly at that higher level of abstraction.â€ â€”  MacKevin Fey on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

Until next week, happy coding.

-- Quincy Larson

Teacher and founder of freeCodeCamp.org

If these aren't worth your time, you can turn them off: https://www.freecodecamp.org/ue/7uPiOikwLHMaXKgByb7Pv

subject: How IoT & AI Are Disrupting Shipping (and Why It Matters for Your Career)
snippet: View online Cisco Networking Academy Logo IT Meets Global Trade: Container 42 in Action What happens when you combine IoT, AI, real-time analytics, and cybersecurityâ€”and pack it all into a shipping
content:
IT Meets Global Trade: Container 42 in Action
What happens when you combine IoT, AI, real-time analytics, and cybersecurityâ€”and pack it all into a shipping container? You get Container 42â€”a smart, connected device thatâ€™s reshaping global logistics and proving just how far tech can go. 

In this video, youâ€™ll see how Cisco is helping digitize one of the worldâ€™s oldest industries.
Why It Matters To You
The shipping and logistics sector is one of the fastest-growing real-world applications for IT professionals. 

From smart ports to secure supply chains, these innovations need network engineers, cybersecurity experts, data analystsâ€”and future-ready minds like yours.
Meet the Speaker
Niels Van den Berg
Leader of Digital Business Development at Cisco

 Niels evangelize Ciscoâ€™s Digitization vision, strategy, and supporting technology, bringing this to life in National Critical Infrastructures.
Don't miss this chance to shape your future and open doors to exciting career opportunities. Join us and be part of a transformative experience.

subject: Coming February 3, 2026:Â  A new era for Cisco certifications
snippet: Read about exciting changes to Learn with Cisco's industry-leading certification portfolio. View online Hi Cisco Networking Academy Partners, Instructors, and Students, On February 3, 2026, Learn
content:
Hi Cisco Networking Academy Partners, Instructors, and Students,




On February 3, 2026, Learn with Cisco will introduce exciting changes to its industry-leading certification portfolio, shaping the next generation of networking careers in the age of AI, network automation, and cybersecurity. With this update, most of our certifications will more clearly follow three certification levels for advancing from entry to expert using the framework learners know and trust:


	- CCNA (Associate)
	- CCNP (Professional)
	- CCIE (Expert)
Whatâ€™s changing includes:
DevNet Certifications Are Transitioning to Cisco Automation Certifications
What this means for you: The DevNet Associate certification exam will be renamed to CCNA Automation. No changes will be made to the exam topics for this certification. Anyone holding an active DevNet Associate certification will automatically be transitioned to CCNA Automation after February 3, 2025. We are not renaming the DevNet Associate course from Cisco Networking Academy at this time.
Cybersecurity certifications will be CCNA Cybersecurity and CCNP Cybersecurity
What this means for you: The Cybersecurity Associate certification will be renamed to CCNA Cybersecurity. No changes will be made to the exam topics for this certification. Anyone holding an active Cybersecurity Associate exam will automatically be transitioned to CCNA Cybersecurity after February 3, 2025. We are not renaming the CyberOps Associate course from Cisco Networking Academy at this time.
Additionally, please note: 



	- The CCNA certification exam and name are not changing.
	- The CCNP Enterprise certification exams and names are not changing.






We are working on Frequently Asked Questions for Cisco Networking Academy and will follow up with more details in the coming weeks.




See the full announcement from Cisco Certifications here: Coming February 3, 2026: A new era for Cisco certifications <http://nsmail.netacad.com/MDU5LVZGWi04MzQAAAGat0I1N3AwMBLf0kKXAUcz9x8MqPq5UZ53zHr4ItIg7couLk3975mnQ6jk8ZwLZ4W9eOMB1PA=>.

The future of networking is intelligent. Be ready.

 <[[${YoutubeLink}]]>

Assistant Professor,

---------- Forwarded message ---------

International Education Study Tour: July 2025Proposal for Students to
Participate in the UnTechEd Japan International Education Study Tour: July
2025
To: Teaching Staff <teachingstaff@charusat.ac.in>, Registrar CHARUSAT <
registrar@charusat.ac.in>, Deputy Registrar (Academics & Exams) CHARUSAT <
dy.registrar.ace@charusat.ac.in>




*Dr R.V. Upadhyay,*
*Provost (Vice-Chancellor),*

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Off. Nadiad - Petlad Highway, Changa-388421, Gujarat, INDIA
https://charusat.irins.org/profile/156375
c: +91 9427215242 | ph: +91 2697 265015 | e: provost@charusat.ac.in
<registrar@charusat.ac.in> | w: www.charusat.ac.in


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Manshi Verma <communications@unteched.in>
Date: Wed, 28 May 2025, 18:12
Subject: Proposal for Students to Participate in the UnTechEd Japan
International Education Study Tour: July 2025Proposal for Students to
Participate in the UnTechEd Japan International Education Study Tour: July
2025
To: provost@charusat.ac.in <provost@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Dr. RV Upadhyay

Greetings from UnTechEd!

We are thrilled to present an extraordinary opportunity for your students
to join the *UnTechEd International Education Study Tour: Japan 2025*,
titled *"Go Abroad, Unlock Your Potential."* Hosted *in partnership with
FPT Academy Japan*, this immersive *one-week program* combines academic
excellence with cultural exploration, offering a transformative experience
for participants.

*Program Overview:*

*Host Country: Tokyo, Japan*
*Host University Partner: FPT Academy Japan*
*Duration: 14 July â€“ 20 July, 2025 (7 Days / 6 Nights)*

Participants will gain hands-on exposure through academic sessions,
workshops, and cultural immersion activities. This program is specifically
designed to broaden global perspectives, enhance professional skills, and
provide an unforgettable learning adventure.

*Program Highlights:*

*1. Academic Sessions: *Led by top experts, students will delve into
trending topics such as:

   - AI Application in Business
   - Digital Transformation
   - Cybersecurity in Business
   - Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion


*2. Field Trip at a Global Company (All in English)*

   - Welcome Ceremony & Company Tour
   - Seminar with Experts
   - Skill-up Workshop
   - Groupwork


*3. Experience Japanese Culture*

   - Calligraphy Culture Class with Japanese Teacher
   - Unique insights into Japanese lifestyle
   - Immersive cultural activities and sightseeing


*Program Cost:*

*Program Fee: 1100 USD (approx. INR 93,500)*
(Note: Payment to be paid in International account, Additional 18% GST
applicable for payments to an Indian account.)

*Inclusions:*

   - 6 Nights Accommodation in dormitories (shared basis)
   - Local airport transfers (group pick-up & drop)
   - Local transport for program-related visits
   - Orientation and in-program activity fees (including transportation &
   entrance tickets)
   - Study materials and printing fees
   - An English-speaking buddy to assist students during program activities
   - Certificate of Participation from FPT Japan


*Exclusions:* Flights, Visa Fee, Meals, Travel & Health Insurance, Personal
Expenses

***UnTechEd will assist students with flight bookings and visa lodgement.*

*Registration Link: https://forms.gle/BoY9ncAxtSUhY5S86
<https://forms.gle/BoY9ncAxtSUhY5S86>*

*Encourage your students to register early to secure their spots.*

This program is an excellent way for students to enhance their academic
profiles, gain global exposure, and immerse themselves in Japan's rich
culture. We look forward to collaborating with you to make this initiative
a success.

For any queries or assistance, please feel free to contact us. We look
forward to your students joining us on this exciting journey to explore the
vibrant culture of Japan

Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: ğŸ’¡User showcase: awesome apps on Replit
snippet: The latest and greatest apps, built with Agent by users like you: a curated movie recommendation engine, a camera-based fitness movement counter, a savings calculator (for ships!), and much more. ğŸ‘‹ Hey
content:
The latest and greatest apps, built with Agent by users like you: a curated 
movie recommendation engine, a camera-based fitness movement counter, a savings 
calculator (for ships!), and much more.


â€Š
â€Š



ğŸ‘‹ Hey it's Matt,

While AI keeps making headlines, the real magic is in what our community is 
building. I'm continually amazed by the apps we're seeing from our usersâ€”they 
just keep getting better.

This month's showcase features: a curated movie-recommendation engine, a 
camera-based fitness movement counter, a savings calculator (for ships!), and 
much more.





 Already have a great project? Submit your app to be featured.

Submit your app  <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7>

Your Watchlists ğŸ¥



Your Watchlists <https://yourwatchlists.com/> offers a ranked list of the 
greatest films ever made, combining insights from seven respected "Top Movies" 
lists.

Log in to mark movies as "Seen" or "Want to See," create your personalized 
watchlist, and share it with friends to compare your cinematic journeys.

 From the creator, Brendan: "My hope is that people use this site to expose 
themselves to movies they may not have otherwise watched, but with a little 
nudge, they end up experiencing some life-changing films, as I have."

Thanks Brendan! (X Profile <https://x.com/therealbrendanb>)


MoovCounter ğŸƒ



MoovCounter <https://moovcounter-phe.replit.app/> is a fitness app that uses 
your device's camera for real-time pose estimation, allowing you to count 
movements during workouts. It displays a live camera feed with an overlay of 
detected body parts, making it easier to track your exercise. See it in action
here <https://x.com/HrtPhil/status/1908233807066460160>. 

From the creator, Philippe "[It allows me to] exercise while talking to my 
coach or listening to podcasts."

Thanks Philippe! (X Profile <https://x.com/HrtPhil>, LinkedIn 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/philippe-henrotte-7641b37b?utm_source=share&utm_campaign=share_via&utm_content=profile&utm_medium=ios_app>
)


Wayfinder Calculator ğŸš¢



 The Wayfinder Calculator <https://wayfinder-calculatorv3.replit.app/> is an 
interactive maritime tool that shows shipping companies how much money and COâ‚‚ 
they can save using Wayfinder's routing technology. It includes real-time fuel 
prices and dynamic visualizations to make complex efficiency calculations 
accessible.

 From the creator, Shane: "This app is a game-changer for shipping companies! 
Ship operators can literally see how many cars worth of COâ‚‚ they're taking off 
the road, share results with stakeholders in one click, and make rock-solid 
business cases for sustainability tech."

I think this is an amazing example of using software to directly address a 
business need.

 Thanks Shane!  <https://replit.com/@sswiderek>


OnTapSEO ğŸ“



OnTapSEO <https://ontapseo.com/> is an end-to-end SEO auto-pilot tool. It's 
also one of the most beautiful sites I've seen!

It gathers information about a user's site, brainstorms targeted keywords, 
fills a content calendar, writes SEO-optimized articles with unique thumbnails 
daily, and publishes directly to connected websites like Replit or Webflow 
blogs.

From the creator, Gerrard: "I run several online businesses, and SEO is the 
primary marketing channel. This app lets me just add my keywords for each site 
for the month in a few minutes, then set it and forget it as it publishes new 
content to my blogs daily... From first prompt to deployed app was 38 days, 
while I was working on several other projects. Thanks so much for what you guys 
are building with Agent, it's a life-changer."

 Thanks Gerrard! (X Profile <https://x.com/GerrardL_>, LinkedIn 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/gerrardlipscombe/> <https://x.com/GerrardL_>)


TagYourRide ğŸš”



TagYourRide <https://tagyourride.com/> is a fun vanity license plate name 
generator. Users enter keywords, select their state, and the app generates six 
creative ideas that meet the state's character requirements, even rendering 
them on an image of the state's license plate.

 From the creator, Brian: "I was looking for an app to generate custom license 
plate ideas. I couldn't find one so I used ChatGPT. Then I realized that this 
should exist as a standalone app, so I created it in less than an hour. Replit 
is awesome!"

 Thanks Brian! (X Profile <https://x.com/BSbriansallee>, LinkedIn 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/salleebrian/> <https://x.com/BSbriansallee>)


Sarasota.tech ğŸŒ´



Sarasota.tech <https://sarasota.tech/> is a member directory that enhances the 
Luma API, transforming a community calendar into an interactive business 
directory and community hub. It provides a modern dashboard for upcoming and 
past events and a directory of listed members.

 From the creator, Raymmar: "We were able to turn our static website into an 
interactive membership hub for our local meetup without the need to stitch 
together a bunch of random platforms... It is a powerful member platform built 
on top of the Luma API and we are even considering offering this to other Luma 
communities. I feel like a sorcerer when I use Replit."

 Thanks Raymmar! (X Profile <https://x.com/raymmar_>, LinkedIn 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/raymmar/>)


What's next ğŸ”® 


These showcases aren't just about celebrating great Replit Apps, they're proof 
that your dream project is within reach, today.

 Thanks to our team's hard work, the only barriers to building are creativity 
and courage. I hope these examples demonstrate youcan build the idea you've 
always dreamed of.

 The first step is getting started. If you get stuck, check out our docs 
<https://docs.replit.com> or tutorials <https://docs.replit.com/tutorials> to 
get unblocked. I'm excited to see what you'll create. âœŒï¸

Start building  <https://replit.com>

Until next time,

Matt <https://www.youtube.com/@mattpalmer>
