subject: Invitation to Infineon Technologies Virtual Meeting
snippet: Dear Students, You are invited to attend a virtual meeting with representatives from Infineon Technologies. This session is a continuation of the previous meeting, where more details will be shared
content:
Dear Students,

You are invited to attend a virtual meeting with representatives from
Infineon Technologies. This session is a continuation of the previous
meeting, where more details will be shared about potential opportunities
and collaborations.

*Meeting Details:*

   -

   *Date:* Wednesday, 28-May-2025
   -

   *Time:* 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM
   -

   *Link to Join:* Click here to join the meeting
   <https://infineon.webex.com/infineon/j.php?MTID=m7fa242f0090d616109416180e46ec804>

We encourage you to attend this session and make the most of this
opportunity.


-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology
*Email*: chintalraval.dit@charusat.ac.in
*Phone*: 9016156565
*Intercom Extension*: 5114

--

subject: Fwd: A session on â€œWriting Quality Technical Papers for IEEE Journals and Conferencesâ€ on May 29, 2025 At 10:30 AM organized by KRC-CHARUSAT
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in> Dear Users, I hope you are doing well. We are pleased to inform you that CHARUSAT- Knowledge Resource
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in>

Dear Users,

I hope you are doing well.

We are pleased to inform you that *CHARUSAT- Knowledge Resource Centre
(KRC) has organized *a session on *"Writing Quality Technical Papers for
IEEE"* in hybrid mode. The core aims to empower university researchers,
students, and staff members with the tools and knowledge required to
publish high-quality technical papers in IEEE journals and conferences. We
invite you to join the same for your academic enrichment. The details of
the same are as follows:

ğŸ“… *Date:* May 29, 2025
ğŸ•’ *Time:* 10:30 AM
ğŸ“ *Venue / Platform:* IIIM Auditorium
ğŸ™ï¸ *Speaker:* *Mr. Dhanu Pattanashetti, *BE, MLISc, PhD (Senior IEEE
Client Services/University Partnership Program Manager)

During the session, participants will gain valuable insights into:

Â·         Tips and best practices to improve an authorâ€™s chances of getting
published

Â·         What do editors and reviewers look for in submissions?

Â·         Why are papers rejected?

Â·         Selecting the right publication for your research submission

Â·         IEEE Authorship tools

Â·         Understanding the IEEE review process

Â·         Ethical considerations in publishing

This is a great opportunity to enhance your technical writing skills and
increase your chances of successful publication in prestigious IEEE venues.

*Registration:* https://forms.gle/QCcfP1fKVv9HftHGA


We encourage all interested teachers, authors, and aspiring researchers to
attend this enriching session. Kindly share this invitation with your peers
who may benefit from the event.

*Note: *All Deans of the faculty are requested to share this with all the
current students and research scholars

We are looking forward to your participation!

--
Regards,

Dr. Pramod D. Patel
University Librarian
R K Patel Knowledge Resource Centre
CHARUSAT campus,Changa-388421
Mob:- 09879334259
Landline No:02697-265032

--

content:
I've shared an item with you:

23DIT BATCH - IT346 Summer Internship-iI Details - 2025-26
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RXWzXYZMhv1nmnrEs-ALFM9Ma-ZkUCX8XFwHzownOYE/edit?usp=sharing&ts=68357faf

It's not an attachment -- it's stored online. To open this item, just click  
the link above.

Dear Students,

This is to inform you to regularly check the guide allocation sheet for  
updates. Please also ensure that your summer internship details are  
submitted no later than 28th May.

Failure to submit the required details by the deadline will result in no  
guide being allocated.

We advise you to check the sheet daily for any changes or updates.

--

subject: Reminder: Submission of Complete Project Details and Internship Reporting Guidelines
snippet: Dear Students, This is a gentle reminder to submit the complete details of your project at the earliest. Timely submission is crucial for smooth progress and evaluation of your work. Additionally,
content:
Dear Students,

This is a gentle reminder to submit the complete details of your project at
the earliest. Timely submission is crucial for smooth progress and
evaluation of your work.

Additionally, please note the following important guidelines:

   1.

   *Guide Allocation:*
   Kindly check the summer internship sheet for your guide allocation
   details.
   2.

   *Weekly Reporting:*
   You are required to share a signed copy of your weekly report via email
   with your internal guide. Please ensure that your external guide is cc'd in
   the email. This reporting must be done on a weekly basis without fail.

For any queries or clarifications, feel free to contact your internal guide.

We appreciate your cooperation and commitment to maintaining these
guidelines.


-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

*Phone*: 9016156565
*Intercom Extension*: 5114

subject: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“ 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
ğŸ” What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
ğŸ’¡ Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

ğŸ”— Student Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
ğŸ”— General IEEE Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
ğŸ§© Available Committees

   1. Main SB Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society

ğŸ“Œ Available Positions

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEEâ€™s mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.
ğŸ“ How to Apply

Please fill out the Google Form below. The selection process includes
evaluation of your responses followed by an interview.

ğŸ“‹ Apply Now
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.

ğŸ” What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in

subject: Lovable Update â€“ 25% less errors, 40% faster
snippet: In the last two weeks we've made Lovable a lot better by fixing bugs and more. Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í Í
content:
Lovable Logo

******************
Lovable update â€”
May 24th
******************

Hey,

In the last two weeks we've made Lovable a lot better by fixing bugs and more.

This everything we've done:

--------------------------
Lovable now uses Claude 4!
--------------------------

Lovable now uses Claude 4!

Anthropic released new AI models a few days ago and within hours this was live inside Lovable.

This makes Lovable:

* 25% less error prone
* 40% faster

Go and create a new project ( https://lovable.dev/ ) and see if you feel a difference!

------------
Improvements
------------

* Revamped the setup flow for both GitHub and Supabase, simplifying multi-step onboarding to reduce confusion.
* Added visual labels to featured projects on the homepage for better discovery.
* Added support for removing custom domains from your Lovable app.
* Commit messages now rely more on conversation history for better context.
* Improved the quality of streaming: smoother experience and no more flashing text.
* Users can now view public Lovable projects without being logged in.
* Active edit cards are now highlighted so itâ€™s easier to see which one is active.
* The default â€œEdit Codeâ€ button now opens the preview instead of the raw code.

Several improvements in collaborator management:

* Added validation to the email invite form in the People tab
* Tooltips now explain the permissions for each role (admin / owner / editor)
* You can now see the role of pending invites
* Better error messages for edge cases like inviting someone already in the workspace

---------
Bug fixes
---------

* Fixed bugs that caused the wrong live preview to show in some cases.
* Fixed a bug where refreshing the preview could change the current path.
* Fixed a bug that caused infinite redirect loops when starting a live preview after logging in.

Thanks for being a user of Lovable, we're working hard to make the experience as good as possible with minimal errors.

See full changelog here ( https://docs.lovable.dev/changelog ).

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Lovable Logo

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

Unsubscribe ( http://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTmjgoDAK2XqAOsl6gDAZcCdCVB3AIEXFVkdignPQ== )

subject: Learn how to code AI Agents with Python [Free 3-hour course on LangChain LangGraph]
snippet: Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time: 1. freeCodeCamp just published a course on building AI agents using the open source LangChain LangGraph Python framework.
content:
Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time:

1. freeCodeCamp just published a course on building AI agents using the open source LangChain LangGraph Python framework. This course will teach you fundamental Agentic AI concepts like Elements, Type Annotations, and Retrieval Augmented Generation. You can code along at home, and by the end of the course you'll have built 5 different agents you can show to your friends. (3 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-langgraph-and-build-conversational-ai-with-python/

2. freeCodeCamp also published this comprehensive guide to Relational Database Management Systems. You'll learn key database architecture concepts and how to diagram them. You'll also learn about Relational Algebra, Data Normalization, Schema Design, SQL Queries, and more. (9 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/master-database-management-systems/

3. On this week's freeCodeCamp podcast, I interview a developer from Iraq about her journey into tech. She has managed to build out her professional reputation through live-streaming herself participating in online coding and data science competitions. She shares tips for making friends with other developers â€“ even when you're living far away from tech hubs like Silicon Valley. (90 minute watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-to-make-developer-friends-when-you-dont-live-in-silicon-valley-with-iraqi-engineer-codelife-podcast-172/

4. Learn what JavaScript Linting is and how it helps you write better code. This tutorial will also teach you about Abstract Syntax Trees and why they're so useful for representing code. (20 minute read): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-javascript-lint-rules-work-and-why-abstract-syntax-trees-matter/

5. I'm thrilled to announce that freeCodeCamp just published our first-ever course on a world language. This full-length Spanish for Beginners course will teach you basic grammar and vocabulary so you can speak at a CEFR A1 Level. The instructor has more than 17 years of experience teaching Spanish to beginners. Â¡VÃ¡monos! (9 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-a1-level-spanish/

As you may know, last year freeCodeCamp published our English for Developers curriculum, and we're continuing to expand it. Even though we focus 90% on teaching programming, we hope to eventually cover many other professional skills like world languages as well. I want to thank each and every one of the 11,371 kind people who support our charity. Please consider joining them in supporting our mission: https://www.freecodecamp.org/donate

Quote of the Week: â€œI had never coded before I started my Computer Science degree. I felt behind compared to my peers. But I started searching online. I found freeCodeCamp. Just being able to write code in the browser and see the output â€“ that was what made coding feel practical and doable.â€ â€” Iraqi Software Engineer Code;Life on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

Until next week, happy coding.

-- Quincy Larson

Teacher and founder of freeCodeCamp.org

If these aren't worth your time, you can turn them off: https://www.freecodecamp.org/ue/7uPiOikwLHMaXKgByb7Pv

subject: Important: Awareness Session on Upcoming Semester Project â€“ 27th May 2025

content:
*Dear Students,*

Greetings!

You are informed that an Awareness Session on the Project Process and
Expectations will be conducted on Tuesday, 27th May 2025, at 10:00 AM.

This session will give you an overview of the complete project process for
the upcoming semester. It will cover all important aspects such as
planning, execution, and evaluation, along with the academic expectations
to ensure a smooth and effective start to your project work.

*All processes like project definition finalization, mentor allocation, and
team formation will be completed before the start of the upcoming semester,
so you can begin implementation from day one.*

Your participation in this session is crucial for a well-prepared and
confident start to your project journey.

-


Dear all,

The VLSI CLUB in collaboration with IEEE CASS Chapter(First Chapter at
Gujarat Level) of V. T. Patel Department of Electronics & Communication
Engineering, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT is pleased to announce a Certification
Course on "SystemVerilog-based Verification". This course is designed for

Dear Library Users,

We are pleased to invite you to a *â€œTransforming Research and Learning with
ScienceDirectâ€,* an online training programme organized by *CHARUSAT -
Knowledge Resource Centre (KRC)*, for one of the premier e-resources
subscribed to by our university, aimed at enhancing academic and research

*ScienceDirect*, by Elsevier, provides access to a vast collection of
scientific journals, books, and articles across a wide range of
disciplines, including: *Pharmacy, Applied Science, Computer Applications,

subject: Out now: safe vibe coding on Replit
snippet: Hi there, Thanks to vibe coding, more people than ever can create software. AI coding is powerful but can be nerve wracking if you're building something for the first time. Is my user information
content:
<https://blog.replit.com/safe-vibe-coding>

Hi there,

Thanks to vibe coding, more people than ever can create software.

 AI coding is powerful but can be nerve wracking if you're building something 
for the first time.

Is my user information safe? Is my API key exposed? Will my app be vulnerable 
to attackers?

Today weâ€™re making Replit even safer so you can continue to create with 
confidence:

âœ“ Even better security: built-in safeguards by default


 * Built-in secure login for your apps (no technical setup required)
 * Automatic security checks that find and fix issues for you
 * Smart detection to keep your private keys safe

âœ“ Time travel through App History with confidence


 *  Easy-to-browse timeline of all your app versions
 * Preview a fully functional version of your app in the past before going 
back to that version
 * Restore both your code and your data to previous states (certain features 
coming soon)

âœ“ Enterprise-ready: vibe coding for professionals


 *  Control who can see your apps with privacy settings
 * Easy user management for organizations
 * Simple tools to share internal apps securely

 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o76diiNCJwA>

Unlike other vibe coding platforms that require technical expertise to stay 
secure, Replit handles the complex parts for you, giving you peace of mind 
while you create.

Want to see how these features make building software easier? 
 Check out our blog post <https://blog.replit.com/safe-vibe-coding> for the 
full story, orbook a friendly demo <https://replit.com/teams#inlineForm> with 
our team.

Happy creating,
The Replit Team


â€Š

 <https://twitter.com/Replit>  <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it> 
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw> 
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>

content:
Dear students,

Find the email below for your reference.
EC-Council Essentials Series -
https://www.eccouncil.org/train-certify/essentials/

---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Help Your Students Upskill with EC-Council Essentials
To: Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dear Prof Pritesh,

Weâ€™re pleased to offer *CHARUSAT students* a unique opportunity to
access *EC-Councilâ€™s
Essential Series* at a heavily discounted *academia rate of â‚¹7,022 per
course*.

These beginner-friendly, globally recognized courses are designed to equip
students with practical cybersecurity skills across a range of key domains:

ğŸ“š *Courses Available:*

   1. Network Defense Essentials
   2. Ethical Hacking Essentials
   3. Digital Forensics Essentials
   4. IoT Security Essentials
   5. Threat Intelligence Essentials
   6. Cloud Security Essentials
   7. DevSecOps Essentials
   8. Security Operations Essentials

ğŸ” *Whatâ€™s Included with Each Course:*

   - ğŸ“˜ eCourseware â€“ 12 Months
   - ğŸ§ª Hands-on Labs â€“ 6 Months
   - ğŸ¯ Capture the Flag style exercises  (Excluding DSE & CSE)
   - ğŸ¥ Video Lectures â€“ 12 Months
   - ğŸ“ Exam Prep Resources â€“ Sample Exam
   - ğŸ“ Exam Voucher (with Remote Proctoring Services)- 12 Months

ğŸ›’ *How Students Can Redeem the Offer:*

   1. Visit:
   https://ec-councilindia.myshopify.com/collections/frontpage-essential-series
   2. Add the desired courses to the cart
   3. Use the code *ECC-ACA-IND-ESS* at checkout
   4. Complete the purchase using their *@charusat.edu.in
   <http://charusat.edu.in>* email ID

We look forward to welcoming your students in these exciting programs.



Kind Regards,

*Senior Manager â€“ Academia*

*EC-Council | Academia*

subject: Learn how to code Android apps [Free 60-hour course]
snippet: Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time: 1. freeCodeCamp just published a comprehensive course that will help you learn modern Android app development. You'll
content:
Here are this week's five freeCodeCamp resources that are worth your time:

1. freeCodeCamp just published a comprehensive course that will help you learn modern Android app development. You'll learn how to use Android Studio alongside the Kotlin language, a popular alternative to coding in Java. The final project involves building a clone of the Uber app â€“ complete with map integration and real-time location tracking. (60 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/master-kotlin-and-android-60-hour-course/

2. And after you're done with that 60 hour course, try this other 60 hour course ;) It's a full-length Generative AI bootcamp led by CTO and AI enthusiast Andrew Brown. You'll learn powerful tools like Juptyer Notebook and Ollama. You'll also get exposure to the latest applied machine learning techniques. This course is designed to be reasonably accessible to non-developers as well, so any curious person can learn how to harness the power of these new tools. (65 hour YouTube course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/free-genai-65-hour-bootcamp/

3. On this week's freeCodeCamp podcast I interview software engineer and prolific freeCodeCamp contributor Sam Crombie about life in San Francisco startup purgatory. Sam left his job at Microsoft to go through Y Combinator, and is currently trying to find product-market fit as a lone-wolf developer. We discuss how useful AI coding tools really are, tips for getting people to care about your apps, and how parents can help their kids get scholarships for Ivy League schools. (2 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/ditching-a-microsoft-job-to-enter-startup-hell-with-lonewolf-engineer-sam-crombie-podcast-171/

4. Learn how to build web apps faster with Vite, a new JavaScript front end build tool. Vite means quick in French. And this quick course wastes no time in showing you the ropes. You'll learn about Hot Module Replacement, Optimized Dependency Prebundling, Intelligent Caching, and more. (1 hour crash course): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-vite-for-a-better-web-development-workflow/

5. Learn how to become a better analytical programmer by analyzing five different JavaScript implementations of the classic Rock-Paper-Scissors game. Along the way, you'll learn how to use visual tools for code comparison, and learn how to diagram codebases using Mermaid.js. I hope this helps you broaden your horizons as a dev and appreciate the many ways you can accomplish simple tasks with code. (2 hour read): https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/how-to-become-an-analytical-programmer-compare-five-projects/

If you haven't made plans for summer yet, consider going all-in on the freeCodeCamp core curriculum. We've got a ton of interactive coding projects waiting for you. You can beat the heat and gain some serious ground with your skills. And if you want to help our charity build even more open source learning resources, I encourage you to support our mission directly: https://www.freecodecamp.org/donate

Quote of the Week: 
â€œYou can do all the user research you want. But at some point, you just need to put your project out there. My biggest false starts came from not launching. I've learned that you canâ€™t just theory-craft forever. You have to actually ship.â€ â€” Sam Crombie on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast, sharing lessons from startup â€œpivot purgatoryâ€

Until next week, happy coding.

-- Quincy Larson

Teacher and founder of freeCodeCamp.org

If these aren't worth your time, you can turn them off: https://www.freecodecamp.org/ue/7uPiOikwLHMaXKgByb7Pv

content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

We are excited to announce the upcoming ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Tech
Team and Content Creation Team Recruitments for 2025.

Interested students are required to fill out the Google Form by May 30th
2025. We appreciate your interest and encourage you to participate.

*Dear All,*

As a part of the *National Technology Day* celebration and *in
collaboration with the Ministry of Educationâ€™s Innovation Cell, Government
of India*, and *Institute Innovation Council (IIC) * we are pleased to

*â€œQuality Project Definition Criteria: Its Relevance, Feasibility, and
Impactâ€*

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NTM5Mjg3ZWUtMjcyMi00YTVkLThiMDQtODM0MzAwODI5OWM2%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22cc1c0c0b-f06b-4134-8e02-bf5840e9e651%22%7d

subject: Nomenclature Competition I Multi Utility Building @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for naming our Multi-Utility Complex. The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC, conference rooms
content:
Dear Students,

CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for *naming our
Multi-Utility Complex.*
The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC,
conference rooms, paperless exam halls, an exam control room, and
multitudes of related services. It is designed to cater to the diverse
needs of CHARUSAT's unique initiatives and will play a pivotal role in
enhancing the overall campus experience.


*Criteria for Nomenclature:*

   - Should reflect Vedic/Sanskrit terminologyâ€”easily memorable
   - Should be meaningful and relevant to the facility
   - Should have Clarity, brevity, and creativity
   - Should have a touch of academia or knowledge


ğŸPrize: The best fit name will be awarded a cash prize of â‚¹11,000/- by the
prime donor of this facility, Shri Devang Patel (Nadiad).


Click to fill out the form <https://forms.gle/WDvwYgL4uC2DBHMi9>
*Deadline*: Submit your response before May 30, 2025.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Build skills in developing agentic AI systems.
snippet: Discover the value of RAG to creating a microservices architecture. Deploying Agentic AI Applications with OPEA June 12, 2025, from 9:00am to 12:00pm PT Reserve your seat to attend. [Time zone
content:
"Intel Software"                                                                                                                                                                    
""                                                                   

""                                                                   

Deploying Agentic AI Applications with OPEA
-------------------------------------------
June 12, 2025, from 9:00am to 12:00pm PT

Reserve your seat to attend."" <https://app.plan.intel.com/e/er?cid=em&source=elo&campid=smggmo_WW_gmocoma_EN_2025_6.12 Workshop Invite_C-MKA-44703_T-MKA-45508&content=smggmo_WW_gmocoma_EMIW_EN_2025_6.12%20Invite%201_C-MKA-44703_T-MKA-45508&elq_cid=21548807&em_id=109035&elqrid=783dd268134e4d38989dfa229258a5b0&elqcampid=66658&erpm_id=14984284&s=334284386&lid=682888&elqTrackId=d9f4ba1f576843ec93b55b21555bdcaa&elq=783dd268134e4d38989dfa229258a5b0&elqaid=109035&elqat=1&elqak=8AF5C923EF714DFE8DB4EA44F011ABBCA730B6156BE8BF00076169DCE8E601756B2C>                                                            

[Time zone converter <https://app.plan.intel.com/e/er?cid=em&source=elo&campid=smggmo_WW_gmocoma_EN_2025_6.12 Workshop Invite_C-MKA-44703_T-MKA-45508&content=smggmo_WW_gmocoma_EMIW_EN_2025_6.12%20Invite%201_C-MKA-44703_T-MKA-45508&elq_cid=21548807&em_id=109035&elqrid=783dd268134e4d38989dfa229258a5b0&elqcampid=66658&erpm_id=14984284&s=334284386&lid=608027&elqTrackId=fcce634ce260412fbf78628cfcdd357f&elq=783dd268134e4d38989dfa229258a5b0&elqaid=109035&elqat=1&elqak=8AF5D30F66E521BB8255D797DF43C18D5416B6156BE8BF00076169DCE8E601756B2C>]
The potential of agentic AI applications is substantial, especially when augmented by the OPEA Agentic AI architecture. This workshop, utilizing the versatile infrastructure provided by the IntelÂ® Tiberâ„¢ AI Cloud, facilitates the development of a hierarchical, multi-agent system for executing a series of question-answering tasks, guided by information retrieved by worker agents.
Topics covered include:
*Applying RAG (retrieval-automated generation) to a microservices architecture for modular and scalable solutions.
*Deploying Agentic AI blueprints on Kubernetes for production-ready AI applications.
*Following best practices for implementing a RAG pipeline in the cloud.
*Integrating Intel Tiber AI Cloud services into Agentic AI applications.
*Building and deploying Agentic AI solutions with OPEA.

snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing email. An individual or the team of students who have an innovative idea and wants to convert it into product or service are hereby informed to go
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing email. An individual or the team of students
who have an innovative idea and wants to convert it into product or service
are hereby informed to go thoroughly through the trailing mail and contact
me at radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in by tomorrow 12.00 noon.

Thank you.

Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, 13 May 2025, 4:53 pm
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to join the Launch of â€œAICTE Productization
Fellowship (APF) Schemeâ€ & YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025 on 14th May,
2025 (Wednesday) at 12 Noon by Honâ€™ble Chairman, AICTE - reg
To: Radhika Patel <radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <
amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: HOD Depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org>
Date: Tue, May 13, 2025 at 4:49â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to join the Launch of â€œAICTE Productization Fellowship
(APF) Schemeâ€ & YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025 on 14th May, 2025
(Wednesday) at 12 Noon by Honâ€™ble Chairman, AICTE - reg
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/ Madam,

Greetings from AICTE, New Delhi!

AICTE is happy to invite all the faculty members, students of AICTE
Approved Institutions for the launch of  * â€œAICTE Productization Fellowship
(APF)  * * Schemeâ€ & YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025. *

* AICTE Productization Fellowship (APF) *  intends to support Student/Group
of Students working on innovative ideas to develop  * New Product /
Services *  which would address mainly the problems in the Society /
Introduce new innovative products or services to the market as per dynamic
needs of the Market/Society.

The main objective of the scheme is to support Innovative Ideas to convert
into a new Product/Service which can drive future economic growth and
contribute to the Nations Vision of  * â€œATMANIRBHAR BHARATâ€. *

* For more details:  https://yukti.mic.gov.in/aicte-fellowship
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVBFpN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoaRghFUExbDVYfBF1FTA9cGlRcABcHFAdXWw4ORBVbWEA=&ext=>
*

* YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025 (YIC 2025)  * in its 4th edition provides
a platform for eligible innovators with technology-based solutions at TRL 4
and above (as registered in the YUKTI Innovation Repository of IIC
institutions). Selected innovation teams will undergo a comprehensive
learning process involving experiential learning, mentoring, and evaluation
to achieve problem-solution fit, product-market fit, and business model
fit. The program also offers connections to investors, incubation support,
and financial assistance opportunities to transform innovations into
successful start-ups.

* For more details:  https://yukti.mic.gov.in/YIC2025
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1NN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoaRghFUExbDVYfBF1FTA9cGmx8IFFSC1Q=&ext=>
*

  * The details of the online meeting are as follows: *

* Title: *   Launch of â€œAICTE Productization Fellowship (APF) Schemeâ€ &
YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025

* Date and Time:  *  May 14, 2025 (Wednesday) 12:00 Noon

* Link: *   https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m9e735c39bf92566ae0238e51c5f3733d
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1JN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoCWgBFXAtYAFxQTUVWAANKG1ZaDkwDUAJGUgsPVw9SHlpMSVhF&ext=TVRJRD1tOWU3MzVjMzliZjkyNTY2YWUwMjM4ZTUxYzVmMzczM2Q=>

* Password: *   * 1234 *

The Scheme Guidelines document is available on the AICTE website:  AICTE
Students Development Schemes
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1FN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoURBQfWAtVEFAcClxXCwccWkdSTBABUQRfUhFOQBJGVVUMTUMYUlRGA1RaQQwDWEUYRVMLU1xWEQ==&ext=>
.

* In view of the foregoing, you are kindly requested to make necessary
arrangements to join the Online Event from a Conference Hall/Auditorium, so
that maximum number of students can attend the launch event (mainly for the
Students). The APF Scheme is being introduced by the Council, which will
benefit the students irrespective of the Year, Branch / Program etc. can
attend the launch event. *

We look forward to your participation in this significant event.

PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cBsZrD8hwlK69twkBqJ1FX9AZYeuIQQX/view?usp=sharing
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1BN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoHQQpHXExRC1pWD1cdAQlfGlNcDwZNXU4DVCASaRR3CVgVVXsDD0VHDXpEe1Agbgh0bGkGQ3hiM2lOR19dFA==&ext=dXNwPXNoYXJpbmc=>


* With Regards, *

* Team AICTE Productization Fellowship (APF), SAG Bureau. *

--
Click Here
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVClNN&sl=cx1kSm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQAPWg1aFwNfB0FUTltdBg9TG1pHBEwDUAJGUj0IXQJaUFMHXB8=&ext=cD1zbXVuc3ViJm1pZD05NSZ1aWQ9W1VOSVFJRF0md3ZpZD0wMDE=>
to unsubscribe from this newsletter.

subject: Edunet Foundation Internship Opportunity for 4th Semester Students
snippet: Dear Students, We are pleased to inform you about an exciting internship opportunity in collaboration with Edunet Foundation, specifically designed for 4th-semester students across relevant disciplines
content:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to inform you about an exciting internship opportunity in
collaboration with *Edunet Foundation*, specifically designed for
*4**th-semester
students* across relevant disciplines.
*Internship Details:*

   -

   *Duration:* 08 Days (5* Days* of on-campus training + *3 Days* in *hybrid
   mode* (online/offline)
   -

   *Daily Hours:* 6 hours per day
   -

   *Mode:* Skill-based, project-oriented learning experience.

This internship will enhance your technical and soft skills through
immersive learning experiences and industry-relevant projects.

We encourage all eligible students to take full advantage of this
opportunity to enhance their employability and build a strong foundation
for their careers. The Edunet Foundation, in collaboration with Shell, is
pleased to offer an exciting internship opportunity through our Green and
AI Skills Program. This initiative is designed to equip students from
Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka with essential Artificial
Intelligence (AI) and Green skills, empowering them to thrive in the
emerging skill ecosystem and build successful careers in the fast-evolving
technology sector.
*Internship overview:*
The internship aims to bridge gaps in the existing academic curriculum
while enhancing student employability through hands-on technical skills and
industry-relevant knowledge. Broadly, it encompasses:

   - *60 hours* of accelerated internship for students enrolled in year 2
   of Science. *Refer to the brochures for the course outline (enclosed)
   and pre-requisites
   <https://edunetfoundationorg-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/namra_edunetfoundation_org/EW2Zgu3hVXFDsMv1UIGOXJ0BZFpXeGeB1dDOkbMVkr5BwA?e=LFROQl>*

   - *Opportunity to work with industry sponsors, *gain hands-on experience
   with real-world technology use cases, and develop prototypes using newly
   acquired skills.
   - *Free, co-branded certification* by sponsor organisations awarded upon
   successful completion of the program;
   - *Access to a wide range of self-paced courses* & a dedicated Learning
   Management System (LMS);
   - *Placement linkages* for eligible students to connect with relevant
   career opportunities.

*About Us:* *Edunet Foundationâ€¯ <http://www.edunetfoundation.org/>*(EF) is
a leading Indian NGO focused on education, skilling, employment, and
entrepreneurship. Edunet isâ€¯*GuideStar certified*â€¯and has Special
Consultative Status with the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) at
theâ€¯*United
Nations*.â€¯With a national footprint and association with regulators, state
skill development missions, schools, and higher education institutions,
EFâ€™s programs haveâ€¯impacted more thanâ€¯2,50,000â€¯learners in the last
year.â€¯We are closely associated with corporations like* Microsoft, IBM,
SAP, EY, Vodafone Idea, Aditya Birla, etc*. to implement their CSR
initiatives on skill development and enhance the skills of our future
workforce.

ğŸ‘‰ *You can register using the provided link: *
https://forms.gle/nNN3nAnTwzfpQuhVA
*----------------------------*

*Thanks & Regards,Ashwin Makwana/Sujal Dadhaniya*
*TPO - **Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*,
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *
AT: Changa, Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat.
(T) 02697-265213, 265214 (M) 9662255116
E: tpo@charusat.ac.in / tnp@charusat.ac.in

Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC
"Helping hand to shape a CAREER to achieve DREAMS"

--

subject: Submission of Summer Internship Details by 15th May
snippet: Dear Students, You are requested to fill in your summer internship details using the attached Google Sheet link by 15th May 2025. Kindly ensure the following while entering the details: Company Name
content:
Dear Students,

You are requested to fill in your *summer internship details* using the
attached Google Sheet link by *15th May 2025*.
Kindly ensure the following while entering the details:

   1.

   *Company Name*
   2.

   *Project Title and Domain*
   3.

   *Mentorâ€™s Name(External) and Contact Information*
   4.

   *Internship Duration* (start and end dates)

*Click on the attached Google Sheet link to submit your information:*
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RXWzXYZMhv1nmnrEs-ALFM9Ma-ZkUCX8XFwHzownOYE/edit?usp=sharing

Please ensure that all details provided are complete and accurate. Failure
to submit the information by the due date may result in delays in
processing your internship records.

For any queries, feel free to reach out to me.

Thank you for your cooperation.


-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

subject: Respond to the form "IT - Company Verification Form for Summer Internship 2025-26"
snippet: Chintal Raval published a form Chintal Raval (chintalraval.dit@charusat.ac.in) has invited you to respond to the following form: Dear Students We are in the process of verifying company details for our
content:
I've shared an item with you:

IT - Company Verification Form for Summer Internship 2025-26
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1-6wV7AwDl20qemctrNX1xBYARjr7I7WwiHQZqmPAkUI/edit?usp=sharing&ts=68218fb8

It's not an attachment -- it's stored online. To open this item, just click  
the link above.

Dear Students
We are in the process of verifying company details for our upcoming summer  
internship program. To facilitate this, we kindly request you to provide  
the necessary information for your company. This step is crucial to ensure  
that all participating companies meet our standards and guidelines.

If your company has already been verified, it will be pre-populated in the  
dropdown menu of the Excel sheet that will be shared with you later today.  
If not, please complete the details as required for the verification  
process.

--

subject: Fwd: Innovation Nexus : A Symposium on Multidisciplinary Research Collaboration
snippet: Dear All, Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA), Faculty of Computer Science and Applications (FCA), CHARUSAT, Changa, is organizing "Innovation Nexus: A
content:
Dear All,

Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA),
Faculty of Computer Science and Applications (FCA), CHARUSAT, Changa, is
organizing "*Innovation Nexus: A Symposium on
Multidisciplinary Research Collaboration*".

This symposium is designed to provide a dynamic platform for researchers,
faculty members, and students to collaborate across disciplines,
encouraging innovative research and fostering academic growth. A
distinguished expert in industrial AI/ML projects will deliver an
insightful session on the latest technological developments in Artificial
Intelligence and its applications in diverse research domains.

An exciting opportunity for research scholars, faculty members, and
students from various disciplines to showcase their research through *engaging
poster presentation sessions*. This competition aims to promote research
dissemination in emerging areas of knowledge.

   -

   *Date:* 7th June 2025 (Saturday)
   -

   *Time:* 10:00 AM to 04:00 PM
   -

   *Venue:* CMPICA, CHARUSAT, Off Nadiad-Petlad Highway, Changa, Dist.
   Anand, Gujarat, India.


All the researchers, faculty members, and students are invited to register
for the same.

*Expert Talk *


   - *Speaker:* Dr. Nidhi Arora
   - *Designation:* Co-Founder and Director - AI, Advic Tech, Sola,
   Ahmedabad
   - *Expertise:* Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate, AI/ML
   Practitioner, GenAI Consultant, MLOps Speaker, Automation Specialist
   - *Topic:* *AI for Interdisciplinary Applications*

We cordially invite all researchers, faculty members, and postgraduate
students to register and participate.

ğŸ”— *Register here:* https://bit.ly/Innovation-Nexus

For further details, kindly refer to the attached brochure.

Warm regards,
*Organizing Team*
CMPICA, CHARUSAT

--

subject: Fwd: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on â€œSWAYAM and SWAYAM Plusâ€ to get feedback from all Faculty, Learners & Students of AICTE approved Institutions - Regarding
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, May 11, 2025 at 6:38 AM Subject: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on â€œSWAYAM and SWAYAM Plus
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, May 11, 2025 at 6:38â€¯AM
Subject: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on â€œSWAYAM and
SWAYAM Plusâ€ to get feedback from all Faculty, Learners & Students of AICTE
approved Institutions - Regarding
To:


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/07-May/AICTE2/index.html>
------------------------------
Sir/Madam,

Greetings from AICTE!

As you aware that â€œStudy Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Mindsâ€
(SWAYAM) is an initiative under the Ministry of Education, Government of
India, designed to provide quality education to all, in line with the three
cardinal principles of the National Education Policy â€“access, equity, and
quality. SWAYAM is a Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) platform aimed
at democratizing education, particularly for those unable to join the
mainstream knowledge  economy due to various barriers.

Mr. Suraj Kr. Maurya, Training Officer, NIOS, one of the ten National
Coordinators of SWAYAM across India, has conducted a research study on
â€œSWAYAM & SWAYAM Plus: Catalysts for Inclusive Education in Indiaâ€ and
has formulated a bilingual Questionnaire along with a QR Code  as per  his
letter No. F-82-20/2025/NIOS/CBC/SWAYAM, dated 12.03.2025 (attached for
ready reference).

You are requested to please disseminate the above bilingual Questionnaire
among all faculty, students, learners and others concerned to scan the QR
Code of the bilingual questionnaire and send their feedback to email:
niossurajmaurya@gmail.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=809ffd01333ffa42ae97f63c14ffdbfcdc55239c&lat=2025&mid=d5c3395d16c67036eeda12b662bfe7a66094d118>
.


PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1REhlQtOQcA4HkzRwqoEljppEwSfvwc1M/view?usp=sharin
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=e4e036d1422e8e37de1045fb6208a3d3cd38c413&lat=2025&mid=d5c3395d16c67036eeda12b662bfe7a66094d118>g


*Regards,*
*Dr. Amit Dutta,*
*Director (P&AP)*
*AICTE,*
*New Delhi-110070*

subject: Innovations Shaping the Future

content:
Tracking the trends shaping tomorrow.
Welcome to your inside look at the ideas, partnerships, and advancements shaping the future of technology. subject: How to: Get the first 100 users for your Lovable app
snippet: Hey, Even most of the greatest builders struggle when they need to ask themselves "How do I get users to try this great thing I built". At Lovable we're committed to help you. Follow
content:
Lovable Logo

Hey,

Even most of the greatest builders struggle when they need to ask themselves "How do I get users to try this great thing I built".

At Lovable we're committed to help you. Follow these 4 steps:

* Publish your app on Lovable Launched ( https://launched.lovable.app/ ) to reach thousands of potential users & get feedback
* Join our Discord ( https://discord.com/invite/lovable-dev ) to showcase your app, get feedback, and discuss with others how to share
* Publish your app on X ( https://x.com/i/communities/1858851338257572046 ) and tag @lovable_dev. We'll re-post your app to showcase it to our community
* Lastly, sign up to our waitlist ( https://lovable.typeform.com/to/wxbx6qfP#email=lilianaocampoh@gmail.com ) for future marketing training opportunities

Our greatest success is if we can help you succeed - if there's anything else we can do to help, please let us know.

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in <amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in>,
harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in <harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in>,
arpitapatel.ec@charusat.ac.in <arpitapatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
trushitupadhyaya.ec@charusat.ac.in <trushitupadhyaya.ec@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Students,

Weâ€™re excited to invite you to join the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
2025-26*, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and
professionally. Whether you're looking to gain hands-on experience, build
your resume, or expand your network, IEEE has something for you!
What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization. Our
Student Branches are university-based groups that offer opportunities for
career development, technical learning, leadership experience, and
networking within fields of engineering and related disciplines.
Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Build Your Resume with Projects and Skills:* Participate in technical
   projects, workshops, and hackathons in areas like Robotics, Artificial
   Intelligence, Signal Processing, VLSI, and more.
   - *Exclusive Networking Opportunities:* Connect with industry
   professionals, mentors, and peers globally for internships, jobs, and
   guidance.
   - *Leadership Experience:* Take on roles within the branch to develop
   key professional skills.
   - *Access to Global Competitions and Events:* Join competitions like
   IEEE Xtreme and attend conferences that boost your professional exposure.
   - *Resources to Stay Ahead:* Get access to the IEEE Xplore Digital
   Library and other exclusive member tools.

Learn more about the benefits of IEEE membership:

   - Student Membership Benefits
   <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>
   - General IEEE Membership Benefits
   <https://www.ieee.org/membership/benefits/index.html>

*Avail the half-yearly offer now and join IEEE at a 50% discount!*

Please refer to the attached PDF for step-by-step instructions on how to
take up membership.

For any queries please reply to this mail.

Join IEEE Now <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>

subject: Fwd: PM Mentorship Scheme for Young Authors (Yuva) 3.0
snippet: Sir / Madam, Concerning the above, this is to bring to your kind attention that after the successful execution of the two editions of PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme, PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme 3.0 has been
content:
Sir / Madam,

Concerning the above, this is to bring to your kind attention that after
the successful execution of the two editions of PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme,
PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme 3.0 has been launched by the Ministry of
Education, Government of India  * to train young and budding authors  *
(below 30 years of age) for the year 2025-26 with the National Book Trust,
India as the Implementing Agency. The Themes of PM-YUVA 3.0 are:

a.Contribution of Indian Diaspora in Nation Building

b.Indian Knowledge System

c.Makers of Modern India (1950-2025)

The scheme will help to develop a stream of writers who can write on
various facets of India encompassing the past, present and future. Besides,
the scheme will also provide a window to the aspiring youth to articulate
themselves and present a comprehensive outlook of contribution of Indians
across fields in ancient and present times.

The scheme aims to cultivate a new generation of writers who can articulate
the contributions of the Indian diaspora in nation-building, highlighting
their peaceful integration and influence across political, economic, and
socio-cultural spheres. It will also emphasise on the role of the Indian
Knowledge System in preserving historical wisdom, generating new
opportunities, and synthesising indigenous knowledge for national
development.

Through this initiative, young authors will explore the impact of
visionaries in various fields like education, science, economy, social
empowerment, etc. thereby presenting a comprehensive narrative of India's
growth and resilience. Given Indiaâ€™s position as the third-largest book
publishing market, this initiative is a crucial step toward projecting its
intellectual and cultural wealth on the global stage.

An online National Contest is being organised from 11 March 2025 â€“ 10 June
2025 to select the authors under the Scheme. There is a provision for
payment of a Scholarship of Rs.50,000 per month for a period of six months
to be paid to each of the selected 50 authors. National Book Trust, India
will be publishing the books produced by the young authors as part of the
Mentorship Scheme.
* You are requested to disseminate the information pertaining to the Scheme
among the students and other stakeholders to encourage greater
participation in this prestigious scheme. *

The details can be accessed at  * https://www.mygov.in/
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CVkBBgkfAhlVB1ZN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D%2BPM%2BMentorship%2BScheme%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoURBQfVBtRC0MfClwc&ext=>
*

The further enquiries related to the Scheme can be sent to the
director@nbtindia.gov.in
,  chiefeditor.nbtindia@gmail.com  and  nbtyuva3.0@gmail.com .

Please find below the link to the Contest and other details for ready
reference:  https:// innovateindia.mygov.in/yuva- 2025
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CVkBBgkfAhlVB1VN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D%2BPM%2BMentorship%2BScheme%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoKXQ1eTwNCAVxfB1tSTAtLUlpDTQoMFhhHQQNMAVYBBA==&ext=>

subject: Fwd: Deadline Extended: DMP 2025 by Code for GovTech x Apna | â‚¹1 Lakh Stipend | PPOs for Top Performers
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing email for good opportunities in tech projects. Feel free to contact TNP coordinators for any queries and clarifications. After receiving multiple requests,
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing email for good opportunities in tech
projects. Feel free to contact TNP coordinators for any queries
and clarifications.




After receiving multiple requests, the deadline for the Dedicated Mentoring
Program (DMP) 2025 by Code for GovTech (C4GT), in collaboration with Apna,
has been extended until Sunday, 11th May at 11:59 PM.

This national-level initiative empowers students and early professionals to
work on impactful, open-source tech projects that address large-scale
public challenges. Over a 3-month period, selected participants will
collaborate with expert mentors and receive a â‚¹1,00,000 stipend for their
contributions.

Application Link:
https://apna.co/contests/dmp_2025?utm_source=email&utm_medium=TPO&utm_campaign=TPO

Key Highlights:

   -

   Work on open-source projects with real-world, population-scale social
   impact
   -

   1:1 mentorship from domain experts in top organizations
   -

   ~â‚¹1,00,000 stipend for selected mentees
   -

   Pre-placement offers (PPOs) and internship opportunities for top
   performers
   -

   No application fee â€“ itâ€™s completely free to apply

We sincerely appreciate your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students and alumni, especially those who are passionate about open-source
technology, public service, and social impact.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need additional
information. Weâ€™re looking forward to seeing more participation from your
institution.

Warm regards,

Mehak

--

subject: Fwd: Register for NIDAR: Indiaâ€™s Largest National Drone Innovation Challenge-reg
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing mail. Read all the details and the eligibility criteria to register for NIDAR: India's Largest National Drone Innovation Challenge. The interested
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing mail. Read all the details and the
eligibility criteria to register for NIDAR: Indiaâ€™s Largest National Drone
Innovation Challenge. The interested students are hereby informed to inform
their willingness to participate via repl to this email by today 2:00 pm.



*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*








Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/07-May/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Madam/Sir,

*Greetings from AICTE!*

The *National Innovation Challenge for Drone Application & Research (NIDAR)* is
Indiaâ€™s largest national drone innovation challenge hosted by the Ministry
of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) and Drone Federation
India (DFI) under the *SwaYaan* Initiative. SwaYaan is a National
Initiative by MeitY to develop and strengthen Indiaâ€™s UAS/Drone ecosystem,
aligning with the Governmentâ€™s vision to make India a global drone hub by
2030. The Drone Federation India (DFI) is a non-government, non-profit,
industry-led body representing 550+ drone companies and 5500+ drone pilots
across the country.

With prizes, startup incubation, and industry mentorship, NIDAR inspires
students and researchers from academia to build collaborative
autonomous drones for solving real-world problems in disaster management
and precision agriculture. Through this initiative, participants gain
hands-on experience, industry-relevant skills, and access to career
opportunities in Indiaâ€™s rapidly growing drone sector. NIDAR aims to be a
transformative milestone in shaping Indiaâ€™s future of drone technology and
aerospace innovation.

*Institutions are encouraged to motivate their students & researchers to
register for NIDAR at *https://nidar.org.in
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=0168c1274cab9f602e8ea18433dbb23410d46f08&lat=2025&mid=c3e7e23f08df8773e65f77a02a86b806d290f913>*.
The last date for registration is 10th May 2025.*

We seek your active support for the initiative.

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hw23rOTXBul3MJle0bXJwYj413x3epkD/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=33b448332f5ea54072ba8e46e60ed9bace6cb7c8&lat=2025&mid=c3e7e23f08df8773e65f77a02a86b806d290f913>



*Warm regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*

content:
Dear Students,

We have gone through your projects. We kindly request you to go through the
details of the AI FinArva Hackathon (available in the trailing email) and
meet me in Lab 206 today, i.e, 09.05.2025 at 1:00 pm without fail.

*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

> Subject: FinArva AI Hackathon 2025 | â‚¹10L+ Rewards + Direct Interviews
> (CTC up to â‚¹25 LPA)
> To:
>
> Dear Placement Cell Team,
>
> I'm reaching out from Apnaâ€™s Early Career Engagements team to share an
> opportunity that may be relevant for your students and recent graduates.
>
> FinArva AI Hackathon 2025
> <https://apna.co/contests/finarva-ai-hackathon-2025?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=TPO_30_PI&utm_id=TPOIT>,
> hosted by GroMo and powered by AWS, is now accepting applications. This
> national-level hackathon invites participants to build AI-led solutions for
> real challenges in financial product distribution, particularly for
> Bharatâ€™s next billion users.
>
> Selected participants will go through mentorship, collaborate with peers,
> and present their ideas to industry leaders. Top teams will also be
> considered for direct interviews with GroMo (CTC up to â‚¹25 LPA).
>
>
>
>    -
>
>    Direct Interviews with CTC up to INR 25 LPA
>    -
>
>    Open to students, recent graduates, and professionals with an interest
>    in AI, product, and fintech
>    -
>
>    No commercial involvement at any stage â€“ participation is free
>    -
>
>    Winners receive prizes worth â‚¹10,00,000+
>    -
>
>    In-person 3-day build sprint in Gurgaon (accommodation and meals
>    covered)
>
> Important Dates:
>
>    -
>
>    Phase 1: Virtual submission deadline â€“ 19th May 2025
>    -
>
>    Phase 2: In-person hackathon in Gurgaon â€“ 30th May to 1st June 2025
>
> Weâ€™d appreciate it if you could circulate this among your students. Please
> also feel free to extend this to your alumni networkâ€”individuals or
> early-stage professionals who may be interested in building with AI or
> exploring fintech problems.
>
> Let me know if you'd like to discuss anything about the event.
> Warm regards,
> Mehak
> Team apna
>

subject: How Lovable users make money with Lovable
snippet: Hey again, Have you ever thought about earning money from Lovable? Here are a few ways people in our community are doing it: Offer Freelance Projects â€“ Our user Sarah pitched a local restaurant with an
content:
Lovable Logo

Hey again,

Have you ever thought about earning money from Lovable? Here are a few ways people in our community are doing it:

* Offer Freelance Projects â€“ Our user Sarah pitched a local restaurant with an outdated ordering system and rebuilt it faster and more affordably than an agency. With Lovableâ€™s tools (like Stripe checkout), she delivered quickly and landed a happy customer.
* Build & Monetize SaaS â€“ Multiple Lovable users have launched subscription-based apps that bring in recurring revenue. For inspiration, check out Renamify ( https://renamify.co/ ) or Aneta ( https://www.aneta.so/ ) (both powered by Lovable).
* Consulting & Workshops â€“ Harry teaches local businesses how to create efficient web tools using Lovable via paid workshops.
* Become a Lovable Partner ( https://lovable.dev/partners ) â€“ Itâ€™s the easiest way to connect with clients looking for custom solutions in our community. As a partner, youâ€™ll get priority access to new projects, plus the freedom to build on your own terms.

Weâ€™re excited to see how youâ€™ll leverage Lovable to turn your passion into income.

Got an inspirational story to share? Reply to this email or post it on x.com and tag @lovable_dev. Can't wait to hear from you!

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Lovable Logo

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

subject: Fwd: Invitation for students to join the Google Cloud India Summit Livestream â€“ Free & Virtual
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing mail and attend the interesting summit for developers on Google Cloud. Hi Amit J Nayak, We hope this message finds you well. We're excited to invite
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing mail and attend the interesting summit for
developers on Google Cloud.





Hi Amit J Nayak,

We hope this message finds you well.

Weâ€™re excited to invite your students to the Google Cloud India Summit
livestream taking place on May 8th, 2025, from 10:30 AM. This summit is
designed to empower the next generation of developers and technologists
with the latest knowledge in cloud computing, Generative AI, and
intelligent applications â€” straight from Googleâ€™s experts.

This is more than just another tech event. The livestream offers students
firsthand exposure to cutting-edge tools by Google along with live product
demos, and expert-led sessions. Itâ€™s a unique opportunity to gain practical
skills and insights into how cloud and AI are transforming industries.

Click here for the YouTube link
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2FgmcnDBiYq2Sm76381WvuZfJQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/dGhd2wLPTw28990aaPhZPzZekgI=210>


Benefits for Students

The Summit is a great opportunity for students to get industry knowledge
straight from Google experts. Here are the things your students can take
away from the summit:

   - Learn directly from Google engineers and experts
   - Get a front-row seat to the future of cloud and Gen AI
   - Future-proof themselves by staying ahead of the curve
   - Explore how top companies are using these AI tools and technologies

The summit livestream is completely free and open to all students and
professionals, regardless of their technical background. Whether theyâ€™re in
engineering, computer science, or any tech-related stream, this is a chance
to stay ahead of the curve in an ever evolving digital world.

Keynote Address

Building the Intelligent Future: How Gemini 2.5 and the New Cloud Empower
Developers to Transform Work.

Add to Calendar
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2FxTPIFvMJllT0sHgEAztCXQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/6lJp5NJLo9JdAShQ3_E7SFbNeJ8=210>

Customer Panel Discussion

This panel discussion will explore the profound ways in which Artificial
Intelligence is reshaping the daily workflows, skill sets, and overall
impact of developers within organizations.

Add to Calendar
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2F4F892cCN33g5JEElPd8PaqOQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/NgAHfmCGV45XQQ_nUutJcxnBwqQ=210>

Your Support Matters

We kindly request you to encourage your students to attend this event. Your
guidance can help them unlock valuable industry exposure and connect with
future-ready technologies that will shape their careers.

Thank you for your continued support in enabling student growth and
industry engagement. Please feel free to share the registration link widely
across your student and faculty networks.

Regards,
Team Hack2skill

Click here
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Funsubscribe%2F03F7GK892IrXh0n6gA892374Db5wt7pAkkBvaJN892BBf5JhQ%2FaaWZFRTELDaDBFe72763K7lA%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/NVM7RtkaTH_Xf5LpAm5sqMk9dwo=210>

subject: Supa Update April 2025
snippet: Supabase Update â€” April 2025 Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in ğŸ‘‹ Here's everything that happened with Supabase in the last month: Project Scoped Roles Project Scoped Roles Project scoped roles are now
content:
()

*****************************
Supabase Update â€” April 2025
*****************************

Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in,

Hereâ€™s everything that happened with Supabase in the last month:

## Project scoped roles

[Project scoped roles](https://supabase.link/projectscopedroles-project-scoped-roles-apr2025-tg16)Â are now available for all Supabase Team plans. Each member in the organization can be assigned a role scoped to the organization or to specific projects.

[[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-project-scoped-roles-apr2025-k2mz)]

## MCP Server now works with VS Code

Set up the Supabase MCP server to work with Visual Studio Code.

[[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-mcp-server-vscode-setup-apr2025-0580)]

## MCP Server can now create and deploy Edge Functions

Use the Supabase MCP server to build Edge Functions.

[[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-mcp-edge-functions-deploy-apr2025-az9v)]

## Supabase UI Library now includes Infinite Query block

React hook for infinite lists that fetches data from Supabase. Use it for infinite scroll.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-infinite-query-apr2025-23b2)] [[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-supabase-infinite-query-apr2025-ruve)]

## Supabase UI Library now includes Social Auth

A block to quickly create authentication UI for [all supported social logins](https://supabase.link/allsupportedsociallogins-supabase-ui-social-auth-apr2025-6vae).

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-ui-social-auth-apr2025-4fcs)] [[Twitter](https://supabase.link/twitter-supabase-ui-social-auth-apr2025-vmmi)]

## Quick Product Announcements

- The new Supabase SOC 2 report is available. [[Link](https://supabase.com/features/soc-2-compliance)]
- We published comprehensive documentation about our security processes and controls. [[Docs](https://supabase.link/docs-security-docs-overview-apr2025-5xpu)]

## Made with Supabase

- Web application for creating and editing AI-generated avatars using OpenAIâ€™s DALL-E API. Built with React, TypeScript, and Supabase. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-ai-avatar-creator-apr2025-96xb)]
- Data transformation systems engineered for your needs [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-data-transformation-systems-apr2025-tgv8)] [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-data-transformation-systems-apr2025-prei)]
- Command line for finding lines that have specific keywords in Rust . [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-rust-cli-keywords-apr2025-byhp)]

## Community Highlights

- Create a Reusable Team component for your application using Next.js, Supabase, and Shadcn [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-reusable-team-component-apr2025-dsxs)]
- Grocery Tracker App using Vue JS and Supabase [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-grocery-tracker-vue-apr2025-f8uy)]
- Use Supabase MCP in VSCode and Cursor [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-supabase-mcp-vscode-apr2025-u5vp)]
- Supabase WordPress Integration - SupaWP Plugin [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-supabase-wordpress-plugin-apr2025-njvx)]
- Implementing multi-tenancy into a Supabase app with Clerk [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-multi-tenancy-supabase-clerk-apr2025-4aza)]
- Build This Self-Expanding YouTube-Powered AI Agent Knowledge Base (n8n + Supabase) [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-self-expanding-ai-apr2025-zvzn)]
- Custom SMTP for Supabase Email Authentication | Complete Setup + Testing [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-custom-smtp-supabase-apr2025-od4h)]
- AI Chatbot That Remembers You! (n8n + Supabase + WhatsApp) [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-ai-chatbot-remembering-apr2025-t09w)]
- Building a MCP-Powered Task Manager Agent with Agno and Supabase: A Step-by-Step Guide [[Article](https://supabase.link/article-mcp-task-manager-apr2025-pc21)]
- How to Build an App From SCRATCH with Lovable + Supabase [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-build-app-scratch-apr2025-k9xh)]

## Weâ€™re Hiring

Come join one of the fastest-growing open source projects ever ğŸ¤—

**Engineering**

- [Billing engineer](https://supabase.link/job-billingengineer-apr2025-8sk1)
- [Client Library Engineer: Python + JavaScript](https://supabase.link/job-clientlibraryengineerpythonjavascript-apr2025-16o8)
- [Senior Auth Engineer](https://supabase.link/job-seniorauthengineer-apr2025-udqk)

## âš ï¸ Baking hot meme zone âš ï¸

[[Twitter](https://x.com/GeoffreyHuntley/status/1906626575946408051)]

From: <mehak.chhabra@apna.co>
Date: Wed, Apr 30, 2025 at 4:10â€¯PM
Subject: FinArva AI Hackathon 2025 | â‚¹10L+ Rewards + Direct Interviews (CTC
up to â‚¹25 LPA)
To:

Dear Placement Cell Team,

I'm reaching out from Apnaâ€™s Early Career Engagements team to share an
opportunity that may be relevant for your students and recent graduates.

FinArva AI Hackathon 2025
<https://apna.co/contests/finarva-ai-hackathon-2025?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=TPO_30_PI&utm_id=TPOIT>,
hosted by GroMo and powered by AWS, is now accepting applications. This
national-level hackathon invites participants to build AI-led solutions for
real challenges in financial product distribution, particularly for
Bharatâ€™s next billion users.

Selected participants will go through mentorship, collaborate with peers,
and present their ideas to industry leaders. Top teams will also be
considered for direct interviews with GroMo (CTC up to â‚¹25 LPA).



   -

   Direct Interviews with CTC up to INR 25 LPA
   -

   Open to students, recent graduates, and professionals with an interest
   in AI, product, and fintech
   -

   No commercial involvement at any stage â€“ participation is free
   -

   Winners receive prizes worth â‚¹10,00,000+
   -

   In-person 3-day build sprint in Gurgaon (accommodation and meals covered)

Important Dates:

   -

   Phase 1: Virtual submission deadline â€“ 19th May 2025
   -

   Phase 2: In-person hackathon in Gurgaon â€“ 30th May to 1st June 2025

Weâ€™d appreciate it if you could circulate this among your students. Please
also feel free to extend this to your alumni networkâ€”individuals or
early-stage professionals who may be interested in building with AI or
exploring fintech problems.

Let me know if you'd like to discuss anything about the event.
Warm regards,
Mehak
Team apna

snippet: Dear Students, Please go through the trailing mail. Interested students, please participate and let your counselors know about your participation and progress. National Inter-college Crossword
content:
Dear Students,

Please go through the trailing mail. Interested students, please
participate and let your counselors know about your participation and
progress.


National Inter-college Crossword Expedition NICE 25 is starting on the 4th
of May. AICTE circular, posters and promos attached.

<https://imsva91-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fnice.crypticsingh.com%2fregister&umid=D2B792A1-3447-3906-96E9-B6FDF2D461ED&auth=777990cd74cc620430ea9ccd0417e323e70695df-ccc8fc1db8563231b57fb21a9cc98baffda40542>
https://nice.crypticsingh.com/default?ReturnUrl=/
<https://imsva91-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fnice.crypticsingh.com%2fdefault%3fReturnUrl%3d%2f&umid=D2B792A1-3447-3906-96E9-B6FDF2D461ED&auth=777990cd74cc620430ea9ccd0417e323e70695df-1b10b24e06c8af764eab337247a8215efe47113e>

A large participation from students of all institutes across the Gujarat
would be of immense value.

PFA for NA.

*Thanks & Regards*

*Dr. V. V. Prajapati*

*Jt. Director (Academic*)

Commissionerate of Technical Education

Block No. 2, 6th Floor,

Karmayogi Bhavan Sector-10-A,

Gandhinagar â€“ 382 010. GUJARAT

subject: Create a custom domain for your Lovable app in < 2 minutes
snippet: Hi there, Realized you haven't published your Lovable app to your own domain yet. It's never been easier to get your own website up and running, let me explain how: Navigate to Publish in the
content:
Lovable Logo

Hi there,

Realized you haven't published your Lovable app to your own domain yet.

It's never been easier to get your own website up and running, let me explain how:

* Navigate to Publish in the top-right corner of the Lovable editor > Manage Domain > Buy a domain
* Find an available domain and complete the purchase
* Back in Lovable, click on "Connect Domain" if not automatically happening

VoilÃ , your app is now accessible on a custom domain!

Open Lovable to publish your app on your domain ( https://lovable.dev/ ) right away!

If helpful, we have a more extensive step-by-step guide here ( https://docs.lovable.dev/tips-tricks/custom-domain ).

Start Building Now ( https://lovable.dev )

Best,
The Lovable Team

Lovable Logo

Turn ideas into Lovable products at
Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

content:
Hi everyone,

Iâ€™m *Anish Mathakiya*, from *CSPIT-CE (2021â€“25 batch)*. I currently
run an *offline
global trading company*, and now Iâ€™m building my new *online retail startup
â€” Novera Global*, focused on home improvement & dÃ©cor products like kitchen
sinks, wash basins, bathroom accessories, and more.

Iâ€™m hiring a *long-term intern team* to join me in this journey. If youâ€™re
truly serious, want to work consistently, and grow with a real startup â€”
this is for you.

ğŸ“¢ Open Roles:

*1. E-Commerce Operations Intern*

   -

   Listing on Amazon, Flipkart, website
   -

   Updating stock, prices, and order handling
   -

   Reports & basic analytics

*2. Digital Marketing Intern*

   -

   Running IG, FB & Google Ads
   -

   Keyword research, SEO, performance analysis

*3. Social Media & Content Intern*

   -

   Posting content on IG, FB, LinkedIn
   -

   Managing calendar, engaging with community

*4. Creative & Graphics Intern*


   -

   Designing social media posts, product banners
   -

   Making short reels/videos
   -

   Branding creatives


ğŸ“Œ Internship Details:

   -

   *Fully Remote | Flexible Timing*
   -

   *First 30 Days = Practice Period* (youâ€™ll learn everything)
   -

   *Stipend after 30 days*, performance-based & increasing

   *6-month internship certificate* (internship continues after that)

------------------------------
ğŸ Perks:

   -

   *PPO (Pre-Placement Offer)* for outstanding performers

   *Chance to earn working partnership* in Novera Global

   Real-world *business experience & mentorship*

------------------------------

content:

4IT IT264 FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPMENT  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyODYxMTgwOTQw?email%3Dd24dit079@charusat.edu.in&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

Group A (3 Hr Practical External Practical Exam)

College Event Management Module

Objective
Build a web application using the MERN Stack that allows users to manage  
various types of college events efficiently.

Features

    - Login/Register User - only logged in user can perform all activities
    - Frontend
    - Create Event (facilitate images upload, types of events)
    - Event List
    - Delete/Edit Event
    - Desplay Event Details -  (pop up)
    - Search

Backend (Develop RESTful APIs:)

    - List all events
    - Add new event
    - Delete an event
    - Edit an event
    - Display Event Details

Create MongoDB Backend with name : college_events_<your_college_id>
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyODYxMTgwOTQw/p/Nzc3NjQ4NzcyNDE1?email%3Dd24dit079@charusat.edu.in&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
