subject: Supa Update March 2025
snippet: Supabase Update â€” March 2025 Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in ğŸ‘‹ Here's a recap of everything we announced during Launch Week and the month of March: Supabase MCP Server Supabase MCP Server We are
content:
()

*****************************
Supabase Update â€” March 2025
*****************************

Hey d24dit079@charusat.edu.in

Hereâ€™s a recap of everything we announced during Launch Week and the month of March:

## Supabase MCP Server

We are launching an official Supabase MCP server. You can use this server to connect your favorite AI tools (such as Cursor or Claude) directly with Supabase.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-mcp-server-mar2025-67zo)] [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-supabase-mcp-launch-mar2025-o0h9)]

## Supabase UI Library

A set of convenient components built on shadcn that can be dropped into any Next.js, React Router, Tanstack Start, or vanilla React application. This initial release includes the following components:

- [Password-based authentication](https://supabase.link/password-basedauthentication-password-authentication-guide-mar2025-cw5l)
- [File Upload Dropzone](https://supabase.link/fileuploaddropzone-file-upload-dropzone-mar2025-hfeq)
- [Realtime Cursor Sharing](https://supabase.link/realtimecursorsharing-realtime-cursor-sharing-mar2025-baf8)
- [Current User Avatar](https://supabase.link/currentuseravatar-current-user-avatar-mar2025-6tay)
- [Realtime Avatar Stack](https://supabase.link/realtimeavatarstack-realtime-avatar-stack-mar2025-ut53)
- [Realtime Chat](https://supabase.link/realtimechat-realtime-chat-feature-mar2025-4xwk)

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-ui-library-mar2025-sy2o)]

## Supabase Studio Improvements

We shipped a number of Supabase Studio improvements and new features. Hereâ€™s a quick rundown of whatâ€™s new:

- **Tabs!**: The Table Editor and SQL Editor now have tabs!
- **Customizable Reports**: create reports to show data exactly how you want to see it
- **SQL Blocks in Custom reports**: use SQL Snippets in blocks inside your custom reports
- **Inline SQL Editor**: use a mini SQL Editor anywhere in the Dashboard
- **Multiple AI Assistant chats**: maintain history of your Assistant chats
- **Logs improvements**: more detailed inspect panel, and stacked charts

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-studio-updates-mar2025-3pej)] [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-supabase-studio-updates-mar2025-0w2r)]

## Edge Functions Deploy from the Supabase Dashboard

You can now create, test, edit, and deploy Supabase Edge Functions directly from the Supabase Dashboard.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-edge-functions-deploy-dashboard-mar2025-8ttw)]

## Realtime Broadcast from Database

Send messages based on changes in the Database, directly from the Database itself. Scale to support sending Database change messages to tens of thousands of users.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-realtime-database-broadcast-mar2025-08p2)]

## Declarative Schemas

Use declarative schemas to define your database structure in a clear, centralized, and version-controlled manner.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-declarative-schemas-database-mar2025-vlqf)]

## Postgres Language Server

Postgres Language Server provides a collection of language tools and a Language Server Protocol (LSP) implementation for Postgres, focusing on developer experience and reliable SQL tooling. Today, we support autocompletion, syntax error highlighting, type-checking, and a linter.

[[Link](https://supabase.link/link-postgres-language-server-tools-mar2025-2ple)]

## Quick Product Announcements

- We expanded our official Third-party Auth integrations to includeÂ [Clerk](https://supabase.link/clerk-third-party-auth-clerk-mar2025-hlnq). We also made Third-party Auth cheaper so that it has pricing parity with Supabase Auth. [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-third-party-auth-clerk-mar2025-qu0z)]
- We have added Deno 2.1 support for Supabase Edge Runtime. With Deno 2.1, you can use built-in tools to scaffold a new project, manage dependencies, run tests, and lints. [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-deno-2-1-support-mar2025-j2ee)]
- You can now automate generation and updates of embeddings in your database. [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-automate-embeddings-updates-mar2025-o0r1)] [[Docs](https://supabase.link/docs-automate-embeddings-updates-mar2025-mtlt)]
- Geo-routing for Supabase API Load Balancer optimizes requests performance for your globally distributed users. [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-geo-aware-routing-mar2025-31v5)]
- Dedicated Poolers are now available in Supabase for everyone on the Pro Plan and above. [[Blog](https://supabase.link/blog-dedicated-poolers-pro-mar2025-lvvf)] [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-dedicated-poolers-available-mar2025-0tgw)]
- The Supabase docs now support type hints. [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-supabase-type-hints-mar2025-822n)]

## Launch Week Hackathon Winners

- AI RPG - An Interactive storytelling platform that enables players to create and play through AI-generated narrative adventures. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-ai-rpg-narratives-mar2025-q8uf)]
- AI Travel Concierge - An app that helps you travel by suggesting destinations and attractions and planning them. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-ai-travel-assistant-mar2025-p6cy)]
- CiteAnalytics - A web analytics tool that tracks when LLM visits your website. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-citeanalytics-llm-tracking-mar2025-ujpb)]
- play.theplaylist - Create YouTube playlists with an interactive UI and easily share it with friends. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-create-youtube-playlists-mar2025-bkcf)]
- sendit - A social media content creation tool to refine posts using AI. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-sendit-ai-tool-mar2025-113z)]
- StoryTime - Generate educational stories for kids using AI. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-storytime-ai-stories-mar2025-cvwt)]
- Supabadge - Generate your own beautiful Supabase event badge! [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-supabadge-generate-event-mar2025-q7so)]
- SupaQuery - Supabase SQL editor with Vim support. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-supaquery-sql-vim-mar2025-gxm8)]
- QuickAudit - An app that logs every DB change (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) for auditing. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-quick-audit-db-logs-mar2025-mwid)]
- Todayâ€™s Diary - A diary app with a minimalistic UI that lets you exchange diary entries with another random user every day. [[Tweet](https://supabase.link/tweet-diary-app-exchange-mar2025-p5nq)]

## Made with Supabase

- MagiCan - Finalist of our Lovable x Supabase hackathon. An infinite canvas platform that revolutionizes collaborative storytelling and project planning with advanced AI capabilities. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-magican-finalist-hackathon-mar2025-ligv)]
- Next.js + Stripe + Supabase A Production-Ready Template - Start building with authentication and payments in minutes. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-nextjs-stripe-supabase-mar2025-5jfb)] [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-nextjs-stripe-supabase-mar2025-5qu1)]
- Hono Supabase Auth Example - This example shows how to use Supabase Auth both on the client and server side with Hono. [[GitHub](https://supabase.link/github-hono-supabase-auth-mar2025-zy9i)]
- Discover exactly when you can achieve financial independence with FireCalculator a precision calculator and visualization tools. [[Website](https://supabase.link/website-financial-independence-timing-mar2025-ncs5)]

## Community Highlights

- Implementing multi-tenancy into a Supabase app with Clerk [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-multi-tenancy-supabase-clerk-mar2025-3vfc)]
- Supabase Just Dropped Their Own Fullstack UI Library! [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-supabase-ui-library-mar2025-uy13)]
- Generating and Storing Google Gemini Embeddings with Vercel AI SDK and Supabase [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-google-gemini-embeddings-mar2025-kidk)]
- Secure Your Next.js App: Email & Google Authentication with Supabase, PostgreSQL RLS, and Triggers [[Link](https://supabase.link/link-secure-nextjs-authentication-mar2025-olom)]
- Supabase just dropped an official MCP Server [[YouTube](https://supabase.link/youtube-supabase-mcp-server-launch-mar2025-yy9s)]

## Weâ€™re Hiring

Come join one of the fastest-growing open source projects ever ğŸ¤—

**Engineering**

- [Client Library Engineer: Python + JavaScript](https://supabase.link/job-clientlibraryengineerpythonjavascript-mar2025-fg8a)
- [Design Engineer](https://supabase.link/job-designengineer-mar2025-jaj6)
- [Senior Auth Engineer](https://supabase.link/job-seniorauthengineer-mar2025-gdyn)
- [Supabase Platform Engineer](https://supabase.link/job-supabaseplatformengineer-mar2025-w4fn)
- [Site Reliability Engineer: Postgres](https://supabase.link/job-sitereliabilityengineerpostgres-mar2025-oleb)

**Growth**

- [Senior/Staff Support Engineer (EMEA)](https://supabase.link/job-seniorstaffsupportengineeremea-mar2025-6ob7)
- [Support Engineer (APAC - Weekends)](https://supabase.link/job-supportengineerapac-weekends-mar2025-nbzf)
- [Customer Solution Architect (US time zones)](https://supabase.link/job-customersolutionarchitectustimezones-mar2025-xgkl)

## âš ï¸ Baking hot meme zone âš ï¸

https://supabase.link/twitter-baking-hot-memes-mar2025-ni1u

subject: Fwd: Summer Internship Program at Appifly Infotech
snippet: Hi Everyone, I wanted to share some important information regarding the Summer Internship Program 2025 by Appifly Infotech, which many of us recently received details about. After further inquiry, it
content:
Hi Everyone,

I wanted to share some important information regarding the *Summer
Internship Program 2025* by *Appifly Infotech*, which many of us recently
received details about.

After further inquiry, it has come to light that the company is asking for
a *â‚¹5000 fee* to participate in the internship. While internships are
valuable opportunities to gain experience, *it's important to be cautious
when companies request payment*, especially without clear justification or
assurance of value.

As fellow students, I strongly *encourage you to reconsider applying* to
this program and to explore *free or merit-based internships* that provide
real learning without financial burden. There are plenty of reputable
companies offering *free internships or even stipends*, and those should be
prioritized for our professional development.

Stay aware and make informed decisions!

subject: Summer Internship Program at Appifly Infotech
snippet: Hello Future Innovators , We are excited to announce that Appifly Infotech is now accepting applications for its Summer Internship Program 2025! If you're looking to apply your academic knowledge
content:
*Hello Future Innovators ,*

We are excited to announce that *Appifly Infotech* is now accepting
applications for its *Summer Internship Program 2025*! If you're looking to
apply your academic knowledge to real-world projects and gain
industry-ready skills, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

*Why Join Us?*
Our internship program is built to help you grow â€” professionally and
personally. You'll collaborate on live projects, receive guidance from
experienced mentors, and get a taste of working in a fast-paced tech
environment.

*Program Highlights:*

ğŸ—“ *Duration:* 1.5 to 2 months

ğŸ’¼ *Domains:*

   -

   Mobile & Web App Development
   -

   Full Stack Development
   -

   UI/UX Design
   -

   Software Testing
   -

   SEO Optimization
   -

   Graphic Designing
   -

   Digital Marketing
   -

   Content Writing
   -

   AI/ML & More

ğŸ“Œ *How to Apply:*

Submit your application through the link below:

ğŸ‘‰ *Apply Now*  :  https://forms.gle/7u4VEV6KtZfgS4reA

ğŸŒ *Visit Us : * https://appiflyinfotech.com/

* Connect With Us:*

 ğŸ”— LinkedIn â€“ <https://www.linkedin.com/company/appifly-infotech>
https://www.linkedin.com/company/appifly-infotech/

Donâ€™t miss this chance to gain practical experience, build your portfolio,
and kickstart your professional journey with us.


*Best Wishes,*
*Appifly Infotech Team*

Crime Cell, Gujarat Police, focusing on building awareness for a safer
online environment. This is your chance to stay informed about
cybersecurity best practices and threats.

subject: Fwd: INTERNSHIP Opportunity - Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Analytics & Marketing
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: EI - HR <hr@edulyt.com> Date: Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 4:03 PM Subject: INTERNSHIP Opportunity - Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Analytics &
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: EI - HR <hr@edulyt.com>
Date: Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 4:03â€¯PM
Subject: INTERNSHIP Opportunity - Artificial Intelligence, Machine
Learning, Analytics & Marketing
To: Edulyt India <care@edulyt.com>


Dear College Representative,

Hope you are doing well.

We are *thrilled* to announce an *amazing internship opportunity* at Edulyt
India for college students who are passionate about analytics and
marketing. This is their chance to dive into the exciting world of data,
gain hands-on experience, and make a meaningful impact!

*Why This Internship is Exceptional:*

   -

   Students will work on *real-world data analysis projects* under the
   guidance of experienced professionals.
   -

   They will collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve *complex
   business challenges*.
   -

   Gain expertise in using *industry-standard analytics tools* and learn
   their practical applications in various industries.
   -

   *Networking Opportunities*: Connect with professionals in the field and
   broaden their career horizons.
   -

   Stand out with a *certificate of completion* to showcase their skills to
   future employers.
   -

   Top performers may enjoy *performance-based stipend* and recognition.

*Details of the Internship Program:*

   -

   *Mode:* Online (Work from Home)
   -

   *Start Date:* 2nd May 2025
   -

   *Duration:* Flexible (1 to 6 Months, as per college schedule)
   -

   *Last Date to Apply:* 26th April 2025
   -

   *Eligibility:* BTech, BE, BCA, MCA, BBA, MBA (and more) â€“ All Years and
   Streams
   -

   *Selection Procedure:* Online Assessment Test
   -

   *Assessment Test Date:* 27th May 2025

*Prepare for Success:* We provide students with access to *preparation
resources* to help them excel in the placements and future projects.

*Registration Link:*
https://edulyt.com/internships.php

Encourage your students to seize this *incredible opportunity*! Together,
letâ€™s empower them to become tomorrowâ€™s data trailblazers.
We welcome students from *all backgrounds* to explore this exciting
programme and make the most of this learning experience.

Got questions? Need more info? Drop us a line at care@edulyt.com and weâ€™ll
be happy to assist you!

Job Description and Program Details are attached herewith for your
reference.

We look forward to welcoming exceptional students from your institution to
join us in exploring the exciting world of analytics and making a
meaningful impact through data-driven insights.

Thank you for partnering with us in shaping the future of Analytics and
Marketing.


Thanks and Regards

*Edulyt India â€“ Education to Employment*

Email: edulyt.india@gmail.com / care@edulyt.com
https://www.linkedin.com/company/18858468/admin/dashboard/


https://edulyt.com/

subject: Fwd: IIT Jammu's Internship & Training Program - Summer School 2025 (Exclusive Opportunity for Students)
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: IIT Jammu Summer Internship <summerschool@iitjammu.ac.in> Date: Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 8:30 PM Subject: IIT Jammu's Internship & Training Program
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Jammu Summer Internship <summerschool@iitjammu.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 8:30â€¯PM
Subject: IIT Jammu's Internship & Training Program - Summer School 2025
(Exclusive Opportunity for Students)
To: <tnp@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Ma'am,

Greetings from *IIT Jammu!*

We are delighted to introduce *IIT Jammu's Summer School 2025 - Internships
& Training Program*, being organized in collaboration with *Techible and
Institute Innovation & Incubation Council, IIT Jammu*, offering *hands-on
training and internship programs* for college students in emerging
technologies. This initiative aligns with *NEP 2020*, emphasizing
practical, industry-driven learning to equip students with future-ready
skills.

*Why This Opportunity?*

   - Master Emerging Technologies with IIT faculty & industry experts
   - Industry Mentors from Top companies like Google, Meta (facebook),
   Amazon, etc.
   - Project-Based Learning with real-world applications
   - Internship Certificate from IIT Jammu for career enhancement
   - Flexible Learning Options â€“ Online & Offline
   - Career Guidance and Support

The program offers multiple *technology-driven domains* such as

   - Artificial Intelligence (LLM, GenAI & Agentic AI)
   - Full Stack Web Development
   - UI/UX, Digital Marketing & Freelancing
   - Python Programming
   - Ethical Hacking & Cybersecurity
   - Blockchain & Web 3.0
   - Data Science & AI
   - IoT & Drones
   - CAD Modelling & Additive Manufacturing

and students can choose as per their interests.

*A detailed brochure is attached* with all the necessary information.

*Application Link: *https://summerschool.iitjammu.ac.in/

*Program Duration:* 4-6 Weeks (Starting 2nd week of June 2025)

*Application Deadline:* May 31, 2025

*Note:* *In case of any technical/network issue with the above URL, please
use this alternative link:* https://techible.io/iit-jammu-summer-school/

We request your support in sharing this *valuable learning opportunity*
with your students.

For any queries, please reach out to us at: summerschool@iitjammu.ac.in

Looking forward to your collaboration in empowering students with
industry-relevant skills.

Best Regards,
Team Summer School
IIT Jammu
Contact: +91-7056954541


-- 
*Prof. Ashwin Makwana (Ph D), *
*Professor,* U & P U Patel *Department of Computer Engineering,*
Faculty of Technology & Engineering(CSPIT),

Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT),
AT: Changa, Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat, India.

subject: 4 prompting techniques to get what you need from Lovable
snippet: Hey there, Ever wondered how experienced users get their target output 50% faster and get stuck much less often? They use our techniques for prompting Lovable. It's not hard to get much better
content:
Hey there,
Ever wondered how experienced users get their target output 50% faster and get stuck much less often? They use our techniques for prompting Lovable.

It's not hard to get much better results from Lovable:
* Break asks into parts, or ask Lovable to create a step-by-step plan
* With each edit, specify what part to change, and what to change it to
* Include images in your prompts to guide Lovable more precisely
* Talk to Lovable like a human - "Think through this carefully" - or even emphasize urgency: "You will be rewarded if you successfully complete this task"
Check out this guide with 20+ techniques ( https://docs.lovable.dev/tips-tricks/prompting-one ) to amplify your prompting.

To dive even deeper, check out this video we created with our friend Mark on how to prompt Lovable correctly:

( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IqWfKj4mUIo&utm_source=marketinglifecycle&utm_medium=email1nontech&utm_campaign=creativeabtest )

Cheers,
Anton

Email footer image

Turn ideas into lovable products at Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

subject: Exciting Internship Opportunities with Agevole Innovations
snippet: Dear Students, We hope this message finds you in great spirits. Agevole Innovations Pvt. Ltd. is delighted to announce the launch of our Internship Programme 2025, a golden opportunity to elevate your
content:
Dear Students,

We hope this message finds you in great spirits. *Agevole Innovations Pvt.
Ltd.* is delighted to announce the launch of our Internship Programme 2025,
a golden opportunity to elevate your skills and gain hands-on experience in
a professional, industry-oriented environment. This is a fantastic chance
for you to explore and enhance your skills in an industry environment.
Internship Details:

Duration: 1.5-2 months
Fields: App Development, Web Development, UI/UX, Cloud, Graphics Designing,
Marketing, Content Writing, AI/ML etc.
How to Apply:
If you are interested, simply fill out the registration form using the link
below:
Registration Link: https://agevole.in/apply/ <https://agevole.in/apply/>

Deadline: 25th April, 2025 (11:59 PM)
This internship is designed to provide you with valuable work experience
and a platform to apply your academic knowledge in real-world scenarios.
Seize this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally. For
inquiries, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at
*internship@agevole.in* <internship@agevole.in>. We're here to assist you
in any way we can.

Best regards,
Agevole Innovations Pvt. Ltd.

content:
Dear Students,

Please find the attached document for *the seating arrangement for the
University Theory Examination [A.Y. 2024-25 -EVEN]*. You are *informed to
adhere* to the guidelines mentioned below to ensure the smooth conduct of
the examination:

   - Follow the attached seating plan without any modifications.
   - Maintain silence and discipline inside the examination hall.
   - *Mobile phones, smartwatches, and any other electronic devices*
are *strictly
   prohibited* inside the exam hall.
   - Leave your bags outside the hall and ensure that you wear an* ID card* at

Floor*, and *Exam
Hall 301* is on the *Second Floor* of the *Multi-Utility Building*.

DEPSTAR - IT

content:

opportunities for your students in the fields of Human Resources and

subject: âš¡ What's new in Replit: Agent v2, Course Launch, Visual Editor & more!
snippet: March was pure MADNESS and the team has been cooking. This month's updates include: Agent v2, Visual Editor, a new free course, and much more. Friday, April 4, 2025 Matt with Replit here, March was
content:
March was pure MADNESS and the team has been cooking. This month's updates 
include: Agent v2, Visual Editor, a new free course, and much more.



 <https://replit.com>



Friday, April 4, 2025


Matt with Replit here,

 March was pure MADNESS and the team has been cooking. This month's updates 
include:


 * Agent v2 out for all: 10x more powerful, 5x more deployed apps
 * Visual Editor is live: Click & select to edit your apps
 * Vibe Coding 101: our new FREE course with DeepLearningAI 

and much, much more!




ğŸš€ Agent v2 is now available for all


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1IQUY2QXpjg> 

Agent v2 is now the default for all users.

v2 features a 10x more powerful creation experience, which we've found results 
in 5x more deployed apps.

All new Agent projects will use v2 by default. To celebrate, we're giving all 
users $10 in extra credits this month! ğŸ


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨ Visual Editor is here



Our new Visual Editor dropped!

You can now directly edit elements in your apps with just a click. Currently 
supported in JavaScript Agent appsâ€”just click the "element selector" icon in 
Agent to get started.


ğŸ“š Vibe Coding 101


In partnership with DeepLearningAI, we've released Vibe Coding 101â€”the 90 
minute course is FREE and teaches you everything you need to know to get 
up-and-running on Replit.


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=55k6J9djOB4> 

Whether you're new to Replit or trying to up your game, you'll want to give 
this one a shot.

Take the course 
<https://www.deeplearning.ai/short-courses/vibe-coding-101-with-replit> 



ğŸ“¹ Videos & tutorials


What is Vibe Coding? If you've heard the term, but it has you scratching your 
headâ€”you're not alone. Follow along for a quick explainer (and learn how you 
can get started vibe coding like the best)


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5OWurmg41tI> 

What is MCP? The AI world is buzzing about the Model Context Protocol. In this 
video, learn EXACTLY what MCP is (and run your own MCP client / server) in 
UNDER 3 minutes.


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zyDm-MJgDOA>

ğŸš€ Get started and share your work


If you've been waiting to give Replit a shot there's never been a better time. 
Our users are building faster than ever. Give it a shot today.

Try Replit Core <> 

If you've already built an amazing app with Replit, share it with us 
<https://forms.gle/sAqiKGTvXYa9Hjzc9> to be featured in an upcoming email.


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


AI is accelerating and it's been a wild ride.

 As always, we'll do our best to make it as simple & easy as possible to turn 
your ideas into apps.

Be sure to follow along for all the greatest in building, vibe coding, and AI.

Until next time, <https://www.linkedin.com/in/vanessakahkesh>

Matt <https://x.com/mattppal> @ Replit

 <https://x.com/mattppal>

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it> 
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw>  
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>



Sent by Replit

1001 E Hillsdale Blvd, Suite 400, Foster City, CA 94404 


Unsubscribe here 
<https://links.replit.com/s/u/I8fndnKE_ustCOw_84-mwAaqtCzpEwnlEwCXFgEyOfaiTf17J42zWRsu7fyxThein_YZ2NHXvcoV78QQGF69tlBKw-7jYGIOWVz877Xoo1dhYtRVUXa5jd_W-EPx0z4aTp2AfbvBc_35hnKYn1aiv7eoN6SVTjmdWkkTmhC4FIJy1Wmqqa7WFobUJSjefoOlMUFebA2EoXoLxSUw/pDl1X1mL1PhopZRFnWx2esgHnQ0J7ocG/7>

subject: Fwd: April 17 Talk: "Empirical Software Design: When & Why" with Software Engineering Pioneer Kent Beck
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: ACM Learning Center <learning@acm.org> Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 11:38 pm Subject: April 17 Talk: "Empirical Software Design: When & Why"
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: ACM Learning Center <learning@acm.org>
Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 11:38â€¯pm
Subject: April 17 Talk: "Empirical Software Design: When & Why" with
Software Engineering Pioneer Kent Beck
To:


ACM TechTalks
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-3199a_0x3372bfx095511>
April 3, 2025
[image: to view image click on]"
*April 17 Talk: "Empirical Software Design: When & Why" with Software
Engineering Pioneer Kent Beck*
*[image: to view image click on]*

Register now
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-3199a_0x3443c9x095511> for
the next free ACM TechTalk, "*Empirical Software Design: When & Why*,"
presented * on Thursday, April 17 * at * 12:00 PM ET/17:00 UTC * by
software engineer *Kent Beck*.

Leave your comments and questions with our speaker now and any time before
the live event on ACM's Discourse Page
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-3199a_0x3443cax095511>.
And check out the page after the webcast for extended discussion with your
peers in the computing community, as well as further resources on software
design and more.

(*If you'd like to attend but can't make it to the virtual event, you still
need to register to receive a recording of the TechTalk when it becomes
available*.)

Since the publication of Parnas' *"*On the Criteria to Be Used in
Decomposing Systems into Modules,*" *we have had good advice on how to
design software. However, most software is more difficult to change than it
should be and that friction compounds over time. The Empirical Design
Project seeks to resolve the seemingly-irresolvable tradeoff between
short-term feature progress and long-term optionality, focusing on:

   - How is software actually designed? What can we learn from data about
   how software is designed?
   - When should software design decisions be made? What is the optimal
   moment given unclear and changing information and priorities?
   - How can we enhance the survival of software projects while expanding
   optionality?

Spoiler alert: make design decisions later and in small, safe steps.

Duration: 60 minutes (including audience Q&A)

*Presenter: *
*Kent Beck**, Software Engineer*
Kent Beck is an American software engineer and the creator of Extreme
Programming, a software development methodology that eschews rigid formal
specification for a collaborative and iterative design process. Beck was
one of the 17 original signatories of the Agile Manifesto.

Visit learning.acm.org/techtalks-archive
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-3199a_0x325156x095511>
for our full archive of past TechTalks.
[image: to view image click on]

Association for
Computing Machinery
1601 Broadway, 10th Floor, New York, NY 10019
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/1601+Broadway,+10th+Floor,+New+York,+NY+10019?entry=gmail&source=g>

subject: Video: Use this guide on Day 1 to build 10x better with Lovable
snippet: Hey, Anton here, founder of Lovable. Super excited to welcome you to our community! I care deeply about you having a great experience from the start and want to share some things to get you going.
content:
Hey, Anton here, founder of Lovable. Super excited to welcome youÂ to our community!

I care deeply about you having a great experience from the start and want to share some thingsÂ toÂ getÂ youÂ going.

While Lovable feels ultra-intuitive, our veteran users say they find it 10x easier to build with Lovable now that they understand how to use it correctly.

If you're already familiar with Lovable:Â Let's get you started on your first project on Lovable.dev! ( https://lovable.dev/ )

If you're new to Lovable, I highly recommend checking out this tutorial video we created for you:
( https://youtu.be/gqsZGxuymTk?si=HpVC6VBU3RwSLXXo&utm_source=marketinglifecycle&utm_medium=email1nontech&utm_campaign=creativeabtest )

I'm also inviting youÂ toÂ our bi-weeklyÂ live onboarding session. JoinÂ usÂ and 100sÂ ofÂ otherÂ newÂ buildersÂ toÂ jointly build, share best practices, and answer any questions you have. This is the perfect chance to learn how to make the most of Lovable from day one.

Reserve your spot here:Â https://lu.ma/lovable-onboarding-livestreams

Anton

Email footer image

Turn ideas into lovable products at Lovable.dev ( https://lovable.dev )

Unsubscribe ( http://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTmjgoAAK2XqAOsl6gDAZX89Znadld1bRv3p5ciig== )

subject: Upcoming changes to Atlas
snippet: Introducing the New Navigation Experience for MongoDB Atlas Hi D24DIT079, MongoDB is refreshing the Atlas navigation to deliver a more efficient, seamless, and productive experience to our customers.
content:
<https://www.mongodb.com/>

Introducing the New Navigation Experience for MongoDB Atlas 






Hi D24DIT079,



MongoDB is refreshing the Atlas navigation to deliver a more efficient, 
seamless, and productive experience to our customers. These changes will begin 
rolling out the week of April 7th, 2025.




Here's a quick overview of what's changing: 

 * Simplified Project Navigation: The side navigation has been redesigned for 
rapid access to key tools, enabling faster navigation of the Atlas platform 
through four sections: Database, Data, Services, and Security.
 * Clearer Resource Context: The updated top navigation bar, the resource 
navigator, ensures developers always know which resource (e.g., project, 
organization, cluster) they are working on. Switching between resources is now 
simpler, with improved context clarity as users navigate deeper into Atlas. The 
workflow now negates any need to backtrack to a projectâ€™s overview.
 * Centralized Utilities Hub: Essential utilities like Alerts, Help, Billing, 
and Identity and Access Management (IAM) are consolidated in one location at 
the top-right corner. This ensures rapid access and saves time. Users can also 
access the product menu to findMongoDB University <https://learn.mongodb.com/>, 
Documentation <https://www.mongodb.com/docs/>, Dev Center 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/>, Community Forums 
<https://www.mongodb.com/community/forums/>, and Support 
<https://support.mongodb.com/>. 
 * Atlas Charts Relocation: Atlas Charts will now be accessible via the 
Visualization heading in theData section of the left-side navigation panel.


Below is a sneak peek at what the primary side navigation for Atlas will look 
like on a project level.



Note: MongoDB will roll out the new navigation experience to Atlas 
organizations in phases to ensure a smooth transition to the new navigation.



The new navigation will start rolling out on April 7th, 2025. It will take 
approximately6 to 8 weeks for the navigation to become available to all Atlas 
organizations. All users will experience the new navigation by June 2025.



If you have further questions, please contact your Account Executive or our 
Support Team <https://support.mongodb.com/>.



Best,
MongoDB Atlas Team

subject: Summer Internship Opportunity â€“ Require Frontend/Backend/Full-Stack Web Developer
snippet: Dear Students, We are inviting passionate and dedicated students to collaborate on an exciting live project focused on developing a full-stack web application for our institute. This is a great
content:
Dear Students,

We are inviting passionate and dedicated students to collaborate on an
exciting *live project* focused on developing a full-stack web application
for our institute. This is a great opportunity to *enhance your technical
skills, gain hands-on experience, and work on a real-world project* that will
be considered as your *summer internship*.

*Project Requirements*

The project involves building a modern web application using the following
technologies:

   1. *Frontend:* Experience with a frontend library or framework (React,
   Next.js, Angular, etc.).
   2. *Backend:* Familiarity with Node.js frameworks (Supabase, Express,
   Hono, Fastify, etc.).
   3. *Database:* Knowledge of SQL or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, PostgreSQL,
   etc.).
   4. *Security:* Understanding of authentication methods and best
   practices for web security.
   5. *Networking:* Basics of website deployment, Linux server setup, and
   configuration(Git/Github).
   6. *UI/UX Design:* Ability to design visually appealing and
   user-friendly interfaces.

*Roles Available*

We are looking for students with expertise in the following roles:

   - *Frontend Developer*
   - *Backend Developer*
   - *Full-Stack Developer*
   - *UI/UX Designer*

*What Youâ€™ll Gain*

   - Appreciation letter and stipend opportunity
   - Practical experience in full-stack web development.
   - A real-world project to showcase in your portfolio.
   - Collaboration with peers to learn and grow.

*How to Apply*

If you are interested, please fill out the application form using the
following *link*: *https://forms.gle/4Q4URSCfVdaxi85WA
<https://forms.gle/4Q4URSCfVdaxi85WA>*

*Note:* *Candidates will go through an interview/screening process before
final selection for the internship.*

We look forward to working with *motivated and committed* students eager to
learn and contribute!
Thank you.
-- 
Regards,
Dr. Parth Goel
Assistant Professor,
Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research(DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
[*ACCREDITED WITH "A+" GRADE BY NAAC, GOI*],
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist:Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph. No: 02697-265060, Ext. No. : 5298
https://parthgoelblog.wordpress.com/

--

subject: Reg. IT266 Project-I Report Verification & Submission
snippet: Dear students, Please find the IT266 Project-I report format attached herewith for your reference. Kindly make the required changes to the attached documents and prepare the final project report.
content:
Dear students,

Please find the *IT266 Project-I* report format attached herewith for your
reference. Kindly make the required changes to the attached documents and
prepare the final project report.

Kindly take care of the content and formatting of your report as it will be
considered one of the evaluations and has weightage in marks of a final
practical examination.

*Kindly consider the following points when you write your report:*

   1. The Font Style of Content is always Times New Roman
   2. Line spacing must be 1.15
   3. Content always justify
   4. Heading Font size is 16, Bold, and Times New Roman style
   5. Subheading font size is 14, Bold, and Times New Roman style
   6. Description font size is 12 and Times New Roman style

*After completing your report, follow the below steps:*

   1. Kindly verify it from your respective guide
   2. Then take a printout of the certificate page only
   3. Get the signature of an internal guide & Head on the certificate page
   4. Scan Certificate Page
   5. Attach it to the final report.

*Google form will be shared for uploading the final report.*



*Deadline for Final Report Verification- till 05th April 2025Internal Guide
& Head Signature- Deadline * *05th April 2025*

*Your report may contain the following things:*

   1. Cover Page
   2. Certificate Page
   3. Declaration Page
   4. Abstract
   5. Index
   6. List of figures (if applicable)
   7. List of table (if applicable)
   8. Introduction of the project
   9. Tools & Technologies are used with Justification
   10. Hardware & Software Requirements
   11. Workflow diagram
   12. Implementation screenshot
   13. Future work
   14. Limitation
   15. Conclusion
   16. References

*For any query, kindly Contact Your Internal Guide.*

-- 
Thanks & Regards,
Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: JavaScript resources for you!
snippet: Explore endless resources to jumpstart your progress. Hey D24DIT079, Welcome to MongoDB Atlas, a modern database that provides an integrated suite of data and application infrastructure. Build for
content:
Explore endless resources to jumpstart your progress.



 <https://www.mongodb.com/>


Hey D24DIT079,


Welcome to MongoDB Atlas, a modern database that provides an integrated suite 
of data and application infrastructure. Build for virtually any type of 
application with support in Atlas for transactional, full-text search, vector 
search, stream processing, and more.




JavaScript resources for you



 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/quickstarts/>

Quickstarts 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/quickstarts/>


 New to building with MongoDB and JavaScript/Node.js? Check out our Quickstart 
guides for step-by-step instructions for your first JavaScript/Node.js project 
on MongoDB.



Quickstart for Node.js CRUD operations > 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/node-crud-tutorial/>







 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/tutorials/>â€Š

Tutorials <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/tutorials/>


 Ready to tackle more advanced JavaScript/Node.js use cases with MongoDB? 
Check out our tutorials.



Build a RAG app with MongoDB and LangChain > 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/products/atlas/add-memory-to-javascript-rag-application-mongodb-langchain/>







 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/videos/>

Videos <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/videos/>


Check out our latest YouTube videos to get expert guidance on building with 
JavaScript/Node.js and MongoDB.



Learn more > <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/javascript/videos/>







 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/catalog?labels=%5B%22Language%22%5D&values=%5B%22Node.js%22%5D>

MongoDB University 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/learning-paths/mongodb-nodejs-developer-path>


Try our free, interactive online courses to learn the basics of building a 
modern JavaScript/Node.js application on MongoDB.



Get started >> 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/learning-paths/mongodb-nodejs-developer-path>




â€Š 







MongoDB Atlas + Amazon Web Services (AWS) 
<https://www.mongodb.com/mongodb-on-aws>



Build sophisticated, enterprise-ready GenAI-powered applications with MongoDB 
Atlas and Amazon Web Services (AWS).



Learn more > <https://www.mongodb.com/mongodb-on-aws>


â€Š

subject: Stakeholder Feedback on Curriculum- SY
snippet: Greetings!!! Hope you are doing well. Kindly fill up the form below about the curriculum feedback of AY. 2024-25 (EVEN). https://forms.gle/ctE8bWqhmFVcwpGY6 It is feedback on the syllabus and teaching
content:
Greetings!!!

Hope you are doing well.

Kindly fill up the form below about the curriculum feedback of AY. 2024-25
(EVEN).

https://forms.gle/ctE8bWqhmFVcwpGY6

*It is feedback on the syllabus and teaching scheme. *

*You can give multiple feedback on different subjects.  *

*All the students must give feedback on the curriculum.*

*Deadline: 04/04/2025 (Friday)*

-- 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Prof. Hitesh Makwana*

*Assistant Professor*

*Department of Information Technology*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (Depstar)*

*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*

*Mo: 8460752501*

--

subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05 am Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg. To: Having trouble reading this
content:
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05â€¯am
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.
To:


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabularyâ€”skills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid formatâ€”online preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18cFYJTXo0Yq6zmen456z8H28ukWH2QGc/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=176b1da9e198e0df1317262dc16b4adeb16352b9&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>



*With Warm Regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>*

snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dipika Damodar <dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, 31 Mar 2025 at 7:43â€¯PM
Subject: Deloitte Internship 2025
To: Shital Sharma <shitalsharma.dit@charusat.ac.in>


*Deloitte Internship 2025: *
Internship Details at a Glance

To help you understand what this opportunity entails, hereâ€™s a breakdown of
the key details:

*Category*

*Details*

Stipend

â‚¹30,000 per month

Role

QA Engineer Intern

Department

Digital Excellence Centre

Eligibility

Pursuing/completed Bachelorâ€™s in CS or related technical fields

Location

Deloitte India (varies by role)

Application Mode

Online via Deloitte Careers Portal
Inside Deloitteâ€™s Digital Excellence Centre

Deloitteâ€™s Digital Excellence Centre (DEC) is an innovation hub where tech
experts collaborate to create transformative digital solutions. This centre
brings together professionals, including software developers, UX designers,
data scientists, and product managers, to develop cutting-edge technology
solutions for businesses across industries.

As an intern in the DEC, you will have the opportunity to:

   - Work on live projects for real clients.
   - Gain hands-on experience with advanced technologies.
   - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve practical business
   challenges.
   - Understand how digital transformation impacts global organizations.

Role of a QA Engineer Intern

As a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer Intern, you will play a critical role
in ensuring software quality and reliability. Your primary responsibility
will be to test software applications to identify bugs, enhance
performance, and ensure smooth functionality.
Key Responsibilities:

   - Writing and maintaining clean, testable code.
   - Designing and executing test cases.
   - Tracking and documenting software bugs and issues.
   - Collaborating with developers, designers, and product managers.
   - Understanding enterprise-level system design and scalability.

Skills You Need to Succeed

Deloitte seeks interns who not only possess technical expertise but also
demonstrate strong problem-solving abilities and teamwork. Below are the
essential skills that will set you apart:
Technical Skills:

   - Basic knowledge of manual and automated testing methodologies.
   - Familiarity with tools like JIRA or other bug-tracking systems.
   - Understanding of software development life cycles (SDLC).

Soft Skills:

   - Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
   - Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
   - Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

What Makes You Stand Out?

Deloitte values candidates who showcase leadership potential, enthusiasm
for technology, and practical exposure. Hereâ€™s what can give you an edge:

   - Passion for technology and problem-solving.
   - Participation in college projects, hackathons, or previous internships.
   - Experience working in coding groups, tech clubs, or collaborative
   projects.
   - A well-structured resume highlighting both academic and practical
   achievements.

Beyond the Stipend: Additional Perks

While the stipend of â‚¹30,000 per month is a great incentive, this
internship offers much more in terms of professional growth:

   - Structured training sessions to enhance your technical and business
   acumen.
   - Mentorship from experienced Deloitte professionals.
   - Networking opportunities with industry experts.
   - Access to Deloitte Universityâ€™s learning resources.
   - Real-world exposure to industry best practices and project workflows.

This internship is a stepping stone toward securing a full-time role in a
top-tier firm.
How to Apply for Deloitteâ€™s Internship 2025?

If this opportunity excites you, hereâ€™s how you can apply:
1. Update Your Resume

Ensure your resume highlights relevant skills, projects, internships, or
certifications. Keep it concise, yet impactful.
2. Gather Necessary Documents

Prepare copies of academic transcripts, identification proofs, and any
relevant certifications.
3. Apply Online via Deloitte Careers Portal

Visit Deloitteâ€™s official careers page, create a profile, and search for
â€˜Internship â€“ QA Engineerâ€™.
4. Complete the Selection Process

Shortlisted candidates will go through:

   - Online assessment to evaluate technical and problem-solving skills.
   - Technical interview to test knowledge of software testing concepts.
   - HR interview to assess soft skills, cultural fit, and career
   aspirations.

--

Best Regards,
Dipika A. Damodar,
Assistant Professor ,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Hi there, welcome to MongoDB! Letâ€™s get started.
snippet: Here are a few resources to help you get started. Welcome to MongoDB Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four steps: Create cluster Add IP address to access list
content:
Here are a few resources to help you get started. 







Welcome to MongoDB 




Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four 
steps:

 * Create cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/deploy-free-tier-cluster/>
 * Add IP address to access list 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/security/add-ip-address-to-list/>
 * Create a user 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/create-mongodb-user-for-cluster/>
 * Connect to cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/connect-to-your-cluster/>



â€Š

If youâ€™re more of a visual learner, weâ€™ve put together a six-minute video 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas> that 
guides you through cluster setup.

 <https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas>

Next, you can start building. Populate your newly-created cluster with some of 
our sample datasets. These are great for testing and quick prototyping.



Get started 
<https://account.mongodb.com/account/login?n=https%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fgo%3Fl%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fv2%2F%3Cproject%3E%26h%3Dclusters%2Fdetail%2F%3Ccluster%3E>

subject: Welcome to Supabase
snippet: Hey there, Welcome to Supabase, the open source Firebase alternative. Supabase gives you all the backend features you need to build a product: Database, Authentication, Storage, Realtime API, Edge
content:
()

*************
Hey there,
*************

Welcome to Supabase, the open source Firebase alternative.

Supabase gives you all the backend features you need to build a product: Database, Authentication, Storage, Realtime API, Edge Functions, Serverless APIs, and more.

Here are some useful resources:

- Read our docs: https://supabase.com/doc
- Check out some examples: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/examples
- Hop into our Discord: https://discord.supabase.com/
- Start by creating a new organization: https://supabase.com/dashboard/new


Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or feedback.

Paul, CEO and Co-Founder @ Supabase


Â© 2023 . All rights reserved.

subject: Fwd: Heartfelt Gratitude for Your Support in Odoo x Gujarat Vidyapith Hackathonâ€™25
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Kudos for the team EcoSattva ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Mar 29, 2025 at 9
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Kudos for the team  *EcoSattva*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 29, 2025 at 9:27â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Heartfelt Gratitude for Your Support in Odoo x Gujarat
Vidyapith Hackathonâ€™25
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hackathon-2025 GVP <hackathon2025.gvp@gujaratvidyapith.org>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 6:04â€¯PM
Subject: Heartfelt Gratitude for Your Support in Odoo x Gujarat Vidyapith
Hackathonâ€™25
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <22dit031@charusat.edu.in>, Keval Dhabalia <dhabaliakeval@gmail.com>, <
d23dcs153@charusat.edu.in>, <d23dcs151@charusat.edu.in>, <
d23dcs150@charusat.edu.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,
On behalf of Gujarat Vidyapith, we extend our sincere gratitude to you and
your institution for your invaluable support in making the *Odoo x Gujarat
Vidyapith Hackathon â€™25 a grand success. Your students' participation in
this 24-hour Hackathon (22ndâ€”23rd March 2025)* played a significant role in
fostering an environment of innovation, collaboration, and learning.

Your encouragement and guidance have empowered students to showcase their
creativity and problem-solving skills, contributing to the spirit of
technological advancement. This success would not have been possible
without your active involvement and motivation.

We deeply appreciate your support and look forward to continued
collaboration in future initiatives. Together, we can create more
opportunities for young minds to innovate and excel.

Once again, thank you for being an integral part of this journey.

*A Glimpse of the Odoo x Gujarat Vidyapith
Hackathonâ€™25: https://shorturl.at/GDukN <https://shorturl.at/GDukN>*


*Best regards,*


Prof (Dr.) Ajay Parikh,

HOD

Department of Computer Sci.

Gujarat Vidyapith, Ahmedabad
[image: Glimpse of Hackathon_F.png.png]


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

subject: âœ¨ What will you vibe code?
snippet: Get inspired with the latest and greatest apps, vibe coded by users like you. Matt here, Vibe coding is taking off & we've seen our users build some amazing apps. If you're looking to get
content:
Get inspired with the latest and greatest apps, vibe coded by users like you.


â€Š
â€Š



Matt here,

 Vibe coding is taking off & we've seen our users build some amazing apps.

If you're looking to get inspired or see what folks like you have created on 
Replit, this email is for you.

Here are some of our favorites. ğŸ¤˜





Already have a great project? Submit your app to be featured.

Submit your app <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7> 

ğŸ”¨ Product



Find My Sauna: <https://findmysauna.com/> A directory of the best saunas in 
the world, Find My Sauna arose from Jan's own experiences traveling.

 Noticing the difficulties in finding a good sauna, Jan set out to create a 
service on Replit where anybody can find the best sauna in ANY city.

From the creator: "I was able to build a prototype super fast. A simple csv 
file with all information served as base for the database that replit built for 
me. Then displaying all the data on the page was as simple as taking the info 
from each column."

 Thanks Jan <https://x.com/JanTovarys>!


ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ”¬ Research



Tablify: <http://www.tablify.me> I'm not going to lie: I'm a sucker for a good 
table, especially when doing research. I love to compare and contrast in 
tabular format.

 Tablify does just that. Search any topic you'd like and Tablify will use AI 
to organize the results by the most logical categories in a visually appealing 
and satisfying format.

From the creator: "I've been an early adopter of Agent and use it almost daily 
to build solutions in my day job as a Chief Product Officer (e.g., a tool to 
help my Customer Success team build workflows for customers) and then on the 
occasional weekend (on hobby projects like Tablify)"

Thanks Matt <https://x.com/mattpollins>!


âš¾ Sport



FanRanked: <https://fanranked.com> FanRanked revolutionized how I think about 
sports apps. Its head-to-head MLB player voting system creates real-time 
dynasty rankings that are simply brilliant. It's been a huge inspiration for my 
own projects, showing how engaging sports data can be.

From the creator: "[Replit has enabled] creating a website I always wanted to 
build but never had the technical knowledge or time to create."

Thanks JD <https://x.com/FanRanked>!


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨ Creativity



Sonic Pics: <https://spacetime-ai.replit.app/> If you haven't noticed, we're 
big on vibes. Sonic Pics is all about getting the vibes from an image and 
generating a playlist on the fly. You'll have to try this one out to believe 
it. It's a really cool app to help you feel what you see.

Thanks Arthur <https://x.com/arthur_cahen>!


ğŸ“š Productivity



Meta Tag Analyzer: <https://seo-tag-inspector.replit.app/> Ok, not going to 
lieâ€”I built this one. But have you every built a site only to have the wrong 
image or title show up when you share a link? Me too.

With Meta Tag Analyzer, you can paste in your site and get a concise summary 
of SEO meta tags.

If you want to learn how to build the same tool, you can follow along in our 
free courseVibe Coding 101 with Replit available now at DeepLearningAI 
<https://www.deeplearning.ai/short-courses/vibe-coding-with-replit/>.


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


The âœ¨vibesâœ¨ have been outstanding latelyâ€”this is just a glimpse of whatâ€™s 
possible with Replit.

 If you're looking for more inspiration, we'll be sharing regular updates on 
what our users are building.

If you haven't started building yet, now is the perfect time.

Jump in!

Start building <> 

Thanks again & until next time,

Matt <https://x.com/mattppal>

 <https://x.com/mattppal> 

â€Š

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it> 
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw> 
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>

Sent by Replit
1001 E Hillsdale Blvd, Suite 400, Foster City, CA 94404

subject: Exciting Internship Opportunities with Agevole Innovations
snippet: Dear Students, We hope this message finds you in great spirits. Agevole Innovations Pvt. Ltd. is delighted to announce the launch of our Internship Programme 2025, a golden opportunity to elevate your
content:
Dear Students,

We hope this message finds you in great spirits. *Agevole Innovations Pvt.
Ltd.* is delighted to announce the launch of our Internship Programme 2025,
a golden opportunity to elevate your skills and gain hands-on experience in
a professional, industry-oriented environment. This is a fantastic chance
for you to explore and enhance your skills in an industry environment.
Internship Details:

Duration: 1.5-2 months
Fields: App Development, Web Development, UI/UX, Cloud, Graphics Designing,
Marketing, Content Writing, AI/ML etc.
How to Apply:
If you are interested, simply fill out the registration form using the link
below:
Registration Link: https://agevole.in/apply/ <https://agevole.in/apply/>

Deadline: 25th April, 2025 (11:59 PM)
This internship is designed to provide you with valuable work experience
and a platform to apply your academic knowledge in real-world scenarios.
Seize this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally. For
inquiries, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at
*internship@agevole.in* <internship@agevole.in>. We're here to assist you
in any way we can.

Best regards,
Agevole Innovations Pvt. Ltd.

subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 â€“ A National-Level Cybersecurity Challenge.
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:30â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 â€“ A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:20â€¯PM
Subject: Launching PENTATHON 2025 â€“ A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE2/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear Faculty,

We are pleased to announce the launch of the "NCIIPC-AICTE PENTATHON 2025",
a premier National-level Hackathon on Capture the Flag (CTF) Challenge and
Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Testing (VAPT). This initiative is
jointly organized by NCIIPC, AICTE, and MIC to identify and nurture the top
cybersecurity talent.

In this regard, we are pleased to inform you the launch of the Pentathon
2025 by the Chairman, AICTE and DG, NCIIPC. We request you to please join
the program online through the below link:

https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m041db1742c446d1739d836000977d27d
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=90873d9a65d4365dd2be6bdc622058d7f74c12f0&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

Date: 26th March 2025
Time: 3:00 PM

*Stages of PENTATHON 2025*:

   1. * Stage 1*: Online Qualification Round. (*5-6thApril 2025)*

 - A jeopardy-style CTF challenge covering Web Attacks, Network
Exploitation, API Vulnerabilities, OT    SCADA, and more.

   2. * Stage 2*: Physical Grand Finale (*1-3rdMay 2025) (Tentative)*

 - A high-stakes live cybersecurity exercise focused on protecting Critical
Information Infrastructure (CII) from advanced cyber threats.

   3. *Stage 3*: Bootcamp and Training for shortlisted teams. *(June2025)
   (Tentative)*

We request you to please join live for the inaugural ceremony for the
launch of NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025. We look forward to your
participation in this prestigious event. For any queries, feel free to
reach out at 011-29581240, 1241 or email: pentathon@aicte-india.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7d6f018fde1112603239e954101e90ee3c15c79b&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xRJeUZPdxDolW18KhQATIdzytI31EzTZ/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=cca47c88bdd3e7aea486d2655d5769f4c97dfaab&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>


*Best regards, *

*PENTATHON 2025**(Organizing Team)*
Share it on Social Media [image: social icon]
<https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjan-sampark.nic.in%2Fcampaigns%2F2025%2F26-Mar%2FAICTE2%2Findex.html>

This message was sent to principal.depstar[at]charusat[dot]ac[dot]in from
AICTE <https://www.aicte-india.org/> through
no-reply[at]sampark[dot]gov[dot]in
------------------------------

subject: Faculty Feedback on E-Governance
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Hope you are doing well and zealously preparing well for the upcoming Summer examination, AY:2024-25. Please note that you all are supposed to give feedback of
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Hope you are doing well and zealously preparing well for the upcoming
Summer examination, AY:2024-25.

Please note that you all are supposed to give *feedback of the faculties
who conducted lab/lecture sessions in the EVEN Semester of AY:2024-25. *

You are supposed to give feedback from your respective login
of e-governance.

Link: *https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/*
<https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/>

Complete the task on or before *doing submission of any subjects. The last
date for Feedback submission is 31/03/2025.*

*Please note that the submissions will not be considered for any subject
unless you submit unbiased feedback in e-governance.*

*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

--

subject: Term-Work Submission Schedule for B.tech IT Semester 4 of AY:2024-25
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! Please find the attached Term-Work Submission Schedule for Semester 4 of the academic year 2024-25. You are required to adhere to this schedule. If you have any doubts or
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings!!!

Please find the attached *Term-Work Submission Schedule* for *Semester 4*
of the *academic year 2024-25*. You are required to adhere to this
schedule. If you have any doubts or queries, feel free to contact the
subject faculty.

Please note that *submissions *will only be *accepted *if the *faculty
feedback* has been *submitted *in the *e-governance system*. Each of you
must provide a screenshot of the feedback status during your submission.



-- 
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Sagar Patel <sagarpatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 7:41â€¯PM
Subject: University Elective Examination Schedule- EC282.01 PROTOTYPING
ELECTRONICS WITH ARDUINO(4/4/2025)
To: <23ec@charusat.edu.in>, <23me@charusat.edu.in>, <23cs@charusat.edu.in>,
<23ce@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23dce@charusat.edu.in>, <
23dit@charusat.edu.in>, <23bsit@charusat.edu.in>, <23bca@charusat.edu.in>

ashishpatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Nikul Patel <nikulpatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
Timil Patel <timilpatel.ee@charusat.ac.in>, CBCS Cordinator <
cbcscoordinators@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Please find the University Elective Examination Schedule for the
subject EC282.01 PROTOTYPING ELECTRONICS WITH ARDUINO.

*It is mandatory for students to submit a signed laboratory manual (spiral
copy) at the time of practical examination.*

*Examination Date*: *04/04/2025*
*Venue & Time*: EC Department, 1st Floor, CSPIT EC/EE Building (See the
attachment for more details)


*Note*: 1. Students need to perform experiments in Proteus and Arduino.
          2. Kindly Refer to the Lab Manual(attached) for the same.


-- 
---Thanks & Regards---
*Dr. SAGARKUMAR B. PATEL*
*Associate Professor,*
*V T PATEL DEPARTMENT OF E&C ENGINEERING,*
*CSPIT, *
*Charotar University of Science and Technology(CHARUSAT)*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*
*Centre of Excellence(CoE) by Govt. of Gujarat*
*CHANGA.*




-- 

Best Regards,
Dipika A. Damodar,
Assistant Professor ,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

snippet: We are excited to announce that the KDPIT is organizing an Expert talk on "Trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future" under Data Science Club @ CHARUSAT. This is an
content:
We are excited to announce that the KDPIT is organizing an Expert talk
on "*Trends
in computing and dominating technologies in the future*" under Data Science
Club @ CHARUSAT.  This is an opportunity to gain insights on understanding
cutting-edge advancements in the technology domain.

*Event Details *
ğŸ“Œ *Topic*: Trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future
ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« *Speaker*: ATUL KUMAR - Manager and Senior Research Scientist @ IBM
Research, Bengaluru.
ğŸ“… Date: March 28, 2025
ğŸ“ Venue: CHARUSAT Campus (Exact location will be shared soon)

ğŸ”¥ Why Should You Attend?
âœ… Learn about the latest advancements in AI and its growing impact across
industries.
âœ… Understand real-world applications of AI in various sectors.
âœ… Gain valuable insights about a career in AI and research.
âœ… Expand your knowledge beyond textbooks and stay ahead in the AI domain.
âœ… Get the opportunity to ask questions and interact with the speaker.

---------- Forwarded message ---------

Subject: 'Getting started with building AI (Artificial Intelligence)
Projects and Agents' online session for the students of Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research.
To:


Session on building AI projects and agents, covering essential concepts and
development steps.

Dear Professor Dr.Amit Ganatra,



Last week we organised a session on Artificial Intelligence. We received a
tremendous response from students across India joining us. Thank you for
your support in sharing about this program. In continuation of these AI
sessions, this week we are organising a webinar on the topic of 'Getting
started with building AI (Artificial Intelligence) Projects and Agents'.
There is *NO FEE* for this session, but *seats are limited* and will be
allocated on a *first-come, first-served basis*.



*Also, since AICTE has declared 2025 as the Year of AI *and since institutions
are actively updating their curricula to* include topics in Artificial
Intelligence. *This series of sessions will help students gain essential
insights into key AI concepts.

email *or*  Click here to share over WhatsApp
<https://czvL704.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/T8+113/czvL704/VXhDCC5kfBg8W2Lcx8g9kgNvBW7CpFKy5tzMdpN4FBQL05nXHsW50kH_H6lZ3m3VJfZZ97FqptXW568-hP2hB1d7W80r4qF8SgVR2W1gnXTT4d1C47W4bkH4_30ScvgVL2p4d7m-8N5W8Bqlbf6pvzPRW5qxxSC2z3T5nW19SZrD5M_9MTW4h8ltg9kn9pQW5CxfLj3lQkwLW43G8dD5dtJvQW5CK3Hh5gCHjdW3HV-r7539xTWW5y4QFG5J0-mJW5rz1c62mw1-TW3VXCJK45VQB6W69kbq53xh9YqW1ZQ5Q115pLtCW8K9kcr5K-p_mW5TxgbG7-N8C8W3KG0BC10GWgmW89798l529qDRW4KL9Cc6xTvJBW6MgQNF2LWvWXW6NKnd_4T3bDrW4C0CTK3xltSvW1GpC4X4vkj1QW25b5KK1V0tl8W6nh78R568WjCN2dcc02yGqmjW8m67t11y55_cf39cJwF04>*

      - *Registration link: *boltiotml.com/liveevent

subject: Fwd: Heartfelt Congratulations and Appreciation to our students for Winning the First Prize in Odoo x National Hackathon held @ Gujarat Vidyapith , Ahmedabad
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! Kindly go through the trailing email depicting the outstanding achievement of our B.tech IT Semester 6 students. Let us all heartily congratulate them and wish them Good
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings!!!

Kindly go through the trailing email depicting the outstanding achievement
of our B.tech IT Semester 6 students.

Let us all heartily congratulate them and wish them Good Luck for their
future endeavors.


*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*







---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 1:01â€¯PM
Subject: Heartfelt Congratulations and Appreciation to our students for
Winning the First Prize in Odoo x National Hackathon held @ Gujarat
Vidyapith , Ahmedabad
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, DEPSTAR IT <
depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

Greetings!!!

I am happy to share the achievement of our B.Tech (IT) Semester 6 students,
Ishwar Goswami (22DIT016), Milan Bavishi (22DIT003) and Krashna Patel
(22DIT050) whose team along with Krushna Parmar emerged as the *Winner of
the First Prize* in Odoo x Gujarat Vidyapith National Hackathon , Ahmedabad
held on the 22nd and 23rd of March, 2025.

Here are the details of the project and the team.

*Winning Project: EcoSattva*

EcoSattva is an advanced platform designed to calculate carbon footprints,
developed using the *MERN stack with integrated Advanced Machine
Learning capabilities.*

Out of *2,200+ competing teams*, they secured a position in the top 50 for
the 24-hour coding challenge at Gujarat Vidyapith. Through their dedication
and teamwork, the students advanced to the final presentation round, where
they were honored to be among the top four teams. Ultimately, our students
emerged as the *Grand Prize Winners* of the competition.
*Award & Recognition:*

   -

   *Winning Prize:* *â‚¹75,000/- sponsored by Odoo*

*Team Details:*

   -

      *Team Name:* *Green Catalyst*
      -

      *Team Members:*
      -

         *Ishwar Goswami (22DIT016)*
         -

         *Milan Bavishi (22DIT003)*
         -

         *Krashna Patel (22DIT050)*
         -

         *Krushna Parmar (22AIML028)*


Itâ€™s a proud moment for both our students and our institute.

Thank You.

--

subject: Fwd: Regarding the circulation of registration for Astronomy and Astrophysics Summer School 2025
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <contact@isa.ac.in> Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 1:32 AM Subject: Regarding the circulation of registration for Astronomy and Astrophysics Summer School
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <contact@isa.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 1:32â€¯AM
Subject: Regarding the circulation of registration for Astronomy and
Astrophysics Summer School 2025
To:

Respected Vice-Chancellor/Chairman/
Director/Principal/Dean/Registrar?Proctor/Head of Departments

Greetings from India Space Academy.

We are writing to inform you that India Space Academy has organized an
Astronomy & Astrophysics Summer School 2025. It is a month-long online
summer skill training programme for students and faculty. The objective
of the programme is to promote space education and employment by
training students and teachers with the skills required for research and
development in astronomy and astrophysics.

During this programme, participants will be exposed to the current
developments in astronomy and astrophysics. They will also be trained on
the skills and techniques required to run the sophisticated software
used by astronomers and researchers. They will also be guided toward a
career in the field of astronomy and astrophysics.
Please circulate this information to your university and its associated
colleges so that students can register for the programme and prepare
themselves for an exciting career as a researcher.

A detailed circular has been attached to this mail.

Registration Start Date: 15/03/2025
Registration End Date: 25/ 04/2025 till 11:55 PM
For more details and registration, visit
https://isa.internship.indiaspaceweek.org/

We look forward to your positive response. For any further
clarification, please contact us at the numbers provided.

subject: Fwd: Summer Internship Opportunities â€“ 2025 at CROWN Software
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Krishna Patel <krishnapatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 9:09â€¯AM
Subject: Summer Internship Opportunities â€“ 2025 at CROWN Software
To: <23dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <24dcse@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Bansari Patel <bansaripatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, Gaurang Patel <
gaurangpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE Depstar <hod.csds@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Please apply for the Summer Internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if
interested.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <hr@glexas.com>
Date: Mon, 24 Mar, 2025, 9:48 pm
Subject: Summer Internship Opportunities â€“ 2025
To: Ashwinmakwana Ce <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Ma'am,

Greetings!

As part of our ongoing collaboration over the years, we are pleased to
extend *summer internship opportunities* for students once again for 2025.
We truly appreciate the support of your institution in connecting students
with industry exposure, and we look forward to continuing this association.

This year, we are offering a *7-8 week internship program* (from *10-05-2025
to 04-07-2025*) in the following domains:

   1.

   *Flutter Developer* â€“ Mobile app development using Flutter, Dart,
   Firebase - 4
   2.

   *Website Developer* â€“ Frontend & Backend development (Html, css,
   Javascript) - 4
   3.

   *REST API Developer* â€“ API development & integration using PHP, SQL - 3
   4.

   *UI/UX Designer* â€“ Wireframing, prototyping, designing, video creation
   using Figma -3
   5.

   *QA & Testing* â€“ Manual and automated testing, bug tracking, and
   reporting - 3

Selection Process:

   -

   Shortlisting based on resume screening
   -

   Followed by a technical interview (online/offline)

Mode of Internship:

   -

   Hybrid (online/offline, depending on project requirements)

We would be grateful if you could kindly forward this opportunity to your
students who might be interested. They can apply using the following *Google
Form*:
https://forms.gle/pw7qPqNViLydodnU8

Please let us know if you require any additional information or if there
are any formalities to proceed with this collaboration. Looking forward to
your kind response.

Best regards,
CROWN Software


-- 
regards
Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science And Technology
