<https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=35737881500>*
https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3771-0386
https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/record/ABZ-0664-2022
https://vidwan.inflibnet.ac.in/profile/290260
*Institute Vision*

*Enrich the youth with skills and values to enable them to contribute in
the development of society: nationally and globally*.

*Institute Mission*

*To provide quality technical education through effective teaching-learning
and research to foster the youth with skills and values to make them
capable of delivering significant contribution in local to global
development. *

 *Department Vision*

*Develop skillful graduate engineers in the field of Instrumentation and
Control Engineering for the benefit of society and industry globally.*

*Department Mission*

*To offer a well-composed course of instructions, learning environment,
hands on experience and problem solving skills for developing professionals
to provide safe and efficient solutions in the field of Instrumentation,
Control, Automation and allied sectors.*

*Program Educational Objectives  (PEOs)*

*Graduates (4-5 years after graduation) will demonstrate ability to,*

*PEO1:* Actively participate in designing, calibration and testing,
operating and maintaining systems in the field of Instrumentation & Control
engineering and allied industry.

*PEO2:* Solve problems in the field of commercial, residential and
industrial automation by applying knowledge of Instrumentation & Control
Engineering.

*PEO3:* Work as an individual and as a team member/leader in
multidisciplinary projects effectively and ethically.

*PEO4:* Provide innovative, feasible, economical and socially relevant
solutions to engineering problems, based on analysis, design and
development using software and/or hardware platforms.

 *Be a good loser for your Loved Ones. But, Be a good winner of Hearts.*

------------------------------
*Pravara Rural Education **Society*
Visit us at : www.pravara.in


<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83nyu9ULBK3Of9JZUU5N1g/videos>
Subscribe our  YouTube channel  : *Pravara Education
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83nyu9ULBK3Of9JZUU5N1g/videos>*



-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

subject:
New announcement: "Practical 6
You are the event managerâ€¦"
snippet: Notification settings Design and Analysis of Algorithms 4IT New announcement Practical 6 You are the event manager for a large festival, and you have the opportunity to secure sponsorship from various
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
Design and Analysis of Algorithms 4IT  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyOTY0OTM5ODg0&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

Practical 6
You are the event manager for a large festival, and you have the
opportunity to secure sponsorship from various companies. Each
company offers a sponsorship amount, but their support comes with
certain conditions that affect the overall budget. Each sponsorship deal
has a weight (representing the budget requirement or resources needed)
and a value (representing the financial contribution or visibility
provided). Your goal is to maximize the total sponsorship value while
staying within the festival's budget constraints. This means selecting a
combination of sponsorship deals that will provide the highest overall
contribution without exceeding the available budget. By employing
backtracking as well as branch-and-bound methods, effectively decide
which sponsorship deals to pursue, ensuring the festival's financial
success.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyOTY0OTM5ODg0/p/NzUxODA4MTg1NjI3&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>

Dear all,

In todayâ€™s world, personal safety and self-defense skills are essential for
everyone, especially for girls and women.

With rising concerns about safety and personal security, it is imperative
to equip young women with the skills and knowledge to protect themselves in
various situations.

CMPICA is organizing Interactive and hands-on self-defense training session
for female students and staff members of CHARUSAT, under EOC on 6th March,
2025, 10:00AM to 12:00PM by Sensei Chetan Fumakiya, Pratibha Academy, Under
the Project of Pratibha Self Defense Foundation.

register using below link on or before 4/3/2025.

Desai ( mittaldesai.mca@charusat.ac.in, (M)  6352954942)

Subject: Fwd: Exclusive Invite - Expert Session Google Solution Challenge
2025
To: DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Shreyansh <shreyansh@hack2skill.com>
Date: Sat, 1 Mar, 2025, 4:48â€¯pm
Subject: Exclusive Invite - Expert Session Google Solution Challenge 2025
To: Amitnayak It <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Amit J Nayak,

We are pleased to invite the students of Charotar University of Science and
Technology to an exclusive Expert Session by a distinguished Industry
Expert on March 4th, 2025, as part of the Google Solution Challenge 2025.
This session aims to equip students with the skills and strategies needed
to excel in these challenges and develop a winning solution.

As Albert Einstein once said, "The only source of knowledge is experience."

Mandatory Registration for Participation

To attend this session, students must be registered for the Google GDG on
Campus Solution Challenge 2025.

Registration Link: https://bit.ly/4ibLu3M
<https://hack2skill-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2UYygSR8BgG142A5Bw7RCO4svmQOne7ifr369ShV81JVKaW1RlQHgltL9XiNCp2-FpHFHC_1ImTrq15JBkyyf3rU94Z_R1C4g3bKXPLaIDUQBZDlZa4LqJN4gCuz8CBm2G8FEcvYeV2wkIKdJu-kyv_zdq3mAjJGEX-bXDkC6GbGPjM102ps4CA>Date:
4th March 2025

Time: 4:00 PM

Beyond the Session : Whatâ€™s in it for your students ?

   -

   Chance to get placed with companies like Disney, HCL, TCS, and more.
   -

   Chance to get invited to Googleâ€™s Career Fair.
   -

   Receive exclusive vouchers for Google Cloud Certifications.
   -

   Attend bootcamps with industry experts across 10 cities in India.
   -

   Win up to â‚¹8 Lakhs in cash prizes.

Click here
<https://hack2skill-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2msRAWD6p5oHtKDeU32D8XeyVWMuFXxyoq0q9V627LatLaW1RlQHD8vA8l6k0nHr2G2oYQOcfygLh-g84pCXy0h-4kSghzR8RKpZgge0-qSMG6ktzZDDTnxmFhu_j_SYBcSosaZQF0B11sat_JW47VIASb4nDaqFOg2Tx7xT-4RX12k8DkGBXCGWaPCWnHWUKYSkoIMBHM49knvTxVN9vt13Vx6HkGaNFdF5eUyrA9X_uILFXSiWZYldzyMJxnd8qqQRp>
to download the PDF for detailed information about the challenge, which you
can also share with your students.

Your efforts in ensuring student participation will significantly enhance
their learning experience and exposure to industry experts. Should you have
any questions, please feel free to reach out.

We look forward to your active support in making this session a valuable
learning opportunity for your students.

Best regards,

Team Hack2skill

To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Team,

Ninjacart is back again with the second batch of openings for their *Tech
Internship Program* after hiring multiple students for the 1st batch PAN
India. *Upon receiving multiple requests, the registration has been
extended till Monday, 3rd March 2025, 10 AM.*

Weâ€™re excited to invite your students to apply for the *Ninjacart Tech
Internship Program 2.0*
<https://apna.co/contests/ninjacart-tech-ninja-intern-hiring-challenge-2025?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=POC20&utm_id=2002>
â€”
a fantastic opportunity to work on impactful agritech projects and gain
hands-on experience in a fast-growing sector.

*Application Link*:
https://apna.co/contests/ninjacart-tech-ninja-intern-hiring-challenge-2025?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=POC20&utm_id=2002

*Highlights of the Internship Program:*

   - *Role: *Tech Interns
   - *Stipend*: â‚¹15,000/month
   - *PPO Opportunity*: â‚¹7 LPA
   - *Location*: Bengaluru (Accommodation & food included)
   - *Duration*:  â€“ 1st April - 31st May

*Eligibility:*

   - B.Tech/B.E. students in CSE/IT (2024/2025 batches).
   - Minimum CGPA/Percentage: 7/70%.

*Important Dates:*

   - *Application Deadline*: 3rd March 2025 - 10 AM
   - *Assessment*: 3rd March 2025 - 2 PM - 8 PM (They can attempt for 30
   minutes anytime basis their availability)

We encourage you to share this exciting opportunity with your students. For
details and application, visit the official website
<https://apna.co/contests/ninjacart-tech-ninja-intern-hiring-challenge-2025?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=POC20&utm_id=2002>
.

Warm regards,
Team apna


--

*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

subject: Join Us for the UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University! ğŸŒ
snippet: Dear All, We're excited to announce the upcoming UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University on February 28th â€“ a must-attend event for students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨ Here's
content:
>
> Dear All,
>
> Weâ€™re excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
>  at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* â€“ a must-attend event for
> students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨
>
> *Hereâ€™s what you can look forward to:*
>
>    1.
>
>    *On-the-Spot Counseling*
>    Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
>    study abroad questions.
>    2.
>
>    *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
>    Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
>    step-by-step.
>    3.
>
>    *Exclusive Scholarships*
>    Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations
>    like the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
>    4.

>

> clarity about your educational journey.

Dear students,


It gives me immense pleasure to announce that the Devang Patel Institute of
Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) is going to organize a Expert
Talk on *"Unveiling the Network: A Deep Dive into Network Services and
Their Security " *as per below schedule.

snippet: Hello AWS enthusiastsğŸ‘‹, It's time for a new tenure and a new team! We're opening applications for the AWS Cloud Club CHARUSAT, and this is your chance to be a part of it. If you're
content:
*Hello AWS enthusiastsğŸ‘‹,*


It's time for a new tenure and a new team! We're opening applications for
the *AWS Cloud Club CHARUSAT, *and this is your chance to be a part of it.


If you're interested in contributing, learning, and leading within the
cloud community and beyond, fill out the application here:
https://forms.gle/HemiKa7MPfyrww6a6


The form will close at *9:00 am, 1st March 2025*


Looking forward to seeing passionate individuals join the team!

For any queries contact:
Dulari Bhushan: +91 78510 37942

Parmesh Bhatt: +91 6355 177 933

Faculty Coordinator:
Dr. Sanket Suthar (CSPIT-IT)

Best regards,
AWS Cloud Club CHARUSAT

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 9:44â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <info@gujgov.edu.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 7:44â€¯PM
Subject: Students' Active Participation in 6th Edition Smart Gujarat
Hackathon
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear,

The Education Department, Gujarat has been doing persistent efforts to
institutionalize the Innovation & Startup Ecosystem in the State through
policy, platform, and processes. To augment the support system for
nurturing student Start-ups in the State, second edition of Student
Start-up and Innovation Policy (SSIP 2.0) was launched on 05 January 2022.

Under the Policy, various flagship initiatives have been envisaged through
which youth can get adequate opportunities to harness their creative
potential. We have pioneered various Open Innovation Programmes like
hackathon and executed them at a large-scale.

The 6th Edition of â€œSmart Gujarat Hackathonâ€ with special focus on
Artificial Intelligence will be a step forward towards building smart and
sustainable solutions to complex challenges. In this edition of hackathon
around 15,000 students are expected to participate and work on problem
statements. Challenges from various departments of the State Government,
Public Sector Undertakings, Municipal Corporations, District Collectorate,
District Panchayats and industries will be broadcasted to students across
universities, institutes, and schools.

The program will feature problem statements from various sectors providing
students with ample opportunities to engage in Artificial Intelligence and
other emerging technology-based solution- oriented projects. Moreover,
winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable
mentorship support from nodal officers of government departments and
benefits from education department of Government of Gujarat, further
encouraging their pursuit of innovation and excellence.

We request all students from your institute to actively participate in 6th
edition of â€œSmart Gujarat Hackathonâ€. This event presents a fantastic
opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving skills and
innovative thinking. To get more details and further update regarding
registration process and list of sectors students can visit the following
link: https://ssipgujarat.in/hackathon. Teams must select a problem
statement online after registration and login in the portal.

Last date for Team registration is 10th March 2025 and synopsis Submission
is 14th March 2025.

Kindly share this with all your students and faculty members so that they
can participate in this event. For any query, please revert us at
ssipgujarat@gmail.com

Team Hackathon
Student Start-up and Innovation Policy
Education Department, Government of Gujarat
3rd Floor, Block No:2 ,Karmayogi Bhavan
Sector 10-A 382010

--

Date: Wed, Feb 26, 2025 at 7:57â€¯PM
Subject: ã€2 days leftã€‘Register for Hack the Future 2025 â€“ Hackathon for
Solving Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To:


Dear friends and Innovators,


Greetings from the IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
(IIEC)!


We are thrilled to invite you to *Hack the Future 2025: Innovating
Intelligent Data Insights*, a national-level hackathon organized by IIEC,
IIT Gandhinagar, in collaboration with the *Ministry of Statistics and
Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India*.


This *36-hour immersive challenge*, scheduled for *March 21â€“23, 2025*, at
IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, will bring together developers, designers,
innovators, and students to leverage *AI and data science* in addressing
critical socio-economic and development challenges using publicly available
data.



*Why Participate?*

âœ… *Solve Real-World Problems:* Tackle challenges curated by MoSPI,
Government of India, and contribute to meaningful solutions.
ğŸ† *Win Exciting Prizes:*

   - *1st Place:* â‚¹2,50,000
   - *2nd Place:* â‚¹1,50,000
   - *3rd Place:* â‚¹1,00,000
   - *2 Special Mentions:* â‚¹35,000 each
   ğŸš€ *Incubation & Piloting Opportunities:* Selected projects may be
   incubated at IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, and piloted in collaboration with MoSPI.
   ğŸš€ *Network & Learn:* Connect with industry experts, policymakers, and
   fellow innovators to expand your horizons.


*Key Dates*

ğŸ“… *Application Window:* February 7â€“28, 2025
ğŸ“¢ *Shortlisted Participants Announced:* March 5, 2025
ğŸ’¡ *Hackathon & Pitching Event:* March 21â€“23, 2025


If you are passionate about *AI, data science, and innovation*, this is
your opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with like-minded
individuals, and create a lasting impact.


*Take the First Step*

ğŸ”— *Apply Now <https://form.jotform.com/250342766778468>*
ğŸ“© *For inquiries:* iiec@iitgn.ac.in | *Visit Us
<https://chat.deepseek.com/a/chat/s/127f9456-4fc6-47ab-bf6e-760519fe586c>*


We canâ€™t wait to see your groundbreaking ideas at *Hack the Future 2025*!



Warm regards,
*Team IIEC*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: GAURANG PATEL <gaurangpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 25, 2025, 6:42â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to Participate in EOC activity_AI for Social Good â€“
Solving Real-World Issues
To: Ashwin Makwana <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Binal Joshi <

neerajjain.as@charusat.ac.in>, Nisha Dave <nishadave.adm@charusat.ac.in>,
Dr. Kirti Makwana <kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in>, Sumam Sunny <
sumamsunny.phy@charusat.ac.in>, Kirti Patel <kirtipatel.mba@charusat.ac.in>,
Vipul Vyas <vipulvyas.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Dipika Damodar <
dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in>, kashyap patel <
kashyappatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Gaurav Kumar <gauravkumar.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <
hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>


Create and share beautiful *email templates*
<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/gmail-email-templates-by/llccdnmbipddnkhmldacpcjjcnljpoij>
[image: banner-bg.jpg]
<https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/eb369ct1lyec5/track-url/yd525sfxod68b/6649bc78c9532e60c578fd57541b3867cc4a14eb>
Dear All,

*The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Department at Charotar
University of Science and Technology is pleased to invite you to
participate in our upcoming Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC) Activity on the
theme "**AI for Social Good â€“ Solving Real-World Issues**"*
Date: 7th March 2025
Timing: 12:00 to 2:00 pm
Registration Link: https://forms.gle/4dnzcafVqqNKr8cd9
Rules:

   -

   Students may present AI-based solutions for improving daily life,
   supporting disabled individuals, enhancing healthcare, or addressing social
   causes.
   -

   Students may submit their ideas in a group of up to 3 members.
   -

   Poster Presentation size: A2 *(presentation format is attached
   herewith.)*
   -

   The poster presentation must be in hard copy.

*Exciting Prizes:*

*1st Prize: â‚¹1500/-*

*2nd Prize: â‚¹1000/-*
*3rd Prize: â‚¹500/-*

   - All participants will receive an e-Certificate of Participation.

We request your kind cooperation and adherence to the above rules to ensure
the smooth conduct of the event.



-


*Thanks and Regards,*


*Gaurang A. Patel*

*Assistant Professor*

Department of Mechanical Engineering

Functional Dept: Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

Charotar University of Science & Technology

Accredited *Grade A+* by NAAC

*Orcid ID: *0000-0003-2356-1444 <https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2356-1444>
*https://vidwan.inflibnet.ac.in/profile/164076
<https://vidwan.inflibnet.ac.in/profile/164076>*
*https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/record/AAY-5208-2020
<https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/record/AAY-5208-2020>*

--

subject: Arthyantra Recruitment â€“ Apply Now for Board Member Positions
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, Arthyantra, the Economics Club of CHARUSAT, is now accepting applications for new team members. This is an opportunity to gain experience in content creation, social media
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

Arthyantra, the Economics Club of CHARUSAT, is now accepting applications
for new team members. This is an opportunity to gain experience in content
creation, social media management, finance, research, and event
coordination while contributing to the clubâ€™s initiatives.

Interested students are required to fill out the Google Form
<https://forms.gle/Aw6fUvSJvebp82tp8> by March 1st. Shortlisted candidates
will be invited for in-person interviews as the next stage of selection.

ğŸ”— Form Link  <https://forms.gle/Aw6fUvSJvebp82tp8>

For any queries, please contact us.
Vansh Malani (9023046891) (Team member)
Nandini Sherwani(9265737966) (Team Member)
Mithil Mistry (8238326605)(President)
Hasti Vakani (9374615759)(President)
Rana Harmin (7046255281)(Advisor)

Best Regards,
Team Arthyantra

New announcement

Dear all, in today's lecture, the syllabus of Statistical Techniques for  
upcoming internal examination is discussed, and
following are the topics of numerical techniques for the internal  
examination:
  1.  Errors in numerical analysis: types of errors, sources of errors.
2.  Finite differences and associated operators.
3.  Newtonâ€™s forward interpolation formula, Newtonâ€™s backward interpolation  
formula.
4.  Lagrangeâ€™s interpolation formula.

subject: Donâ€™t Miss Out: Join Us for the UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University! ğŸŒ
snippet: Dear All, We're excited to announce the upcoming UniExplore 2.0 International Fair at Charusat University on February 28th â€“ a must-attend event for students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨ Here's
content:
Dear All,

Weâ€™re excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* â€“ a must-attend event for
students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨

*Hereâ€™s what you can look forward to:*

   1.

   *On-the-Spot Counseling*
   Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
   study abroad questions.
   2.

   *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
   Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
   step-by-step.
   3.

   *Exclusive Scholarships*
   Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations like
   the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
   4.

   *One-to-One Profile Evaluation*
   After pre-counseling, meet university reps tailored to your profile for
   more personalized advice.

This event is a your *gateway to transforming their future* and gaining
clarity about your educational journey.

*ğŸ“Œ Donâ€™t miss out!*
Mark your calendars for *February 28th*, and take your first step toward
international education.

*To register, click the link below*:
*Register Now* <https://arisoverseas.com/uniexplore/>
*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT*
*Time: 10.00 A.M to 03.00 P.M*
*Date: 28 FEB 2025*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you take the next big step
in students academic journey!

*Thanks & Regards,**Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *
AT: Changa, Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat
(T) 02697-265213

--

subject: Fwd: Students' active participation in 6th Edition - Smart Gujarat Hackathon
snippet: Dear Students, We request all students to actively participate in 6th edition of â€œSmart Gujarat Hackathonâ€. This event presents a fantastic opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving
content:
Dear Students,

We request all students to actively participate in 6th edition of â€œSmart
Gujarat Hackathonâ€. This event presents a fantastic opportunity for
students to showcase their problem-solving skills and innovative thinking.
To get more details and further update regarding registration process and
list of sectors students can visit the following link:
https://ssipgujarat.in/hackathon. Teams must select a problem statement
online after registration and login in the portal.

The last date for Team registration is *10th March 2025* and synopsis
Submission is *14th March 2025*.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Student Start-up and Innovation Policy (GoG- Education Dept.) <
ssip@gujarat.gov.in>



Dear,

The Education Department, Gujarat has been doing persistent efforts to
institutionalize the Innovation & Startup Ecosystem in the State through
policy, platform, and processes. To augment the support system for
nurturing student Start-ups in the State, second edition of Student
Start-up and Innovation Policy (SSIP 2.0) was launched on 05 January 2022.

Under the Policy, various flagship initiatives have been envisaged through
which youth can get adequate opportunities to harness their creative
potential. We have pioneered various Open Innovation Programmes like
hackathon and executed them at a large-scale.

The 6th Edition *of â€œSmart Gujarat Hackathonâ€ with special focus on
Artificial Intelligence* will be a step forward towards building smart and
sustainable solutions to complex challenges. In this edition of hackathon
around 15,000 students are expected to participate and work on problem
statements. Challenges from various departments of the State Government,
Public Sector Undertakings, Municipal Corporations, District Collectorate,
District Panchayats and industries will be broadcasted to students across
universities, institutes, and schools.

The program will feature problem statements from various sectors providing
students with ample opportunities to engage in *Artificial Intelligence and
other emerging technology-based solution- oriented *projects. Moreover,
winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable
mentorship support from nodal officers of government departments and
benefits from education department of Government of Gujarat, further
encouraging their pursuit of innovation and excellence.

We request all students from your institute to actively participate in 6th
edition of â€œSmart Gujarat Hackathonâ€. This event presents a fantastic
opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving skills and
innovative thinking. To get more details and further update regarding
registration process and list of sectors students can visit the following
link: https://ssipgujarat.in/hackathon. Teams must select a problem
statement online after registration and login in the portal.

Last date for Team registration is *10th March 2025* and synopsis
Submission is *14th March 2025*.

Kindly share this with all your students and faculty members so that they
can participate in this event. For any query, please revert us at
ssipgujarat@gmail.com


*Team Hackathon*


Student Start-up and Innovation Policy

Education Department, Government of Gujarat

3rd Floor, Block No:2 ,Karmayogi Bhavan

Sector 10-A 382010

*To,*

 *The Vice Chancellor of Technical Universities,*

* All Director/Principal of AICTE Approved Institutions*

*Subject: Participation in **World Robot Olympiad (WRO) Season 2025* *commenced
on 18th November 2024 onwards.* *-regarding.*

*Greetings from AICTE!*

India STEM Foundation, encouraging participation from students across all
colleges, institutions, and universities under AICTE. This initiative aims
to empower students by enhancing their STEM skills, thereby equipping them
for future career opportunities in science, technology, and engineering in
World Robot Olympiad (WRO) Season 2025.

Additionally, they are offering *free entry to the first 10 teams* registering
under the Future Engineers category to further encourage participation.

You are therefore, requested to go through their official website,
www.wroindia.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=285179548b56426f4fd9c2435a1527886d13698c&lat=2025&mid=c83349089799f549cc1852a43938478f43fc0e7b>,

to participate in the *World Robot Olympiad (WRO) Season 2025*.

We look forward to your active participation in the program.

subject: Cisco Presents: Navigating the Future of AI and Cybersecurity
snippet: View online Cisco Networking Academy Logo AI and Cybersecurity: The Future of Defense Join Omar Santos, Distinguished Engineer at Cisco and Co-Chair of CoSAI, for a session on cybersecurity's
content:
AI and Cybersecurity: The Future of Defense
Join Omar Santos, Distinguished Engineer at Cisco and Co-Chair of CoSAI, for a session on cybersecurity's future. Discover how AI agents and shadow AI risks are reshaping industries and learn about strategic innovations to protect digital infrastructures. Secure your spot in this essential discussion today.
Why You Should Attend:
- 
Discover cutting-edge AI advancements transforming cybersecurity.

 

	- 
Learn innovative strategies to safeguard digital infrastructures.

 

	- 
Gain insights from industry-leading experts on future tech trends.
Meet the Speaker & Host
Omar Santos
Distinguished Engineer
Cisco

Dear All,

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), FTE,
CHARUSAT has organized a talk on *"Web Application Security: Identifying
and Mitigating Vulnerabilities"*  with an objective to equip students with
skills to secure web applications from various kinds of vulnerabilities.

The expert of the talk is* Mr. Gatin Shah, Application Security Specialist,
UBS, Pune.*

You may refer to his profile on: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gatinshah/

The session will be held online, and registered participants will receive a
joining link ahead of the scheduled talk.

*Event Details:*

    Day & Date: Saturday, March 01, 2025
    Time: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM

To register, please click on the following link:
https://forms.gle/zuYfbpV8rEJF8z8r8

We encourage all domain interested participants to register and get ready
to dive into this rapidly evolving domain.

subject: What will you build?
snippet: Get inspired with the latest and greatest apps, created by users like you. Matt here, The start of 2025 has been incredible, and we're amazed by what our community is creating. I'm excited to
content:
Get inspired with the latest and greatest apps, created by users like you.


â€Š
â€Š 



Matt here,

 The start of 2025 has been incredible, and we're amazed by what our community 
is creating.

I'm excited to share some standout projects that showcase the diversity and 
creativity of our platformâ€”from AI-powered tools to creative apps that are 
making a real difference.





Already have a great project? Submit your app to be featured.

Submit your app <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7> 

ğŸ“š Education



PromptCraft <http://promptcraftpro.com/>: Learn prompt engineering by solving 
challenges. Designed for non-technical users as a interactive, educational full 
stack app. PromptCraft is an interactive platform designed to teach users the 
art of effective prompting through engaging challenges.

From the creator: "I can't believe I built a complex full stack application. 
All within 6-8 weeks. It has allowed me to teach others skills which will help 
them 10x their productivity with LLMs." â€”Abhijat 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/asaraswat/>

CPDProof <https://cpdproof.com>: As in, "Certified Professional Development." 
CPDProof turns any public article or youtube video into verified learning hours 
through an AI Quiz and QRCode certification. ThanksHasan! 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/hasansaifislam/> 


ğŸ”¨ Productivity



Gridgoals <https://gridgoals.com>: A playful and visually spectacular app to 
see your habits in a neat little grid. Click any box for a fun effect!

 "I've been much more consistent and motivated in my 2025 goals. Now, I'm 
working on creating courses to teach people how to build with AI, including 
using Replit Agent." â€”Sani <https://x.com/sanisideup_>

Mind Mapper <https://ai-mind-mapper.replit.app/>: A tool for breaking down 
complex topics into manageable subtopics and brainstorming ideas using mind 
maps (using AI of course). Mind Mapper is seriously fun to play and helped me 
brainstorm this email. Great jobDavid <https://x.com/davidstoeckli>! 


ğŸ¥• Health and Awareness



Calorease <https://calorease.replit.app/> <https://calorease.replit.app/>: 
Frustrated by excel, paper, and other food journals, Jake set out to create the
fastest food journal on the planet. You have to see it to believe it, but it 
absolutely rips. ğŸ”¥

This one might replace MyFitnessPal! Big shout-out to Jake at State Farm 
Calcium Lab. <https://calciumlab.com/>

Guided Letter <https://guidedletter.com/>: Create campaigns with guided 
questions to help your members write strong, personal letters to 
decision-makers. Make it easy for your community to take action with AI 
assistance.

From the creator: "Replit is helping my community organization, Strong North 
Tahoe, to build tools that help people make a difference! So much of the AI 
focus is on big tech and the scary stuff, so I'm excited to use it to empower 
communities in ways previously unavailable."

Thanks Nick <https://x.com/TheNicholaus>!


ğŸ” Search tools



Nowplai <https://nowplai.com>: I think this is an app we've all wanted. 
Nowplai finds song links on every major music platform. Now you can share your 
eclectic music taste with your eclectic friends who don't use Spotify.

 "I made sharing songs easier in the group chats where some people use Apple 
Music and some use Spotify." Amazing workEgor <https://x.com/egorka>!

Libscope <https://libscope.replit.app/>: LibScope assists developers in 
discovering the most suitable libraries for their projects. By analyzing your 
project's specific requirements and context, LibScope provides tailored library 
recommendations. ThanksBrthrs Agency <https://www.linkedin.com/company/brthrs/>!


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


 This is just a glimpse of whatâ€™s possible with Replit. If you're looking for 
more inspiration, we'll be sharing regular updates on what our users are 
building.

If you'd like to be featured in our next issue, submit your project below. 

Submit your app <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7> 

Thanks again & until next time,

Matt <>



â€Š

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it>  
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw> 
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>

Sent by Replit
1001 E Hillsdale Blvd, Suite 400, Foster City, CA 94404 

Unsubscribe here 
<https://links.replit.com/s/u/ts8kT0jJWE8DucGCRi9AhvzppzrD3Oo-CxLMaAtt5k3uPS5Ix_QD-eOLlpaxoDTpI7d2U8UcfvWT-BHYWyA29YrgUcGE5lfkSUGwBWttMPrDpk9OJHGpirG6CF4AhG0M1GKgmL0s7nzliqipseH9MScmomaqtXMExPSz6AWXGXj4q6lTJKicBAnuX0RiFOIp_9K8EAkM1z0rJ5d1/pk3hGOjePlKdaVf_KNdfNVKtCoP2yLyB/6>

subject: Fwd: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at Their Dream Company!
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 9:17â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at Their Dream
Company!
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Please pass this on to the students.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 20, 2025 at 6:42â€¯PM
Subject: Help Your Students Secure an HR Interview at Their Dream Company!
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/14-Feb/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear [Training and Placement Officer],

With *30,000+ job opportunities* from top companies like *Google, KPMG,
Amazon, EY, and Deloitte,* your students have an incredible chance to
secure an HR interview at their dream companyâ€”and we need your support to
help them seize this opportunity!


*Introducing Dream Job Challenge 2025*
Apna is giving students the platform to showcase their passion and land
interviews at their dream workplaces. They simply need to tell us why they
deserve to work there, and if they stand out, Apna will go the extra mile
to help them succeed.

*How You Can Help:*

   - *Encourage Registration* â€“ Ask students to sign up here:
   https://apna-job-web.app.link/e/SqXtrvexVQb
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=be98477a0c746f09e2d6f090de179e2c26939d0d&lat=2025&mid=fce76760055f554abe243f88e21858fff6026a9b>

   - *Ensure Profile Completion* â€“ Only completed profiles can access top
   jobs
   - *Promote Dream Job Challenge 2025* â€“ Inspire students to take the next
   step

PFA:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Jm0pPuX-TxNKy9WdzVYwTqYEcT6BMxe8/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=117518947182740027481&rtpof=true&sd=true
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7662651e7872f36b4be461a9451a7bd18fe28e96&lat=2025&mid=fce76760055f554abe243f88e21858fff6026a9b>


*Best regards,*
*eGovernance*
*AICTE, New Delhi*
Share it on Social Media [image: social icon]
<https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjan-sampark.nic.in%2Fcampaigns%2F2025%2F14-Feb%2FAICTE1%2Findex.html>
[image:

5 Ways to Stay Accountable to Your Learning Goals in 2025 


As the year unfolds, it's common for the initial enthusiasm behind your New 
Yearâ€™s resolutions to fade, but developing a love for learning (it is February 
after all!) can help create a strong foundation for consistent motivation and 
growth. With that in mind, here are 5 ways to help you stay accountable to your 
learning goals this year.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/stay-accountable-to-learning-goals/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2025_february_in_development&utm_content=hero_blog_learning_goals_cta>

How to Cultivate a Lifelong Love for Learning


Part of the joy (and challenge) of working in an industry that constantly 
shifts is that you never stop being a student â€” upskilling is part of the gig. 
We spoke with John King, a 60-year-old Web Architect, about how cultivating a 
lifelong love for learning has helped him identify which skills are in demand 
and enabled him to find his next role.

Dear All,

Weâ€™re excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* â€“ a must-attend event for
students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨

*Hereâ€™s what you can look forward to:*

   1.

   *On-the-Spot Counseling*
   Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
   study abroad questions.
   2.

   *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
   Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
   step-by-step.
   3.

   *Exclusive Scholarships*
   Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations like
   the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
   4.

   *One-to-One Profile Evaluation*
   After pre-counseling, meet university reps tailored to your profile for
   more personalized advice.

This event is a your *gateway to transforming their future* and gaining
clarity about your educational journey.

*ğŸ“Œ Donâ€™t miss out!*
Mark your calendars for *February 28th*, and take your first step toward
international education.

*To register, click the link below*:
*Register Now* <https://arisoverseas.com/uniexplore/>
*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT*
*Time: 10.00 A.M to 03.00 P.M*
*Date: 28 FEB 2025*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you take the next big step
in students academic journey!

also, Please Forward this to all year Students and encourage them to
Participate!

*Thanks & Regards,*
*Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *

(T) 02697-265213

Design and Analysis of Algorithms 4IT  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyOTY0OTM5ODg0&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

5 Dynamic Programming Approach
5.1 You are organizing a music festival and need to pack supplies in a  
limited
number of trucks for transport. Each truck has a maximum capacity, and
you have a variety of supplies, each with a specific weight and value. Your
goal is to maximize the total value of the supplies transported without
exceeding the truck's weight limit.
You are given:

ï‚· An integer array weights[] where weights[i] represents the
weight of the ith supply item.
ï‚· An integer array values[] where values[i] represents the
value of the ith supply item.
ï‚· An integer capacity representing the maximum weight the
truck can carry.

You need to determine the maximum total value of supplies that can be
packed into the truck.



5.2 In a bioinformatics lab where you need to compare two DNA sequences
to find the longest common DNA subsequence. This is essential for
identifying similarities and differences between the genetic material of
different organisms, which can help in various biological studies.
Given two strings, s1 and s2, representing the DNA sequences, your task
is to find the length of the longest common DNA subsequence between
them.
See details

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Prabhakar Dorge <prabhakardorge2007@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, Feb 19, 2025 at 8:01â€¯AM
Subject: National Level Online Coding Challenge Competition 2025
To:


Dear Sir / Madam,

 Unstop and ADIS is going to conduct National Level Online Coding Challenge
Competition 2025 for students. National Level Online Coding Challenge
Competition 2025 is an event where programmers from around the world
compete by solving algorithmic and programming problems. This competition
can range from beginner-friendly to highly advanced and often feature a mix
of individual and team-based challenges.

 This Online Coding Challenge Competition is the real test to check students
coding knowledge. Each participant will get a certificate for their
participation.

 *Awards -*

subject: Fwd: Workshop on "Cloud Computing and Operating Systems"
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!! Interested students can contact their counsellors for the same. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Vaishali Vadhavana <vaishalivadhavana.dcs@charusat
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!

Interested students can contact their counsellors for the same.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Vaishali Vadhavana <vaishalivadhavana.dcs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 3:08â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Workshop on "Cloud Computing and Operating Systems"
To: Ritika Jani <ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>, Bhavika Patel <
bhavikapatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head CSE Depstar <hod.csds@charusat.ac.in>, Disha Panchal <
dishapanchal.dcs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Ma'am,

Kindly forward this to 4th and 6th semester students of CE and IT.
They can register if interested.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Disha Panchal <dishapanchal.dcs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 3:03â€¯PM
Subject: Workshop on "Cloud Computing and Operating Systems"
To: <23dcse@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head CSE Depstar <hod.csds@charusat.ac.in>, Vaishali Vadhavana <
vaishalivadhavana.dcs@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Students,*

We are excited to invite you to an exclusive workshop* on "Cloud Computing
and Operating Systems"*, a power-packed *3-hour* session designed to
provide valuable insights on OS adaptations for cloud infrastructure.

*Workshop Details:*
ğŸ“… *Date:* 1st March 2025
ğŸ•˜ *Time:* 10:00 AM Onwards
ğŸ“ *Venue:* 329, A5 Building (DEPSTAR)
ğŸ¤ *Speaker:* Mr. Nirav Desai, Analyst Engineer, System Level Solutions,
Anand

This workshop aims to enhance your understanding of cloud-based operating
systems and their real-world applications.
*Session Goals*

   -

   Overview of Cloud OS and its significance.
   -

   Real-world applications of Cloud OS platforms.
   -

   Hands-on experience with cloud environments.

*Topics Covered*

   -

   *Cloud OS Basics:* Definition, importance, and benefits.
   -

   *Core Features:* Virtualization, resource management, security,
   automation.
   -

   *Popular Platforms:* OpenStack, VMware vSphere, Microsoft Azure, AWS.
   -

   *Hands-on Activities:* Deploying virtual machines, container
   orchestration with Docker/Kubernetes, cloud storage with AWS S3.
   -

   *Future Trends:* AI-driven cloud OS, edge computing, serverless
   architectures, cross-cloud compatibility.

*Hands-on Activities (Live Demonstration & Practice)*

   1.

   *Deploying a Virtual Machine in the Cloud*
   -

      Log in to the AWS Management Console.
      -

      Launch an EC2 instance with a chosen OS (Ubuntu/Windows Server).
      -

      Configure instance type and storage settings.
      -

      Access the instance via SSH/RDP and explore basic cloud operations.
      -

      *Outcome:* Understand cloud resource provisioning and access.
      2.

   *Container Orchestration with Docker/Kubernetes*
   -

      Install Docker on a cloud-based VM.
      -

      Pull and run a sample container (e.g., nginx, redis).
      -

      Scale and stop containers to simulate real-world use cases.
      -

      (Optional) Use Kubernetes (Minikube) to create and manage a cluster.
      -

      *Outcome:* Learn the fundamentals of container-based deployment and
      scaling.
      3.

   *File Storage and Management in the Cloud*
   -

      Create an Amazon S3 bucket.
      -

      Upload, manage, and retrieve files using AWS S3 and CLI commands.
      -

      Understand permissions and data access policies.
      -

      *Outcome:* Gain insights into cloud-based storage solutions and
      security measures.


*How to Register?*
Click the link below to complete your registration:

https://forms.gle/zQvHbR85DdKMfuTKA


Hurry! Limited seats available. Secure your spot today and be part of an
enriching learning experience.

For any queries, feel free to contact undersigned and/or Ms. Vaishali
Vadhavana,CSE Depstar

Looking forward to your participation!





-- 
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Vaishali Vadhavana*
*Assistant Professor,*
*Computer Science & Engineering,*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),*
*At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist: Anand, (Gujarat) India. *
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology & Research (DEPSTAR),*




-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

Dear Sir/Ma'am,

We are thrilled to announce the launch of *SBI* *College Youth Ideathon
(CYI) 2025* â€“ Indiaâ€™s largest student entrepreneurship challenge, jointly
organized by *IIT Delhi*, *MEPSC* (under Min of Skill Development &
Entrepreneurship),* Infyni* and *ThinkStartup*.

Launched by* Dr Kiran Bedi *on 4th Feb 2025 at Constitution Club of India
in the August presence of Dean - IIT Delhi and CEO - MEPSC, the *SBI
College Youth Ideathon* aims to ignite innovation across all colleges,
engaging 100,000+ students in an exciting journey of ideation,
entrepreneurship, and real-world problem-solving.

We encourage your institution and students to participate in SBI College

snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*

*Changa, Anand,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:36â€¯PM
Subject: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings!!



To inculcate the culture of scientific research and to motivate students to
explore the opportunities in space science, we are excited to announce a *Space
Talk Series. *This series is customized to offer numerous benefits for
students, including:


Â·  Awareness of Space Technology

Â·  Showcasing various ongoing projects related to Space by ISRO

Â·  Career Opportunities in Space Applications

The first talk in the series is organized by V. T. Patel Department of
Electronics and Communication Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT and it will
focus on the topic titled *"**Indian Planetary Missions: Through the Eyes
of a Scientist"*

We are delighted to have *Dr Arpit Patel, Scientist-E, **Physical Research
Laboratory*, Ahmedabad, as a distinguished speaker. Dr. Arpit has
contributed to numerous payloads in Indian Space Missions such as *Mars
Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan), Chandrayan -3, Aditya L1 *and many more.

Event Details:

Â·  *Date:* Wednesday, February 19, 2025

Â·  *Time:* 10:30 am onwards

Â·  *Location:* Seminar Hall, 2nd floor, A6 Building

We look forward to your active participation in this *Space Talk Series*.
The registration link is as follows:

https://forms.gle/sqitonXPC2Jgxo4YA

For any query, kindly contact *Dr. Killol Pandya, M: 7600004093*,
*killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in
<killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in>*,

Trushit Upadhyaya

Cc: Head Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

This is to inform you that the University Practical Examination
(Supplimentary Exam 1) February 2025 of the university elective (CL281.01
Environmental Sustainability & Climate Change) is scheduled for 21/02/2025
(Friday). The details of the exam are as follows:

Date: 21/02/2025 (Friday)
Timings: 9:00 am to 11:00 am
Venue: Room no. 513, Environmental Engineering Lab., 1st floor, CSPIT Civil
building

I will forward this email to the concerned students, and you are also
requested to forward this email to the concerned students.

Thanks and regards,

Ms. Hemangi Oza
M. Tech Environment Engineer
Assistant Professor
Dept. of Civil Engineering
CSPIT CHARUSAT
Changa, Anand.
Mo. No.: 8780473646

MA262 -SNT -4IT- 2025  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/Njg3NDI1MDQwNDc0&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New assignment

"Analyzing the Relationship Between Two Variables Using Correlation  
Coefficients"
Problem Definition:




This Practical aims to measure the strength and direction of the  
relationship between two variables using correlation coefficients. The  
implementation will include for measuring linear relationships and for  
assessing monotonic relationships. By applying these methods,  it will  
provide insights into the degree of association between the selected  
variables, aiding in data-driven decision-making.

The analysis will be conducted using at least , each representing  
real-world scenarios where correlation analysis is beneficial.

e.g


    - Variables: Study hours vs. Exam scores
    - Purpose: Determine if more study hours lead to higher scores.
    - Variables: Temperature vs. Electricity consumption
    - Purpose: Evaluate how temperature fluctuations affect power usage.

Best wishes.
Due Feb 18
See details

National Coordinators on SWAYAM Platform for examination to be conducted by

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 11:28â€¯PM
Subject: Wider dissemination of 1516 Online Credit Courses offered by
National Coordinators on SWAYAM Platform for examination to be conducted by
NTA during January, 2025 Semester among faculty and students of all
Technical Higher Education Institutions/Universities/AICTE Approved
Institutions for Enrolments and to avail Credit Transfers â€“Regarding
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/17-Feb/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

To

*All Technical Higher Education Institutions/*

*Universities/AICTE Approved Institutions*

*Sub: **Wider dissemination of 1516 Online Credit Courses offered by
National Coordinators on SWAYAM Platform for examination to be conducted by
NTA during January, 2025 Semester among faculty and students of all
Technical Higher Education Institutions/Universities/AICTE Approved
Institutions for Enrolments and to avail Credit Transfers â€“Regarding*

Sir/Madam,

Greetings from AICTE!

As you are aware, the national on-line education MOOCs Platform â€œSWAYAMâ€
was launched by MOE on 9th July, 2017. A number of top-ranking
Universities/Institutions offer on-line MOOCs/Certificate programmes
through SWAYAM in almost all disciplines including high demand areas of new
technologies.  Till date, more than *13000+* courses have been offered
through SWAYAM and the total enrolment in these courses has crossed *4.6*
Crores.

For the current *Jan 2025 Semester*, *1516* online credit courses
comprising 12 (Twelve) Online Credit Courses are offered on SWAYAM Platform
for learners.  The examinations for these Credit Courses have been
scheduled to be conducted by NTA on *17, 18, 24 and 25 May 2025.* The
enrolment for these credit courses has already started. Registration for
examination of above 1516 online Credit Courses would be announced in due
course of time. The details of the Courses being offered in *Jan, 2025*
Semester are available on SWAYAM website https://swayam.gov.in/
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=b60c54b9431137cf3f332a642086a6f82534d034&lat=2025&mid=2f9eea8cbec1ab4661467789302036abb53ae010>
as per the URL given below :

*https://storage.googleapis.com/swayam2_central/assets/pdf/January%202025%20Semester%20Course%20list.pdf
<https://storage.googleapis.com/swayam2_central/assets/pdf/January%202025%20Semester%20Course%20list.pdf>*

The University Grants Commission had earlier notified the *UGC (Credit
Framework for Online Learning Courses through SWAYAM) Regulations, 2021*
during March, 2021 which facilitates an Institution/University to allow
credit transfer up to *40% of the total courses* being offered by any
higher education institution in a particular programme in a semester
through online learning courses on SWAYAM Platform. *AICTE has also adopted
the credit transfer up to 40% on UGC pattern in continuation of AICTE
(Credit Framework for Online Learning Courses through SWAYAM) Regulation*
and has already requested all Universities/Institutions/Colleges, from time
to time, to *allow credit transfer up to 40% of the total courses being
offered in a semester through SWAYAM*. As per Para 4 (1) of UGC (Credit
Framework for Online Learning Courses through SWAYAM) Regulations, 2021,
the schedule of the SWAYAM based online credit courses shall be aligned
with the conventional education semester commencing in the month of *January
and July of every year*. With this, the students studying in conventional
Institutes/Colleges can transfer the credits earned through the SWAYAM
Courses into their academic records.

In view of above, all Technical Higher Education Institutions/Universities/
AICTE Approved Institutions are requested to give wide publicity to the
above 1516 online Credit Courses in their respective Institutions and to
explore the feasibility for credit transfer in respect of these Courses as
per University Grants Commission (Credit Framework for Online Learning
Courses through Study Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds)
Regulations, 2021. This will enable Students from all streams of the
respective Universities/Institutions to be aware of the same and encouraged
to benefit from the credit transfer of high-quality MOOCs courses of SWAYAM.

*Thanks & Regards,*



*Dr. Amit DuttaDirector (P&AP/SWAYAM)AICTE,New Delhi-110070*

To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Sir/Ma'am,*

I hope this email finds you well. On behalf of the *IIT Guwahati *Daksh
Gurukul team, I would like to extend our heartfelt gratitude for your
invaluable support in spreading the AI & ML qualifier test. With your
encouragement, we witnessed an overwhelming *participation of over 5,000
students*, from different states in India and the reception has been
phenomenal. *The top-performing students have now been selected *for this
prestigious opportunity to learn from IIT Guwahati professors, and we are
thrilled to see their journey unfold.

We are now restarting the qualifier test for the *Data Science Program* and
would love for students from your institution to participate this *Sunday*.
This is a great opportunity for students to:

   -

   Test and enhance their logical and analytical skills.
   -

   Gain a chance to learn directly from IIT Guwahati professors.
   -

   Explore the transformative world of Data Science, regardless of their
   branch, degree, or year of study.

*Selection Process & Deadline*

   - *Pan India selection process is live*
   - *Entrance test: This Sunday*
   - *Registration Link - https://bit.ly/IITGuwahatiDataScience
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiDataScience/1/0100019516d79e42-ab57c790-7c59-445e-8a27-a4b071a17771-000000/Cmbxh8TOn6_Gv73Wf2psN2N2cPM=413>
*



Book Exam Slot
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiDataScience/2/0100019516d79e42-ab57c790-7c59-445e-8a27-a4b071a17771-000000/GEK6qYnG4c57lh9i6fK0vNTx4bo=413>

The Data Science industry is at the forefront of innovation, driving
advancements across diverse fields such as* healthcare, finance,
sustainability, artificial intelligence, e-commerce, automotive,
agriculture, and many more*. Itâ€™s not just about numbers; itâ€™s about
solving real-world problems, predicting trends, and creating impactful
solutions. From optimizing supply chains in logistics to enabling
personalized recommendations in entertainment, Data Science is reshaping
industries and creating new opportunities

We encourage your students to take this opportunity and attempt the
qualifier test. For more details and to register, they can visit:
*https://bit.ly/IITGuwahatiDataScience
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiDataScience/3/0100019516d79e42-ab57c790-7c59-445e-8a27-a4b071a17771-000000/IpqyA7sZes4icq97H9OlgV3xWxI=413>
*

We request you to share the invite with your students by forwarding this
email. Thank you once again for your continued support. Together, we can
empower the next generation of innovators and problem-solvers.


*Warm regards,*
Team IIT Guwahati (Daksh Gurukul), Datascience Program

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation for participation
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 15, 2025 at 4:50â€¯PM
Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation
for participation
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,



"The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things but
their inward significance.â€ â€“ Aristotle



We are delighted to inform you that the Faculty of Humanities, in
collaboration with Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management, CHARUSAT is
hosting a unique and enriching Pichhwai Art Workshop, scheduled for March
1, 2025. The workshop will be held in the afternoon slot, providing an
excellent opportunity to explore and engage with this traditional form of
Indian art. *Further, this workshop also aims at promoting Indian arts and
culture proliferated under NEP 2020*.



The ancient painting technique known as Pichhwai art, which originated in
Nathdwara, Rajasthan, some 400 years ago, is intricately linked to the
area's religious legacy. The background of Lord Shrinathji, a venerated
embodiment of Lord Shri Krishna, has long been decorated with these
paintings, which originated at the Nathdwara temple. The themes mostly
centre on events from Lord Shri Krishna's early childhood, which depict his
favourite festivals, pastimes, and seasonal festivities.In addition to
their traditional function as sacred temple hangings, Pichhwai paintings
have become more and more popular as home decor, interiors for museums, and
art galleries. Beyond paintings, the motifs and intricate designs are now
replicated on textiles, cushion covers, and carpets, preserving the
artistic legacy in contemporary decor.



We have invited upcoming and enthusiastic artists, Shri Mahesh Rabari and
Ms. Muskan Mehta. The artists conducting the Pichhwai Art Workshop are
highly skilled practitioners dedicated to preserving and promoting this
traditional art form. They have mastered the intricate techniques and
symbolism of Pichhwai Art, bringing its rich heritage to life.



*Workshop details are:*



Â·  *Date: * March 1, 2025

Â·  *Day: * Saturday

Â·  *Time: * 1 pm to 4 pm

Â·  *Venue:  *Centre Square, IIIM

Â·  *Registration Link and QR Code: https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7
<https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7>*


[image: adobe-express-qr-code (4).png]



*Last date for the registration: February 21, 2024*


Contact Ms. Jayshree Mehta +91 76001 47568 for details.



Kindly find the event poster and captivating creations by the artists.



Thanks and Regards,





Binit Patel
Bhaskar Pandya

--

Dear Institute,

Greetings from cvDragon!
We are back with our next Masterclass - *The Ultimate Video Resume
Masterclass*, a must-attend session designed to help your students craft
compelling video resumes that capture recruiters' attention and boost their
chances of landing their dream jobs. In todayâ€™s digital hiring landscape, a
well-crafted video resume can set candidates apart from the competition!

*Workshop Takeaways*:

   - *Who Should Create a Video Resume*? Understand when and why a video
   resume can be a game-changer.
   - *How to Create Your Own Video Profile* â€“ Step-by-step guidance on
   recording a professional and impactful video resume.
   - *Script Preparation* â€“ Learn how to draft an engaging script to
   present yourself confidently and effectively.
   - *Key Elements to Include* â€“ Know what recruiters look for in a video
   resume and how to showcase your skills and personality.
   - *Dos and Donâ€™ts *â€“ Avoid common mistakes that can make or break your
   video resume.
   - *Voice Modulation & Body Language* â€“ Master essential techniques to
   sound confident and appear professional on camera.
   - *Live Demonstration* â€“ Watch a practical example of a well-crafted
   video resume.


We kindly request you to share the following details with your students so
they can register for this valuable opportunity.

*Workshop Details:*
*Date*: 21st February, 2025

&

"Unleash Your Imagination, Let Your Story Shine!"

"Storytelling is an age-old art that captivates audiences, stimulates
imagination, and preserves cultural heritage. Join us in this exciting
event where stories come to life, imagination knows no bounds, and
voices create unforgettable experiences!"

STORY NARRATING COMPETITION 2025, organized under the theme
INDIAN KNOWLEDGE SYSTEM, is here to celebrate creativity, culture, and
storytelling!

Tales, or Fictional Narratives

ğŸ“¢ GENERAL RULES

 	* The competition is open to all registered students. Participants
must confirm their registration before the event.
 	* The narration must be in English.
 	* Each participant will have a 3 to 5-minute time slot for their
narration. Exceeding the limit may result in a penalty.
 	* Minimal use of handheld props is allowed, but the focus should
remain on narration. Visual presentations are not permitted.
 	* The storytelling should be engaging, expressive, and creative.
Unique presentation styles are encouraged.
 	* Participants must narrate their stories from memory. Reading
directly from a script is not allowed.

their scheduled slot.

Dear All,

We are delighted to inform you about â€œ*Youth* àª¸àª‚àªµàª¾àª¦â€ an event dedicated to
awakening young minds, organized by Maa Shakti Charitable Trust, Nadiad.
This is a wonderful opportunity for staff and students to gain insights,
engage with thought leaders, and be part of an enriching experience.


To participate, please *click here* <https://forms.gle/FZidw9iVKRKuSwRQA> and
register yourself.

We request *all principals to circulate this information among your
students and encourage them to register before 19th February 2025.* Based

distribution among registered participants.

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - Indian Knowledge System - Story Narrating Competition - Invitation for students to participate
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Interested students can apply. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Feb 14, 2025 at 3:50 PM Subject:
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Interested students can apply.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 14, 2025 at 3:50â€¯PM
Subject: CHARUSAT - Indian Knowledge System - Story Narrating Competition -
Invitation for students to participate
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are thrilled to invite all the students of CHARUSAT to participate in
the upcoming *Storytelling Competition*, an event designed to celebrate the
power of storytelling and creativity. This is their chance to bring stories
to life through compelling narration, expressive delivery, and engaging
presentation.

Whether they have a story to tell or wish to experience the magic of
storytelling, this competition is an excellent platform to showcase talent
and captivate the audience.

ğŸ“… *Date:* February 21, 2025 (Friday)

ğŸ“ *Venue:* Will be communicated to registered students

All the details regarding rules, judging criteria, and registration are
provided in the *attached brochure*. Kindly go through it, share it with
your students and inform the interested students to register by February
20, 2025.

Students should not miss this wonderful opportunity to refine their
storytelling skills and gain recognition for their talent.

We look forward to an exciting and inspiring event!

For any queries, feel free to reach out to *Dr. Kinjal Bhatia (+91
9033395935). *

Thanking you in anticipation of your positive response,

With regards,

Binit Patel
Bhaskar Pandya


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Certification Course on "Internet of Vehicles (IoV): 5G and Beyond Autonomous and Connected Cars"
snippet: Dear Students, Short Description of the course. About the course : This certification course explores both fundamental and advanced concepts of the Internet of Vehicles (IoV) with a focus on 5G
content:
Dear Students,

Short Description of the course.

*About the course :* This certification course explores both fundamental
and advanced concepts of the Internet of Vehicles (IoV) with a focus on 5G
technology and its applications in autonomous and connected cars. The
course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of IoV integration
with modern vehicular technology, enhancing connectivity, safety, and
efficiency.

*Course Objective :* The course is focused on the professional sectors like
Embedded, Cyber security, Network Analysis with the interdisciplinary
branch of Data science and Data Analysis. This course provides the
implementation of 5G technology on intelligent transportation systems. We
will generate the data, analyse it, and create an algorithm to estimate
traffic patterns, behaviours, alongwith the networking capabilities of 5G.
We will have major modules like Software, Sensing and Hardware. Later on we
targeted the capstone project.

Interested candidates can register using the link or QR code provided in
the course brochure (Attached with this email). Please find the course
brochure in the attachment for syllabus, Industry Collaborators and other
details.

Registration Form: https://forms.gle/LDVQeHW4HJ55uNp66

Course registration Fees : 499/- only.

Note :  We have received sufficient registrations. The registration is open
for deserving and qualified candidates in Mathematics, Programming, Data
Science, and Data Analysis.

            Master Students can join the course, understand the
prerequisite and extend their dissertation on this topic.

Course Start Date : 15th FEB 2025, Venue and Time will convey to registered
candidate through email today evening,



-- 
*With Warm Regard...**..*
*Dr. D.Chauhan*
*Ph.D Wireless Communication*
*Associate Professor*
*Coordinator-Career Development and Placement Cell*
*Member of University-Industry Interaction Cell*
*Electronics and Communication Engineering*
*Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
Accredited *GRADE A+* by NAAC
*Mobile No : 09909454907*

--

snippet: Notification settings 4IT IT264 FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPMENT New material Lab 2 Advanced JavaScript Concepts for MERN Topics to Cover Asynchronous programming: Promises and async/await. Error handling (
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
4IT IT264 FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPMENT  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMyODYxMTgwOTQw&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
New material

Lab 2
Advanced JavaScript Concepts for MERN

    -
    Topics to Cover
    - Asynchronous programming: Promises and async/await.
    - Error handling (try...catch).
    - JavaScript modules (export, import).
    - Using JavaScript Date and Math objects.

Project: Task Reminder System
Objective: Build a task reminder system that schedules reminders and  
handles asynchronous delays.
Tasks

    - Create an array of task objects, where each task has fields like  
title, dueTime (in minutes from now), and priority.
    - Write functions to:
    - Add a new task to the list.
    - Sort tasks by their priority.
    - Display tasks due within a certain timeframe (e.g., next 10 minutes).
    - Simulate sending reminders using setTimeout() based on the task's  
dueTime.

Use try...catch to handle errors, such as invalid task data or missing  
fields.Export and import the task management functions using Jav aScript  
modules.
Ref.  
Linkshttps://medium.com/@ravipatel.it/asynchronous-programming-promises-async-await-in-javascript-ba-13714a289591https://medium.com/@ravipatel.it/javascript-modules-for-beginners-7eb53ab455cehttps://khadkagopal.medium.com/exploring-the-math-and-date-objects-in-javascript-a-comprehensive-guide-0c32392a3678https://medium.com/@dilarauluturhan/javascript-error-handling-try-catch-throw-finally-de5d26f16790

New material

Lab 3
Introduction to Node.js and Basic Module

Topics to Cover:

    - What is Node.js?
    - Installing Node.js.
    - Using the Node.js REPL.
    - Core modules (fs, path, os).
    - Writing and running a simple script.

Project: System Utility Dashboard

    - Objective: Create a command-line tool that provides system information.
    - Tasks:
    - Use the os module to display the OS type, total memory, free memory,  
and CPU details.
    - Use the fs module to save the system information to a log file.
    - Use the path module to ensure the file is saved in a standardized  
format (logs/system-info.txt).

subject: Re: Guidelines for Project Presentation -1 â€“ SGP (4th Semester) Scheduled on 14/02/2025
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Please find the attached sheet that includes the location and time for the presentation. Additionally, the rubrics are also provided in word file. On Tue, Feb 11
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Please find the attached sheet that includes the location and time for the
presentation. Additionally, the rubrics are also provided in word file.

On Tue, Feb 11, 2025 at 12:56â€¯PM Ritika Jani <ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear Students,
> Greetings for the day!!!
>
>
> Kindly read the guidelines carefully.
> *Presentation Date:* 14/02/2025, Friday from 09:10 AM onwards*Important
> Notes:*
>
>    - Along with the presentation, *regular lectures and labs will
>    continue* as scheduled.
>    - Students must *attend their classes* and only proceed for the
>    presentation *when their turn arrives*.
>    - *Group distribution**, location, and timing will be shared soon*.
>
> *Preparation Guidelines:**1. Presentation Structure*
>
> Ensure your presentation follows a logical sequence:
>
>    - *Title & Concept Clarity:* Clearly state your project title and
>    concept. Make sure it aligns with the project objectives.
>    - *Problem Statement & Objectives:* Define the problem your project
>    addresses and its goals.
>    - *Requirements Analysis:* Clearly specify both functional and
>    non-functional requirements.
>    - *Innovation & Use of Emerging Technologies:* Highlight unique
>    aspects of your project and its use of modern technologies.
>    - *Implementation & Feasibility:* Explain how your project is
>    developed, its feasibility, and its impact.
>    - *Demonstration & Results:* Provide a working demonstration or
>    prototype if applicable.
>    - *Progress & Future Scope:* Summarize key takeaways and potential
>    future enhancements.
>
> *2. Presentation Format*
>
>    - *Time Limit:* Keep your presentation concise and within the allotted
>    time. (20 Minutes per group)
>    - *Slide Design:* Use professional, clear, and visually appealing
>    slides. Avoid excessive text.
>    - *Visual Aids:* Include diagrams, graphs, and visuals to enhance
>    understanding.
>
> *3. Teamwork & Collaboration*
>
>    - All team members should contribute to the presentation.
>    - Assign roles in advance to ensure smooth delivery.
>    - Be prepared to answer questions from the panel.
>
> *4. Evaluation Criteria*
>
> Your presentation will be assessed based on the following:
>
>    - Clarity & Relevance of Title/Concept
>    - Completeness of Functional & Non-Functional Requirements
>    - Originality & Innovation
>    - Use of Emerging Technologies
>    - Impact, Feasibility & Prioritization
>    - Teamwork, Collaboration & Presentation Skills
>
> Refer to the *SGP Comprehensive Evaluation Rubric* for detailed scoring
> criteria.
> *5. Presentation Etiquette*
>
>    - Dress in formal or business casual attire.
>    - Speak clearly and confidently.
>    - Maintain eye contact.
>    - Manage your time effectively to cover all points.
>    - Medium of Communication should be in English only.
>
>
>    - *Rehearse your presentation* multiple times to ensure a smooth
>    delivery.
>    - *Arrive on time* and be ready before your slot.
>    - *Ensure all necessary materials (slides, SRS document files, etc.)
>    are prepared* and available.
>
> Best of luck with your presentations! ğŸš€
>
> --
> *Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
> Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
> Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
> Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
> Mo. +91 99987 71587
>
>
> *            Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC, GOI*
>
>
> --
> *Thanks and Regards,*
> *RITIKA JANI.*
> *Assistant Professor.*
> *Department of Information Technology,*
>
> *Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
> *CHARUSAT, Changa.*
>
> *"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*
>


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

February 2025











Your career â€” decoded

lean on. This month is all about forming your own game plan to reach your 
career goals â€” with a little help, of course. From tips to stay accountable to 
intentions you set earlier this year to events that share big ideas from our 
own community to an all-new challenge that will help you crack the code to your 
career growth, see how you can make the most of your learning experience.

subject: Certification Course on "Internet of Vehicles (IoV): 5G and Beyond Autonomous and Connected Cars"
snippet: Dear All, Greetings! Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology and Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications, constituent institutes of Charotar University of Science and
content:
Dear All,

Greetings!

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology and Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai
Patel Institute of Computer Applications, constituent institutes of
Charotar University of Science and Technology, are pleased to jointly
announce a certification course on *"Internet of Vehicles (IoV): 5G and
Beyond Autonomous and Connected Cars."*

This certification course explores both fundamental and advanced concepts
of the *Internet of Vehicles (IoV)* with a focus on *5G technology* and its
applications in *autonomous and connected cars*. The course aims to provide
a *comprehensive understanding* of IoV integration with modern vehicular
technology, enhancing *connectivity, safety, and efficiency*.

Interested candidates can register using the link or QR code provided in
the course brochure. Please find the course brochure in the attachment for
syllabus, Industry Collaborators and other details.

Registration Form: https://forms.gle/LDVQeHW4HJ55uNp66

Last date for the registration is February 15, 2025.

For any query Please contact Dr. Dharmendra V. Chauhan (M : 9909454907,
Email : dharmendrachauhan.ec@charusat.ac.in)

*Course highlights:*

Eligibility: CHARUSAT Students

Course Delivery mode: Offline

Start Date: Communicated to the registered students

We look forward to your participation.

-- 
*With Warm Regard...**..*
*Dr. D.Chauhan*
*Ph.D Wireless Communication*
*Associate Professor*
*Coordinator-Career Development and Placement Cell*
*Member of University-Industry Interaction Cell*
*Electronics and Communication Engineering*
*Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
Accredited *GRADE A+* by NAAC
*Mobile No : 09909454907*

--
