Dear Sir/Madam,
Greetings from AICTE!!

          We are glad to share with you that the Ministry of Education
launched the National Educational Alliance for Technology (NEAT) scheme to
bring the best technological solutions developed by Ed-Tech Companies in
education technology to enhance youth employability. These solutions use
Artificial Intelligence for personalized and customized learning
experiences for better learning outcomes and skill development in niche
areas. This scheme is also offering these courses/solutions free of cost to
economically and socially weaker sections of students as per policy.

          We are herewith to inform you that *a webinar on awareness of
NEAT scheme and its on-boarded courses is scheduled on 13th February 2025
from 3:00 PM onwards *for more awareness among the all stakeholders.

Webinar is as per below given schedule:

*Keynote Speakers:*

Prof. T. G. Sitharam, Honâ€™ble Chairman, AICTE

Prof. Anil D. Sahasrabudhe, Honâ€™ble Chairman, NETF

Dr. Buddha Chandrasekhar, Chief Coordinating Officer, AICTE

*Ed-Tech Partners: *

EDZ ONE International Private Limited, The Art of Living, Futureminds and
New edtech Skills Pvt Limited

*Date: *13th February 2025, Thursday

*Major Themes of the Courses/Products: *

School education courses, Professional and personal skill development and
Courses on computer science.

We request you to join the session and also circulate among all the
students /faculty/ learners of your institute as well as to your network.
The link to join the webinar is given below:

NEAT 4.0 - NEAT awareness program for on-boarded Courses

Dear [Training and Placement Officer],

With *30,000+ job opportunities* from top companies like *Google, KPMG,
Amazon, EY, and Deloitte,* your students have an incredible chance to
secure an HR interview at their dream companyâ€”and we need your support to
help them seize this opportunity!


*Introducing Dream Job Challenge 2025*
Apna is giving students the platform to showcase their passion and land
interviews at their dream workplaces. They simply need to tell us why they
deserve to work there, and if they stand out, Apna will go the extra mile
to help them succeed.

subject: Guidelines for Project Presentation -1 â€“ SGP (4th Semester) Scheduled on 14/02/2025
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Kindly read the guidelines carefully. Presentation Date: 14/02/2025, Friday from 09:10 AM onwards Important Notes: Along with the presentation, regular lectures
content:
Dear Students,
Greetings for the day!!!


Kindly read the guidelines carefully.
*Presentation Date:* 14/02/2025, Friday from 09:10 AM onwards*Important
Notes:*

   - Along with the presentation, *regular lectures and labs will continue*
   as scheduled.
   - Students must *attend their classes* and only proceed for the
   presentation *when their turn arrives*.
   - *Group distribution**, location, and timing will be shared soon*.

*Preparation Guidelines:**1. Presentation Structure*

Ensure your presentation follows a logical sequence:

   - *Title & Concept Clarity:* Clearly state your project title and
   concept. Make sure it aligns with the project objectives.
   - *Problem Statement & Objectives:* Define the problem your project
   addresses and its goals.
   - *Requirements Analysis:* Clearly specify both functional and
   non-functional requirements.
   - *Innovation & Use of Emerging Technologies:* Highlight unique aspects
   of your project and its use of modern technologies.
   - *Implementation & Feasibility:* Explain how your project is developed,
   its feasibility, and its impact.
   - *Demonstration & Results:* Provide a working demonstration or
   prototype if applicable.
   - *Progress & Future Scope:* Summarize key takeaways and potential
   future enhancements.

*2. Presentation Format*

   - *Time Limit:* Keep your presentation concise and within the allotted
   time. (20 Minutes per group)
   - *Slide Design:* Use professional, clear, and visually appealing
   slides. Avoid excessive text.
   - *Visual Aids:* Include diagrams, graphs, and visuals to enhance
   understanding.

*3. Teamwork & Collaboration*

   - All team members should contribute to the presentation.
   - Assign roles in advance to ensure smooth delivery.
   - Be prepared to answer questions from the panel.

*4. Evaluation Criteria*

Your presentation will be assessed based on the following:

   - Clarity & Relevance of Title/Concept
   - Completeness of Functional & Non-Functional Requirements
   - Originality & Innovation
   - Use of Emerging Technologies
   - Impact, Feasibility & Prioritization
   - Teamwork, Collaboration & Presentation Skills

Refer to the *SGP Comprehensive Evaluation Rubric* for detailed scoring
criteria.
*5. Presentation Etiquette*

   - Dress in formal or business casual attire.
   - Speak clearly and confidently.
   - Maintain eye contact.
   - Manage your time effectively to cover all points.
   - Medium of Communication should be in English only.


   - *Rehearse your presentation* multiple times to ensure a smooth
   delivery.
   - *Arrive on time* and be ready before your slot.
   - *Ensure all necessary materials (slides, SRS document files, etc.) are
   prepared* and available.

Best of luck with your presentations! ğŸš€

-- 
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,

Mo. +91 99987 71587

snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 11, 2025 at 9:25â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: URGENT: Call for Participation - National Summit on Cyber
Warfare & OSINT Hackathon 2025
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 10, 2025 at 6:51â€¯PM
Subject: URGENT: Call for Participation - National Summit on Cyber Warfare
& OSINT Hackathon 2025
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/10-Feb/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear Directors/Vice Chancellors,

AICTE is proud to partner with UPSIFS and Cybervidyapeeth Foundation for
India's First Summit on Dimensions of Cyber Warfare, scheduled for March
16-21, 2025, in Lucknow. This initiative represents a critical step in
strengthening our nation's cyber defense capabilities.

The summit features two flagship events:

   1. *Call for Papers (March 17-18)*


   - Focus areas: Cognitive warfare, deepfake detection, OSINT,
   cryptocurrency investigation
   - Selected papers receive Ministry of Defense recognition
   - Publication opportunities in leading journals
   - Cash prizes up to INR 75,000 per category


   1. *OSINT Hackathon (March 16-18)*


   - 72-hour intensive development
   - Team size: 5 members
   - Focus on practical tool development
   - Cash prizes up to INR 125,000
   - Industry internship opportunities

This summit aligns with AICTE's commitment to fostering innovation in
cybersecurity education and research. The participation of your
institution's faculty and students is crucial for its success.

I strongly urge you to:

   - Share this information with all departments
   - Encourage faculty and student participation
   - Facilitate team formation for the hackathon
   - Support research paper submissions

Registration deadline: February 28, 2025 Full details at:
https://cybervedmanthan.in
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=eb7cb23e04aaa5b60e42499adb30f309a09fd6bc&lat=2025&mid=f7360845f9716173bbbd62799f51fb5d532694e8>

Together, let's strengthen India's cyber warfare capabilities.

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gmnpfLXPf2YZc7_tmmyMr6BpcwXx5uVh/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=8635a8daecc36f0dbb0ff1aab31fb3441ba4e42c&lat=2025&mid=f7360845f9716173bbbd62799f51fb5d532694e8>

*Best regards, *
* Dr. Buddha Chandrasekhar *
* Chief Coordinating Officer *
* AICTE, *

subject: Fwd: Certification course on â€œApplied AI: From Data Visualization to Generative Modelsâ€
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Kindly find the details of Applied AI: From Data Visualization to Generative Models. Offered by CMPICA in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message ---------
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Kindly find the details of  *Applied AI: From Data Visualization to
Generative Models. *Offered by CMPICA in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FCA CHARUSAT <dean.fca@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 10, 2025 at 1:19â€¯PM
Subject: Certification course on â€œApplied AI: From Data Visualization to
Generative Modelsâ€
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Family Members,

Greetings of the day!

Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA)
is pleased to announce a certification course on *â€œApplied AI: From Data
Visualization to Generative Models.â€*

This course covers both fundamental and advanced concepts of AI
applications, including AutoML, Power BI, Deep Learning, and a special
focus on Generative AI and its industry applications*.* It is designed
for *Undergraduate
and Postgraduate students, PhD Scholars, Faculty Members, and Working
Professionals* looking to explore this domain and build a career in AI.

The course commences on February 15, 2025 (Saturday), and will be conducted
in a hybrid mode with sessions every Saturday. A detailed syllabus is
available here: Course Details
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/cmpica/files/AI/AnnexureCC.pdf>.

The *brochure* is attached for your reference.

ğŸ”¹ *Registration Link:* Click Here <https://forms.gle/8CckUMRfY2THhrPM9>
ğŸ”¹ *Registration Fee:* â‚¹499/-
ğŸ”¹ *Last Date to Register:* February 14, 2025

We kindly request you to share this information along with the brochure
with your students, faculty members, and colleagues and encourage them to
register.

Looking forward to your support.
Regards,


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*

*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

subject: Fwd: Invite for Maker Fest Vadodara 2025 - 8-9 February
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. R V Upadhyay <rvu.as@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 6, 2025 at 7:46â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Invite for Maker Fest Vadodara 2025 - 8-9 February
To: Teaching Staff <teachingstaff@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: HT Patel <htpatel@yuvalay.org>
Date: Thu, 6 Feb 2025, 07:45
Subject: Invite for Maker Fest Vadodara 2025 - 8-9 February
To: Dr. Narottam Sahoo(GOG-Dept Sci & Tech) <adv-gujcost@gujarat.gov.in>
Cc: Mr. Pavit Bhaveshkumar Shah(GoG-DST Dept.) <so-sp-gujcost@gujarat.gov.in>,
Dr. R V Upadhyay <rvu.as@charusat.ac.in>




Dear Sir,

We are delighted to invite you to the 7th edition of Maker Fest Vadodara on
8th and 9th February 2025 at the Faculty of Technology & Engineering, M S
University, Vadodara.

This yearâ€™s exhibition will feature *70 Maker Teams* (selected from 500
applications) from *seven* categoriesâ€”*Technology, Environment, Education,
Agriculture, Health, Art, and Science*â€”showcasing groundbreaking
innovations such as *Farming Pods, Underwater Drones, AI Robots, Robotic
Finger and Arm, Fire Fighting Vehicles, Herbal Solutions for Insect Bites,
Electrifying Leaf Collecting Machine, Autonomous Electric Tractors, and
incredible creations from scrap and matchsticks.*

*Maker Fest Vadodara* is a platform that fosters innovation, mentorship,
and collaboration, inspiring thousands of creators and visitors each year.
*We look forward to your presence and **request that people from your
esteemed organization should take this valuable opportunity to visit the
Fest on 8th and 9th February and gain insight from the latest innovations
happening around us.*

Maker Fest Vadodara 2025 is organized by Yuvalay E-Lab (Yuvalay Charitable
Trust) and Vadodara Innovation Council, with the co-host as Faculty of
Technology & Engineering, MSU.

Regards,
H T Patel
Yuvalay Charitable Trust
Ashish Bhavsar
Vadodara Innovation Council
www.makerfestvadodara.com

--

subject: Fwd: Reminder: February 12 Talk, "Unlock Hugging Face: Simplify AI with Transformers, LLMs, RAG, Fine-Tuning" with Manning Author Wei-Meng Lee
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Feb 6, 2025 at 10:39â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Reminder: February 12 Talk, "Unlock Hugging Face: Simplify AI
with Transformers, LLMs, RAG, Fine-Tuning" with Manning Author Wei-Meng Lee
To: DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: ACM Learning Center <learning@acm.org>
Date: Thu, 6 Feb, 2025, 10:38â€¯pm
Subject: Reminder: February 12 Talk, "Unlock Hugging Face: Simplify AI with
Transformers, LLMs, RAG, Fine-Tuning" with Manning Author Wei-Meng Lee
To: <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>


ACM TechTalks
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-318c1_0x3372bfx093110>
February 6, 2025
[image: to view image click on]"
*Reminder: February 12 Talk, "Unlock Hugging Face: Simplify AI with
Transformers, LLMs, RAG, Fine-Tuning" with Manning Author Wei-Meng Lee*
*[image: to view image click on]*

If you haven't done so yet, register now
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-318c1_0x343b04x093110> for
the next free ACM TechTalk, "*Unlock Hugging Face: Simplify AI with
Transformers, LLMs, RAG, Fine-Tuning*," presented * on Wednesday, February
12 * at * 12:00 PM ET/17:00 UTC * by *Wei-Meng Lee*, Founder of Developer
Learning Solutions and author of an upcoming Manning Publications book.*
Marlene Mhangami*, Senior Developer Advocate at Microsoft, will moderate
the questions and answers session following the talk.

Leave your comments and questions with our speaker now and any time before
the live event on ACM's Discourse Page
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-318c1_0x343b05x093110>.
And check out the page after the webcast for extended discussion with your
peers in the computing community, as well as further resources on Hugging
Face, LLMs, RAG, and more.

(*If you'd like to attend but can't make it to the virtual event, you still
need to register to receive a recording of the TechTalk when it becomes
available*.)

Hugging Face has transformed the landscape of AI development and deployment
with its robust ecosystem of pre-trained models, innovative libraries, and
versatile tools for natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, and
more.

In this talk, weâ€™ll uncover how Hugging Face simplifies machine learning
workflows, empowering developers and researchers to achieve more with less
effort. You'll discover the power of the Transformers library and
the pipelineobject, and learn how to leverage pre-trained models to perform
tasks such as NLP, image recognition, and more. We'll explore practical
applications like text generation, sentiment analysis, and question
answering.

Additionally, we'll delve into using large language models (LLMs) to answer
questions based on custom datasets through Retrieval-Augmented Generation
(RAG) and learn how to fine-tune pre-trained models for specialized tasks.

Whether you're new to AI or an experienced practitioner seeking to
streamline your workflows, this session will provide actionable insights
and practical guidance to harness the full capabilities of Hugging Face in
your projects.

Duration: 60 minutes (including audience Q&A)

*Presenter: *
*Wei-Meng Lee**, Founder, Developer Learning Solutions*
Wei-Meng Lee is a technologist and founder of Developer Learning Solutions,
a company specializing in helping companies adopt the latest IT
technologies. Wei-Meng provides consultancy services to companies on
adopting blockchain and AI solutions for their businesses. Heâ€™s the author
of the upcoming book, *Hugging Face in Action*.

*Moderator: *
*Marlene Mhangami**, Senior Developer Advocate, Microsoft*
Marlene is a software engineer, explorer, and speaker currently based in
London. She is a Senior Developer Advocate working at Microsoft focusing on
Python and AI. Marlene is a previous director and vice-chair for the Python
Software Foundation and is currently serving as the Vice-Chair of the ACM
Practitioner Board. In 2017, she co-founded ZimboPy, a non-profit
organization that gives Zimbabwean young women access to resources in the
field of technology. She is also the previous chair of PyCon Africa and is
an advocate for women in tech on the continent.

subject: Google Calendar now shows events from Gmail
snippet: Google Calendar now shows events from Gmail Google Calendar can show events such as reservations and flights, that Gmail creates from messages you receive. Your calendar now shows this event from Gmail
content:
Google Calendar now shows events from Gmail



Google Calendar can show events such as reservations and flights, that  
Gmail creates from messages you receive. Your calendar now shows this event  
from Gmail:

Attend IDP's USA Biggest Education Fair | 7 February - IDP Vadodara  
office on Fri Feb 7, 2025 at 12:00pm

Only you can see an event from Gmail unless you change the event's  
visibility. You can also change the default visibility of events from Gmail  
in Calendar settings.

To stop seeing these events in Calendar or change their default visibility,  
go to Events from Gmail in Calendar settings. To stop Gmail from creating  
these events, you must also turn off Smart features and personalization in  
Gmail settings. Learn more at  
https://support.google.com/calendar/?p=events_from_gmail about events from  
Gmail and how to control them.

This is the only notification you’ll get about events from Gmail. In  
the future, Calendar won’t send you an email when Gmail creates a new  
event.

snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*

*Changa, Anand,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean Research <dean.research@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Feb 5, 2025 at 12:43â€¯PM
Subject: Enroll Now: Free Self-Paced E-Course on Patent Practices in
Research for CHARUSAT Members
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear CHARUSAT Family members,*

We are pleased to announce the launch of our *free, self-paced e-course,
"Patent Practices in Research,"* exclusively for CHARUSAT students (UG, PG,
PhD), faculty, and other members. This course is designed to provide a
comprehensive understanding of Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), focusing
on patents with a technical perspective to facilitate easier comprehension
for the research community.

*Course Highlights:*

   - Understand fundamental concepts of Intellectual Property and Patents
   - Learn to identify patentable ideas and non-patentable subject matters
   in India
   - Gain insights into the Indian patent system and processes
   - Hands-on experience in patent search using open-source and commercial
   databases

*How to Enroll:*

   1. *Register for the course (Mandatory):* Click Here
   <https://forms.gle/xrsRLVqjciVWaKSZ9>
   2. *Join the Google Classroom to access course content:* Click Here
   <https://classroom.google.com/c/MzA2NDc3MzE4NzU2?cjc=73dyeph>
   3. *Complete the assessment for certification:* Click Here
   <https://classroom.google.com/c/MzA2NDc3MzE4NzU2/a/MzA2NDgyODI3Mzgy/details>

*Course Enrollment:* Open throughout the year.

We encourage all CHARUSAT members to take advantage of this valuable
opportunity to enhance their knowledge and skills in the domain of patents
and intellectual property rights.

*Circulate this information to the students from your department / college
also.*

For any queries, please feel free to contact us.

Best Regards,
CHARUSAT IPR Cell
*Dean Research*

Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC, GOI

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Off. Nadiad - Petlad Highway, Changa, Gujarat, INDIA 388421
www.charusat.ac.in

Dear Sir/Madam,

Recently, Turnip signed an MoU with AICTE regarding our *16-Day
Entrepreneurship Awareness Program*. Turnip was one of the 22 companies
selected as online education partners.
[image: Turnip signs MoU with AICTE]

With this course, scholars can *master fundamental startup concepts in a
simple and practical manner*. It can be conducted as a MOOC certification,
or any value added activity.

* Register via the Official Course Page *
<http://url5505.turnip.co.in/ls/click?upn=u001.3zvY44KeqgXrGb8wCP618VPaUVVizkWV3-2Bae7lmqk2FA1GglId78OJqbJuBqa0KAHJzYcZdZDqqhXtI7y16DxA-3D-3DpJRr_Ga7Lx8pu544RJnPoLnvD8W4pFiMiH0OCAfIBq4xgpeiOyQmkoVWiAR49-2F-2FLVLNcBdm6eC6N62lPSOc3Utx00GUaoIQ77h15zNMA9q-2FiQCraE-2BNKNgL02l0r0gNwj14O5-2Fh-2BBjloEqdIY0ANL4Bey0d7rD4oVGq0BxcBb-2FN4m2XyzapG2KKLkhQye-2FMZFbAezf84S0jtmQNtVAoO0sZ6t0HnkjKoMjPM6mk-2B9TkIAjP9XVIxqrI9lo2tImBu3vAiYvfU9MB31YUKUtGrJvhIbCdhkyq5qGwLPj9Ypd9Ume0ERfwMMv1Z-2F7FvNSN26q0dh7DNaYFzEx37WOUPJgEyR9CxzZ-2FpHXn1GtJsNOwZggW0-3D>

*Course features*

âœ…  Duration: 16 days (online, self-paced)
âœ…  Reduced fee (28th Feb): *â‚¹295/-* (incl. quiz and certificate)
âœ…  *Upgraded AICTE Evaluated Certificate* with quiz score, institute name
and designation
âœ…  Includes course ebook and 100+ startup resources
âœ…  Starts immediately after registration and email verification

*Course lessons*

   - Key entrepreneurial traits
   - Why start a startup?
   - How to find startup ideas?
   - Validating startup ideas
   - Total Addressable Market (TAM)
   - Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
   - The Sales Funnel
   - AIDA Model
   - Digital Marketing Funnel
   - Go-to-market (GTM)
   - Product-Market Fit (PMF)
   - Team building
   - Fund raising
   - Forming a company in India
   - Bonus lesson and startup resources

*Course author*

The course is created by *Dr. Rahul Kapoor*, Founder and Director of Turnip
Innovations. He has a successful startup exit within B2B SaaS. He is a
Professor of Entrepreneurship and runs a Section 8 non-profit company as an
incubation center at IMI Kolkata.

*Please share the program details with all students, faculty and innovation
stakeholders*.

Thanks and regards,

content:
Protecting Civilization: Cybersecurity Critical Infrastructure
Industrial control systems for operational technology security...Â now there's a mouthful! But it's such a critical field within the realm of cybersecurity, it makes sense. And fortunately for you, we've got the right person to walk you through all the knowledge you need to explore a future in cybersecurity, helping to keep critical infrastructures protected.

subject: Fwd: US University Graduate Education Fair - @CHARUSAT on 4th FEB 2025
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Head CDPC CHARUSAT <head.cdpc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 11:04â€¯AM
Subject: US University Graduate Education Fair - @CHARUSAT on 4th FEB 2025
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>



<https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=5952a72cec&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-a:r-4577378780472427793&view=att&disp=safe&realattid=f_m6okuwz10&zw>Dear
All,
Greetings from Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)!!

We invite you to explore the U.S. University Education Fair at our Campus. This
in-person fair is your chance to interact with 15+ reputed and accredited
U.S. Universities, offering a wide array of graduate programs (Masterâ€™s,
Ph.D. programs).

*Fair details: *

*Date : Tuesday, February 04, 2025*

*Time :  10.00 - 12.30 noon*

*Venue : Center Square , **IIIM BUILDING, Charusat University campus,
Changa*


Registration Required:

https://forms.gle/AvMb5rh1WNjKVhq9A


Fairs are an opportunity for you to connect with U.S. higher education
institutions to learn more about study options in the United States.

*Meet the Officials from 14 U.S. Universities :*

   - Governors State University
   - Lewis University
   - Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences [ MCPHS ]
   - Northeastern University
   - San Jose State University
   - The Catholic University of America
   - University of Louisville, College of Business
   - University of Massachusetts Lowell
   - University of Nebraska Lincoln
   - University of Southern California Marshall School of Business
   - University of Wisconsin Milwaukee
   - Wayne State University
   - Worcester Polytechnic Institute
   - ETS INDIA Testing Body [ TOEFL / GRE ]
   - Indo American Education Society


*STUDENT - TO DO LIST BEFORE THE FAIR:*


   1. Research participating Institutes before arriving at the fair event.
   2. Make a list of priority Institutes that you would like to visit
   followed by secondary interests.
   3. Visit booths in that order to ensure you have enough time!
   4. Create a list of questions you would like to ask university
   representatives that are not easily found on the Institute websites.
   5. After visiting a fair booth, write a few notes about your discussion.
   This will help you to remember individual conversations before visiting the
   next booth.
   6. You may also reach out to the Indo American Education Society for any
   guidance & information related to Higher Education in the US.
   7. Visit Institutes not already on your personal interest list time
   permitting. You might be surprised to identify new institutes that are not
   on your radar!

Highlights of the fair:

   -

   Chat one-to-one with U.S. university representatives and get your
   questions answered on programs, application processes and financial aid at
   these universities.
   -

   Collect the latest brochures and course descriptions of universities at
   your convenience during the fair.
   -

   Interact with Indo American Education Society advisers, A Trusted Non
   Profit advising center that provides accurate, current, comprehensive and
   unbiased information on the U.S. university application process.
   -

   Meet with testing organizations and discuss the latest updates on
   testing.



*Registration is done through the below link:*

https://forms.gle/AvMb5rh1WNjKVhq9A


[image: CHARUSAT_USA_Uni_Fair.jpg]


*Prof. Ashwin Makwana, *
Head, *Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*, CHARUSAT
Charotar University of Science & Technology, AT: Changa,
Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat.
02697-265213/265123, (M)9408151969

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Workshop Series: Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Grab the opportunity for learning Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications. More details are in the trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Grab the opportunity for learning  *Introduction to Quantum Computing:
Fundamentals and Applications. *More details are in the trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dipak Ramoliya <dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 1:53â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to Workshop Series: Introduction to Quantum Computing:
Fundamentals and Applications
To: <21dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <22dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <
23dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <24dcse@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>, Nilesh Dubey <nileshdubey.ce@charusat.ac.in>,
Bhavika Patel <bhavikapatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Ritika Jani <
ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar_CSE <depstar_cse@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

We are pleased to invite you to an exciting *workshop series on
"Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications"* organized
by the *Department of Computer Science & Engineering, **Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), Charotar** University
of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT).*
*Workshop Details:*

ğŸ“… *Date:* 7th February 2025
â° *Time:* 12:10 PM â€“ 02:00 PM
ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« *Speaker:* Dr. Nilesh Dubey, Assistant Professor, Department of
Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR, CHARUSAT
*Objective:*

This workshop aims to provide undergraduate students with a *comprehensive
introduction to quantum computing*, covering its fundamental principles and
real-world applications.

ğŸ“Œ *Register now* and donâ€™t miss out on this knowledge-packed session!

https://forms.gle/nff8JdvX13CDkpLFA
*Agenda:**Module 1: Introduction to Quantum Computing*

ğŸ”¹ What is Quantum Computing?
ğŸ”¹ History and Evolution
ğŸ”¹ Classical vs. Quantum Computing
ğŸ”¹ Importance and Impact
*Module 2: Quantum Mechanics Basics*

ğŸ”¹ Wave-Particle Duality
ğŸ”¹ Superposition
ğŸ”¹ Entanglement
ğŸ”¹ Measurement and Observation
*Module 3: Quantum Computing Concepts*

ğŸ”¹ Qubits and Quantum Gates
ğŸ”¹ Quantum Circuits and Algorithms
*Module 4: Quantum Computing Applications*

ğŸ”¹ Cryptography and Security
ğŸ”¹ Optimization and Simulation
ğŸ”¹ Machine Learning and AI

This is a great opportunity to *gain insights into the future of computing
and explore potential research and career opportunities in this field.*

Looking forward to your participation!
[image: Endowment.png]

--
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
Mo. +91 99987 71587


*            Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC, GOI*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Opportunity to Join Blockchain Discussion on Bharat Blockchain Network
snippet: Dear Students, I hope you are doing well. We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging Blockchain Discussion hosted on the Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community. This is a great
content:
Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well.

We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging *Blockchain
Discussion* hosted on the *Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community*.
This is a great opportunity for blockchain enthusiasts to expand their
knowledge, interact with like-minded individuals, and showcase their
expertise.
*Discussion Details:*

   - *Format:* A structured discussion (not a formal debate) on a relevant
   blockchain topic.
   - *Topic:* Will be shared upon confirmation of participation.
   - *Preparation Time:* 3 days after topic announcement.
   - *Team Requirement:* 2 teams of at least 4 members each.
   - *Prizes:* Exciting rewards for outstanding contributions!

*Why Participate?*

   - Gain insights into the latest blockchain trends.
   - Engage in meaningful discussions with industry professionals.
   - Enhance your knowledge and critical thinking skills in blockchain
   technology.
   - A chance to win prizes for demonstrating exceptional understanding and
   ideas.

*How to Confirm Your Participation?*

To confirm your participation, please *reply to this email* with your team
details, including:

   - *Team Member Names*
   - *ID Numbers*
   - *Contact Numbers*

We look forward to your participation and an insightful discussion!

Best Regards,

*Shrey Lakhtaria**Dhairya Kanabar*
*Campus Ambassador, IDS/BBN*

-- 


Shrey Lakhtaria

Computer Science Engineering, CSPIT.

<https://github.com/shreylakhtaria>
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/shrey-lakhataria/>
<https://www.instagram.com/shrey7120/>

From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 9:19â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: 3030 Eklavya Weekly Online STEM Program- IIT Gandhinagar
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org>
Date: Fri, Jan 31, 2025 at 10:33â€¯PM
Subject: 3030 Eklavya Weekly Online STEM Program- IIT Gandhinagar
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


* Respected Madam/Sir, *

* IIT Gandhinagar *  is starting  * 3030 Eklavya, an online STEM program *
 to enhance Conceptual understanding and develop out-of-Box thinking among
students and faculty. The program is free to watch though the certification
has a nominal cost. The aim is to Demystify NEP and showcase effective
implementation of NEP 2020 across the schools.

The 1st Episode was published,  Computing with Soap
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=AlcBBgkfAhlRAVFN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D3030%2BEklavya%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoURBQfQA1DEEBTBhxQDQsdWVxDBkwjCkxiRy04ST5DQg==&ext=c2k9ZDdueWJWYlRBdVdFQThBVw==>
, received  * 75K total views, 10K homework/project submissio * n and the  *
average watch time *  was  * 19 minutes * . The session demonstrates
solving computational problems - optimum metro-rail network; Fastest
descent problem posed by Galileo, analysed by Newton, Fermat  - Calculus of
Variations, Numerical Methods; Optimization and nature of the universe;
Cell structures & divisions using bubbles.

Next Episode: CCC - Cool & Confusing Clocks  https://tinyurl.com/eklavyaep2
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=AlcBBgkfAhlRAVBN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D3030%2BEklavya%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoXWg1ITBBaSlZeDh1WCQpTQ0xUBhNQ&ext=>

* CBSE & CCL IIT Gandhinagar *  are proud to bring the 3030 Eklavya Online
program for teachers / students to:

   - Promote critical thinking, and creative  * problem-solving in
   teachers/students * .
   - Make Science/Math engaging/inspiring with  * numerous hands-on STEM
   activities * ,  * questions and assignments * .
   - Enhance conceptual understanding of  * difficult topics in STEM *

* Next Episode * :  * 2nd Feb, Sunday 4 PM : *   https://tinyurl.com/eklavyaep2
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=AlcBBgkfAhlRAVBN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D3030%2BEklavya%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoXWg1ITBBaSlZeDh1WCQpTQ0xUBhNQ&ext=>


  * The History of Time and Clocks *

The program session demonstrates how Ahmedabadâ€™s metro network design -
optimum route & 300 year old problem of sliding in the fastest time, will
be solved by soap !! Also, understanding cell divisions and structures
using bubbles, DIY projects like making your own soap, recipe of giant
bubbles etc. Looking at curriculum topic in a different perspective,
Geometry - using a conic section through a shadow of a stick and measuring
earthâ€™s radius, Numbers & Patterns - multiplication table of 2 and
light-reflection pattern in a coffee mug, the path of a ship and a straight
line on earth, Algebra - finding time in a confusing clock with both hands
identical.

 The details of joining the program are given below.

Program

* 3030 Eklavya *

Time

* Live Every Sunday 4- 4:45 PM,   *

* Next Episode (2nd Feb 2025, Sunday) *

Organizer

* CBSE and CCL IIT Gandhinagar *

To Watch,

& Certification

<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=AlcBBgkfAhlRAVdN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D3030%2BEklavya%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoGWA9QTxtXSlxYF1VSDAJaXFtUBAIQFwBRGQsPHA==&ext=>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 9:17â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation | Grant Support
By IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Jan 31, 2025 at 5:21â€¯PM
Subject: DISHA Program for Transformative Innovation | Grant Support By
IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore
To: Principal Depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Dr. Amit Nayak

Greetings from IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore !!

We are excited to invite you and your esteemed institution/organization to
participate in the DISHA (Developing Innovations for Successful Harnessing
and Adoption) program, spearheaded by the
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>. This program is an
exceptional opportunity for faculty and student-led startups to bring
groundbreaking innovations to life, transforming ideas into commercially
viable solutions.

About DISHA:
The DISHA program aims to identify, fund, and mentor deep-tech innovations,
facilitating their journey toward commercialization. It focuses on
Cyber-Physical
Systems (CPS) in critical areas such as Digital Healthcare, Intelligent
Manufacturing, and related domains, emphasizing System Modelling,
Simulation, and Visualization.

Who Can Apply:

   -

   Open to faculty, researchers, and students from higher education
   institutes across India who wish to commercialize their technology
by creating
   spinoff startups.
   -

   Faculty, researchers, and students with market-ready products or
   technologies aimed at commercialization.
   -

   Startups already incorporated as Private Limited/LLP by eligible faculty
   and/or researchers and/or students.
   -

   Existing Startups having strong academic link/willing to collaborate
   with academics for technology upgradation/willing to take IP developed
   in academia to the market through their startup.

Program Highlights:

   -

   Financial support of up to INR â‚¹50L initially, with additional funding based
   on progress up to INR â‚¹50L.
   -

   Comprehensive mentorship in technology and business development.
   -

   Assistance with IP filing, startup registration, and commercialization
   strategies.
   -

   Host institutions will receive grants from the IITI DRISHTI CPS
   Foundation to support startups and research initiatives at their respective
   institutions.
   -

   Access to entrepreneurial resources, including tools and credits for
   early-stage development.

Why Participate?
This initiative provides a unique platform to:

   -

   Bridge the gap between academia and industry.
   -

   Accelerate innovation to market-ready solutions.
   -

   Establish a network with experts, investors, and peers.

We firmly believe your institutionâ€™s or organizationâ€™s expertise and
innovative projects can significantly contribute to and benefit from this
initiative.

For more details on eligibility and application procedures, please refer to
the program guidelines attached here.

The application deadline is 9th February 2025, and we encourage you to
submit your proposals at your earliest convenience.

Link for Application: *Click Here
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/technology-development/disha/>*

We look forward to your participation in shaping the future of innovation
and fostering impactful collaborations.

Note:

   1.

   Guidelines, FAQs and Program Brochure are attached for your reference in
   this email.


*Regards,*

Rekha Ganeshkar

IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation


*E:* *tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>*

*M:*  +919303854671

*W:* drishticps.iiti.ac.in

*A:* IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore

Simrol, Indore, 453552, Madhya Pradesh


<https://www.linkedin.com/company/iiti-drishti-cps-foundation-iit-indore/>
<https://www.facebook.com/DrishtiCPS/>

Subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunities for Students at Profcess External
Inbox TPO REVERT
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: business support <business.support@profcess.org>
Date: Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 11:13â€¯AM
Subject: Internship Opportunities for Students at Profcess External Inbox
TPO REVERT
To:


  Dear Training and Placement Officer,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing on behalf of Profcess to introduce our internship program and
explore the possibility of collaborating with your esteemed institution. We
are currently offering internships for students in the following domains:

- Product Management
- Human Resources
- Data Science (Real-Based Projects)
- UI/UX Design
- Social Media/Digital Marketing/Content Creation
- Software Development (Frontend & Backend)

At Profcess, we understand the importance of balancing academic commitments
with practical experience. Our internships are designed to be flexible,
ensuring that students' studies are not disrupted. Specifically for
technical domains, students can invest time according to their schedules.
Additionally, we offer leaves following examination timetables, allowing
students to focus on their academic responsibilities during those periods.

The internship duration is typically 2-3 months, providing ample time for
students to gain hands-on experience, practical knowledge in their chosen
field, and an understanding of management environments. If required, we can
also provide detailed descriptions for each domain.

We would be delighted to discuss this opportunity further and understand
the next steps from your side. Our HR Manager, Karnika Shrivastava, is here
to help you with any other information you may need.

Looking forward to your positive response.

Warm regards,
Karnika Shrivastava
HR Manager, Profcess
Email: business.support@profcess.org
Phone: +91 74704 72725

--

subject: GLORY OF DEPSTAR IT - SPOUTAL 25
snippet: ï»¿ Dear all, It gives me immense pleasure to share that students of our department have brought glory by winning prizes in 5 events (onstage + Sports) of SPOURAL 2025. I would like to congratulate the
content:
Dear all,

It gives me immense pleasure to share that students of our department have brought glory by winning prizes in 5 events (onstage + Sports) of SPOURAL 2025. I would like to congratulate the winners and Runner up.

ğŸ–ï¸DEPSTAR-IT Trophies:ğŸ†ğŸ¥

Cultural trophies:

1. Mahendi  - WINNER 
2. Photography - RUNNERS UP 

Sports trophies:

1. VollyBall Girls - RUNNER UP
2. Table Tennis Boys -  WINNER 
3. Chess boys - RUNNER UP 

Sports trophies of DEPSTAR faculties

1. TUG OF WAR- FEMALE - CHAMPIONS
2. BADMINTON  - FEMALE- RUNNERS UP


We, the DEPSTAR-IT family also would like to appreciate the efforts of all the students who have participated in various events of SPOURAL - 2025

Last but not the least, our student central council members , ULSC & DLSC members and other volunteer students who have worked really hard to make this event successful. 

I also thank the faculty co-ordinators and student coordinators of the various events.

"Positive attitude can help to achieve anything you want", and our dear students have proved this!! 

From the very first day of the event practice, all the participants have shown their spirit to win and they really did it!!

â€œSOMETIMES WE WIN AND SOMETIMES WE LEARNâ€ 
Stay Motivated and Enthusiastic in future too !!ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥

#ROCKINGSTARS_OF_DEPSTAR
Sent from my iPhone
--

subject: Replit Product Updates: Agent & Assistant, integrations, improvements, and more!
snippet: The good news: 2025 is off to an excellent start. The great news: there has never been a better time to build and there's never been a better place than on Replit. Friday, January 31, 2025 Matt
content:
The good news: 2025 is off to an excellent start. The great news: there has 
never been a better time to build and there's never been a better place than on 
Replit.



 <https://replit.com>



Friday, January 31, 2025


Matt here,

 âœˆï¸ 2025 is flying by. The great news: there has  never been a better time to 
be a builder or a better place to build than Replit (ok, I'm biased).

Our January updates include Agent & Assistant improvements, integrations, a 
better builder experience, Teams updates, performance optimizations, tech 
talks, & more!




ğŸ‰ Agent & Assistant Improvements


Agent


 To start, you'll notice shorter build times and faster responses from Agent. 
We've been hard at work on performance and reliability updates.

We've also added new integrations:

â€¢ xAI: Build AI-powered apps with Grok. 

â€¢ SendGrid: Add email to your apps with SendGrid.

â€¢ Slack: Build apps that can read from and write to your Slack workspace. 
Walkthrough videohere! <https://youtu.be/wDWlkVfTo_A>



Assistant


 Assistant now integrates with Workflows for app configuration. If you haven't 
tried outWorkflows <https://docs.replit.com/replit-workspace/workflows>, 
they're a seriously powerful way to configure your Replit Apps.



 You can also execute shell commands directly from the Assistant pane, now 
with added warnings to make sure you don't run any destructive commands.



ğŸ’ª Builder Experience


We're continuously working to make the experience of building on Replit 
faster, simpler, and as efficient as possible.

 â€¢ Easy GitHub import: Put "replit.com/" in front of any GitHub URL to import 
it.



â€¢ More beautiful apps: React is now the default for frontend projects.

 â€¢ Faster Flask: 40x performance boost for Flask deployments.

â€¢ Zippier zips: Faster and more reliable zip exports of your apps.

â€¢ Smooth autoscale: We've optimized autoscale deployments for speed and 
reliability.

 â€¢ Optimized Databases: Databases have been further optimized for cost 
efficiency and performance.


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨ Teams & Organizations


Teams users, we hear youâ€”lots of new Teams functionality dropped in January. 

 â€¢ Featured projects: Enhanced project "featuring" controls and customizations.

â€¢ Mobile search: Teams users can now search Replit Apps on mobile.

â€¢ Login flow: Improved Teams login flow.

â€¢ Account switching: Better account switching.



ğŸ› ï¸ Other improvements youâ€™ll love 


â€¢ Deployments: Better URL pastingâ€”we now handle links with or without https. 
We've also improved error handling for failed deployments. Additionally, DNS 
formatting now better adheres to industry standards.

â€¢ Tooling: Shell now features bash autocompletion (just tab-twice). We've also 
added a QR code to the Webview for easy mobile access. You can also resize the 
Webview to popular mobile screen sizes.





ğŸ“¹ Videos & tutorials


Our tech talks from December are now live on YouTube. Join Replit CEO Amjad 
Masad and engineering leaders for an exclusive tech talk showcasing the future 
of collaborative coding and AI, straight from the Replit HQ in Foster City, CA.


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtuwxIJrnS0> 

Don't know where to start? Our latest tutorial is a gentle intro to building 
without code. Learn to get started prompting with natural languageâ€”from idea to 
deployment in just a few minutes.


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ji8C1LxWyXU>

ğŸš€ Get started and share your work


If you've been waiting to give Replit a shot there's never been a better time.

 Our users are building faster than ever. Give it a shot today.

Try Replit Core <> 

If you've already built an amazing app with Replit, share it with us 
<https://forms.gle/sAqiKGTvXYa9Hjzc9> to be featured in an upcoming email.


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


As always, we've been shipping harder to make your experience betterâ€”for 
faster apps, & stronger results.

 Stay tuned for more of the latest & greatest in building with AI.

Until next time, <https://www.linkedin.com/in/vanessakahkesh>

Matt <> @ Replit

 <https://x.com/mattppal>

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it>  
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw> 
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>



Sent by Replit

1001 E Hillsdale Blvd, Suite 400, Foster City, CA 94404 


Unsubscribe here 
<https://links.replit.com/s/u/iF-wStINgf5_eu_axJyqnAMgmqsSKKiMqDU9XIAkjwtob6DlNT3dfz37FYHJvxc361U15dP3DrTyDKtu3ekmL9rR8tEXcmpQbV6RXSXi3MgqwQEI1thruOw-ax4qxrjcdGGIJZd4znjwIh5F2M2Gw8ph6Hce4H-Brs62Jq1GJ8wCyT4mcGaymfF0hkWyBs3Ox6n8YRlhQ1Dtfp5V/I8j2TPoniGpN5soh83Il3w31TsnzQoCW/5>

content:

*Changa, Anand,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 30, 2025 at 10:05â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: 3030 Eklavya Weekly Online Program- IIT Gandhinagar
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE(no-reply) <noreply9@aicte-india.org>
Date: Thu, Jan 30, 2025 at 9:56â€¯AM
Subject: 3030 Eklavya Weekly Online Program- IIT Gandhinagar
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Respected Madam/Sir,

We would like to inform you that 3030 EKLAVYA is a program for teachers,
students and parents.

The 1st episode, Computing with Soap:
https://www.youtube.com/live/A3-PpOYzXps?si=d7nybVbTAuWEA8AW received 75K
views, 10K assignment submission, 19 min avg watch time.

Contains solving computational problems - optimum metro-rail network,
Fastest descent problem posed by Galileo, analysed by Newton, Fermat  -
Calculus of Variations, Numerical Methods, optimization and nature of the
universe, cell structures & divisions using bubbles.

The link of the Next Episode: *History of Time & Clock (2 Feb, Sunday 4
PM): *https://www.youtube.com/live/S6RR7sYtLzE?si=XWq3W-z9EQSiwKfA

*Link for Registration:* https://eklavya.iitgandhinagar.ac.in/

We request you to please disseminate the link among your team and also
encourage your team of faculty, students to watch the innovative programme.

*Regards*

*Dr. Amit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,**New Delhi- 110070, Ph : 011-29581117*

--

Tutor
To: Agnirva Space <space@agnirva.com>


Dear Sir/Madam,

We trust this message finds you well. We are delighted to present a unique
educational advancement for your students through The Agnirva Space
Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
(Free
and Online), Recognized by AICTE and provided by Agnirva.com - an ISRO
Registered
Space Tutor, inaugurated by IN-SPACe.

Please encourage your students to join this free online program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>.
~ 55,000+ students from esteemed institutions like BITS Pilani, IIM
Bangalore, ISB Hyderabad, IIT Kharagpur, IIT Delhi, IIT Bhu, Delhi
University, LPU, VIT Vellore and 500+ other institutions have already
enrolled. We believe this program can significantly benefit your students
as well.

The Agnirva Space Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
not
only equips students with advanced knowledge in space sciences but also
prepares them for significant future roles across various industries
influenced by space technology. This program offers comprehensive space
content that culminates in a well-deserved certificate.

[image: Aicte Recognised - Agnirva Space Internship Program.jpg]

Regards,

Team Agnirva.com

From: IIT Guwahati Online <iitg.daksh.gurukul@masaischool.com>
Date: Tue, Jan 28, 2025 at 6:39â€¯AM
Subject: Your action is needed here | Opportunity for your students
To: <provost@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Educator,*

Greetings from the *IIT Guwahati, Daksh Gurukul *team.

We are thrilled to inform you that the first phase of the Entrance Test for
the* Credit-Linked program in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning *has
started. We seek your continued support in informing your students about
this significant opportunity. *This test is open to students regardless of
their degree (tech or non-tech) or year of study.*

*Selection Process:*

   - *Top-performing students* will be offered enrollment into the program.
   - A *waiting list* will be maintained for qualified candidates, who will
   be notified if seats become available.

*Test Details:*

   - *Date:* 2nd February 2025 (Sunday)
   - *Mode:* Online
   - *Registration Deadline:* 30th January 2025
   - *Registration Link: * *https://bit.ly/IITGuwahatiFirstAI
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/1/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/QN1H9jBTd0P3EuBxCHb2hlcnhl8=410>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/2/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/UVu5p1u-LD8ltLUWEOwVoFQEUF8=410>*

*Why the Entrance Test is Important:*
The entrance test assesses fundamental knowledge and *Logical Reasoning*,
providing a fair evaluation for students from all backgrounds. It serves as
an essential step for gaining admission to this highly competitive program,
which includes *hands-on learning*, real-world projects, and personalized
mentorship from *IIT Guwahati *professors and industry experts.

*Curriculum Overview:*
The program provides a comprehensive curriculum that covers all the
essential concepts of *AI and ML with an industry-aligned curriculum.*.

*Key Benefits of the Program:*

   - Earn a prestigious *Certificate from IIT Guwahati *
   - Access to *exclusive career opportunities* and mentorship for tech
   career
   - Build an impressive *portfolio* that demonstrates practical skills

We kindly ask for your support in encouraging your students to register for
the entrance test and take the first step toward a successful career. You
can easily share this information by forwarding this email to your students
or* click here to share on Whatsapp
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fapi.whatsapp.com%2Fsend%2F%3Ftext=New%2BOpportunity%2BFrom%2BIIT%253A%250A%250AFirst%2BPan-India%2BEntrance%2BTest%2Bfor%2BIIT%2BGuwahati%2527s%2BCredit-Linked%2BAI%2B%2528Artificial%2BIntelligence%2529%2B%2526%2BML%2B%2528Machine%2BLearning%2529%2BProgram.%2B%250A%250AThe%2Btest%2Bis%2Bscheduled%2Bfor%2B%252A2nd%2BFeb%2B2025%2B%2528Sunday%2529%252A%2Band%2Bwill%2Bbe%2Bconducted%2B%252Aonline%252A.%2B%250A%250A%252A%252ARegistration%2Bcloses%2Btoday%253A%252A%2Bhttps%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiFirstAI%2B%250A%250AThe%2Btest%2Bevaluates%2B%252Abasic%2Bfoundation%252C%2Breasoning%252C%2Band%2Blogical%2Bskills%252C%2Bmaking%2Bit%2Baccessible%2Bto%2Bstudents%2Bfrom%2B%252A%252Aany%2Bdegree%2Bor%2Bacademic%2Byear%252A%252A.%2BTop%2Bperformers%2Bwill%2Bsecure%2Badmission%2Bto%2Bthe%2Bprogram%252C%2Bwith%2Ba%2B%252A%252Awaiting%2Blist%252A%2Bfor%2Bqualified%2Bcandidates.%250A%250ADon%25E2%2580%2599t%2Bmiss%2Bthis%2Bopportunity%2Bthat%2Bequips%2Bstudents%2Bwith%2B%252Acutting-edge%2Bskills%2Bin%2BAI%252A%25E2%2580%2594register%2Bnow%2521%26type=custom_url%26app_absent=0/1/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/1wWJd7ydJ4jtW4kAq8iHTEVCkFc=410>*


*Thanks,  Team AI & ML  - Daksh Gurukul, IIT Guwahati*

subject: Important Guidelines for Exam Results and Lesson Plan Execution
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you about the following important guidelines: CIE/Internal/Mid-Semester Exam Results: If your CIE/Internal/Mid-Semester Exam results are not announced within 10 days of
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you about the following important guidelines:

   1.

   *CIE/Internal/Mid-Semester Exam Results:*
   If your CIE/Internal/Mid-Semester Exam results are not announced within *10
   days of the respective exam*, kindly contact the concerned subject
   teacher. If the issue remains unresolved, you may bring it to our attention
   for further action.
   2.

   *Lesson Plan Adherence:*
   If you observe that the teaching is not aligned with the lesson plan,
   please discuss it first with the respective subject teacher. If the issue
   persists, please escalate it to us for further assistance.

We encourage you to take these steps promptly to ensure a smooth academic
experience.

-- 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Prof. Hitesh Makwana*

*Assistant Professor*

*Department of Information Technology*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (Depstar)*

*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*

*Mo: 8460752501*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025 at 8:57â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: New opportunity | Kindly share with your students
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Guwahati <syed.fahad@masaischool.com>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025 at 8:15â€¯AM
Subject: New opportunity | Kindly share with your students
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

I am delighted to share an incredible opportunity for your students to join
the *AI (Artificial Intelligence) & ML (Machine Learning) Credit-Linked
Program*, offered by Daksh Gurukul - *IIT Guwahati*. This program is
tailored to equip learners with cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence and
Machine Learning skills, mentored by IIT Guwahati professors and industry
leaders from top organizations.

The program begins with the *First PAN-India Entrance Test on 26th January
2025.* We kindly request you to encourage students to register for this
pioneering opportunity today.

*Test Details:*

Date: 26th Jan 2025 (Sunday)
Mode: Online
Registration Link: *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/1/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/b-aUUUJhY1zZ9JSIMX_h2GGUqj4=410>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/2/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/nCxny5EzYcRhVGvdWj_xTf0UMPs=410>*

*What Makes This Initiative Stand Out?*
The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds*
and evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

   - *Credit-Linked Advantage:* Students earn academic credits,
   distinguishing this program from standard certification courses.
   - *Industry-Aligned Curriculum:* Designed to meet the latest demands in
   AI-driven industries.
   - *Guided by Experts:* Training sessions led by experienced faculty and
   industry professionals.

We kindly request your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students. Please encourage them to register and take the first step toward
an impactful career in Artificial Intelligence. *You can easily share this
information by forwarding this email or clicking here to share via
WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=New%2520Opportunity%253A%250A%250AFirst%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Guwahati's%2520Credit-Linked%2520AI%2520(Artificial%2520Intelligence)%2520%2526%2520ML%2520(Machine%2520Learning)%2520Program.%2520%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520*26th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)*%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520*online*.%2520%250A%250A**Registration%2520closes%2520today%253A*%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiFirstAI%2520%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520evaluates%2520*basic%2520foundation%252C%2520reasoning%252C%2520and%2520logical%2520skills%252C%2520making%2520it%2520accessible%2520to%2520students%2520from%2520**any%2520degree%2520or%2520academic%2520year**.%2520Top%2520performers%2520will%2520secure%2520admission%2520to%2520the%2520program%252C%2520with%2520a%2520**waiting%2520list*%2520for%2520qualified%2520candidates.%250A%250ADon%25E2%2580%2599t%2520miss%2520this%2520opportunity%2520that%2520equips%2520students%2520with%2520*cutting-edge%2520skills%2520in%2520AI*%25E2%2580%2594register%2520now%2521/1/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/ll2uJ4JtaWsaOLYhU7PcFeOkz0k=410>*


*Best regards, ~Team IIT Guwahati (Daksh Gurukul),  Credit-Linked AI & ML
Program*

harder part. To help you stay on track, weâ€™ve compiled seven tips our learners 
have used to keep themselves motivated on their learning journey.

Date: Tue, Jan 21, 2025 at 10:30â€¯AM
Subject: AICTE-Recognized Free Online Space Internship at Agnirva.com - An
ISRO Registered Tutor
To: <space@agnirva.com>


Dear Sir/Madam,

We trust this message finds you well. We are delighted to present a unique
educational advancement for your students through The Agnirva Space
Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
(Free
and Online), Recognized by AICTE and provided by Agnirva.com - an ISRO
Registered
Space Tutor, inaugurated by IN-SPACe.

Please encourage your students to join this free online program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>.
~ 55,000+ students from esteemed institutions like BITS Pilani, IIM
Bangalore, ISB Hyderabad, IIT Kharagpur, IIT Delhi, IIT Bhu, Delhi
University, LPU, VIT Vellore and 500+ other institutions have already
enrolled. We believe this program can significantly benefit your students
as well.

The Agnirva Space Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
not
only equips students with advanced knowledge in space sciences but also
prepares them for significant future roles across various industries
influenced by space technology. This program offers comprehensive space
content that culminates in a well-deserved certificate.
[image: Aicte Recognised - Agnirva Space Internship Program.jpg]

Regards,

Team Agnirva.com


--

subject: It's time to get inspired.
snippet: If you're looking for your next great project, we've got you covered. See what people like you are building on Replit. Matt here, We're almost a month into 2025, but it's never too late
content:
If you're looking for your next great project, we've got you covered. See what 
people like you are building on Replit.


â€Š
â€Š 



Matt here,

 We're almost a month into 2025, but it's never too late to start your next 
great project.

I'm excited to share some of the best apps we've seen on Replitâ€”amazing emoji 
search, tools for musicians, products from product managers, and much moreâ€”all 
built by folks like you.





 Already have a great project? Submit your app to be featured in our next 
issue.

Submit your app <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7> 

ğŸ”¨ Productivity



Product Workbench <https://productworkbench.replit.app/>: Product Workbench 
supercharges your product strategy by blending proven frameworks with AI-driven 
insights. From ideation to release, it helps you spot new opportunities, make 
smarter decisions, and keep your entire team on the same page.

From the creator: "[Replit] helped me go from product manager to product 
creator."

Realitix <https://realitix.io/>: Math and metrics for purchasing real estate. 
Realitix delivers simplified, clear financials when comparing multiple 
properties. An excellent example of software applied to a tangible problem.

From the creator: "[I am] allowing people to use the app for free without 
getting spammed by home lenders or other companies."


ğŸš€ Tools and Products



EmojiFast: <https://emojifast.com/> This one is pretty self-explanatory.... 
It's emoji, butfast. Search, copy, and paste your favorite emojis with speeds 
only Lightning McQueen can truly appreciate.

80/20 Agent <https://8020agent.com/>: Turn Google Ads data into useful 
information & AI powered insights.

From the creator: "I couldn't code at all 2 years ago. Never touched React or 
TS until 2 months ago. Now have an app used by hundreds of people. It's 
magical."


ğŸ’¡ Innovative Apps



Merge Club <https://merge-club.replit.app/guide>: A web-based guide for 
discovering and understanding microgrant and fellowship opportunities 
worldwide. Merge Club is a seriously beautiful and well-designed site, built 
and deployed on Replit.

From the creator: "I LOVE REPLIT AGENT!"

Compliance Guard <https://video-synopsis-paullieber98.replit.app/>: Improve 
your apps accessibility! Capture your application's user journey and get 
AI-powered compliance insights, detailed analysis, and actionable 
recommendations to make your video more accessible.

From the creator: "[Automate] finding accessibility gaps ... rather than 
[paying] accessibility human experts."


ğŸ® Creative Projects



Microtonal Trainer: <https://microtonal-trainer.replit.app/> You have to hear 
it to believe it! Train your ears to hear tiny shifts in musical pitch. Start 
simple and unlock new challenges as you master each levelâ€”perfect for musicians 
wanting to develop superhuman pitch perception.

From the creator: "It allows me to practice hearing if my singing is sharp or 
flat. [Previously] it was hard to find something to train with. This all came 
together within an hour."

Magical Bedtime Stories <https://storycreator.replit.app/>: A form-based web 
app that creates custom children's bedtime stories. Tell the app about your 
story recipient & get a personalized story that can be downloaded as a PDF.

From the creator: "I'm 16, and this was my first time ever using Replit. I'm 
excited to do more in the future!!"


ğŸ”® Looking Ahead


This is just a glimpse of whatâ€™s possible with Replit. If you're looking for 
more inspiration, we'll be sharing regular updates on what our users are 
building.

 If you'd like to be featured in our next issue, submit your project below. 

Submit your app <https://forms.gle/4SHuSUZRhQShEZVv7> 

Thanks again & until next time,

Matt <>



â€Š

 <https://twitter.com/Replit> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/repl-it>  
<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgoJjdR6-7AMu9fDitb6nVw> 
<https://www.instagram.com/repl.it/?hl=en>

Sent by Replit

subject: Confirmation of Your Registration for the 'Study Abroad Expo'
snippet: Dear Student We are delighted to confirm your registration for India's Biggest Study Abroad Expo, scheduled to be held on Monday, 20th January 2025 at Grand Mercure, Vadodara. Your participation
content:
Dear Student

We are delighted to confirm your registration for *Indiaâ€™s Biggest Study
Abroad Expo*, scheduled to be held on *Monday, 20th January 2025* at *Grand
Mercure, Vadodara*.

Your participation has been confirmed following your telephonic
confirmation with the HSS faculty. We appreciate your enthusiasm for
attending this expo and taking the first step toward exploring
international academic opportunities.

As you will be arriving directly at the venue, please follow these
instructions:

   1. *Carry your CHARUSAT ID card* and identify yourself as a CHARUSAT
   student at the venue for smooth entry.
   2. *Take a selfie at the expo venue* and send it to *Mr. Vijay Makwana*
   on *[9998380041]* as proof of your attendance.

*Event Highlights:*

   -
   - Direct interaction with representatives from* leading foreign
universities and
   IDP.*
   - Guidance on *scholarships, education loans*, and *IELTS preparation*.
   - Hospitality at the expo venue, ensuring a comfortable and enriching
   experience.

Given that the university has made arrangements for hospitality based on
your confirmation, we kindly request you to attend the expo without fail.
Your active participation will ensure you make the most of this exceptional
opportunity to explore your study abroad aspirations.

Should you have any questions or require assistance, please feel free to
contact us at +91 9998380041 [Dr. Vijay Makwana].

We look forward to seeing you on the day of the event!

Warm regards
[image: photo]
Dr. Vijay Makwana
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Charotar University of Science and Technology

[image: icon] 02697-265134  <02697-265184>  [image: icon] 9998380041

[image: icon] vijaymakwana.cs@charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Opportunity to Participate in International Competitions - AICTE SSPCA Scheme
snippet: Dear Students, We are happy to inform you about the SSPCA scheme, which provides financial assistance for participating in international competitions. This initiative aims to enhance your technical
content:
Dear Students,

We are happy to inform you about the SSPCA scheme, which provides financial
assistance for participating in international competitions. This initiative
aims to enhance your technical skills and foster innovation. If you are
enrolled in an AICTE-approved technical course and have excelled in
national events, We encourage you to take advantage of this opportunity.
For further details, please refer to the guidelines or contact me.

-- 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Prof. Hitesh Makwana*

*Assistant Professor*

*Department of Information Technology*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (Depstar)*

*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*

*Mo: 8460752501*

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Avalancheâ€™25 â€“ Celebrating Innovation and Excellence
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!! Kinldly find the events and dates of Avalance'25 from the attachment in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal RPCP CHARUSAT
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!

Kinldly find the events and dates of Avalance'25 from the attachment in
trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal RPCP CHARUSAT <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Jan 17, 2025 at 3:43â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to Avalancheâ€™25 â€“ Celebrating Innovation and Excellence
To:


Dear Sir/Madam

Ramanbhai Patel College of Pharmacy (RPCP), Charotar University of Science
and Technology, are delighted to invite you to *Avalanche 2025
(9th Edition)*, a national-level Pharma Tech Fest, set to take place
on *24th and
25th January, 2025. *Organized with unparalleled enthusiasm and creativity,
this flagship event promises to be a confluence of intellect, innovation,
and inspiration for *B.Pharm, M.Pharm, and Pharm.D students*. *Avalanche
2025* aims to bridge the realms of academia, industry, and society through
an array of engaging events and activities.

Additionally, we take pride in launching our exclusive *souvenir,
"Resurgence,"* which will feature insightful messages, sponsor
advertisements, and a showcase of student talent.

Join us as we celebrate the spirit of excellence, camaraderie, and learning
at *Avalanche 2025*. Your presence will undoubtedly enrich the fest and
inspire the participants.

Please find the attached invitation card of Inaugural Ceremony and brochure
of Avalanche 2025.



Kindly, grace the occasion with your presence.



Thanking you,



Sincerely,



Avalanche '25 Team,

RPCP-CHARUSAT

*Dr. Manan Raval*
*Principal - Ramanbhai Patel College of Pharmacy*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*CHARUSAT Campus,*
*Changa - 388421, Ta: Petlad, Di: Anand*
*Ext. No. - (02697) 265141*
*E-mail - principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>*



-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Join Indiaâ€™s Biggest Study Abroad Expo â€“ Register Now!
snippet: Dear Students We are excited to invite you to India's Biggest Study Abroad Expo, an exclusive opportunity for aspiring international students to interact directly with university representatives
content:
Dear Students

We are excited to invite you to *Indiaâ€™s Biggest Study Abroad Expo*, an
exclusive opportunity for aspiring international students to interact
directly with university representatives from *Australia* and *Canada*.

*Event Details:*
ğŸ“… *Date:* Monday, 20th January
â° *Time:* 11:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM
ğŸ“ *Venue:* Grand Mercure, Vadodara

*Why You Should Attend:*

   - *Direct Access to World-Class Institutions*: Meet representatives
from *130+
   universities* to explore your academic options and scholarships.
   - *Scholarship Opportunities*: Learn how 11,000+ students secured
   scholarships last year and how *you* could be next.
   - *On-the-Spot IELTS Booking*: Book your IELTS test and receive access
   to free preparation materials.
   - *Education Loan Assistance*: Get guidance on securing education loans
   up to â‚¹3 crore and save up to â‚¹1 lakh.

We understand you may have commitments to sports or cultural events, so we
kindly request that you register only if you can ensure your confirmed
participation.

*How to Register:*
Scan the QR code on the poster or click here
<https://forms.gle/8qRf6dHQNqLTBfe39> to secure your spot. Spaces are
limited, and registrations open till 4:00 PM today.)
[image: adobe-express-qr-code (7).png]

We look forward to helping you take the first step toward your global
education journey. Please feel free to reach out to us at +91 9998380041 if
you have any questions.

Warm regards,

*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: [Cisco Broadcast Registration] Protecting Civilization: Cybersecurity Critical Infrastructure
snippet: View online Cisco Networking Academy Logo Protecting Civilization: Cybersecurity Critical Infrastructure Did you know a cybersecurity career can empower you to travel the world and change it for the
content:
Protecting Civilization: Cybersecurity Critical Infrastructure
Did you know a cybersecurity career can empower you to travel the world and change it for the better? There are so many niche fields within cybersecurity, each dedicated to protecting infrastructures across the globe - and you're going to get the chance to explore several of them with our speaker Joe Marshall, Senior Security Strategist at Cisco Talos. This is a Find Yourself in the Future event you don't want to miss!
Why You Should Attend:
- 
Firsthand expertise: Gain insights from a cybersecurity professional with real-world experience in protecting critical infrastructure.

 

	- 
Actionable knowledge: Learn about famous attacks onÂ critical infrastructure and how they shaped cybersecurity.Â 

 

	- 
Career-boosting: Hear from an expert from the world's largest private threat intelligence organization.
Meet the Speaker & Host
Joe Marshall
Leader of Security Research Engineering
Cisco Talos
Jasmyne-Nicole Walker
Copywriter (Host)
Cisco Networking Academy
Discover how you can kick-start your career in the exciting field of Cybersecurity. Spaces are limited â€“ register today.

The future is here, and you donâ€™t want to miss it.
