20th Jan
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

We are pleased to share an update regarding the Credit-Linked Data Science
Program offered by *Daksh Gurukul - IIT Guwahati**.* Over the past two
months, we conducted a Pan-India Entrance Test, and 250 students have
successfully cleared and joined this prestigious program.

Based on requests from institutions nationwide, the entrance test is being
reopened for the final time for this batch. The test is scheduled for
*Sunday*, and we will select 100 students from this round.

We kindly request your support in encouraging students from your
institution to participate in this opportunity.

*Test Details:*

Date: 19th Jan 2025 (Sunday)
Mode: Online
Registration Link: *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiTestSunday/1/0100019467f0bf56-7e859521-ddfd-47e7-848a-ac6335e8ef5b-000000/bm2gbIvQMf2NSkPmNUOcEK7LYfY=409>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiTestSunday/2/0100019467f0bf56-7e859521-ddfd-47e7-848a-ac6335e8ef5b-000000/DYW4zjkPC1IQizIJA41kP1Hxk7I=409>*

*What Makes This Initiative Stand Out?*
The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds*
and evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

   - *Credit-Linked Advantage:* Students earn academic credits,
   distinguishing this program from standard certification courses.
   - *Industry-Aligned Curriculum:* Designed to meet the latest demands in
   data science and AI-driven industries.
   - *Guided by Experts:* Training sessions led by experienced faculty and
   industry professionals.

We kindly request your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students. Encourage them to register and take the first step toward an
impactful career in Artificial Intelligence. *You can easily share this
information by forwarding this email or by clicking here to share via
WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=Register%2520for%2520the%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Guwahati's%2520Credit-Linked%2520Data%2520Science%2520Program%250A%250AIn%2520the%2520first%2520phase%252C%2520we%2520filled%2520**100%2525%2520of%2520the%2520seats**.%2520Due%2520to%2520high%2520demand%2520and%2520requests%2520for%2520reopening%2520from%2520across%2520India%252C%2520**100%2520additional%2520seats**%2520have%2520been%2520added%2520for%2520this%2520batch.%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520**19th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)**%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520**online**.%2520**Registration%2520closes%2520today%253A**%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiTestSunday%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520evaluates%2520**basic%2520foundation%252C%2520reasoning%252C%2520and%2520logical%2520skills**%252C%2520making%2520it%2520accessible%2520to%2520students%2520from%2520**any%2520degree%2520or%2520academic%2520year**.%2520Top%2520performers%2520will%2520secure%2520admission%2520to%2520the%2520program%252C%2520with%2520a%2520**waiting%2520list**%2520for%2520qualified%2520candidates.%250A%250ADon%E2%80%99t%2520miss%2520this%2520opportunity%2520that%2520equips%2520students%2520with%2520**cutting-edge%2520skills%2520in%2520data%2520science%2520and%2520AI**%E2%80%94register%2520now!%250A/1/0100019467f0bf56-7e859521-ddfd-47e7-848a-ac6335e8ef5b-000000/7qSAj3HquE1HibBuW7mO8eGzJcQ=409>*

subject: Fwd: IGNITE 2025- A Techfest for UG and PG Students
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!! IGNITE '25 is here, more details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <principal.cmpica@charusat.ac
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!

IGNITE '25 is here, more details are in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 16, 2025 at 10:08â€¯AM
Subject: IGNITE 2025- A Techfest for UG and PG Students
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Dean FCA CHARUSAT <dean.fca@charusat.ac.in>


Dear all,
Greetings!!

It gives us immense pleasure to extend an invitation to you for the
technical symposium IGNITE 2025 on January 24, 2025 at Smt. Chandaben
Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA). IGNITE is a
tech fest that promises a unique blend of technical and non-technical
competitions, providing an exceptional platform for students of
Undergraduate and Postgraduate programmes to showcase their talents and
foster intellectual growth.

Details of the event are enclosed in the attached poster. The below
competitions are organized for igniting the hidden talent:

Â· *Code Clash (C,C++/Java Programming)*

Â· *Web Warrior (Webpage Designing)*

Â· *Query Quest (SQL/PLSQL)*

Â· *Scholar Showcase (Project/Poster Presentation)*

Â· *Ignite Got Talent (Show your talent in singing/dancing/Instrument
Playing etc.)*

Â· *InstaImpact (Instagram Reel)*

 Visit our official website to view the event descriptions and registration
information.  Feel free to bring friends, colleagues, or anyone who shares
a passion for learning and exploration.

Together, let's make IGNITE 2025 an unforgettable celebration of knowledge
and creativity.



We look forward to welcoming you at IGNITE 2025




I/C Principal,
Smt.Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications(CMPICA),
(M.C.A,M.Sc.(IT),B.C.A, B.Sc.(IT) and Ph.D Programmes)
Charotar University of Science and Technology(CHARUSAT),CHANGA
*( NAAC Accredited with "A+"  Grade)*

Contact No:- 02697-265241
Website: www.charusat.ac.in

subject: Fwd: Good Article to study and share with our studetns - How Software Development is Changing Forever, and How You'll Need to Change With It
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Good article about The Evolution of Software Development and the Necessary Adaptations for Professionals, hardly takes a few minutes to read. Happy Reading. ----
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Good article about *The Evolution of Software Development and the Necessary
Adaptations for Professionals*, hardly takes a few minutes to read.

Happy Reading.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Head IT DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <hod.itds@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 16, 2025 at 11:33â€¯AM
Subject: Good Article to study and share with our studetns - How Software
Development is Changing Forever, and How You'll Need to Change With It
To: DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


By Joseph Barron,
ğŸ— 9+ years of experience building and scaling full-stack web applications,
with 5+ years leading engineering teams to deliver high-impact solutions.
Education-
B.S. Software Development, Western Governors University
Work-
Software Engineering Manager (Architecture)
Source -
https://dev.to/jdbar/how-software-development-is-changing-forever-and-how-youll-need-to-change-with-it-1jih

--------------------------------
I'm sorry, you'll probably find this is a really long article. From the
title, you probably think I'm either about to profess the infinite glory of
AI â€” or proclaim how it will gradually end the world and take your job.

But I promise that's not what this is. In fact, since you're reading this
here on Dev.to, I promise to tell you why you're likely to do well in a
post-AI world.

For as long as programming has existed, one thing has remained constant:
itâ€™s always been about writing code. Despite how computing has changed over
decades, one thing has remained the same... we write code, and the machine
follows our instructions.

Today, tools like Copilot, Cursor, and ChatGPT are turning that process on
its head. AI doesnâ€™t just follow instructions; it helps create them. You
describe what you need, and it spits out code that gets you halfway
thereâ€”sometimes further.

It feels unbelievable.

But it raises unsettling questions. If AI gets better at writing code,
whatâ€™s left for developers? Is this the end of a decades-old careerâ€”or the
beginning of something far greater?

The best programmers I know are not intimidated by the
hallucination-riddled outputs of ChatGPT and Claude. But the history of
computing suggests that these programmers shouldn't be so confident that
the world won't demand that they adapt anyways.

*The Next Big Abstraction in Computing*
Each shift in the evolution of how we produce software has been a story of
abstraction. The amount of data needed to build an application has not
decreased over time, it's gotten larger. But the words we use to describe
that data have become more expressive and succinct.

*Assembly Language:* No more punch card systems or painstakingly producing
machine code by hand. With assembly, developers could write instructions
using a more human-readable syntax, abstracting away the binary intricacies
of hardware. This meant they could shift focus from managing individual
bytes to designing and building more complex systemsâ€”operating systems,
rudimentary user interfaces, and early software applications. It was a big
first step toward programming as we know it today: enabling humans to
communicate with machines without needing to speak like one.


*Compiled Languages*: Portable, high-level code revolutionized programming.
Instead of writing instructions specific to a machineâ€™s hardware,
developers could write code in high-level languages like FORTRAN or C,
which compilers translated into optimized machine code. This abstraction
allowed developers to focus on solving complex problems rather than
worrying about hardware-specific details. The result? The rise of portable,
scalable applicationsâ€”from enterprise systems to the software that powers
our everyday lives. It wasnâ€™t just about making programming easier; it was
about opening the door to larger, more ambitious projects that transformed
industries.


*Interpreted Languages*: Languages like Python and JavaScript took
abstraction a step further, prioritizing ease of use, flexibility, and
platform independence. With interpreted languages, developers didnâ€™t need
to compile code into machine instructionsâ€”they could write and run programs
dynamically, often with instant feedback. This democratized programming,
making it accessible to people who didnâ€™t have traditional technical
backgrounds. Despite being notorious for quirks and inefficiencies, these
languages fueled the web and app revolutions, enabling entire ecosystems of
innovation. Today, countless communities thrive around building micro-SaaS
apps, games, and experimental projects that wouldnâ€™t have been possible
without these accessible tools.

If history has taught us anything, itâ€™s that new tools donâ€™t eliminate
jobsâ€”they create them.



A guy in 1957: "A compiler could never outperform my hand-crafted machine
code."

Programming originally meant managing every detailâ€”manually allocating
memory, writing low-level code tailored to specific hardware, and
understanding every intricacy of the machine. A skillset that was
incredibly niche and difficult to acquire. Today's students can
effortlessly render their React piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance in any environment that
can run a browser, without worrying about the nitty gritty details. Each
leap in abstraction has not only made programming complex systems easier
but has also unlocked countless new opportunities, expanding whatâ€™s
possible with far less effort.

I believe AI-assisted coding fits neatly into this ongoing story of
abstractions. Each transition in the evolution of programming has shared a
central theme: that code can be represented as data. Every paradigm shift
has been about abstracting how we describe and manipulate that data. Large
language models take this abstraction one step further: they allow us to
represent code (and anything else generative AI can produce) in the form of
natural language.

*Natural Language*: Generative LLMs have unlocked a form of software
development that was previously relegated to niche artisan programming
languages: the ability to build applications using plain English. Well,
almost. While these models can â€œautocompleteâ€ their way to appearing
technically proficient, achieving reliable and precise outputs still
requires significant technical expertise. However, their advancing
capabilities give us a preview of an inevitable future where natural
language programming is the de-facto way to produce software.
What Changes for Developers?
Unlike many of the previous paradigm shifts in computing, AI is not just
abstracting code... it is also abstracting effort itself. A strong
developer can describe in detail what they need, and an AI can nearly
handle the rest. "Agentic" tools are becoming capable of brainstorming and
planning somewhat autonomouslyâ€”at least, they give the appearance of doing
so. The code these programs write won't necessarily pass the sniff test of
the top programmers (in fact, the code might not even run), but it doesn't
seem like we're far away from getting consistent and reliable outputs.

AI also isnâ€™t a deterministic tool in the toolbox, like a compiler. There's
a degree of chaos and unpredictability that, when combined with its
approximate knowledge of many things, enables it to act as a pretty good
collaborator. Even if you don't use the code it writes directly, you might
find it's a wonderful rubber-duck, capable of bouncing ideas back and
forth, willing to iterate on any ridiculous thought you have. Its ability
to parse large amounts of documentation quickly is useful when researching
how to go about building a system. And that means the role of the developer
will evolve in a new way.

In the future, the developers with the highest job security wonâ€™t
necessarily be the ones most deeply familiar with language features, APIs,
and libraries. AIâ€”even in its current impressive-but-primitive stateâ€”can
already approximate much of that information with surprising accuracy.

Instead, the developers who stand to gain the most will be those who excel
at the things AI will (hopefully) struggle with for a long time. AI, at
least as of today, cannot hold an entire business context in its memory. It
doesnâ€™t understand the domain. It doesnâ€™t grasp the customer, the roadmap,
the budget, the politics, the culture, the positioning, the strategyâ€”or the
teamâ€™s past failures and victories. It doesnâ€™t exist in the world, building
relationships with the people navigating the ship itâ€™s been prompted to
help steer. And despite its generative capabilities, it has little
meaningful awareness of the industry itâ€™s operating in.


ChatGPT's weakness is it doesn't comment on Jeff-the-product-director's
cool leather jacket to build rapport.

The developer who seeks to exploit this inherent weakness in AI's ability
to build and understand complex relationships will shift their priorities.
It will no longer be worth exerting so much effort to write code, because
large language models will eventually sufficiently abstract the production
of reliable code via natural language. From a programming perspective, it
will suffice for the developer to be just expert enough within their
technical domain to ensure that the machine does not make any critical
technical mistakes.

More importantly, the developer who is adaptable will leverage their deep
understanding of the business domainâ€”an area where AI simply has no ability
to compete, at least for the time being. The developer who has genuine
interest and empathy for the end-users, the business, and the people
working in it, will use AI to build the most effective solutions with
1/10th the effort compared to those who staunchly remain traditional
codersâ€”who, in the eyes of the business, will miss the forest for the trees
pursuing the dopamine-rush of a puzzle well-solved by their own hands.

The developers who thrive will be the ones who learn how to collaborate
with AI, taking advantage of all of its strengths and its weaknesses.

*What Skills Will Developers Need?*
If AI shifts the nature of programming from "writing code" to "articulating
solutions," then the skills developers value today will evolve to
universally encompass the soft-skills honed by those who've had time to
build software engineering experience in the pre-AI corporate world.

Initially, the safest group will be senior engineers and managers already
celebrated for delivering measurable business impact. They will reap the
early benefits of this shift, standing just inches from the sheer edge of a
suddenly expanding value chasm that separates them from the incoming junior
developers who have had no opportunity to build technical experience or
domain knowledge. These newcomers have the grave misfortune of trying to
cross a bridge that is suddenly falling apart beneath them.

But even senior engineers wonâ€™t be safe forever. The critical move for
senior and junior engineers alike will be to lean heavily on their unique
strengths over AI, and offload everything else.

The ability to articulate a problem clearly and break it down into
actionable logical steps will be a key differentiating skill. AI can
generate code, but it canâ€™t understand ambiguous or poorly framed
requirements. Developers must be highly effective translators of business
needs into prompts that AI can act on effectively. They must provide the
right amount of technical context so as to not let the AI run amok by
either under- or over-engineering a terrible implementation.

While AI can write individual components of a system, it canâ€™t yet design
how all those parts fit together, at least very well. In my personal
experience, it loses sight of the bigger picture quickly, and is an
indecisive pushover when evaluating important decisions. Developers will
need to focus on architecture and integration, ensuring that the pieces
generated by AI fit within the broader system and align with organizational
goals.


We need to refactor this rectangle right here, or we all die instantly.


Developers will need to rigorously evaluate and refine AI outputs, ensuring
they are efficient, secure, and aligned with business objectives. This will
involve a mix of technical expertise and gut intuition honed through
experience with production systems.

The developer who builds trust with stakeholders, understands user pain
points, and advocates for solutions that align with company values will
have a clear edge. These are not skills an AI can replicate (yet), and they
will set the best developers apart. (And arguably, they already do.)

The measure of success as a developer has never been, and still won't be,
how many lines of code you can pushâ€”it will be how much impact you can
drive. The winners in this new landscape will be those who:

Ship solutions that actually solve user problems.
Build resilient systems that scale with the needs of the business.
Use AI as a multiplier, not a crutch.
This is a shift from a craftsman mentality to a strategist mentality. The
best developers will spend less time manually refactoring and testing, and
more time solving meaningful problems. The skill of traditionally writing
code will become less and less intrinsically valuable, except in cases
where peak technical performance is vital to the business or product
strategy.

*AI Will Replace Developers Who Don't Adapt*
Hereâ€™s the truth: the role of developers isnâ€™t going away, but what
developers do day-to-day will change dramatically. The tasks that are
repetitive, time-consuming, and easily described will be automated. Thatâ€™s
not a threatâ€”itâ€™s an opportunity.

Developers who embrace this change will have more time to focus on things
that truly matter. Crafting seamless experiences. Discovering innovative
solutions. Solving real world problems.

But those who resistâ€”who double down on manual processes or dismiss the
potential of these toolsâ€”risk being left behind. AI isnâ€™t waiting for
anyone to catch up. If you find yourself scoffing at the imperfect code AI
generates today, remember: there was once a great programmer who believed
they would always write better assembly than a compiler. We know how that
story ended.

The beauty of this shift is that it lowers barriers and opens the door for
anyone willing to learn. Generative AI is a toolâ€”not a replacementâ€”and like
every paradigm shift before it, those who embrace it will amplify their
problem-solving capabilities. Whether youâ€™re a junior developer just
starting out or a seasoned architect, AI offers a way to do more, faster,
and with greater focus on what truly matters.

But succeeding in this new era requires adaptation. You canâ€™t approach AI
as just another tool for automation. Itâ€™s a collaborator. Learn how to
guide it effectivelyâ€”how to frame problems, validate outputs, and iterate
on solutions. Shift your focus from the mechanics of coding to the broader
picture: understanding users, designing systems, and aligning with strategy.

AI is abstracting effort itself, freeing developers to put their energy
where it counts: driving real impact. If you can master this transition,
you wonâ€™t just keep upâ€”youâ€™ll be able to change the world.

AI Will Amplify Buildersâ€”But Replace Manual Work
The highest-performing developers wonâ€™t just write code; theyâ€™ll use AI to
redefine how businesses operate. By leveraging their technical skills in
collaboration with AI, theyâ€™ll automate the definition and translation of
business and user needs, analyze unstructured data to uncover
opportunities, and pinpoint inefficiencies in processes. These developers
wonâ€™t just automate workflowsâ€”theyâ€™ll effectively automate the organization
itself.

Itâ€™s not far-fetched to imagine Sam Altmanâ€™s prediction of a one-person
unicorn becoming reality within the next decade.

For those in non-technical roles, this should be a wake-up call. Developers
using AI wonâ€™t just stick to their traditional domainsâ€”theyâ€™ll expand into
others, from marketing and operations to design and even product
leadership. Not maliciously, and not intentionally to displace people, but
because AI will give them (or the companies that employ them) the tools to
radically change manual processes that were once untouchable.

*What If Iâ€™m Not a Developer?*
The solution is simple: learn to build. Not necessarily to code like a
software engineer, but to design and build systems that solve problems.
Start now, before the gap widens.

AI is transforming the nature of work. Any process that can be automated
profitably, likely will be. This isnâ€™t speculationâ€”itâ€™s the trajectory of
technological progress. The people who understand how to create, build, and
solve problems with these tools will race ahead, automating tasks,
increasing productivity, and unlocking entirely new opportunities.

If youâ€™re in a non-technical role, you might think: "I donâ€™t need to learn
to code. AI will handle it for me." Thatâ€™s partially trueâ€”AI tools are
lowering the barriers to entry and making it easier to get started. But the
people who thrive in this era will be the ones who understand and are
well-practiced in the fundamentals of how to build a solution from nothing.

AI isnâ€™t magic. It doesnâ€™t understand your business, your customers, or
your goals. It still relies on human inputâ€”on people who can frame
problems, validate outputs, and integrate solutions. Developers already
know how to do this, and theyâ€™re collaborating with AI to push boundaries.
You can do it tooâ€”it just takes practice and a willingness to adapt.


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

Sir/Madam



The Higher and Technical Education Department, in collaboration with CAWACH
Kendra, is delighted to invite students from various
institutes/universities to participate in the Cyber Rakshak Natya Utsav.
This unique initiative aims to raise awareness about cyber fraud prevention
and digital safety through engaging skits and short plays. Flyer of the
event is attached herewith for reference.



*Event Highlights: *

Topic Themes:

   1. Digital Financial Safety
   2. Social Media Awareness
   3. Cybercrime and Prevention
   4. Mental Health and Digital Well-being
   5. Digital Citizenship and Ethical Online Behavior



*Competition Levels and Prizes:*

District-Cluster Level Prizes:

1st Winner: â‚¹11,000

2nd Winner: â‚¹7,000

3rd Winner: â‚¹5,000



State Level Prizes:

1st Winner: â‚¹1,00,000

2nd Winner: â‚¹71,000

3rd Winner: â‚¹51,000



*Key Details*

   - Registration Period: December 30, 2024, to January 25, 2025
   - Eligible Participants: Students from Government and Grant-in-Aid
   Colleges, Gram Vidyapeeths, and State & Private Universities across Gujarat.

*How to Register*

Please nominate a faculty mentor to submit the team registration and skit
concept summary.

*Link for Registration (QR Code is available in the flyer) :*

https://imsva91-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fdocs.google.com%2fforms%2fd%2fe%2f1FAIpQLSc3OdJOJ4PsTZmL6BYnqKNxT9fCzvZZSfLvbndGim0fsTVQiQ%2fviewform%3fusp%3dheader&umid=72BCD313-2B96-4906-9CC8-B532144EBC06&auth=777990cd74cc620430ea9ccd0417e323e70695df-6095d27a5426c785bcb13b1238aa3415cacbaf6c


For any queries, contact cawach-edu@gujgov.edu.in or call on: 8200743148


Looking forward your institutes's enthusiastic participation in this
meaningful and creative endeavor to promote cyber safety.

You are requested to encourage students for maximum participation in the
event.

*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Provost CHARUSAT <provost@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Jan 15, 2025 at 10:33â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | Batch date
- 20th Jan
To: Teaching Staff <teachingstaff@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Guwahati <iitg.daksh.gurukul@masaischool.com>
Date: Wed, 15 Jan 2025, 08:41
Subject: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | Batch date -
20th Jan
To: <provost@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

We are pleased to share an update regarding the Credit-Linked Data Science
Program offered by *Daksh Gurukul - IIT Guwahati**.* Over the past two
months, we conducted a Pan-India Entrance Test, and 250 students have
successfully cleared and joined this prestigious program.

Based on requests from institutions nationwide, the entrance test is being
reopened for the final time for this batch. The test is scheduled for
*Sunday*, and we will select 100 students from this round.

We kindly request your support in encouraging students from your
institution to participate in this opportunity.

*Test Details:*

Date: 19th Jan 2025 (Sunday)
Mode: Online
Registration Link: *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiTestSunday/1/0100019467f1ddd9-4fc38fe3-813d-46ed-b9e7-b20142703e63-000000/URhFnafmHRX_R7PUhTYhUGYF9MI=409>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiTestSunday/2/0100019467f1ddd9-4fc38fe3-813d-46ed-b9e7-b20142703e63-000000/n7I37NI7ZigYcvxFEn7_PWdDUYo=409>*

*What Makes This Initiative Stand Out?*
The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds*
and evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

   - *Credit-Linked Advantage:* Students earn academic credits,
   distinguishing this program from standard certification courses.
   - *Industry-Aligned Curriculum:* Designed to meet the latest demands in
   data science and AI-driven industries.
   - *Guided by Experts:* Training sessions led by experienced faculty and
   industry professionals.

We kindly request your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students. Encourage them to register and take the first step toward an
impactful career in Artificial Intelligence. *You can easily share this
information by forwarding this email or by clicking here to share via
WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=Register%2520for%2520the%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Guwahati's%2520Credit-Linked%2520Data%2520Science%2520Program%250A%250AIn%2520the%2520first%2520phase%252C%2520we%2520filled%2520**100%2525%2520of%2520the%2520seats**.%2520Due%2520to%2520high%2520demand%2520and%2520requests%2520for%2520reopening%2520from%2520across%2520India%252C%2520**100%2520additional%2520seats**%2520have%2520been%2520added%2520for%2520this%2520batch.%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520**19th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)**%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520**online**.%2520**Registration%2520closes%2520today%253A**%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiTestSunday%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520evaluates%2520**basic%2520foundation%252C%2520reasoning%252C%2520and%2520logical%2520skills**%252C%2520making%2520it%2520accessible%2520to%2520students%2520from%2520**any%2520degree%2520or%2520academic%2520year**.%2520Top%2520performers%2520will%2520secure%2520admission%2520to%2520the%2520program%252C%2520with%2520a%2520**waiting%2520list**%2520for%2520qualified%2520candidates.%250A%250ADon%E2%80%99t%2520miss%2520this%2520opportunity%2520that%2520equips%2520students%2520with%2520**cutting-edge%2520skills%2520in%2520data%2520science%2520and%2520AI**%E2%80%94register%2520now!%250A/1/0100019467f1ddd9-4fc38fe3-813d-46ed-b9e7-b20142703e63-000000/uvaFzQmVGwPsFYAze1NP3S_Nfcs=409>*

Science Program*

subject: Kickstart Your Year with Our Cybersecurity â€œFind Yourself in the Futureâ€ Series!
snippet: View online Cisco Networking Academy Logo Dear Networking Academy Community, As we embark on a new year filled with opportunities, it's the perfect time to enhance your cybersecurity skills and
content:
Dear Networking Academy Community, 

As we embark on a new year filled with opportunities, it's the perfect time to enhance your cybersecurity skills and prepare for the future. Our "Find Yourself in the Future" series offers valuable insights into the dynamic world of cybersecurity, and we invite you to explore our latest webinars.Â 

Whether youâ€™re just starting your journey or looking to advance your expertise, these webinars are designed to equip you with the knowledge and tools you need to elevate your career. Donâ€™t miss outâ€”explore our latest events today!
Infrastructure Security - The Backbone of the Digital World
Discover the crucial role of infrastructure security in protecting our digital environments. In this session, Mike Bullard, a leader in Infrastructure Security at Cisco, delves into the technology that secures everything from servers to data centers. Gain insights from an industry expert and learn what it takes to excel in this field.
Threat Monitoring â€“ The Art of Cyber Vigilance
Elevate your cybersecurity expertise by learning the latest threat monitoring strategies. Join Daniela Herrera, Senior Technical Course Developer at Splunk, for an engaging session complete with a live demo. Discover how vigilance can protect against cyber threats and secure your digital assets.
Incident Response of the Network â€“ Navigating the Cyber Crises
Explore the Incident Life Cycle and the spectrum of cybersecurity threats in this enlightening webinar. Rachael Alagna, Leader of Information Security at Cisco, shares her inspiring career journey and offers practical insights into incident response. Understand the impact of data breaches and discover recommended Cisco courses to advance your career in cybersecurity.
Don't miss this opportunity to equip yourself with cutting-edge knowledge and skills. Watch these webinars to stay ahead in the ever-evolving world of cybersecurity.

subject: Upcoming Review of Software Group Projects for 4th Semester by industry professionals on 15 Feb 2025
snippet: Dear Students, I hope this message finds you well. We are pleased to inform you that the Software Group Projects for the 4th Semester will be reviewed by esteemed industry professionals. This is a
content:
Dear Students,

I hope this message finds you well.

We are pleased to inform you that the *Software Group Projects* for the 4th
Semester will be reviewed by esteemed *industry professionals*. This is a
valuable opportunity for our students to receive feedback from experts in
the field.

*Details of the Review:*

   - *Objective:* Evaluation of the Project definition, functional
   requirements, and non-functional requirements.
   - *Reviewers:* Industry professionals with extensive experience in
   software development and project management.
   - *Date and Time: *15/02/2025 (9:30 AM to 4:00 PM)

*Points to be Reviewed in the First Review:*

   - *Project Definition:*
      - Clarity and completeness of the problem statement.
      - Objectives and scope of the project.


   - *Functional Requirements:*
      - Correctness and completeness of the functional requirements.
      - Relevance to the project's objectives.


   - *Non-Functional Requirements:*
      - Identification of critical non-functional requirements.
      - Feasibility and realism of the proposed non-functional criteria.


   - *Project Plan:*
      - Overview of the timeline and milestones.
      - Resource allocation and risk management.


   - *Initial Design(Optional):*
      - Preliminary design and architecture.
      - Alignment with the functional and non-functional requirements.


-- 
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: The inside scoop at Replit: behind the scenes building Agent
snippet: Last month's tech talks are now available to stream. Learn all about the engineering behind Agent & Assistant. ğŸ‘‹ Matt here, If you're interested in "behind the scenes" at Replit,
content:
Last month's tech talks are now available to stream. Learn all about the 
engineering behind Agent & Assistant.


â€Š
â€Š 



ğŸ‘‹ Matt here,

 If you're interested in "behind the scenes" at Replit, I have some news for 
you.


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtuwxIJrnS0>

Our most recent Tech Talks are now available to stream.

Recorded live at Replit's office in Foster City, CA, the talks cover:

â€¢ How Agent turns natural language into working applications,
â€¢ Multi-agent architecture and context management,
â€¢ Collaborative shell technology and state synchronization,
â€¢ AI-driven design systems and component theming.

Check them out at the link above.












Watch the talks <https://youtu.be/dtuwxIJrnS0> 

If you're interested in individual talks, we've made them available on a 
playlisthere. 
<https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLto9KpJAqHMRXNmehlfgboIDO8zmct8iy>

We had a blast sharing how we build at Replit with the community. Stay tuned 
for more updates.

Thanks again & until next time,

Matt <>

January 2025











Starting fresh this new year


Wherever you left off at the end of last year, now is an opportunity for a 
fresh start. As you decide what you want your next year to look like, weâ€™re 
here with some suggestions for setting realistic resolutions and tangible 
to-dos, plus helpful community events to attend â€” and even a chance to spruce 
up your desk setup.

â€Œ


Happy New Year, 

The Codecademy Team

35 Easy Resolutions to Kickstart Your 2025


This year, letâ€™s resolve to make resolutions we can keep. Our team of 
Curriculum Developers share some ideas for bite-sized goals you can set for 
yourself this year.


Check it out

subject: Fwd: Appreciation to Lesson Planning Portal Developer - Dhairya Shah (23DCS118) & Priyanshu Valiya (23DCS141)
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! We are excited to share that Dhairya Shah - 23DCS118 and Priyanshu Valiya - 23DCS141 have made a significant contribution to the development of our application.
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

We are  excited to share that *Dhairya Shah - 23DCS118 and Priyanshu Valiya
- 23DCS141*  have made a significant contribution to the development of our
application. Letâ€™s all congratulate them for their hard work and
dedication!

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Parth Goel <parthgoel.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Jan 7, 2025 at 10:26â€¯AM
Subject: Appreciation to Lesson Planning Portal Developer - Dhairya Shah
(23DCS118) & Priyanshu Valiya (23DCS141)
To: <21dit@charusat.edu.in>, <21dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <
21dce@charusat.edu.in>, <22dit@charusat.edu.in>, <22dce@charusat.edu.in>, <
22dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <23dit@charusat.edu.in>, <23dcse@charusat.edu.in>,
<23dce@charusat.edu.in>, <24dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <24dce@charusat.edu.in>,
<24dit@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <
amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>, <23DCS118@charusat.edu.in>, <
23DCS141@charusat.edu.in>


Dear Students,

We are delighted to share the contributions of our students *(Dhairya Shah
- 23DCS118 and Priyanshu Valiya - 23DCS141) *for the successful completion
of Phase -1 of the Lesson Planning (LP) Portal (Web Application) and making
it live for teachers. This platform is designed to streamline academic
processes and objectives, save valuable time, and enable teachers to
efficiently manage lesson planning for their subjects.

The key contributors of this project are as follows:

   - Dhairya Shah (23DCS118) â€“ Lead Developer & System Architect
   - Priyanshu Valiya (23DCS141) â€“ Next.js Developer
   - Dr. Parth Goel (Coordinator, Teaching Learning Committee) â€“ Mentor and
   Testing of a portal

It is worth noting that this significant task was *completed within just
three weeks*, resulting in Phase 1 (Version 1.0) of the portal. Their
efforts have culminated in a user-friendly and efficient platform that will
benefit the entire institution. This accomplishment is a testament to the
hard work and dedication of our students.

*Let us all take a moment to applaud Dhairya and Priyanshu for their
outstanding accomplishment and be inspired by their dedication.*

We would like to acknowledge and express our gratitude to Dr. Amit Nayak
sir (Process Owner - Teaching Learning Committee) and Dr. Bankim Patel sir
(Principal-DEPSTAR) for their continuous support and valuable suggestions
during the portal's implementation.

Thank you for your continuous enthusiasm and support in making such
initiatives successful.

-- 
Regards,
Dr. Parth Goel
Assistant Professor,
Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research(DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
[*ACCREDITED WITH "A+" GRADE BY NAAC, GOI*],
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist:Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph. No: 02697-265060, Ext. No. : 5297
https://parthgoelblog.wordpress.com/

subject: The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles | Volume 10 - Issue 1
snippet: Welcome to Quill The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles Greetings from CHARUSAT! In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we are delighted to introduce Quill â€” the official
content:
[Welcome to Quill]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/wx675d1tcad9c/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/a31db465432dd089f9e892e8753dafb6c5467911]


THE QUILL: CHARUSAT CHRONICLES

Greetings from CHARUSAT!

In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we
are delighted to introduce QUILL â€” the official newsletter of
CHARUSAT. True to its name, Quill embodies the spirit of creativity,
intellect, and expression that defines our vibrant community.

WHATâ€™S INSIDE QUILL?

 	* ACCOLADES: CHARUSAT'S EXCELLENCE â€“ Celebrating extraordinary
accomplishments of our students, faculty, and alumni.
 	* RESEARCH PUBLICATIONS: THE EDGE OF EXPLORATION â€“ Showcasing
groundbreaking discoveries.
 	* EMINENT SPEAKERS: UNVEILING NEW PERCEPTIONS â€“ Dive into engaging
conversations and transformative ideas.
 	* CAMPUS BUZZ: CELEBRATING CAMPUS LIFE â€“ Experience the energy and
excitement of campus life.
 	* FACULTY SPOTLIGHT: ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE â€“ Highlighting the
brilliance of our faculty.
 	* STUDENT SPOTLIGHT: RISING STARS â€“ Inspiring stories of our
student community.

Quill is more than just a newsletter; it is a chronicle of our shared
vision, growth, and success. Join us in celebrating the milestones and
moments that make CHARUSAT a hub of inspiration and innovation.

[Quill Cover Page]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/wx675d1tcad9c/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/acc0b593868118ea4029db7c89d967632bd3964b]

Warm regards,
THE EDITORIAL TEAM
CHARUSAT

subject: Join the National Cyber Security Awareness Workshop
snippet: Dear Students, I came across an excellent opportunity for you to enhance your cybersecurity knowledgeâ€” the National Cyber Security Awareness Workshop, organized by Cyber Space India as part of the
content:
Dear Students,

I came across an excellent opportunity for you to enhance your
cybersecurity knowledgeâ€” the *National Cyber Security Awareness Workshop*,
organized by *Cyber Space India* as part of the *Indian Space Week*
initiative.

This workshop will cover crucial topics in cybersecurity and provide
insights from industry experts, making it a valuable experience for anyone
interested in staying informed about digital security.

*Key Details:*

   - *Event Name:* National Cyber Security Awareness Workshop
   - *Registration Link:* https://workshop.indiaspaceweek.org/

If this aligns with your interests, I encourage you to register and make
the most of this learning opportunity. This is a great opportunity to learn
from industry experts and stay updated on the latest trends in
cybersecurity.

For further details, please refer to the registration link above.

*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*

--

subject: Re: CCNA Academy - Introduction to Basics of Networking Technology @ DEPSTAR in AY:2024-25
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! We are excited to announce an orientation session for the CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate) program, which will take place this Friday (03/01/2025) at 11:
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

We are excited to announce an orientation session for the *CCNA* (Cisco
Certified Network Associate) program, which will take place *this Friday
(03/01/2025) at 11:45 AM* in *Room 329 (SH)*.

This session is open to all students interested in learning more about the
CCNA certification, course details, and how it can benefit your future
career in networking and IT.

*Details:*

   - *Date:* 03/01/2025
   - *Time:* 11:45 AM
   - *Location:* Room 329
   - *Resource Person:* Dr. Amit Nayak (HOD DIT)

We encourage you to attend if you are considering pursuing CCNA
certification or simply want to learn more and get a better understanding
of the CCNA program.

We look forward to seeing you there!

On Thu, Dec 26, 2024 at 12:17â€¯PM Ritika Jani <ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>
wrote:

> *Dear Students,*
> [image: cleardot.gif]
>
> Greetings for the day!!!
>
> We are excited to announce that Devang Patel Institute of Advance
> Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) is offering specialized networking
> knowledge through the *CCNA Academy*, along with the opportunity to earn
> the CCNA certification.
>
> The Cisco Networking Academy Program provides students with valuable
> internet technology skills through certifications like *CCNA* and *CCNP*.
> The goal of this program is to train and equip students to design, build,
> and maintain complex computer networks, addressing the demands of the
> digital economy and providing access to cutting-edge IT and
> telecommunications technologies.
> *Objectives:*
>
>    - To provide students at DEPSTAR with highly employable IT skills in
>    internet networking.
>    - To help meet the growing demand for skilled networking
>    professionals, reducing the need for foreign talent in the industry.
>
> *Methodology:*
>
> Cisco Systems will supply the curriculum, training materials, and program
> support needed to establish and maintain the academy. Students will have
> access to comprehensive online study materials, including interactive labs,
> helping them develop confidence and hands-on experience in networking. The
> Cisco curriculum ensures the development of practical computer networking
> knowledge and skills.
> *Scope of the Certification Course:*
>
> In todayâ€™s competitive job market, many organizations prefer professionals
> with not only a degree but also relevant certifications. The Cisco
> Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification is one of the most
> recognized credentials in the industry. By completing the CCNA program,
> students will gain a deep understanding of networking principles and
> concepts.
>
> *CCNA Networking Competencies Include:*
>
>    - Understanding computer hardware, software, electricity, networking
>    terminology, and protocols.
>    - LANs and WANs, OSI model, Ethernet, and IP addressing.
>    - Designing and documenting basic network infrastructure and
>    structured cabling.
>    - Network-to-network communication.
>
> *Course Fees:*
>
>    - 2000 INR
>
> The CCNA Academy classes will be held on the *1st and 3rd Saturdays of
> each semester*.
>
> Interested students can register by filling out the Google form:
> https://forms.gle/y7JpPyz95GzxKLqb6
>
> For more details about the course, please visit the official Cisco
> Networking Academy site:
> https://www.netacad.com/
>
> Course content:
> https://www.netacad.com/courses/networking
> *Tutor:*
>
> Dr. Amit Nayak (Ph.D., Head of the Department - Information Technology)
> *CCNA Academy Statistics at DEPSTAR:*
>
>    - *AY 2017-18:* 42 students
>    - *AY 2018-19:* 32 students
>    - *AY 2019-20:* 32 students
>    - *AY 2020-21:* 33 students
>    - *AY 2021-22:* 16 students
>
> For any queries, feel free to reach out to *Ritika Jani* or *Dr. Amit
> Nayak*.
>
> --
> *Thanks and Regards,*
> *RITIKA JANI.*
> *Assistant Professor.*
> *Department of Information Technology,*
>
> *Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
> *CHARUSAT, Changa.*
>
> *"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*
>


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Fwd: Whistle Blower Policy
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Kindly go through the attachment of the Whistle Blower Policy from tailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Kindly go through the attachment of  the Whistle Blower Policy from tailing
mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Jan 1, 2025 at 10:09â€¯AM
Subject: Whistle Blower Policy
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Provost CHARUSAT <provost@charusat.ac.in>


To,
All CHARUSAT Family members,

The CHARUSAT university believes in upholding high standards of integrity
and ethical behaviour and strives to confirm in all its actions to this
core value. The university is engaged with several stakeholders, each being
critical in helping the university to achieve its vision and mission.
Employees are expected to observe high morals by following right conduct
with honesty and that too without any fear.



In view that a policy for â€œWhistle Blowerâ€ is prepared and circulated for
the information of all the employees, students and stakeholders of the
university.



The purpose of the Whistle Blowing is to correct something wrong or illegal
and not to serve any personal advancement i.e it has to be done in good
faith and for the betterment of the functioning of the university (i.e
academic and administrative).



The Whistle Blower policy is attached herewith for information of all the
CHARUSAT family members.


*[Note : all the Dean and Principal are hereby informed to circulate this
policy amongst all the students]*


Regards,


*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*






Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC


www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

Subject: Fwd: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | 2025
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Ropar <aiforall.iitrpr@masaischool.com>
Date: Tue, Dec 31, 2024 at 6:21â€¯AM
Subject: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | 2025
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

We are delighted to invite your students to participate in the *2025 First
Entrance Test* for IIT Ropar's prestigious *AI Minor Program*. This is an
exclusive opportunity to secure a *Minor in AI* with *15 credits*, a *Student
ID card*, and an *official email ID from IIT Ropar*, alongside a *5-day
campus immersion* program at IIT Ropar.

This unique program is designed for students passionate about Artificial
Intelligence and eager to learn directly from IIT professors. *Seats are
limitedâ€”out of 300, only 95 are left!*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITRoparEntranceTest2025/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/qrpPwGucqZSc64KdUa2FABtLdCA=406>*
*Date:* 5th January 2025 (Sunday)
*Mode:* Online
*Registration Link:* Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITRoparEntranceTest2025/2/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/ldU8nIOZISdynSvodhK5oRDSTdA=406>
Benefits
for selected students

   - *Minor with IIT Ropar Credits:* A valuable addition to any academic
   profile.
   - *Campus Immersion:* Experience life on the IIT Ropar campus during a
   5-day program.
   - *Guidance by IIT Professors:* Learn from experts like Prof. Sudarshan
   Iyenger, HoD, CSE Department, IIT Ropar. Watch Prof. Iyenger's Message
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FYHNAkPRwI0k/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/o67vpw6PtA_Gj52NQ2EeSE4TMLA=406>
   .
   - *Exclusive for Test Qualifiers:* Only those who clear the test and
   join the AI program can avail these benefits.

The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds* and
evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

Please share this information with your students and faculty to maximize
participation. Students can register now using the link above. *You can
easily share this information by clicking here to share via WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=Register%2520for%2520the%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Ropar%2527s%2520AI%2520Minor%2520Program%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520**5th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)**%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520**online**.%2520**Seats%2520are%2520limited%2520%25E2%2580%2594%2520out%2520of%2520300%252C%2520only%252095%2520left!**%250A%250AThis%2520program%2520offers%2520students%2520a%2520Minor%2520in%2520AI%2520with%2520**15%2520credits%252C%2520a%2520Student%2520ID%2520card%252C%2520and%2520an%2520official%2520email%2520ID%2520from%2520IIT%2520Ropar%252C%2520alongside%2520a%25205-day%2520campus%2520immersion%2520program.**%250A%250ALearn%2520directly%2520from%2520IIT%2520professors%2520like%2520Prof.%2520Sudarshan%2520Iyenger%252C%2520HoD%252C%2520CSE%2520Department%252C%2520IIT%2520Ropar%252C%2520and%2520embark%2520on%2520a%2520transformative%2520journey%2520in%2520Artificial%2520Intelligence.%2520%5BWatch%2520his%2520message%5D(https:%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FYHNAkPRwI0k)%250A%250A**Registration%2520Link%253A**%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITRoparEntranceTest2025%250A%250AEncourage%2520students%2520to%2520register%2520today%2520and%2520secure%2520their%2520spot!/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/qGxWFa_JfA8H4-nrVZ9NIcmGb_E=406>*

subject: Fwd: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | 2025
snippet: Dear Students, An opportunity to register for IIT Ropar's prestigious AI Minor Program, refer the trailing mail. Thank You. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <
content:
*Dear Students, *

*An opportunity to register for IIT Ropar's prestigious AI Minor
Program, refer the trailing mail.*

*Thank You. *

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Dec 31, 2024 at 9:23â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | 2025
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Ropar <aiforall.iitrpr@masaischool.com>
Date: Tue, Dec 31, 2024 at 6:21â€¯AM
Subject: Kindly share this opportunity with your students | 2025
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

We are delighted to invite your students to participate in the *2025 First
Entrance Test* for IIT Ropar's prestigious *AI Minor Program*. This is an
exclusive opportunity to secure a *Minor in AI* with *15 credits*, a *Student
ID card*, and an *official email ID from IIT Ropar*, alongside a *5-day
campus immersion* program at IIT Ropar.

This unique program is designed for students passionate about Artificial
Intelligence and eager to learn directly from IIT professors. *Seats are
limitedâ€”out of 300, only 95 are left!*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITRoparEntranceTest2025/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/qrpPwGucqZSc64KdUa2FABtLdCA=406>*
*Date:* 5th January 2025 (Sunday)
*Mode:* Online
*Registration Link:* Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITRoparEntranceTest2025/2/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/ldU8nIOZISdynSvodhK5oRDSTdA=406>
Benefits
for selected students

   - *Minor with IIT Ropar Credits:* A valuable addition to any academic
   profile.
   - *Campus Immersion:* Experience life on the IIT Ropar campus during a
   5-day program.
   - *Guidance by IIT Professors:* Learn from experts like Prof. Sudarshan
   Iyenger, HoD, CSE Department, IIT Ropar. Watch Prof. Iyenger's Message
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FYHNAkPRwI0k/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/o67vpw6PtA_Gj52NQ2EeSE4TMLA=406>
   .
   - *Exclusive for Test Qualifiers:* Only those who clear the test and
   join the AI program can avail these benefits.

The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds* and
evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

Please share this information with your students and faculty to maximize
participation. Students can register now using the link above. *You can
easily share this information by clicking here to share via WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=Register%2520for%2520the%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Ropar%2527s%2520AI%2520Minor%2520Program%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520**5th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)**%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520**online**.%2520**Seats%2520are%2520limited%2520%25E2%2580%2594%2520out%2520of%2520300%252C%2520only%252095%2520left!**%250A%250AThis%2520program%2520offers%2520students%2520a%2520Minor%2520in%2520AI%2520with%2520**15%2520credits%252C%2520a%2520Student%2520ID%2520card%252C%2520and%2520an%2520official%2520email%2520ID%2520from%2520IIT%2520Ropar%252C%2520alongside%2520a%25205-day%2520campus%2520immersion%2520program.**%250A%250ALearn%2520directly%2520from%2520IIT%2520professors%2520like%2520Prof.%2520Sudarshan%2520Iyenger%252C%2520HoD%252C%2520CSE%2520Department%252C%2520IIT%2520Ropar%252C%2520and%2520embark%2520on%2520a%2520transformative%2520journey%2520in%2520Artificial%2520Intelligence.%2520%5BWatch%2520his%2520message%5D(https:%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FYHNAkPRwI0k)%250A%250A**Registration%2520Link%253A**%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITRoparEntranceTest2025%250A%250AEncourage%2520students%2520to%2520register%2520today%2520and%2520secure%2520their%2520spot!/1/010001941a324712-e87291df-54f2-4cf7-9b6d-67efa7f9a95a-000000/qGxWFa_JfA8H4-nrVZ9NIcmGb_E=406>*

Best regards,
*Team IIT Ropar, AI Minor Program*

subject: Reg. Students Guidelines for IT266 Project I & Project detail submission link
snippet: Dear students, To ensure a smooth and productive experience for all students, we would like to remind you of the guidelines for the IT266 Pproject I. These guidelines are crucial for your successful
content:
Dear students,

To ensure a smooth and productive experience for all students, we would
like to remind you of the guidelines for the IT266 Pproject I. These
guidelines are crucial for your successful participation in the project and
will enable you to make the most of this valuable opportunity.

For project approval, please contact your respective subject Faculty. If
you are unable to find a good and innovative project, you may discuss it
with your respective subject faculty.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15PP_F4lrhcVWOUhQNz20Q7_FH0mZ8oLpDiZd7oLQ5to/edit?usp=sharing

Deadline to submit  (Project Details):  *03/01/2025 (Friday)*


-- 
Thanks & Regards,
Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Join SmileFiesta 2.0 â€“ A Day of Fun and Rejuvenation on January 2nd 2025
snippet: Kindly reach out to your counselor for any query. Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
content:
Kindly reach out to your counselor for any query.

*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Kishan Patel <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Dec 27, 2024 at 9:41â€¯AM
Subject: Invitation to Join SmileFiesta 2.0 â€“ A Day of Fun and Rejuvenation
on January 2nd 2025
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Faculty Members,

Greetings! Jay Hind !!

The U & PU Patel Department of Computer Engineering, in collaboration with
the Department of Information Technology, Department of Computer Science &
Technology, and Department of AIML, *CHARUSAT NSS Unit*, is delighted to
invite you to *SmileFiesta 2.0*â€”a day dedicated to relaxation, inspiration,
and connection.

This thoughtfully curated series of activities promises to provide a
refreshing break from your routine while fostering camaraderie and a sense
of community among our esteemed faculty members.
Hereâ€™s what we have in store for you on *Thursday, January 2nd 2025:*

1. Glow with Yoga ğŸŒŸğŸ§˜â€â™€ (9:00 AM - 10:00 AM)
Start your day with a calming yoga session designed to relax your mind and
rejuvenate your body through gentle movements and mindful breathing. Leave
feeling refreshed and glowing with positivity.

2. Smile Stories ğŸ˜ŠğŸ“– (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM)
Celebrate joy, kindness, and laughter in this heartwarming session of
story-sharing. Together, letâ€™s rediscover the power of positivity and its
impact on our well-being.

3. Pottery Playtime ğŸºğŸ¨ (12:00 PM - 2:00 PM)
Tap into your creative side by molding clay into unique pieces of art.
Whether youâ€™re a beginner or an expert, this therapeutic activity is sure
to leave you with a sense of accomplishment and relaxation.

4. Back to School Bash ğŸ’ğŸ‰ (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM)
Revisit the fun of school days with nostalgic mini-games like Lagori (Seven
Stones), Sakad, Lakhoti, and Dabba Eyes Spies. Relive childhood memories,
compete, and enjoy a lively afternoon with colleagues.

The exact venues for these sessions will be shared with you shortly.

We encourage you to join us for this memorable experience! Your
participation will make the event even more special. Please confirm your
attendance by filling out the Google Form at the link below:

subject: Fwd: Registration and Selection Trials for CHARUSAT Cricket Boys Team (AIU West Zone Inter-University Tournament)
snippet: Kindly reach out to your counselor for any query. Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
content:
Kindly reach out to your counselor for any query.

*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sports CHARUSAT <sports.officer@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Dec 26, 2024 at 10:27â€¯PM
Subject: Registration and Selection Trials for CHARUSAT Cricket Boys Team
(AIU West Zone Inter-University Tournament)
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students

All interested students are hereby informed that the registration and
selection trials for the CHARUSAT Cricket Team for participation in the AIU
West Zone Inter-University Cricket Tournament will be conducted as per the
following schedule:

Details of Registration

Registration Link:-
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdi8ZNNbl45OrI_okJMR2LOhDrbIO3CkO9s4EoYKX1tXrEyOQ/viewform?usp=sf_link

Selection Trials
Trial Dates: 28/12/2024
Time: 9:00 am
Venue: CHARUSAT Sports Complex (Cricket ground)

Eligibility Criteria
1. Must be a full-time student of CHARUSAT University.
2. Should meet the age and participation norms as per AIU guidelines.
3. Must possess basic cricket skills (batting, bowling, and fielding).
Selection Process
1. Skill assessment in batting, bowling, fielding, and fitness.
2. Performance evaluation during match simulations.
3. Final selection will be based on the recommendations of the selectors.

Important Notes
Bring your own cricket kit for the trials.
Players must arrive 30 minutes prior to the scheduled trial time.
Selected candidates will be notified through official communication
channels.
For further queries, contact the CHARUSAT Sports Section

Dr Pritesh Patel
Assistant Director, Physical Education & Sports
CHARUSAT University

--

subject: CCNA Academy - Introduction to Basics of Networking Technology @ DEPSTAR in AY:2024-25
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! We are excited to announce that Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) is offering specialized networking knowledge through the CCNA
content:
*Dear Students,*
[image: cleardot.gif]

Greetings for the day!!!

We are excited to announce that Devang Patel Institute of Advance
Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) is offering specialized networking
knowledge through the *CCNA Academy*, along with the opportunity to earn
the CCNA certification.

The Cisco Networking Academy Program provides students with valuable
internet technology skills through certifications like *CCNA* and *CCNP*.
The goal of this program is to train and equip students to design, build,
and maintain complex computer networks, addressing the demands of the
digital economy and providing access to cutting-edge IT and
telecommunications technologies.
*Objectives:*

   - To provide students at DEPSTAR with highly employable IT skills in
   internet networking.
   - To help meet the growing demand for skilled networking professionals,
   reducing the need for foreign talent in the industry.

*Methodology:*

Cisco Systems will supply the curriculum, training materials, and program
support needed to establish and maintain the academy. Students will have
access to comprehensive online study materials, including interactive labs,
helping them develop confidence and hands-on experience in networking. The
Cisco curriculum ensures the development of practical computer networking
knowledge and skills.
*Scope of the Certification Course:*

In todayâ€™s competitive job market, many organizations prefer professionals
with not only a degree but also relevant certifications. The Cisco
Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification is one of the most
recognized credentials in the industry. By completing the CCNA program,
students will gain a deep understanding of networking principles and
concepts.

*CCNA Networking Competencies Include:*

   - Understanding computer hardware, software, electricity, networking
   terminology, and protocols.
   - LANs and WANs, OSI model, Ethernet, and IP addressing.
   - Designing and documenting basic network infrastructure and structured
   cabling.
   - Network-to-network communication.

*Course Fees:*

   - 2000 INR

The CCNA Academy classes will be held on the *1st and 3rd Saturdays of each
semester*.

Interested students can register by filling out the Google form:
https://forms.gle/y7JpPyz95GzxKLqb6

For more details about the course, please visit the official Cisco
Networking Academy site:
https://www.netacad.com/

Course content:
https://www.netacad.com/courses/networking
*Tutor:*

Dr. Amit Nayak (Ph.D., Head of the Department - Information Technology)
*CCNA Academy Statistics at DEPSTAR:*

   - *AY 2017-18:* 42 students
   - *AY 2018-19:* 32 students
   - *AY 2019-20:* 32 students
   - *AY 2020-21:* 33 students
   - *AY 2021-22:* 16 students

For any queries, feel free to reach out to *Ritika Jani* or *Dr. Amit Nayak*
.

-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: [Welcome to Replit] The next billion software creators
snippet: Hi Om, We're on a mission to bring the next billion software creators online. If more people can code, more people can independently create, innovate, and build wealth on the internetâ€”no matter
content:
Hi Om,

 Weâ€™re on a mission to bring the next billion software creators online. If 
more people can code, more people can independently create, innovate, and build 
wealth on the internetâ€”no matter where they are in the world. By using Replit, 
youâ€™re becoming part of that future.
â€Š

Meet Replit Agent: Your AI Coding Partner

 To help make your coding journey as seamless as possible, we built Replit 
Agentâ€”an AI-powered assistant designed to support you every step of the way. 
Whether youâ€™re a seasoned developer or just beginning, Replit Agent is here to 
accelerate your learning and bring your ideas to life faster than ever:


 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IYiVPrxY8-Y> â€Š

In this short video <https://youtu.be/IYiVPrxY8-Y>, we walk through how Replit 
Agent can help you:

 ğŸš€ Start Creating Instantly: Replit Agent takes care of the setup, so you can 
bring your ideas to life.

ğŸ¤– AI-Powered Assistance: Think of Replit Agent as your team of software 
engineers on demand, helping with everything from simple fixes to complex 
projects.

 â¬†ï¸ Inspired Creation: See an app or website that inspires you? Simply 
screenshot, upload, and Agent will build it

â˜ï¸ Easy Deployment: When youâ€™re ready to share your work, Replit Agent 
simplifies deployment so you can bring your project to life online.
â€Š

ğŸ’¡ Getting started with Replit


Login to Replit: Start exploring the platform and experiment with your first 
code.

Meet Replit Agent: Sign up <https://replit.com/~?upgrade=1> for Core, and let 
Replit Agent guide you through creation, setup, and even deployment.

Watch the Agent Launch Video <https://youtu.be/IYiVPrxY8-Y>: Take a closer 
look at how Replit Agent can transform your workflow.

 Weâ€™re excited to see where this journey takes you. If you ever have questions 
or need a hand, our team and the Replit community are here to help. Together, 
weâ€™re building a future where anyone can create with code, and weâ€™re thrilled 
to have you along for the ride.

Happy Building!

The Replit Team


â€Š

subject: Fwd: Offer for the CHARUSAT Girl Students to watch 31st (2024) Gujarati Movie for free
snippet: Dear Girl Students, you can avail the offer, excluding college hours. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Convener ULSC <convener.ecc@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Dec 23, 2024 at 4:24 PM
content:
Dear Girl Students,

you can avail the offer, *excluding college hours.*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener ULSC <convener.ecc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Dec 23, 2024 at 4:24â€¯PM
Subject: Offer for the CHARUSAT Girl Students to watch 31st (2024) Gujarati
Movie for free
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>, <family@charusat.edu.in
>


Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,



Recently a Gujarati movie entitled '*31st (2024)*" has been released in
theatres. The movie is based on a real life incident, which happened to a
girl in Ahmedabad. You can get more information about the film from online
sources.



The producer of the movie has extended the Free Movie Review for *CHARUSAT
Girl Students*. The girl students currently pursuing their studies at
CHARUSAT will get a *free entry in the theatres* after showing her student
I-Card, issued by CHARUSAT, at the ticket counter of the theatre.



Girl students and Lady Faculty members can avail the offer at *Shaan Cinema
â€“ Anand* and *Lux Cinema - Petlad* till December 28, 2024. The offer is
limited to the scheduled shows of the film. The entry is subject to the
availability of seats. One ticket will be issued for one I-card. The offer
is limited for the film viewing only, other facilities are not the part of
this scheme.



We wish the maximum number of students to avail this offer.



Thank you.




PS: The right of the entry is reserved by the cinema owner.


With regards,
Regards,
Convener/ Co-convener,
ULSC-CHARUSAT.


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Canada Day by IDP â€“ A Unique Study Abroad Opportunity
snippet: Dear Students, We are delighted to inform you about an exciting opportunity to gain valuable insights into studying in Canada through the upcoming "Canada Day by IDP" event, exclusively
content:
Dear Students,



We are delighted to inform you about an exciting opportunity to gain
valuable insights into studying in Canada through the upcoming *"Canada Day
by IDP"* event, exclusively hosted for you at CHARUSAT University in
collaboration with IDP Education.



This event is designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of
the opportunities that await in Canada and address common misconceptions
about studying there. Highlights of the event include:



Â·  *Expert Talk:* "Breaking the Myths about the Present Scenario of
Studying in Canada and Fact-Checking the Enormous Opportunities Awaiting in
Canada."



Â·  *One-on-One Counseling:* Get personalized guidance and profile
assessments from IDP's Canada team experts.



Â·  *On-the-Spot Solutions:* Address your queries directly with experienced
counselors.



*Event Details:*

Â·  *Date:* Tuesday, December 31, 2024

Â·  *Time:* 11:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM

Â·  *Venue:* IIIM Auditorium, CHARUSAT University Campus

Â·  *Registration Link:* Register Here
<https://forms.gle/sNBS7gZavGohxxtG8> (Please
use your CHARUSAT email ID to register.)



This is a remarkable opportunity to explore the possibilities of studying
in Canada and receive tailored advice for the academic journey. We
encourage you to register and make the most of this exclusive event.



Seats are limited, so please register as soon as you can to secure your
participation.



If you have any questions, please get in touch with Dr. Vijay Makwana at
+91 99983 80041.




Thanks & Regards,

*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Reg. University Elective Course Selection - UG Semester 4_ AY_2024-25
snippet: Dear Students, The syllabus booklet for the University Elective Course(s) for UG Semester 4 is attached for your reference. Kindly select your preferred course for Semester 4 by December 28, 2024,
content:
*Dear Students,*

The syllabus booklet for the *University Elective Course(s) for UG Semester
4 *is attached for your reference.

Kindly select your preferred course for Semester 4 by *December 28,
2024*, *without
fail.*



 Please find the dates for the conduction of university elective lectures &
examinations.



*Lecture dates: 01-Feb-2025, 15-Feb-2025, and 01-Mar-2025*

*Exam dates: 04-Apr-2025 and 05-Apr-2025*



If you have any questions, feel free to reach out.
--

Best Regards,
Dipika A. Damodar,
Assistant Professor ,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Reg. Course Registration of 4th semester B.Tech IT of AY:2024-25 in e-governance
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! Course registration for the 4th semester (Even term, A Y. 2024-25) can now be done in e-governance. So, you all are hereby informed to complete the course registration
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings!!!

*Course registration* for the* 4th semester *(Even term, A Y. 2024-25) can
now be done in e-governance. So, you all are hereby informed to *complete
the course registration process in e-governance on or before 23/12/2024
without fail.*

Link to access e-governance: https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/

*From the Program Elective Course(s) - Group 1, offered subject is below*

*HS111.03A - HUMAN VALUES AND ETHICS*

The elective course details are attached herewith for your reference.

Selected courses will not be changed later.

*The deadline will not be extended in any circumstances.*

Feel free to contact your batch counselor in case of any queries/doubts.

-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Successful Blood Donation Camp â€“ A Heartfelt Thank You to the CHARUSAT Family
snippet: Successful Blood Donation Camp â€“ A Heartfelt Thank You to the CHARUSAT Family Dear CHARUSAT Family, We are pleased to share the remarkable success of the Blood Donation Camp held on December 20th, 2024
content:
* Successful Blood Donation Camp â€“ A Heartfelt Thank You to the CHARUSAT
Family*

Dear CHARUSAT Family,

We are pleased to share the remarkable success of the Blood Donation Camp
held on December 20th, 2024. This event was made possible thanks to the
unwavering dedication of our entire CHARUSAT Family.

A special mention goes to *the student team*, whose active participation
and enthusiasm played a pivotal role in making this life-saving initiative
a reality. Their commitment to service and compassion truly reflects the
core values of our university.

For your reference, we have attached *the list of student participants *along
with *some glimpses of the event*.

Such events are a testament to the strong spirit of collaboration at
CHARUSAT. Your encouragement and involvement are key to inspiring us to
organize more impactful activities in the future.

We are grateful for your continued support and look forward to your
participation in future endeavors.

Together, letâ€™s continue to make a meaningful difference in society and
strengthen our commitment to community service.


---Thanks & Regards---
Mr. Kishan Patel
Program Coordinator
CHARUSAT NSS Unit
CHARUSAT, Changa 388421

--

subject: Reg. NCAT Test for 6th and 4th Semester
snippet: Dear Placements Interested Students, This is to inform all placement-interested students that the National Career Aptitude Test (NCAT) is scheduled to be conducted soon. Participation in this test is
content:
Dear Placements Interested Students,

This is to inform all placement-interested students that the *National
Career Aptitude Test (NCAT)* is scheduled to be conducted soon.
Participation in this test is *compulsory* as part of your placement
preparation process.

The NCAT results will be closely monitored by the departmental placement
coordinators, and your performance in this test will contribute
significantly to your placement readiness evaluation.

*College Name*

*City*

*For Courses*

*Pass out Year*

*Test Name*

*Date*

*Timings*

*Pre-registration link for students*

*(To be shared with students as soon as possible)*

*Test Link*

*(To be shared with the students on test date)*

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research, Anand

Anand

      All courses

2025,2026,2027

NCAT

21/12/2024

10:00 AM â€“ 6:00 PM

*https://naukri.com/campus/campusreg/nccnrk4
<https://naukri.com/campus/campusreg/nccnrk4>*

*https://www.naukri.com/campus/ncat-aptitude-test?src=gnbPrepare&utm_source=Sarika&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=NCAT
<https://www.naukri.com/campus/ncat-aptitude-test?src=gnbPrepare&utm_source=Sarika&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=NCAT>*



*Test Details:*

*Test duration: 60* minutes

*Test Content* â€“

1)      Verbal Ability

2)      Quantitative Aptitude

3)      Logical Reasoning


--
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

Baa (àª®àª‚àª—àª² àª¬àª¾ àª¨à«€ àªªà«àª£à«àª¯àª¤àª¿àª¥àª¿ àª¨àª¿àª®àª¿àª¤à«‡)

convener.ecc@charusat.ac.in>, Pritesh Patel <
priteshpatel.sports@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>,
Dean CHARUSAT <dean@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,*

Greetings

We are pleased to announce that the *10th Blood Donation Camp in Memory of
Mangla Baa (*àª®àª‚àª—àª²àª¾ àª¬àª¾ àª¨à«€ àªªà«àª£à«àª¯àª¤àª¿àª¥àª¿ àª¨àª¿àª®àª¿àª¤à«‡) is scheduled to be held on *20th
December 2024*, from *08:00 AM to 04:00 PM* at *"AASTHA," Indukaka Marg,
Vallabh Vidyanagar*.

To ensure the success of this noble cause, we humbly request All Faculty
Members, Staff Members and Students For kind support in Blood Donation.
Kindly *fill out the attached Registration form* to confirm participation.
We are expecting a Participation of at least * Minimum 10 Members per
