subject: Participation in Endowment Chair
snippet: Dear All, Thank you for showing interest in the Endowment chair activity. I request you all to take maximum advantage of all the sessions and get an interaction chance with the session expert. A
content:
Dear All,

Thank you for showing interest in the Endowment chair activity. I request
you all to take maximum advantage of all the sessions and get an
interaction chance with the session expert.

A certificate will be provided to those who attend all these sessions.
Those who want to interact with Sir, regarding your projects/research,
kindly register here <https://forms.gle/qGHHLFraWu7yeDnY8>(before 10 PM
today).
Join the WhatsApp group <https://chat.whatsapp.com/Gu4iXiTsLSlEdqvUAT2uk3>
for quick updates.

*Venue: 245 Seminar Hall first floor, A6 Building*
*Session time:9:10 to 11:10*
*Interaction Time: 12:00 PM onward*

Kindly check the detailed schedule below

*Day*

*Date*

*Time*

*Agenda*

1

19th December

9:00 am to 11:00 am

The Philosophy of Science: Doing Meaningful Science in the 21st Century

(Seminar Hall,1st floor,  A6 Building)

12:00 pm to 3:30 pm

Interaction with faculties and HoDs

(Interested faculties are requested to do the registration in link
<https://forms.gle/hkJGj9qBNeh4F9Mg9>)

*(Room No: 625)*

2

20th December

9:00 am to 11:00 am

Network Science: A Graph Theoretical Paradigm for Modelling Complex Systems

(Seminar Hall,1st floor,  A6 Building)

12:00 pm to 3:30 pm

Interaction with PhD research scholars

(Interested research scholars are requested to do the registration in link
<https://forms.gle/hkJGj9qBNeh4F9Mg9>) (*Room 628B)*

3

21st December

9:00 am to 11:00 am

Computational Creativity: Application of Artificial Intelligence for
Imitating Human Creativity

(Seminar Hall,1st floor,  A6 Building)

12:00 pm to 3:30 pm

Interaction with faculties for writing effective articles and proposal

(Interested faculties are requested to do the registration in link
<https://forms.gle/hkJGj9qBNeh4F9Mg9>)

*(Room 628B)*




-- 
Best Regards,
*Deep Kothadiya, PhD*
Assistant Professor
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science And Technology
CHARUSAT- Changa

--

content:
*Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,*

Greetings

We are pleased to announce that the *10th Blood Donation Camp in Memory of
Mangla Baa (*àª®àª‚àª—àª²àª¾ àª¬àª¾ àª¨à«€ àªªà«àª£à«àª¯àª¤àª¿àª¥àª¿ àª¨àª¿àª®àª¿àª¤à«‡) is scheduled to be held on *20th
December 2024*, from *08:00 AM to 04:00 PM* at *"AASTHA," Indukaka Marg,
Vallabh Vidyanagar*.

To ensure the success of this noble cause, we humbly request All Faculty
Members, Staff Members and Students For kind support in Blood Donation.
Kindly *fill out the attached Registration form* to confirm participation.
We are expecting a Participation of at least * Minimum 10 Members per
department/Institute* to make this event a success.

Registration Link:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeK3xjEBzWG-Op23zkYgo6d8fNl-Mv9AC7FCApND6Ble1-AuQ/viewform?usp=sf_link

   - Reporting Time at Central Lawn on 20/12/2024 : 09:10 AM on Sharp


   - Transportation Will Provided by CHARUSAT.
   - Refreshment will Provided by the Organizer.

Your small act of kindness can make a big difference in saving lives. Letâ€™s
unite and *be heroes* by promoting the spirit of donation and service.

*P.S.: @Counselors Please Pass this Information to Students Via **WhatsApp*
*Group.*

Thank you for your cooperation and support!

subject: Fwd: Get Students Placement Success with Our Free Interview Masterclass
snippet: Dear Students, You are requested to attend the session. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <info@cvdragon.com> Date: Mon, Dec 16, 2024 at 10:33 AM Subject: Get Students Placement
content:
Dear Students,

You are requested to attend the session.



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <info@cvdragon.com>
Date: Mon, Dec 16, 2024 at 10:33â€¯AM
Subject: Get Students Placement Success with Our Free Interview Masterclass
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>



Dear Institute,

As the *placement season* approaches for the *Class of 2025*, we at
*cvDragon* are excited to offer an exclusive opportunity to help your
students prepare for success. We are hosting a *Free Interview Masterclass*
designed to equip students with the essential skills they need to impress
recruiters and excel in interviews.

We present *The Ultimate Interview Masterclass* a power-packed session that
covers everything your students need to excel in both *digital and
in-person interviews*. With *recruiters increasingly looking for candidates
who can demonstrate confidence, problem-solving skills, and strong
communication*, this workshop gives students the tools to excel.

Why Should Your Students Attend?

   - Ensure students are fully prepared for the upcoming *placement season*.
   - Learn how to make a *lasting impression on recruiters*.
   - Gain confidence in handling the *Top 10 most asked interview questions*
   .
   - Develop essential skills for both *digital and in-person interviews*.
   - Receive a *certificate of participation*.

We kindly request you to share the following details with your students so
they can register for this valuable opportunity.

*Workshop Details:*
*Date*: 19th December, 2024
*Timings*: 7:00 PM- 9:00 PM
*Registration Link:* https://cvdragon.com/sessions/MCI/register/13718

If you have any questions or need further information, feel free to reach
out.

Ritika Kiradoo
cvDragon
91-9883124674
If you do not want to receive emails from cvDragon: Unsubscribe
<https://cvdragon.com/responses/unsubscribe/13718/principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


-- 
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: Fwd: Energy Conservation Cell: Poster making Competition for Students & Staff of CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!! Interested students may apply for the competition - more details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <
content:
Dear Students,
Greetings for the day!!

Interested students may apply for the competition -  more details are in
trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Dec 13, 2024 at 4:13â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Energy Conservation Cell: Poster making Competition for
Students & Staff of CHARUSAT
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Head Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Dec 13, 2024 at 3:46â€¯PM
Subject: Energy Conservation Cell: Poster making Competition for Students &
Staff of CHARUSAT
To: Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>, Principal
CIPS <principal.cips@charusat.ac.in>, Principal I2IM CHARUSAT <
principal.iiim@charusat.ac.in>, Principal MTIN CHARUSAT <
principal.mtin@charusat.ac.in>, Principal PDPIAS CHARUSAT <
principal.pdpias@charusat.ac.in>, Principal RPCP CHARUSAT <
principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in>, HOD
Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>, Principal ARIP <principal.arip@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <
principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Respect Sir/Ma'am,
Please convey this mail to students, staff, and student counselors and
encourage them to participate.
___

Dear All,
Energy Conservation Cell-CHARUSAT has organized a hand-drawn poster-making
competition for students and staff of CHARUSAT on the occasion of "National
Energy Conservation Day-14th December 2024."

The theme of the poster is "Innovations in Energy Saving."  The participant
has to submit an *A3 size hand-drawn pencil sketch poster *to the Head,
Electrical Engineering Department, CSPIT (Room No. 136, A6 Building,
CAPIT) before 6 January 2025, 04.30 pm.

First Three winners will be awarded prize money.
No Entry Fee.
For more details, contact: Head, Electrical Engineering Dept., CSPIT.

Regards,
____
--
Dr. Nilaykumar A. Patel
Associate professor & Head,
Electrical Engineering Dept.
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,
Changa. 388421
Ta: Petlad.
Phone:02697 265041

My Web Page: https://sites.google.com/charusat.ac.in/nilaypatel/home


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

CODE REVIEW 2024






 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/code-review-2024/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=EOY2024&utm_content=announcement_header_img>











Just like you, weâ€™ve grown a lot. Weâ€™ve evolved from a platform where you 
write your first line of code into a place that helps you develop tech skills 
for any stage in your career. Weâ€™ve added new domains (like cloud and 
cybersecurity), new AI features to learn faster than ever, and helped you 
actualize new opportunities to further your career with things like industry 
certification prep.



And we couldnâ€™t have done it without you. 



Join us as we look back at our favorite moments, milestones, and stats in this 
yearâ€™s Code Review.


Check it out 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/code-review-2024/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=EOY2024&utm_content=announcement_cta1>



















The year in stats


Join us as we look back at our favorite moments, milestones, and stats in this 
yearâ€™s Code Review.









507,530,006 minutes 


Learners (including you!) spent over 507 million minutes in our learning 
environment this year. Thatâ€™s a lot of new skills added, projects created, and 
careers developed!













220+ courses & 20+ certification paths 


We worked hard to help you diversify your skills and expand your learning into 
new domains like cloud, IT, and professional skills. We also added new paths 
for you to prep for top industry certifications.













20,000+ interview simulations 


Interviewing is crucial for growing in your career. Since launching, our 
Interview Simulator hit 20K+ simulations, helping thousands of people perfect 
skills to land a dream job.













676,443,705 XP 


We created skill XP to help you visualize your day-to-day growth. In just a 
few short months, our entire community earned over 676 million (yes, million) 
XP.


















Dive into more data with this yearâ€™s Code Review


Check it out 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/code-review-2024/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=EOY2024&utm_content=announcement_cta2>

December 2024











Time to reflect and recharge


If this time of year has you feeling like your battery is low, youâ€™re not 
alone. Whether itâ€™s work, school, or the holidays, thereâ€™s plenty to keep us 
busy, but itâ€™s also a good time to pause and reflect on how far youâ€™ve come 
this year before you jump back into your learning journey. Read on for tips on 
celebrating wins small and large, insights into the current state of the tech 
industry from thousands of IT professionals, and more.

â€Œ


Thanks for learning with us, 

The Codecademy Team 







NEW SKILL PATHS <> 




 
<https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/information-technology?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=it_course_catalog_img>




Prepare for your next career move with in-demand IT certifications


Earning an industry certification can boost your credibility as you build a 
career in tech, and our new certification prep skill paths â€” included with your 
Pro or Plus membership â€” will prepare you for top IT certifications like 
CompTIA A+, Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), and more. Not ready to 
commit to one path? Start with one of our free foundational courses like 
Networking Fundamentals.


Explore the IT catalog 
<https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/information-technology?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=it_course_catalog_cta>






NEW COURSES <> 



 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-object-oriented-programming-with-c-plus-plus?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_oop_course_img>

Learn Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) with C++


Implement the four basic principles of object-oriented programming in C++.


Start course 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-object-oriented-programming-with-c-plus-plus?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_oop_course_cta>

 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-data-storytelling?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_data_storytelling_course_img>

Learn Data Storytelling


Use data visualization and basic design principles to create compelling data 
stories tailored to your audience.


Start course 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-data-storytelling?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_data_storytelling_course_cta>






UPCOMING EVENTS <> 






December 19


Comic Quest: Web Scraping Basics with Python

Register now 
<https://community.codecademy.com/c/events/comic-quest-web-scraping-basics-with-python?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=community_events_web_scraping_cta>












Bienvenidas y bienvenidos a CÃ³digo Club


Weâ€™re excited to introduce our new club for Spanish speaking learners. From 
Club Captain Ariel Gonzales AgÃ¼ero: â€œLa misiÃ³n de este club va mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de solo 
proporcionar contenido en espaÃ±ol; su objetivo es crear una experiencia 
comunitaria donde el idioma nos une, y lo usamos como una herramienta que 
fortalezca el aprendizaje y la colaboraciÃ³n.â€

Check it out 
<https://community.codecademy.com/c/codigo/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=community_events_codigo_club_cta>












Join the Women in Tech Club


Weâ€™ve also launched a new space for women in the community to come together to 
develop technical skills, share knowledge, and help one another reach their 
full potential in a male-dominated industry. Come create lasting connections 
and get inspired!

Learn more 
<https://community.codecademy.com/c/women-in-tech/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=community_events_women_in_tech_cta>


















FROM THE BLOG <> 




 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/small-wins-to-celebrate/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=blog_professional_developer_img>


7 Small Wins To Celebrate On Your Journey To Becoming A Professional Developer


As we say goodbye to another year, it's time to reflect on how far you've 
come. Here are a few milestones to celebrate as you learn.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/small-wins-to-celebrate/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=december_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=blog_professional_developer_cta>

management and experience and organization.


Michelle Clement
Web Developer
South of England

subject: Fwd: Documentary film making Competition
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Showcase your talent in documentary film making competition specially highlighting women empowerment. More details are given in trailing mail. ----------
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Showcase your talent in documentary film making competition specially
highlighting women empowerment. More details are given in trailing mail.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener Women Development Cell CHARUSAT <convener.wdc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Dec 3, 2024 at 10:32â€¯AM
Subject: Documentary film making Competition
To: Womencell CHARUSAT <womencellmembers.charusat@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All!!

I hope this message finds you well. As part of our celebrations for Women's
Day, we are excited to announce a documentary film competition that aims to
highlight the incredible stories of women and their contributions to
society.

This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your work and creativity while
making a statement about the importance of womenâ€™s representation in media.

**Key Details**

Ã˜  The film should follow the theme of the competition:

*Womenâ€™s empowerment, achievements, safety and hygiene*

Ã˜ Duration: Documentaries should be between 15 minutes.

Ã˜ Awards: Prizes will be awarded in cash for the top three submissions,
with an opportunity to screen your film at our Womenâ€™s Day event.

Ã˜ The short film must be original and no watermark of any kind should be on
the film.

Ã˜ The film must be of the highest quality possible.

Ã˜ Last date for submission of online entry form along with the film link is
28th February 2025.

Ã˜ No submission will be considered after *28th February 2025*.

Ã˜ Films will be judged entirely on the concept, technical aspects.

Ã˜ The decision of the jury members is final.

Ã˜ Each applicant may submit only one film.

Ã˜ The film should be with a massage.



There is no registration fee for this competition. Registration open
till *16th December
2024*:

*https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeKrNSJkOom9HV3WEk4B_bCExFIFXtADCeGUq_ErOApTI3p7Q/viewform?usp=sf_link
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeKrNSJkOom9HV3WEk4B_bCExFIFXtADCeGUq_ErOApTI3p7Q/viewform?usp=sf_link>*



Looking forward to seeing your amazing films!

*Regards,*
*WDC Convener*



-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

snippet: Dear Students Greetings for the Day!!! Nice opportunity to get recognized. More details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@
content:
Dear Students

Greetings for the Day!!!

Nice opportunity to get recognized. More details are in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Dec 4, 2024 at 11:50â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: AICTE & MIC || KAPILA- Funding opportunity for 100 Patents
Per Institution â€“ REGISTRATION OPEN for KAPILA 2024-25 (Phase II) || Submit
applications by 31st December 2024
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All
Good opportunity although our university is helping us in that direction.
So, please read it carefully and approach to your HoD for  further
assistant, if any.
With regards

Bankim Patel

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ahmedabad Indovation Centre <indovation.ahmedabad@aicte-india.org>
Date: Wed, Dec 4, 2024 at 11:35â€¯AM
Subject: AICTE & MIC || KAPILA- Funding opportunity for 100 Patents Per
Institution â€“ REGISTRATION OPEN for KAPILA 2024-25 (Phase II) || Submit
applications by 31st December 2024
To: indovation ahmedabad <indovation.ahmedabad@aicte-india.org>
Cc: Mitesh Vadher <inf.ahmedabad@aicte-india.org>


Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings from AICTE & the Ministry of Educationâ€™s Innovation Cell,
Government of India.

*â€œAvail funding for a patent through KAPILAâ€*

AICTE and Ministry of Educationâ€™s Innovation Cell (MIC), has launched
the â€œ*Kalam
Program for IP Literacy and Awareness (KAPILA)*â€.

We are pleased to announce the launch of the KAPILA 2024-25 Scheme
(Phase-III) for all Higher Education Institutions (HEIs), to provide
financial support and assistance to innovators.

This scheme presents an opportunity for your institution to benefit from
patent filing and examination fee on reimbursement mode. We encourage the
Institute to participate in the application process and take advantage of
this initiative.

Under the Scheme, Institutes having patents filed by the HEIs on or after
1st April 2023 to the Indian Patent Office will be considered. Further, the
Applications filed by HEIs on or after 1st March 2024 will be considered
for reimbursement submit a filed patent application may be eligible to
receive a reimbursement of *100% of the total application cost* (Filling &
Examination Fee). This reimbursement offer is available for a maximum of *100
patent applications* per year per Institute.
We want to emphasize that the KAPILA Scheme is now open to all higher
education institutions.

For more detailed information, including eligibility criteria, application
guidelines, and reimbursement procedures, please refer to the attached
document or visit our official website.
â—  *KAPILA Scheme document:*
https://kapila.mic.gov.in/KAPILA%20Scheme%20Document.pdf
â—  *User guide:*
https://kapila.mic.gov.in/KAPILA%20User%20Guidlines%202024.pdf

Please note that only *conveners of the KAPILA Committee *can register
their institute and submit applications on behalf of the applicants, not
individuals (students/faculty). After the Convener completes institute
registration, kindly inform their respective Institute students and faculty
to apply.

*NOTE: All Higher Education Institutions are eligible to apply for the
scheme and can submit their applications by 31st December 2024 (KAPILA
2024-25 Phase-III).*

*If you have any further questions or require assistance, please do not
hesitate to contact our dedicated support team at kapila@aicte-india.org
<kapila@aicte-india.org> OR call 011-2958 1337 / 09266744473*

*Webinar Information:*
A webinar to provide detailed information and address questions will be
held on:

*6th December 2024 (Friday), 11:30 AM*

*LINK:*
https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m30f5f75b66b8b11a39f2a2164191a6e1https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m30f5f75b66b8b11a39f2a2164191a6e1

With Warm Regards,
*Dr. Elangovan Kariappan*
*Assistant Innovation Director | Program Incharge KAPILA*
Innovation Cell | Ministry of Education, Govt. of India
AICTE HQ | New Delhi - 110070
Email - kapila@aicte-india.org
Contact - 011-2958 1337/1332
 Mobile: 09266744473
Website: https://kapila.mic.gov.in



Thanks & Regards,

*Shyamsundar S.*
Manager, IP & Technology Transfer,
Ahmedabad Indovation Centre,
Ministry of Education's Innovation Cell, Govt. of India

*Contact Phone: +91-9611607928*
*Email**: in
<innovationofficer4@aicte-india.org>dovation.ahmedabad@aicte-india.org
<dovation.ahmedabad@aicte-india.org>*
*Website:** https://mic.gov.in/ <https://mic.gov.in/>*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

subject: Fwd: Change in Seating Arrangement for B.Tech 3rd Semester (CS & IT) on 2/12/2024
snippet: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT, Changa ---------- Forwarded message
content:
Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ritesh Patel <riteshpatel.adm@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, 30 Nov 2024, 3:26 pm
Subject: Change in Seating Arrangement for B.Tech 3rd Semester (CS & IT) on
2/12/2024
To: Dhaval Bhoi <dhavalbhoi.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Radhika Patel <
radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Abhilash Shukla <
abhilashshukla.mca@charusat.ac.in>, COE Exam <coe.exam@charusat.ac.in>,
Dean FTE CHARUSAT <dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute
of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Group <
hod@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Madam/Sir,

This is to inform you that the seating arrangement for the B.Tech 3rd
Semester students of CS and IT branches (DEPSTAR) has been revised for *2nd
December 2024*. The updated seating will now be in the *IIIM Institute*.

Kindly refer to the enclosed sheet for detailed information regarding the
updated seating arrangement.

We request the faculty members to guide and ensure students are aware of
this change. Students are advised to review the details and comply
accordingly.

--

subject: Fwd: Mandatory Safety Reminder for CHARUSAT family: Helmet & Seat Belt Compliance â€“ NSS Initiative
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings For the Day!!! WE ALL LOOK SAME WITH OUR HELMETS AND SEATBELTS ON !!!. USE YOUR HELMET AND BUCK UP YOUR SEATBELT FOR YOUR LIFE. THAT MAKES INJURIES LESS SEVERE AND SAVE LIVES.
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings For the Day!!!

*WE ALL LOOK SAME WITH OUR HELMETS AND SEATBELTS ON !!!. *

*USE YOUR HELMET AND BUCK UP YOUR SEATBELT FOR YOUR LIFE.  THAT MAKES
INJURIES LESS SEVERE AND SAVE LIVES. *

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Kishan Patel <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 11:28â€¯AM
Subject: Mandatory Safety Reminder for CHARUSAT family: Helmet & Seat Belt
Compliance â€“ NSS Initiative
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>, <family@charusat.edu.in
>
Cc: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear  Charusat Family Members,

Greetings From Charusat NSS Unit

We would like to inform you that it is now *mandatory* for all
Students,Staff and faculty Members to:

   - *Wear helmets* while riding two-wheelers.
   - *Fasten seat belts* when driving or traveling in a car.

To ensure adherence, *NSS Volunteers* *will be stationed at both university
gates to monitor compliance and raise awareness.* We kindly ask everyone to
be *polite and cooperative* with them, as they are working to safeguard
your safety.

This initiative is *compulsory* and has been implemented to maintain a safe
environment for all members of the CHARUSAT community.

Your cooperation is crucial to the success of this initiative. Letâ€™s work
together to make our campus safer.

Thank you for your Valuable support and understanding .


--
Regards,
Kishan Patel
NSS Program Coordinator
CHARUSAT NSS UNIT


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively for women- reg.
snippet: Dear Female Students, Greetings for the day!!! "There is no limit what we as women can accomplish", Details of All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) mentioned in the trailing mail. ------
content:
Dear Female Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

"There is no limit what we as women can accomplish", Details of  All India
Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) mentioned in the trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 3:27â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY
Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively
for women- reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 1:52â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon
(AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively for women- reg.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2024/27-Nov/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Madam/Sir,
*Greetings from AICTE!*

This is in continuation to AICTEâ€™s earlier letter/email dated 24.10.2024.

As you are aware that AICTE in collaboration with Shooting Stars Foundation
has launched the *All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a
national-level start up competition exclusively for women!* This is a great
opportunity for entrepreneurially ambitious women to turn their ideas into
impactful ventures. You are encouraged to circulate the details amongst
women students of the below program and urge them to participate in maximum
numbers.

 *Key Details:*

   - Registrations: Now Open.. *Last date to register : On or
   before 28th November, 2024*
   - Eligibility: Women across India (can participate individually or as
   part of a team)
   - Mode: Fully Online
   - There is no registration fee and students will not be required to pay
   any fee at any stage of the program
   - *Registration link*:
   https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ao5Ubh0xGUJFqcvscdjpLdU01nKEUAA7pCUuBKxIH4U
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=938a374247f82f82e78f245ef3a7199ee9dfe27f&lat=2024&mid=86beb6e0a8858f25fc8f5e9b241b9bd3105e43ee>
   - For Questions: aiwos@sstarsfoundation.org
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=98f649ce3763190f3ec4eb29ba81f067af6a6ae2&lat=2024&mid=86beb6e0a8858f25fc8f5e9b241b9bd3105e43ee>

*About AIWOS:*

AIWOS is a national level start-up competition exclusively for Women to
spark entrepreneurship interest in women students. We are bringing together
experts and organizations for a 1st of its kind *Women Exclusive Startup
Program* to maximize their learning and career outcomes.

* Women students registering/participating for AIWOS ?*

   - Tailored training programs to enhance employability (Registered
   Students will get details of upcoming webinars)


   - Mentorship from industry leaders and successful entrepreneurs
   - Chance for start-ups to be considered by top angel investors and
   incubators for funding and incubation support
   - Internship/Placement opportunities at top corporates

Kindly motivate women students to take advantage of this opportunity to
accelerate their careers and step towards their entrepreneurial journey!









*With Warm Regards,Dr. Amit Dutta,Director,Policy & Academic Planning
BureauAll India Council for Technical Education,Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant
Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=8e6e16112bf8339f34e6b788be03f2a1e32d300c&lat=2024&mid=86beb6e0a8858f25fc8f5e9b241b9bd3105e43ee>New
Delhi- 110070
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=8e6e16112bf8339f34e6b788be03f2a1e32d300c&lat=2024&mid=86beb6e0a8858f25fc8f5e9b241b9bd3105e43ee>
Phone
no. 011-29581117Email id - directorpnap@aicte-india.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=87b4bd005580c1234edcfca80a4a05f84242732d&lat=2024&mid=86beb6e0a8858f25fc8f5e9b241b9bd3105e43ee>*
Share it on Social Media [image: social icon]
<https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjan-sampark.nic.in%2Fcampaigns%2F2024%2F27-Nov%2FAICTE%2Findex.html>
[image:

*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

Greetings for the day!!!

Kindly go through trailing mail and grab the chance to upgrade your skills.

<23cse@charusat.edu.in>, <22it@charusat.edu.in>, <23it@charusat.edu.in>, <

Dear Students,

I hope this email finds you well and thriving in your academic journey.

We are delighted to invite you to be a part of the upcoming *Endowment
Chair Activity entitled "*Machine Learning: Pioneering the Fusion of
Knowledge Across Fields", with the renowned *Dr. Ganesh Bagler*, Professor
at IIIT-Delhi and a pioneer in AI and healthcare innovations, an enriching
opportunity designed to broaden your horizons and foster your academic and
professional growth.

Don't miss this opportunity to gain insights into cutting-edge machine
learning technologies and their interdisciplinary applications! By
participating, you will:

   - Gain *in-depth knowledge* on emerging trends and specialized subjects.
   - Enhance your *critical thinking and problem-solving skills* through
   interactive discussions.
   - Build connections with *esteemed professionals and peers*, expanding
   your network.

subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunities in Various Tech Domains at CoderOne
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ashwin Makwana <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 8:56 AM Subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunities in Various Tech Domains at
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ashwin Makwana <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 8:56â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunities in Various Tech Domains at CoderOne
To: Ronak Patel <ronakpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Sanket Suthar <
sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in>, Khushi Patel <khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>,
Chintal Raval <chintalraval.dit@charusat.ac.in>, Krishna Patel <
krishnapatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Dharmendrasinh Rathod <
dharmendrarathod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, TNP Cell - CHARUSAT <
tnp@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: HR CoderOne <hr@coderone.in>
Date: Tue, 26 Nov, 2024, 8:53 am
Subject: Internship Opportunities in Various Tech Domains at CoderOne
To: <tnp@charusat.ac.in>, <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

Greetings from CoderOne !!

I hope this email finds you well. We are thrilled to announce
remote internship opportunities in various tech domains at *CoderOne*. As a
prestigious institution known for producing talented and ambitious
individuals, we believe students from CSPIT Anand - Chandubhai S Patel
Institute of Technology, Anand would be an excellent fit for these roles.

We are currently looking to recruit *Winter Interns* in the
following domains:

   1. Full Stack Web Development
   2. UI-UX Design
   3. Data Science and Analytics

*Kindly forward this opportunity to the eligible students* meeting the
following criteria:

*Eligibility Criteria  for** these **Internships:*

   - *Degrees & Batch Passouts: *
   - *B.Tech./B.E : 2025(4th Year)/2026(3rd Year)/2027(2nd Year)/2028(1st
   year)*
   - *M.Tech : 2025/2026 Passout*
   - *BCA/MCA: 2025/2026/2027 Passout*

These internships offer an excellent opportunity for you to gain hands-on
experience, work on real-world projects, and enhance your skills under the
mentorship of experienced professionals in the industry.

If you are passionate about any of these domains and eager
to kick-start your career in the tech industry, we encourage you to fill
out the Registration Form linked below to express your interest and provide
us with some basic information:

*Registration Form Link**:* Click Here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScLp5qmewJ5b4IArf-ipZkKAxdCwltJ_0l7cIJQ9JvCFFwA0w/viewform?usp=sf_link>

*Last Date: 15 December 2024*

Please note that these internship positions are competitive, and we will
select candidates based on their qualifications, skills, and enthusiasm for
the respective domains.

We look forward to receiving your applications and potentially welcoming
you to our team!

Best Regards,


*HR Manager*

*CoderOne*

*Website :* CoderOne <http://coderone.in/>

*Email :* hr@coderone.in


-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor ,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Announcement: SPOURAL'25 - A Celebration of Sports and Cultural!
snippet: Greetings from the University Level Central Student Council! We are thrilled to announce that *SPOURAL'25*, our much-anticipated annual sports and cultural extravaganza, will take place from *6th
content:
Greetings from the University Level Central Student Council!



We are thrilled to announce that *SPOURAL'25*, our much-anticipated annual
sports and cultural extravaganza, will take place from **6th January to
31st January 2025*.* Mark your calendars for a month of energy, enthusiasm,
and excellence!



Event Schedule:



**Sports Competitions: 6th January to 28th January,2025**



**Cultural Events: 29th January to 31st January,2025**



This year, we are excited to expand our sports categories with the
*addition of Handball and Ultimate Frisbee* for students and Chess and
Table Tennis for Faculty, bringing fresh opportunities for athletes to
shine. With these new additions, *SPOURAL'25 promises to be bigger and
better than ever!*



**Important Note:**



This is a general announcement for all Institutes/Departments. We encourage
you to start your team selection and gear up for the exciting competitions
ahead. Letâ€™s showcase our collective talent, teamwork, and enthusiasm!



Stay tuned for further details regarding registrations, event line-ups, and
schedules. Together, letâ€™s make SPOURAL'25 an unforgettable celebration of
sportsmanship and culture.





Warm regards,


*Convener,*


*University Level Central Students Council (ULSC).*

*CHARUSAT.*

--

subject: Seating Arrangement of External Exam of BTECH -3rd Semester
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the following guidelines for the upcoming university theory examination. Â· Students must adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment. Â· Students
content:
Dear Students,



Kindly go through the following *guidelines for the upcoming university
theory examination*.



 Â·       *Students must adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
email attachment. *

Â·        *Students are required to uphold decorum in the examination
hall. Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are
strictly prohibited within the exam hall. *

Â·        *Bags must be left outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID
card. Students have to take their seat in the exam hall at least 15
minutes before the exam time.*

Â·        *The exam will take place in Exam Hall 1 and Exam Hall 2 of
Multi-Utility Building. The Multi-Utility Building is located behind the
MBA building. Exam Hall 1 is situated on the first floor, and Exam Hall 2
is on the second floor of this building.*

Â·        *All students are required to enter the campus through the Karoli
Gate and follow the signboards to reach the Multi-Utility Building.*



*A seating plan and seating arrangement is attached for your reference.*



*All the best for your exam.*


*Thanks & Regards,*

*Exam Committee,*

*DEPSTAR - IT*

--

subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunity with Agnirva Space - ISRO Registered Space Tutor
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Interested students may register for an internship program. More details are shared in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Interested students may register for an internship program. More details
are shared in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Nov 22, 2024 at 11:33â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Internship Opportunity with Agnirva Space - ISRO Registered
Space Tutor
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Agnirva Internship <internship@agnirva.com>
Date: Fri, 22 Nov, 2024, 11:26â€¯am
Subject: Internship Opportunity with Agnirva Space - ISRO Registered Space
Tutor
To: <space@agnirva.com>


Dear Sir/Madam,

We hope this message finds you well. We are reaching out to formally extend
an exclusive opportunity for your students to participate in a *Free Online
Space Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>*
offered by *Agnirva.com <https://agnirva.com>* - an ISRO Registered Space
Tutor, inaugurated by IN-SPACe.

This internship spans 8 weeks with 440 steps and approximately 80 hours of
learning. Students will receive an *internship certificate* upon successful
completion. This internship is applicable to students from all disciplines
- management, arts, engineering, medical, commerce - because future
advancements in the space sector will impact all professions.

Please encourage your students to leverage this opportunity. More than
30,000+ students from esteemed institutions like *BITS Pilani, IIM
Bangalore, ISB Hyderabad, IIT Kharagpur, IIT Delhi, IIT Bhu, Delhi
University, LPU, VIT Vellore* and *500+* other institutions have already
enrolled. We believe this program can significantly benefit your students
as well.

Learn more about us â¡ï¸ Agnirva.com <https://agnirva.com>

[image: Free Online Space Internship Opportunity]

*If you have already forwarded this message to your students, please ignore
this reminder.*

Regards,
Team Agnirva


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Fwd: IIT Ropar: Invite for Minor in Artificial Intelligence (AI) Program Entrance Test
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!! Grab the opportunity to learn and shine. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Nov 21
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!

Grab the opportunity to learn and shine.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Nov 21, 2024 at 9:17â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: IIT Ropar: Invite for Minor in Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Program Entrance Test
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Ropar <aatif.hussain@masaischool.com>
Date: Thu, Nov 21, 2024 at 8:55â€¯AM
Subject: IIT Ropar: Invite for Minor in Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Program Entrance Test
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Professor,
We are pleased to announce that IIT Ropar is now accepting applications for
the *Minor in Artificial Intelligence (AI) program.* This opportunity is
available to undergraduate students from diverse branches, including but
not limited to Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, and Computer Science. The
program is suitable for students with a *basic understanding of
programming *who wish to further their expertise in this evolving field.

The curriculum emphasizes practical experience, guiding students from
*Introduction
to Prompt Programming* to *neural networks* and the latest in *large
language models*. By the end, students will be capable of building live AI
projects, ready to apply their skills to real-world technological
advancements.

*Entrance Test Details:*

   - *Date:* 24th November 2024 (Sunday)
   - *Duration:* 60 minutes
   - *Mode:* Online
   - *Registration Link: *https://bit.ly/Prof-IITRopar
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fmails.masaischool.com%2Flink%2F277caab1-9754-46e9-9818-043cb61b6427%2Fc6cab2f4-15bc-4387-af4a-21d2a51581e8%2Fb4f1ed39-8956-4667-b9be-7c48c058ff90/1/010001934cc08135-446fbc94-7354-4fea-91d9-25076b728bbf-000000/nhFVcn9WViVoSQbAi41zH7wz5BA=401>

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fmails.masaischool.com%2Flink%2F277caab1-9754-46e9-9818-043cb61b6427%2Fc6cab2f4-15bc-4387-af4a-21d2a51581e8%2Fb4f1ed39-8956-4667-b9be-7c48c058ff90/2/010001934cc08135-446fbc94-7354-4fea-91d9-25076b728bbf-000000/2oyhkMmINa4ND6JYLPuqTiJ_Gvw=401>*

   -

   *Important Notes:*
   - Students must register for the test before *22nd November 2024*. Early
      registration is recommended.
      - The test will be conducted online with participation from students
      across colleges nationwide and will assess students on the
basics of* Programming, Mathematics,
      and Logic reasoning*
      - Kindly encourage your students to register promptly and prepare
      thoroughly for these topics.


We would appreciate your support in sharing this information with your
students. Kindly forward this circular or *Click here to share it over

2019. Now he is a full stack software developer at IBM.

Even you can become a front-end developer in just 14 weeks by joining our 
beginner-friendly bootcamp.


Register now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/bootcamps/frontend-2?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=bootcamp2_reminder2&utm_content=cta1>



















Bootcamp highlights















Live virtual sessions to learn with experts in real-time












Access to session recordings to learn at your own convenience












Step-by-step guidance for learners of all skill levels












10+ real-life projects including a news app












Interview preparation to help you achieve the offer letter from your dream 
company












Free Codecademy Pro access to practice












Premium certificate to showcase your achievements























Registration window will be closing soon, reserve your spot today

What â€œThink Like a Programmerâ€ Really Means


The mind of an engineer might seem like an elusive thing full of complicated 
syntax and equations. But hereâ€™s a secret: Having a programming mentality and 
thinking like a programmer isnâ€™t about memorization, itâ€™s about how you 
approach problems with code. Learn tangible ways to think like a programmer and 
enhance your coding skills.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/how-to-think-like-a-programmer/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_november_in_development&utm_content=hero_blog_programmer_mentality_cta>










 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/how-much-does-it-cost-to-learn-coding/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_november_in_development&utm_content=blog1_switch_careers_img>


How Much Money You Need to Save to Switch Careers


Ever wondered how much it really costs to learn coding and switch careers? 
Weâ€™ll break down the expenses and various paths you can take, from our 
budget-friendly self-paced courses to pricier bootcamps. Borrow strategies and 
tips that helped Codecademy learners save up for a major life change.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/how-much-does-it-cost-to-learn-coding/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_november_in_development&utm_content=blog1_switch_careers_cta>










 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/how-to-read-a-tech-job-description/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_november_in_development&utm_content=blog2_techjob_description_img>


How to Read a Tech Job Description


Donâ€™t just skim job descriptions searching for buzzwords like 
â€œremote-friendly.â€ Read job descriptions closely, because they hold a great 
deal of information. If you know what to look for, you can find insights into 
the companyâ€™s culture, your potential role, and even what to include in your 
resume to boost your chances of being called in for an interview.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/how-to-read-a-tech-job-description/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_november_in_development&utm_content=blog2_techjob_description_cta>

From: Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Nov 6, 2024 at 1:40â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Cisco Social Impact Partner Update Newsletter - October 2024
To: Shital Sharma <shitalsharma.dit@charusat.ac.in>


Share with the students.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: cisco_community_affiliate_update_help(mailer list) <
cisco_community_affiliate_update_help@cisco.com>
Date: Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 10:59â€¯PM
Subject: Cisco Social Impact Partner Update Newsletter - October 2024
To: cisco_community_affiliate_update_help(mailer list) <
cisco_community_affiliate_update_help@cisco.com>


Welcome to the latest issue of our newsletter for Cisco's Social Impact
Investments (SII), in which we highlight recent success stories from our
partners
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/community/social-impact-partners.html>,
as well as opportunities to engage
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/purpose/social-impact/investments.html>
with
Cisco and the Cisco Foundation
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/impact/cisco-foundation.html>.



How can we make this update more useful to you? To share your suggestions,
please reply to this message. If you are interested in learning more about
Cisco's offerings to our social impact partners, please check out our
programs, requirements, and application procedures here
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/purpose/social-impact/investments.html#~grant-programs>
.



To request subscriptions for yourself and others, please use our online form
<https://ciscocx.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3gdyVyj7Sh2nb70>. To discontinue
your subscription, simply reply to this message with the word "unsubscribe."



Charu Adesnik <https://blogs.cisco.com/author/charuadesnik>
Executive Director, Cisco Foundation
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/impact/cisco-foundation.html>
Director, Social Impact Investments
<https://blogs.cisco.com/tag/social-innovation-investments> (SII), Cisco
Systems, Inc.


------------------------------

[image: Cisco Foundation Annual Impact Report eBook]
<https://ebooks.cisco.com/story/foundationimpactreport2024/page/1>



*Cisco Foundation celebrates our grantees and investees in 2024 impact
report*



Our One Billion Lives Positively Impacted
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/technology-for-good/one-billion.html>
campaign
inspired us to share more partner impact stories, as well as lessons
learned as a strategic funder. In our new eBook, we invite you to dive
deeper into the Cisco Foundation's vision, mission, and unique approach to
Social Impact Investments -- and experience the progress, partnership, and
impact we created in Fiscal Year 2024.



Get the full story in our new eBook.
<https://ebooks.cisco.com/story/foundationimpactreport2024/page/1>


------------------------------

*Cisco's "One Billion Lives" campaign wins prestigious Ragan Award*



Cisco's "One Billion Lives
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/technology-for-good/one-billion.html>"
Campaign has won a national award as the top corporate social
responsibility (CSR) campaign in 2024. The Ragan Awards for CSR & Diversity
<https://www.ragan.com/celebrating-the-winners-of-ragans-2024-csr-diversity-awards-list-of-winners/>
celebrate
the most successful campaigns, initiatives, people and teams in the
communication, PR, and marketing fields.



Our campaign was designed to celebrate and amplify the amazing work of our
100+ global non-profit partners and share the "Blueprint to One Billion
<https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2024/pdf/ITLGEN-1404.pdf>"
-- an overview of Cisco's differentiated approach to creating positive
change around the world. Our winning submission highlighted key elements of
our campaign which were originated, designed and executed by our team --
all within a fraction of the time typically required by campaigns of this
magnitude.


------------------------------

*Financing regenerative agriculture: a pathway to healthier soil, cleaner
water, and climate resilience*



In 2021, the Cisco Foundation committed US$100 million over 10 years
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/environmental-sustainability/climate-grants-and-investments.html>
to
fund nonprofit grants and impact investing in climate solutions. Across the
Foundation, we apply a multi-sector approach across all our sector areas to
create a world of equitable, resilient, and empowered communities
contributing to a regenerative climate future. We are proud to support four
Cisco Foundation partners that are paving the way for regenerative
agricultural practices to happen more efficiently, equitably, and at
greater scale -- One Acre Fund <https://oneacrefund.org/>, Mad Agriculture
<https://madagriculture.org/>, myAgro <https://www.myagro.org/>, and
Miraterra <https://www.miraterrasoil.com/>.



Learn more about the important work of these innovative partners.
<https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/financing-regenerative-agriculture-a-pathway-to-healthier-soil-cleaner-water-and-climate-resilience>


------------------------------

*Cisco Crisis Response team aids in Hurricane Helene relief efforts*



Hurricane Helene struck Florida on September 26th as a powerful Category 4
hurricane, bringing 140mph winds and a 15-foot storm surge to some parts of
the Gulf Coast. While the intensity of the storm diminished after making
landfall, torrential downpours, tornadoes and mudslides from the storm
wreaked havoc in Georgia, Tennessee, and Western North Carolina.



In response to Hurricane Helene, Cisco Crisis Response
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/impact/cisco-crisis-response.html>
activated
our incident response protocols to quickly mobilize communications assets
and trained personnel. Since the initial impact, 9 CCR staff members and 19
employee volunteers supported response efforts in western North Carolina
and elsewhere in the affected region. We dispatched emergency networking
kits to 11 partner organizations to provide temporary connectivity or
augment capacity. The team also provided remote support and configuration
assistance to affected organizations, including a virtual Security
Operations Center to monitor deployed networks. Volunteers contributed over
550 hours of their time and logged over 7000 miles while delivering
critically needed equipment or services.



Cisco has also launched a Hurricane Helene giving opportunity for employees
who wish to support relief efforts carried about by the American Red Cross
<https://www.redcross.org>, World Central Kitchen <https://wck.org>, and
Americares <https://my.americares.org/>. For the full story, read our blog
on Cisco's Helene relief efforts
<https://blogs.cisco.com/news/cisco-crisis-response-reinstating-connectivity-to-communities-impacted-by-hurricane-helene>
.


------------------------------

*Science Buddies inspires STEM engagement among young learners*



Cisco social impact partner Science Buddies
<https://www.sciencebuddies.org> aims
to make STEM education accessible and engaging, especially in underfunded
or resource-limited communities. Tammy Sila, a 4th-grade teacher at Whiting
Elementary School in a small rural town, utilized Science Buddies to engage
her students in STEM activities. She emphasized the importance of these
resources in establishing an after-school STEM club, noting that without
them, the club wouldn't have continued. Tammy used Science Buddies to
introduce her students to new areas like coding and electrical projects.
The Topic Selection Wizard was particularly helpful, allowing students to
find projects that matched their interests and giving them a sense of
ownership. Tammy credited Science Buddies with keeping students excited
about STEM, highlighting their willingness to stay after school to learn
more.


------------------------------

*Defy Ventures announces bold Commitment to Action at the Clinton Global
Initiative*



Cisco social impact partner Defy Ventures <https://www.defyventures.org> was
invited to participate in the Clinton Global Initiative
<https://www.clintonfoundation.org/programs/leadership-public-service/clinton-global-initiative/>,
an international network of leaders and organizations committed to solving
the world's most pressing challenges. At the CGI 2024 Meeting in September,
Defy Ventures announced a bold Commitment to Action to triple their impact
over the next 5 years -- scaling their efforts across the 9 states where
they currently operate programs and expanding to as many as nine new states.


------------------------------

*Study shows that TalkingPoints' platform reduced absenteeism by 24%*



Cisco social impact partner TalkingPoints helps educators stay in closer
touch with families. Researchers found that using TalkingPoints resulted in
statistically significant improvements in attendance rates, resulting in
increased learning hours for students:



   - TalkingPoints led to an average 24% decrease in absenteeism rates
   across all grades with sufficient sample sizes (K-5, 7). Gains for
   Spanish-speaking students were more significant than for their
   English-speaking peers.
   - On average, attendance increases equate to an additional two days in
   school per student during the period studied. Extrapolating these results
   through the entire school year would mean an average gain of six additional
   days in school per student.



Learn more about this compelling new research.
<https://learn.talkingpts.org/hubfs/pdf/TalkingPoints-Tulsa-Research-Executive-Summary.pdf>


------------------------------

*Ten Strands works to bring environmental literacy to California public
schools*



Cisco social impact partner Ten Strands <https://tenstrands.org/> is a
California-based nonprofit with a mission to build and strengthen the
partnerships and strategies to bring environmental literacy to all of
California's TK-12 public school students. Their strategy is grounded in
three priorities: advocating for state investments in environmental and
climate literacy, building the capacity of districts and county offices of
education to implement proven strategies for scaling widespread educational
change, and strengthening the statewide network of dedicated partners in
the education sector.



Ten Strands' K-12 Climate Change and Environmental Justice Program, now
titled "Seeds to Solutions," will empower students to be environmentally
literate, engaged community members prepared to act for the well-being of
their family, broader community, and environment. Developed as open
education resources for teaching and learning, these curricular materials
will enable curriculum developers, educators, community partners, and
professional learning experts to create locally relevant productive
adaptations. Cisco's investment in interoperability and identifying the
optimal technology platform to deliver the program's curriculum units will
allow the resources to be widely used across California and possibly beyond.



To learn more about Ten Strands' initiatives and recent accomplishments,
visit their 2023 Annual Report <https://tenstrands.org/2023-report/>.


------------------------------

*Celebrating the success of the Chief Minister's Good Governance Associates
Program in India*



Chief Minister's Good Governance Associates Program <http://www.cmgga.in> is
a strategic initiative by the Government of Haryana that was launched in
2016. Cisco has supported the program since 2021 through a strategic
partnership with Ashoka University, funding six associates each year via
the India Cash Grant Program
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en_in/about/csr/india-cash-grants.html>. This
collaboration has led to numerous innovative state government programs,
greatly benefiting Haryana's citizens.


------------------------------

*Food4Education selected as winner of 2024 Audacious Project*



Cisco social impact partner Food4Education <https://food4education.org> has
been selected as a winner of the 2024 Audacious Project to support
implementation of their bold Pan-African school feeding strategy. The
Audacious Project encourages the world's greatest changemakers to dream
bigger than they can imagine -- then helps shape their ideas into viable
multi-year plans and launch them alongside some of the biggest names in
philanthropy.



F4E's vision is a Pan-African blueprint for school feeding that is
cost-effective, locally-rooted and sourced, and nutritious. This catalytic
capital will enable them to execute against their goal to feed 3 million
African children on a daily basis by 2030, tripling their impact in Kenya
and sharing the blueprint with two other African countries. Cisco has
supported Food4Education with cash grant funding, technology donations, and
advisory services/pro-bono consulting, and more. Their founder and CEO was
also a previous recipient of the Global Citizen Cisco Youth Leadership
prize.


------------------------------

*Cool.org seeks to spark curiosity and joy about computer science*



Cisco social impact partner Cool.org <https://cool.org> knows that the real
impact of education goes beyond numbers -- it's about inspiring joy,
sparking curiosity, and strengthening connections between teachers and
students. Three weeks ago, they launched their 2024 Social Impact Research
Report at The Reality of Teaching event, sharing the results of months of
research conducted in partnership with GoodWolf Partners. This report
brings to light the profound influence of Cool.org's resources on
classrooms across Australia.



Four out of five teachers report that using Cool.org resources has improved
their teaching skills, enhanced their knowledge, and helped them feel more
confident tackling real-world topics. Student engagement has increased by
76%, with educators crediting the real-world applicability and relevance of
the materials for capturing students' interest. 68% of educators said the
resources bring enjoyment back to their jobs when the profession faces
significant challenges.

Get the full report on Cool.org's positive social impact.
<https://cool-media-production-public.s3.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com/attachments/kQtWD4XxFtd2jtYHY1lBOfdWKU5r9us4KfvRod67.pdf>


------------------------------

*Regional Solution Grant program helps drive hyper-local change*



In 2023, the Cisco Foundation launched a new Regional Solution Grants
Program (RSG), which develops and enhances local or regional partnerships
between Cisco employees and public charities in communities where employees
live, work and/or give. RSG focuses on digital, tech-enabled solutions that
support vulnerable and/or underserved people. Cisco volunteers nominate
eligible organizations through an internal, employee-driven process. Read
more about the social impact achieved by some of the RSG grantee partners
in the following blogs:



   - GreenWolf (Costa Rica) Cisco blog April 2024: Environmental Day and
   Circular Economy
   <https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/earth-day-how-were-helping-our-social-and-environmental-systems-heal-and-thrive>
   - Ocalenie Foundation (Poland) Cisco blog June 2024: World Refugee Day
   <https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/leveraging-technology-to-empower-refugees-with-secure-and-equitable-access-to-information-resources-and-opportunities>
   - Yayasan Konservasi Alam Nusantara (Indonesia) Cisco blog July 2024: World
   Conservation Day
   <https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/how-technology-is-being-used-to-help-support-environmental-conservation>
   - WaterAid (Colombia) Cisco blog March 2024: World Water Day
   <https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/transforming-communities-one-drop-of-water-at-a-time>
   - The Bridge International (South Korea), Hand In Hand (Kenya), CARE
   Peru (Peru) Cisco blog August 2024: World Entrepreneurship Day
   <https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/transforming-underserved-communities-and-fostering-sustainable-growth-through-entrepreneurial-endeavors>


------------------------------

*Solar Sister builds economic inclusion for women while fostering climate
resilience*



Solar Sister empowers women to bring clean energy solutions to their
communities, driving a grassroots clean energy revolution. Cisco's funding
enabled Solar Sister to digitize and standardize their training curriculum
and other offerings to support their aggressive growth and replication
goals.



Solar Sister's network of more than 11,000 Solar Sister Entrepreneurs
brings climate-resilient technologies to their communities while building a
pathway to prosperity for themselves and their families through
entrepreneurship. The communities served by our social impact partner often
face immense barriers to accessing economic opportunities, including gender
disparity, economic and political instability, and climate disaster. Solar
Sister meets women where they are by adapting their model to these unique
contexts to remove barriers to entry and provide the Solar Sister
opportunity to as many women as possible.



Learn more about how Solar Sister is working to build climate resilience.
<https://solarsister.org/climate-resilience-project/> To learn even more
about Solar Sister, explore their recently released learnings report
<https://solarsister.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/IH_Digital-report-external-draft_Oct-2024-1.pdf>
on
digitizing women entrepreneurs.


------------------------------

*Yayasan Konservasi Alam Nusantara (YCAN) works to transforming fishery
management in Indonesia via AI technology collaboration*



With grant support from the Cisco Foundation, Yayasan Konservasi Alam
Nusantara (YKAN) is leveraging the innovative software application called
FishFace (Fish Facial Identification Technology) to help the government and
fishing communities understand the status of fish stocks in the area and to
design solutions to manage these fisheries for the benefit of people and
nature.



Learn more about how artificial intelligence is making a positive impact on
marine biodiversity.
<https://world.einnews.com/pr_news/733824272/transforming-fisheries-management-in-indonesia-ai-technology-collaboration-with-ykan-intelion-the-n50-project>


------------------------------

*Age-Proofing AI: Enabling an intergenerational workforce to benefit from
AI*



Cisco social impact partner Generation <https://www.generation.org/> recently
studied AI's potential impacts on midcareer and older workers. They found
three calls to action -- encouraging employers to do more to make the most
of their most experienced workers; encouraging midcareer and older works
actively to pursue AI skills; and encouraging the retooling of workforce
programs that serve midcareer and older workers to be more AI-savvy.



Generation offers profession-specific programs to train and place adults
into careers that would otherwise be inaccessible. Cisco's investments have
enabled Generation to streamline their systems and implement AI-based job
search and creation tools.



Learn more about how everyone can contribute to intergenerational workplace
inclusion.
<https://www.generation.org/midcareer-report-2024/?insEmail=1&insNltCmpId=623&insNltSldt=10080&insPnName=generation&isIns=1&isInsNltCmp=1>


------------------------------

*Transforming underserved communities and fostering sustainable growth
through entrepreneurial endeavors*



World Entrepreneurs Day 2024, observed on August 21, celebrates the
ingenuity and perseverance of entrepreneurs who are the driving force
behind innovation and economic growth worldwide. This year's theme,
"Empowering Entrepreneurs for a Sustainable Future," underscores the vital
role that entrepreneurs play in creating solutions to global challenges and
advancing sustainable development. Learn how some of Cisco's non-profit
partner organizations -- Agora Partnerships
<https://www.agora-partnerships.com/>, The Bridge International
<https://www.thebridgeint.com/en/>, CARE Peru <https://care.org.pe/>, Centro
Community Partners <https://www.centroinc.org/>, Defy Ventures
<https://defyventures.org/>, and Hand in Hand International
<https://www.handinhandinternational.org/> -- are enabling the
transformative impact of entrepreneurs and fostering environments where
their ideas can thrive and lead to a brighter, more sustainable future.



Learn more about the transformative power of entrepreneurial inclusion.
<https://blogs.cisco.com/our-corporate-purpose/transforming-underserved-communities-and-fostering-sustainable-growth-through-entrepreneurial-endeavors>


------------------------------

*Human-I-T wins recognition and supports survivors of Hurricane Helene*



Cisco social impact partner Human-I-T, a nonprofit dedicated to providing
equitable access to technology for those affected by the digital divide, is
proud to have won the 2024 BigCommerce Innovation Award, recognizing the
nonprofit's groundbreaking efforts to empower communities through
technology, internet access, digital training, and tech support. The
award celebrates
Human-I-T's mission
<https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/human-i-t-recognized-for-innovation-by-bigcommerce-302253539.html>
to
transform lives, drive digital inclusion, and promote environmental
sustainability by diverting unwanted tech from landfills and making digital
access a reality for all.



The organization is also offering internet solutions to communities
impacted by Hurricane Helene in Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, South
Carolina, Tennessee, and Virginia. For survivors of Hurricane Helene,
reliable internet access can mean the difference between life and death,
finding help -- or being left in the dark. Learn more.
<https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/human-i-t-provides-internet-support-to-hurricane-helene-survivors-302269019.html?tc=eml_cleartime>


------------------------------

*Service Year Alliance poll shows young Americans support the American
Climate Corps (ACC), see opportunities in green jobs*



New research
<https://www.dataforprogress.org/memos/9/25/the-american-climate-corps-and-the-green-workforce-are-broadly-favored-by-young-americans-once-they-learn-about-them>
from
Data for Progress and Service Year Alliance
<https://www.serviceyearalliance.org> finds that young people
overwhelmingly say climate change is a concern and they want to take
personal actions to protect our planet for future generations.

The Cisco Foundation's climate portfolio supports Service Year Alliance in
launching their Climate Project, which examines how service years can be
leveraged as a human capital solution to effectively combat the impacts of
climate change and develop the next generation of climate resilience
leaders. Some key findings:



   - 81% of young people say that "climate change poses a serious threat to
   our future."
   - 67% of young people agree that they want to take more personal action
   to address climate change.
   - Gaining general work experience (89%), earning a living wage (87%),
   and protecting our planet for future generations (86%) are the top reasons
   a young person would join the ACC.



Learn more about their compelling findings.
<https://www.serviceyearalliance.org/new_poll_young_americans_support_the_american_climate_corps>


------------------------------

*Tvaran 2.0: Catalyzing digital innovations that help empower women *



Tvaran is a flagship initiative by Cisco, launched in partnership with
Villgro <https://villgro.org>, aimed at driving female empowerment. The
second edition of the accelerator, Tvaran 2.0
<https://villgro.org/programs/tvaran-2-0/> focusses on catalysing women-led
digital innovations across three key areas: Digital Solutions Led by Women,
Digital Solutions Impacting Women, and Technology/Digital Solutions
Enabling Financial Inclusion. Participant programs will undergo a rapid
acceleration program, designed to enhance the validity and sustainability
of their business models through revenue scaling and/or replication in new
markets including field trials.


------------------------------

*Awana Digital Mapeo Tools adopted by Brazilian government*



Cisco Foundation provided early funding for technological enhancements to
Awana Digital's core program: Mapeo <https://awana.digital/our-tools>, a
free digital toolset for documenting, monitoring and mapping various types
of data.



FUNAI, the Brazilian governmental body responsible for Indigenous affairs,
formally adopted Mapeo tool as part of their official conservation and
monitoring strategy. This decision followed the enthusiastic response from
Indigenous communities who have been using Mapeo for land protection
efforts, including during a recent women-focused gathering in Brazil's
Mosaico Gurupi region. The event led to the formation of the Kraho Women's
Guardians team, who conducted their first monitoring trip and uncovered
illegal activity. FUNAI's endorsement of Mapeo underscores its potential to
empower more communities in safeguarding their territories.



Read more about the Awana and FUNAI partnership launch.
<https://www.gov.br/funai/pt-br/assuntos/noticias/2024/mulheres-criam-grupo-de-vigilancia-indigena-para-aumentar-protecao-territorial-na-ti-kraolandia-com-apoio-da-funai>


------------------------------

*Climate Mental Health Network featured for New York Climate Week*



The growing mental health crisis, exacerbated by climate change, is
affecting millions of people worldwide. The Climate Mental Health Network
(CMHN), founded by Sarah Newman in 2021, is a collective of mental health
advocates working to shift the conversation on how we address climate
emotions. New York Climate Week 2024 featured this growing body of work led
by CMHN and explored how addressing climate emotions is critical to
building emotional resilience and laying the groundwork for effective
collective action.



The Cisco Foundation has provided seed funding to build out a web-based
tool for Gen-Z climate mental health in the style of the successful "imi"
guide for LTBTQ+ teen identify exploration and wellbeing.



Learn more about this vital resilience-building work.
<https://www.climateweeknyc.org/news/sarah-newman-founder-climate-mental-health-network-discusses-intersection-climate-change-and>


------------------------------

*Living Goods works to scale up community health plans in Africa*



Cisco's social impact partner Living Goods <https://livinggoods.org/> has
long understood the unique role that community health workers (CHWs) can
play in their communities. In September at the 79th Session of the UN
General Assembly (UNGA 79), leaders from Uganda, Malawi, Tanzania, CÃ´te
d'Ivoire, and Liberia engaged in a powerful dialogue on scaling community
health initiatives. Hosted by Africa Frontline First and Africa CDC, the
session emphasized the critical role community health workers play in
addressing public health crises such as COVID-19 and Ebola. Dr. Sanderson
Kuyeli, representing Dr. Samson Mndolo, Malawi's PS Health, described
community health workers as the "heart and engine of the health system."
They are essential in ensuring healthcare delivery to the most remote areas.



Living Goods leverages catalytic technology, high-impact training, and
quality treatments that empower government community health workers (CHWs)
to deliver quality care to their neighbors' doorsteps. Cisco's funding has
enabled diagnostic and treatment apps; development of an enterprise-wide
technology platform; creation of a data warehouse and enhanced
infrastructure and tools; and the development of predictive algorithms.



Learn more about how CHWs improve their lives while serving their
communities in need.
<https://livinggoods.org/media/living-goods-unga79-scaling-community-health-plans-in-africa-a-vital-dialogue-with-leaders/>


------------------------------

*Learn more about Cisco's work to positively impact lives around the world*



Driven by our purpose, we combine our technology, people, and broader
networks to address society's greatest challenges. Learn more:



Social Impact Investment (SII) Blogs
<https://blogs.cisco.com/tag/social-innovation-investments> | Social Impact
Partners <https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/community/partners.html>
 | The Power of Purpose
<https://www.cisco.com/site/us/en/about/purpose/index.html> | Grant Funding
<https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/purpose/social-impact/investments.html#~types-of-funding>
 | Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Hub
<https://www.cisco.com/c/m/en_us/about/csr/esg-hub.html>


------------------------------

word "unsubscribe."*
