subject: Fwd: Participation of Students, Teachers, and Administrators in the â€˜Ask Our Expertâ€™ Programme on NAD-ABC on November 8, 2024 -Regarding
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Kindly attend the webinar for getting more information about ABC ID. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Kindly attend the webinar for getting more information about ABC ID.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Nov 7, 2024 at 11:28â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Participation of Students, Teachers, and Administrators in
the â€˜Ask Our Expertâ€™ Programme on NAD-ABC on November 8, 2024 -Regarding
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Please do needful.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE(no-reply) <noreply6@aicte-india.org>
Date: Thu, 7 Nov, 2024, 11:00â€¯pm
Subject: Participation of Students, Teachers, and Administrators in the
â€˜Ask Our Expertâ€™ Programme on NAD-ABC on November 8, 2024 -Regarding
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Madam/Sir,
Greetings from All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) ..!

We are pleased to inform you that the Ministry of Electronics and
Information Technology (MeitY) is organizing a *online live talk show *on
the *Academic Bank of Credits(ABC)*, a project of the Ministry of Education
(MoE) aimed at providing a seamless, student-centric learning experience
while enhancing the ease of credit accumulation and transfer for students
across institutions.

As part of the outreach efforts under the Digital India Initiative, MeitY
is hosting the 3rd episode of the â€œAsk Our Expert Programmeâ€ focused on
ABC-NAD. This programme will be held *on November 8, 2024, starting at 1 PM
onwards*. The live talk show will be conducted by experts from the
government, featuring focused discussions aimed at equipping faculty,
students, and administrators from various Academic Institutions (AIs) with
essential knowledge about the benefits, implementation process, and
opportunities associated with the ABC.Given the role that these
stakeholders play in the success of the Academic Bank of Credits, we
earnestly urge you to encourage and facilitate their participation in this
session.

The details for joining the webinar are mentioned below:-

Â·         *Date*: 8th November 2024
Â·       *  Time*: 1 PM onwards
Â·         *Platform*: YouTube Official Digital India Channel
Â·         *Link*: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dqIoGwIXjoM

This session will not only deepen the understanding of participants about
ABC but also align them with the Digital India vision for a more connected
and efficient educational ecosystem. The insights shared during this will
empower faculty to effectively leverage ABC, support students in their
academic journeys and help administrators optimize institutional credit
management practices.

We trust that this collaboration will greatly benefit our educational
community, ultimately contributing to a more integrated and accessible
learning environment for all.

For any further assistance, Mr. Gaurav Khare may kindly be contacted at
gaurav.khare1@digitalindia.gov.in.

Thank you for your support in encouraging faculty and students to engage in
the future of e-governance and collaborative technology platforms.

In view of the foregoing,  AICTE requests your institution to share this
information with all the faculty, students, staff, and others, so that they
can benefit from it.

*With regards*
*(e-Governance)*
*All India Council for Technical Education*
*Nelson Mandela road, Vasantkunj, New Delhi-110070
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Nelson+Mandela+road,+Vasantkunj,+New+Delhi-110070?entry=gmail&source=g>*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively for women- reg.
snippet: Dear Girl Students, Greetings for the Day!! Nice opportunity to shine for a start-up. More details are in the trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal
content:
Dear Girl Students,

Greetings for the Day!!

Nice opportunity to shine for a start-up. More details are in the trailing
mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 12:14â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY
Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively
for women- reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Thu, 31 Oct, 2024, 11:19â€¯am
Subject: Invitation to participate in All India Women ONLY Start-a-thon
(AIWOS) - a national-level start up competition exclusively for women- reg.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2024/30-Oct/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Madam/Sir,

*Greetings from AICTE!*

AICTE in collaboration with Shooting Stars Foundation has launched the *All
India Women ONLY Start-a-thon (AIWOS) - a national-level start up
competition exclusively for women!* This is a great opportunity for
entrepreneurially ambitious women to turn their ideas into impactful
ventures. You are encouraged to circulate the details amongst women
students of the below program and urge them to participate in maximum
numbers.

*Key Details:*

   - Registrations: Now Open
   - Eligibility: Women across India (can participate individually or as
   part of a team)
   - Mode: Fully Online
   - There is no registration fee and students will not be required to pay
   any fee at any stage of the program
   - Registration link:
   https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ao5Ubh0xGUJFqcvscdjpLdU01nKEUAA7pCUuBKxIH4U
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=769680ef3c574a5d93da237d42fc6e175d7e3844&lat=2024&mid=b5c2567dc4949bd5ba70e03b8ec45a7aa59cbd6e>
   - For Questions: aiwos@sstarsfoundation.org
   <https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=4359d6e7d64444273436de745bffd060e834cc53&lat=2024&mid=b5c2567dc4949bd5ba70e03b8ec45a7aa59cbd6e>

*About AIWOS:*

AIWOS is a national level start-up competition exclusively for Women to
spark entrepreneurship interest in women students. We are bringing together
experts and organizations for a 1st of its kind *Women Exclusive Startup
Program* to maximize their learning and career outcomes.

*Women students registering/participating for AIWOS ? *

   - Tailored training programs to enhance employability (Registered
   Students will get details of upcoming webinars)


   - Mentorship from industry leaders and successful entrepreneurs
   - Chance for start-ups to be considered by top angel investors and
   incubators for funding and incubation support
   - Internship/Placement opportunities at top corporates

Kindly motivate women students to take advantage of this opportunity to
accelerate their careers and step towards their entrepreneurial journey!

 PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sWNE6HblCwe1vf3T3QZvXVtFtOmzBdnQ/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=2989eedcbd6de7b1c233fab1ecb73708951fc41c&lat=2024&mid=b5c2567dc4949bd5ba70e03b8ec45a7aa59cbd6e>



*With Warm Regards,**Amit Dutta**,*

November 2024











Giving thanks for our community


Here at Codecademy, our community is what keeps us going! Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re

>>>> Dear all,
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, Clubs
>>>> Management | Technical Club is excited to introduce the "*Learn After
>>>> College Hours*" initiative. We believe that education extends beyond
>>>> the classroom and that collaborative learning can thrive even after formal
>>>> college hours.
>>>>
>>>> In this context, we are organizing a webinar on *"Blockchain
>>>> Foundations: The Core of Trustless Technology"*. This session will be
>>>> delivered by *Ms. Naina Parmar*
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> *Webinar Details:*
>>>>
>>>>    - *Date:* 25th September,2024
>>>>    - *Time:* 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
>>>>    - *Mode:* Online (MS Teams - The joining link will be sent to
>>>>    registered participants only.)
>>>>
>>>> *Why Attend?*
>>>>
>>>> Blockchain technology is reshaping industries by enabling secure,
>>>> decentralized, and transparent systems. Through this session, you will:
>>>>
>>>>    - Understand the core principles of blockchain and its architecture.
>>>>    - Explore the concept of a *trustless system* and how blockchain
>>>>    ensures security without intermediaries.
>>>>    - Learn about the real-world applications of blockchain in various
>>>>    sectors like finance, healthcare, and supply chain.
>>>>    - Get insights into future career opportunities in the blockchain
>>>>    domain.
>>>>
>>>>  *Registration Process:*
>>>>
>>>> To attend this insightful session, please click the link below to
>>>> register:
>>>>
>>>> Â·       Registration link: https://forms.gle/LfTufATSkW11wUGK6
>>>>
>>>> Â·       Registration Deadline: 23rd , September 2024
>>>>
>>>> Itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity to expand your technical knowledge and
>>>> explore the future of digital trust.
>>>>
>>>> For any queries, please feel free to contact Ms. Dipika Damodar (Email
>>>> id: dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in | Contact: 7405862155).
>>>>
>>>> We look forward to your active participation!
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> --
>>>> Best Regards,
>>>> Clubs Management | Technical Club

snippet: Invitation to "Introduction to Dart Programming" Webinar - Meeting Details Dear all, In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, the Clubs Management | Technical Club is excited
content:
Invitation to "Introduction to Dart Programming" Webinar - Meeting Details

Dear all,

In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, the Clubs
Management | Technical Club is excited to introduce the "Introduction to
Dart Programming" initiative. We believe education extends beyond the
classroom, and collaborative learning can thrive even after formal college
hours.

In this context, we are organizing a webinar on "Introduction to Dart
Programming," which will be delivered by *Mr. Pravin Jadav*.

*Webinar Details:*

   - *Date*: 22nd October 2024
   - *Time*: 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM
   - *Mode*: Online (MS Teams - Kindly find the meeting ID and passcode
   below)

*Meeting ID*: 487 560 116 851
*Passcode*: jGkvc8

We look forward to your active participation in this session.

>>> hodds@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
>>> principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
>>>
>>>
>>> Dear all,
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, Clubs Management
>>> | Technical Club is excited to introduce the "*Learn After College
>>> Hours*" initiative. We believe that education extends beyond the
>>> classroom and that collaborative learning can thrive even after formal
>>> college hours.
>>>
>>> In this context, we are organizing a webinar on *"Blockchain
>>> Foundations: The Core of Trustless Technology"*. This session will be
>>> delivered by *Ms. Naina Parmar*
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> *Webinar Details:*
>>>
>>>    - *Date:* 25th September,2024
>>>    - *Time:* 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
>>>    - *Mode:* Online (MS Teams - The joining link will be sent to
>>>    registered participants only.)
>>>
>>> *Why Attend?*
>>>
>>> Blockchain technology is reshaping industries by enabling secure,
>>> decentralized, and transparent systems. Through this session, you will:
>>>
>>>    - Understand the core principles of blockchain and its architecture.
>>>    - Explore the concept of a *trustless system* and how blockchain
>>>    ensures security without intermediaries.
>>>    - Learn about the real-world applications of blockchain in various
>>>    sectors like finance, healthcare, and supply chain.
>>>    - Get insights into future career opportunities in the blockchain
>>>    domain.
>>>
>>>  *Registration Process:*
>>>
>>> To attend this insightful session, please click the link below to
>>> register:
>>>
>>> Â·       Registration link: https://forms.gle/LfTufATSkW11wUGK6
>>>
>>> Â·       Registration Deadline: 23rd , September 2024
>>>
>>> Itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity to expand your technical knowledge and
>>> explore the future of digital trust.
>>>
>>> For any queries, please feel free to contact Ms. Dipika Damodar (Email
>>> id: dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in | Contact: 7405862155).
>>>
>>> We look forward to your active participation!
>>>
>>>
>>> --
>>> Best Regards,
>>> Clubs Management | Technical Club
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> --
>>> Regards:
>>> Dr Dweepna Garg
>>> Head Of Department & Assistant Professor
>>> Department of Computer Engineering
>>> Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)
>>> Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
>>> Contact No. : 02697-265321 (Intercom)
>>>

subject: 3rd Semester University Examination Schedule (Regular) November 2024
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the attached schedule for the upcoming University Examination of the Odd semester (3rd) for the Academic Year 2024-25. You are required to adhere to the following guidelines
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the attached schedule for the upcoming University Examination
of the Odd semester (3rd) for the Academic Year 2024-25.

You are required to adhere to the following guidelines during the
examination period:

Uphold decorum in the examination hall at all times.
Bags must be left outside the exam hall.
Wear your ID Card throughout the exam.
Report to the exam venue and be seated at least 15 minutes before the
scheduled exam time.
Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly
prohibited inside the exam hall.
Please note: The seating arrangement will be shared with you shortly.

Wishing you all the best! Prepare well for your exams.
-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Fwd: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - Worldâ€™s No. 1 Ethical Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (Oct 2024) - For CHARUSAT Students Only
snippet: Dear Students, Grab the opportunity as mentioned in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Pritesh Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, 21 Oct 2024, 9:44
content:
Dear Students,

Grab the opportunity as mentioned in trailing mail.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Pritesh Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, 21 Oct 2024, 9:44 am
Subject: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - Worldâ€™s No. 1 Ethical
Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (Oct 2024) - For CHARUSAT
Students Only
To:


Dear students,

We are glad to inform you that *"Charotar University of Science and
Technology - CHARUSAT"* is the official *EC-Council Academia Partner *since
January 2020. We are immensely pleased to welcome â€œCHARUSATâ€ *students* to
EC Council's newly launched *CEHv13* program. Certified Ethical
Hacker CEHv13
<https://www.eccouncil.org/programs/certified-ethical-hacker-ceh/> will
teach you the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and
methodologies hackers and information security professionals use to hack an
organization lawfully. *100+ students have benefited from CEH at CHARUSAT
with a subsidized academia kit price.*

*Whatâ€™s new in CEHv13?*: *From the creators of Certified Ethical Hacker
(CEH) comes the latest and evolved version 13 with added AI capabilities.
Structured across 20 learning modules covering over 550 attack techniques,
CEH provides cybersecurity professionals with the core knowledge they need
to detect and defend against emerging threats.*

*You will get:*

   - EC-Council Official Course Book for CEHv13 for self-study (24 Months) -
   Accessible Online/Offline. To Download App
   <https://support.vitalsource.com/hc/en-us/articles/201344733-Bookshelf-Download-Options>

   - Access To iLabs for 6 Months. Check the ilabs Demo Here:
   *https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI* <https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI>.
   - An Exam Voucher (1 Year) - *Get a globally recognized certificate
for* passing
   the exam. Accreditations
   <https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fwww.eccouncil.org%2faccreditations%2f&c=E,1,hLej6Kb3ZRL_QKhhm71kedMm89bbj8UclU3d50zuCt2frG_t19Fir_60SvUk16RJBGYXwVBLF11HLMhr7nDv8WGkPElWNiTm9zdZ_xfo&typo=1>
   - Over 200 hands-on labs with Over 3,500 hacking tools. Learn how to
   hack multiple operating systems (Windows 11, Windows servers, Linux,
   Ubuntu, Android)
   - The venue of the Exam will be our University Premises.

*Popular Cybersecurity Tools in the Course:*


* - Network scanning and mapping tools (e.g., Nmap, hping3)- Vulnerability
assessment tools (e.g., OpenVAS, Nessus)- Penetration testing tools (e.g.,
Metasploit, Aircrack-ng)- Packet sniffers and network analyzers (e.g.,
Wireshark, Omnipeek Network Analyzer)- Social engineering tools (e.g.,
Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET), SpeedPhish Framework (SPF))- Password
cracking tools (e.g., John the Ripper, L0phtCrack)- Forensics tools (e.g.
FTK, EnCase, Autopsy)- Wireless hacking tools (e.g., Aircrack-ng,
Wifiphisher)- Encryption tools (e.g., CryptoForge, VeraCrypt)*
*Master AI to automate ethical hacking tasks and hack and defend against AI
systems.*

*â€¢ ShellGPT* â€“ Automates various reconnaissance and penetration testing
tasks using AI-driven scripting.
*â€¢ ChatGPT *â€“ Helps generate code, automate tasks, and create scripts for
ethical hacking.
â€¢ *FraudGPT* â€“ Simulates AI-assisted malicious activities to learn defense
strategies.
â€¢ *WormGPT* â€“ An offensive AI tool used to simulate exploitations and
malware creation.
â€¢ *DeepExploit* â€“ AI-powered vulnerability scanning and exploitation tool.
â€¢ *Nebula* â€“ Automates network discovery and vulnerability identification
with AI.
â€¢ *Veed.io* â€“ Can visualize security analytics and post-exploitation
results for better reporting.


*Typical Job Roles for C|EH :*

   - Mid-Level Information Security Auditor
   - Cybersecurity Auditor
   - Security Administrator
   - IT Security Administrator
   - Cyber Defense Analyst
   - Senior Security Consultant
   - Information Security Manager
   - Senior SOC Analyst
   - Solution Architect
   - Cybersecurity Consultant



   - Vulnerability Assessment Analyst
   - Warning Analyst
   - Information Security Analyst 1
   - Security Analyst L1
   - Infosec Security Administrator
   - Cybersecurity Analyst L1, L2, & L3
   - Network Security Engineer
   - SOC Security Analyst
   - Security Analyst
   - Network Engineer

*Webinar on "A Career in Cybersecurity" by EC-Council with Collaboration of
CHARUSAT | Campus Official: *https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-QgxO3JhlA


*Testimonials:*

   - How Certified Ethical Hacker Helped Me Land a Job with Big4 | Sidhant
   Gupta <https://youtu.be/PLvVyh96n8M?si=IVLEptb5F-QPMUaw>

subject: CHARUSAT - FMS - IIIM - Invitation @ Prabandhan 2024 (Exhibition cum Sale) - Inaugural Ceremony
snippet: Dear All, Greetings! We are thrilled to inform you that Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM) is organising PRABANDHAN â€“ 2024 from October 25 to 28, 2024 (10:00 AM to 09:00 PM). Prabandhan
content:
Dear All,



Greetings!



We are thrilled to inform you that Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of
Management (IIIM) is organising *PRABANDHAN â€“ 2024 *from October 25 to 28,
2024 (10:00 AM to 09:00 PM).


Prabandhan is a student-driven event in which students work in close
collaboration with industries, entrepreneurs, gruh-udhyog, and SMEs to
understand the product, devise marketing strategies, learn financial
management and negotiation skills, and ultimately sell the product.


You are invited to visit the exhibition with your family, friends, and
relatives to motivate the student participants.




The inaugural ceremony details are as follows:



*Chief Guest: Anitaben Patel & Aartiben Patel (IPCO Parivar)*

*Place: Sardar Patel Banquet Hall, Anand (Opp. D Z Patel High School, 80
Feet Road, Anand)*

*Date: October 25, 2024 (Friday)*

*Timing: 10:00 AM*



*Please find the attached invitation and product poster herewith this mail.*


*Hoping to see you all at Prabandhan 2024 during all the four days of the
event (October 25-28, 2024).*



*Regards,*



*TEAM PRABANDHAN - IIIM*

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener ULSC <convener.ecc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Oct 18, 2024, 6:37â€¯PM
Subject: CHARUSAT Team Selection for All India/West Zone Inter University
Youth Festival 2024-25
To: <family@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Pritesh Patel <priteshpatel.sports@charusat.ac.in>, Jay Patel <
jaypatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Pinal Patel <pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

We are excited to invite you to participate in the selection process for
the CHARUSAT team at the upcoming All India/West Zone Inter University
Youth Festival 2024-25. This festival is a prestigious platform where you
can showcase your talents and represent our university on a national level.

*Benefits of Participation:*

- Recognition and Exposure: Gain visibility and recognition for your
talents.

- Skill Development: Enhance your leadership, teamwork, and creative skills.

- National-Level Opportunities: The chance to represent CHARUSAT at
national youth festivals.

- Networking: Build connections with peers across universities.

*Important Details:*

*- Registration Form: *https://forms.gle/C1VFdPTgfucvzUHKA

*- Deadline for Registration:* 1st November, 2024

*- Guidelines, Rules, and Regulations*: Please review the attached
documents carefully for event details and required documents.

We encourage all students to take advantage of this opportunity to grow and
make CHARUSAT proud. For any queries, feel free to contact us.

subject: Fwd: Reg. Anti-ragging Registration for First Year Student
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ashish Katira <ashishkatira.dit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 1:08 PM Subject: Reg. Anti-ragging Registration for First Year Student To:
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ashish Katira <ashishkatira.dit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 1:08â€¯PM
Subject: Reg. Anti-ragging Registration for First Year Student
To: <24dit@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head IT DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <hod.itds@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <
amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>, Sachin Patel <sachinpatel.dit@charusat.ac.in>,
Ritika Jani <ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>, Radhika Patel <
radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Greetings...!

Kindly find the below-mentioned affidavit of the anti-ragging registration
for AY 2024-25. You are informed to complete it on or before *27/09/2024
(Friday).*

Kindly find the revised process for filing the anti-ragging affidavit.

Step-1: Go to www.antiragging.in or http://www.antiragging
.in/affidavit_university_form.php read and confirm you and your parents
have read and understood the AICTE regulations on curbing the menace of
ragging. Confirm and agree that you will not engage in ragging in any form.

Step-2: Fill in the information as desired and submit the form. Read and
confirm that you and your parents have read and understood the AICTE
regulations

Step-3: On successful completion, you will receive an email regarding the
reference number and weblink where you will be able to check your
registration status

Step-4: Go to http://www.antiragging.in/undertaking_request.php and *generate
an undertaking document. Take a print of it. Put your signature and your
parent's signature and submit the hard copy of it to your respective
counselor Faculties. The counselor will submit it to me on 30 /09/2024 once
all students have completed it for their batch*.
[Reference ID can be found in your mail received from the anti-ragging
 committee.]

Step-5: Go to this google form link : https://forms.gle/bvRammcwEUDYe1bm7
and Submit Anti-Ragging Form(Signed copy of Student & Parents)

*Refer to this information for filling up the online affidavit:*
Principal Name: Dr. Bankim Patel
College phone no: 02697-247500
Nearest Police station: Mehlav

Kindly contact Ashish Katira sir (Room 227 - DEPSTAR) for any queries.

Regards,
Katira Ashish D.



-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Kindly go through trailing mail and act accordingly.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Jimit R Patel <jimitpatel.maths@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 17, 2024 at 9:43â€¯AM
Subject: First and second Assignment Submission Status for MA253 (DMA)
To: Bhavika Patel <bhavikapatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Ritika Jani <
ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <hod.itds@charusat.ac.in>, <
hod.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Head Maths <head.maths@charusat.ac.in>, Dr.
Pragnesh Makwana <pragneshmakwana.maths@charusat.ac.in>


Dear students,



The following students have not submitted their assignments:



*First Assignment Submission in offline mode:*



*DIT:* 23DIT049; 23DIT050; D24DIT086; D24DIT088



*DCE:* 23DCE017; 23DCE081; 23DCE098; D24DCE131; D24DCE137; D24DCE142;
D24DCE145; D24DCE146; D24DCE148; D24DCE150; D24DCE151; D24DCE158;
D24DCE159; D24DCE162

23DIT059; 23DIT062; 23DIT067; 23DIT071; D24DIT086; D24DIT088; D24DIT095

D24DCE145; D24DCE146; D24DCE151; D24DCE159; D24DCE164



Kindly complete your submission process before 11:00 AM on 18/10/2024.



If you do not submit your assignment, you will lose your internal marks.


Regards.

-- 

*Dr. Jimitkumar R. Patel*

Assistant Professor, Department of Mathematical Sciences,

P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences (PDPIAS),

subject: Announcement of ULSC Logo Competition Winner
snippet: Dear Students and Faculty, We are excited to announce the winner of the ULSC Logo Competition! After careful consideration and review of all the creative submissions, we are pleased to congratulate
content:
Dear Students and Faculty,

We are excited to announce the winner of the ULSC Logo Competition!

After careful consideration and review of all the creative submissions, we
are pleased to congratulate *Satyam Charola (ID: 22CE016)* as the winner of
this competition. His design will represent the ULSC, and we appreciate the
effort and creativity he put into the logo.

Satyam was awarded with a cash prize for his achievement.

We extend our heartfelt thanks to all participants for their outstanding
contributions and enthusiasm. Stay tuned for more such opportunities!

Best regards,

*Convener*


*University Level Central Students Council*

*CHARUSAT.*

--

Dear All!!

We are thrilled to invite you to our upcoming event of Expert talk with *Smt.
Sunaina Tomar (IAS)* *Additional Chief Secretary (Higher and Technical
Education),Government of Gujarat *on 17/10/2024 at 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.
This event promises to be a fantastic opportunity to connect, share ideas,
and engage with fellow participants.

*Event Details:*

*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

content:

subject: Fwd: Urgent: Encouragement for Student Participation in Yuva Sangam Phase-5.
snippet: Dear all, Intrested students may register for Yuva Sangam Phase-5. Regards, Rajesh Patel ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date:
content:
Dear all,

Intrested students may register for Yuva Sangam Phase-5.

Regards,
Rajesh Patel

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 11 Oct, 2024, 4:28â€¯pm
Subject: Fwd: Urgent: Encouragement for Student Participation in Yuva
Sangam Phase-5.
To: HOD Depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE(no-reply) <noreply9@aicte-india.org>
Date: Fri, Oct 11, 2024 at 4:25â€¯PM
Subject: Urgent: Encouragement for Student Participation in Yuva Sangam
Phase-5.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Vice Chancellor/Director/Principal/ Dean,

Greetings from AICTE!

As you know, Yuva Sangam is a key initiative under the Ek Bharat Shreshtha
Bharat (EBSB) program, launched by the Hon'ble Prime Minister of India.
This flagship program facilitates exposure tours for youth primarily
students from Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) to experience diverse
cultures and achievements across different states. Through these exchanges,
we aim to foster national integration and understanding among young people.

Yuva Sangam not only emphasizes cultural exchange but also includes
activities designed to enhance leadership, sports, and soft skills.
Participants will engage in workshops on communication and teamwork, take
part in sports events organized by SAI, and have the chance to interact
with VVIPs and notable personalities from the host state.

The success of previous Yuva Sangam phases underscores the vital role of
youth in building connections across communities. This initiative has
positively impacted the lives of thousands, contributing to a more united
and inclusive India.

I encourage you to motivate your students to register for Yuva Sangam
Phase-5, an enriching student exchange program under EBSB.

Registration is open from *October 10, 2024* to *October 21, 2024* and can
be completed online at https://ebsb.aicte-india.org/.

Please find attached a document with strategies to inspire student
registrations for Yuva Sangam.

PFA:

subject: Alumni Talk: Global Opportunities - Navigating Higher Studies in Canada & the USA
snippet: Dear Students, We look forward to sharing how our alumni have applied their knowledge and skills to get into colleges in Canada and the USA on October 12, 2024, from 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM. This will be a
content:
Dear Students,

We look forward to sharing how our alumni have applied their knowledge and
skills to get into colleges in Canada and the USA on October 12, 2024, from
5:00 PM to 6:00 PM.

This will be a very informative session where you will learn how to deal
with Canadian and American higher education institutions. Our highly
regarded alumni will tell you about the application process, study
programs, and life as an international student.
-- 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Prof. Hitesh Makwana*

*Assistant Professor*

*Department of Information Technology*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (Depstar)*

*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*

*Mo: 8460752501*

--

subject: Fwd: Tata STRIVE _free Google certification program 2024 with Charusat University
snippet: Dear Charusat University Learners Greetings from Tata STRIVE!!! This is regarding the Tata STRIVE _Google Career Certificate Scholarship Program These are scholarships for the Google certification
content:
Dear Charusat University Learners
Greetings from Tata STRIVE!!!
This is regarding the Tata STRIVE _Google Career Certificate Scholarship
Program

These are scholarships for the Google certification program and Tata STRIVE
is bringing them to your institution. These programs can help students get
on the fast track to an entry-level job in a high-growth field. Students do
not need relevant experience to complete this flexible, online job training.

You can complete the certificate at your own pace in the given time.

There are 8 Google industry relevant Domain / Technical courses. (Anyone
you can choose)
1. Google Data Analytics Professional
2. Google UX Design
3. Google IT Support
4. Google IT Automation with Python
5. Google Digital Marketing and E-Commerce
6. Google Business intelligence
7. Google Advanced Data Analytics
8. Google Cybersecurity
Along with Google Certifications, Tata STRIVE also offers complimentary
Youth Development Modules (YDM) Course (20 hrs). These modules are Leading
Self, Leading at Social Relationships, and Leading at Work. These will also
be hosted online on the TCS-ion platform.

We are also offering Subject Matter Expert (SME) Sessions, where an online
platform will be set up for esteemed speakers from high-profile companies
and students to interact and clear doubts.

kindly refer the below details:
Registration Link:

To register for the Google Certification Program, please use the following
link:

Registration Link
<https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxv-yuk-dhiTbUdks9rAKDSMroBtNdhDfbdxcxheU2Qjnmi9G1ZkPgqsYWduE6JWL8TIQ/exec>

by selecting the proper options


*State: GujaratDistrict: AnandInstitute name: Charusat University*

Registration Deadline: 12th Oct 2024 up to 12:00 noon

Orientation Date:
Course End date: 18th Dec, 2024




Thank you!

*----------------------------*

*Thanks & Regards,Ashwin Makwana/Sujal Dadhaniya*
*TPO - **Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*,
*Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *
AT: Changa, Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat.
(T) 02697-265213, 265214 (M) 9662255116
E: tpo@charusat.ac.in / tnp@charusat.ac.in

Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC
"Helping hand to shape a CAREER to achieve DREAMS"

--

subject: Fwd: Invite Your Students to Participate in the XR Creator Hackathon â€“ A Prestigious National-Level Opportunity
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly Grab the opportunity. Regards, Rajesh Patel ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Oct 9, 2024 at 9:13
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly Grab the opportunity.

Regards,
Rajesh Patel

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Oct 9, 2024 at 9:13â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Invite Your Students to Participate in the XR Creator
Hackathon â€“ A Prestigious National-Level Opportunity
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Chhavi Garg <chhavi@bharatxr.co>
Date: Tue, Oct 8, 2024 at 11:56â€¯PM
Subject: Invite Your Students to Participate in the XR Creator Hackathon â€“
A Prestigious National-Level Opportunity
To: Principal Depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Respected Sir/Ma'am,

Are your students ready to take the leap into the future of technology? The *XR
Creator Hackathon <https://forms.gle/3A9XmiQbcx76LUaU6>* is not just
another competition; it's a* gateway to innovation*,* recognition, and
real-world experience* in the thriving field of Extended Reality (XR)! We
invite your esteemed institution to be a part of this transformative
challenge, proudly presented under the *"Create in India" initiative* at
the *WAVES Summit (World Audio Visual & Entertainment Summit)
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2HUCq26MeJMXJl19DnlBbBTm4nTkC-suE3F0hrbhjN2T-QPRskgFkwyYJWufNamnf0QSX7g0kUmTtofrVVLvT0aff-uNMtHspgOSAku0wXPTyifprWfg9wikDaY5skQus9eebkHfZdYm8BVyULyAJ6pFHqjOLyC46WB1De4_nN-FPyg>,
*in collaboration with the *Ministry of Information & Broadcasting
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2nGIF5f2RutoKyLKWBBb8K00uYrAQ9RdT8VO0ghWHdPEBQfRskgFky6fDjv889b-RcvuaENJn4L5oV-JRubGRn9xj5wRmR8ThvhicikGsoN4tvvblkEd6WKiYAboODzh22Zw4cloMDCqIjfBHUKa5ZPelHvByghpbjw444S5KrUCInkw>,
Bharat XR,
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/28-WaDsymZgg9SRn415QBFM8wUgJf_NOXsTeJY97hOr0DQfRskgEPotDczTVFEbbDAJmkxZwGoI6SOigwzDNDK0-oEBdOENBBIsCl0l-21T4OmdRvKbfBbd9zyL0A3s-ut1X6u7jjqDP5FIO3Mj9apmbWgCqlC_8FB6E_M3VntKi7Ctk>
Wavelaps, and XDG.*

At *Bharat XR
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2TqD2nVTfjJpghpWdCFL0k6jvuDrjhA-Hg20msn-mtUYGQfRskgFAr3lMXKb_7c9l7VfEMVZuVoeU-rQcucbI6ieTZ0LUbN3qRH9EVMlBe-JJf7TOv73oJ8kgA0OylM0heRwmvrfBhk2gdABl5jNjvaGGv85E5Ku8ATof-0cgFoucL5w>*,
we are passionate about leading the charge in Extended Reality technologies
in India. Our mission is to *empower and nurture the next generation of XR
talent,* and this hackathon is a direct extension of that vision. By
participating, your students have the chance to engage with the latest
AR/VR tools, gain hands-on experience, and be recognized on national and
global stages.

*What Awaits the Participants?  *

   - A prize pool of 5 lakh INR
   - Investment opportunities for their winning ideas
   - Global recognition in the XR industry
   - A fully sponsored trip to the WAVES Summit in New Delhi
   - Exclusive chances for sponsored trips to international AR/VR
   conferences

*Choose from Exciting Themes:*
Students can dive into one of five dynamic themes:

   - Healthcare, Fitness, Well-Being
   - Educational Transformation
   - Immersive Tourism
   - Digital Media & Entertainment
   - E-Commerce & Retail Transformation

*How to Register?*

   - Form to nominate yourself as the *PoC* for the hackathon:
   https://forms.gle/dhqDYnkvcBM2ySjX9
   <https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2H2wWoZQmtvt2K0oJxqQo0zolSUAzcL-mNaMzAV4vVPUJQfRskgEylTD0KCvVrLF78i_k4Hdt7Qwnb24b_YGfHVA8s22eiCnpDEQWfiltZsJrCPIflrifqKNOAHmB8wxo6Bd4wzvWm_FKGAOBPAgEMUjCCQIPGUyg_3eVItlU78DeA5BhJaXNrt2JOcDAM_NI7Q>
   - About XR Creator Hackathon: https://wavelaps.com/xrcreatorhackathon/
   <https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2h2Tvnvrvpj7WzNFu9yyAM6sqW4TCY9VMQhz8dn_1-BoLQfRskgFGqZisTc4I04fUt68FoOhoCmfQif8pUS9hGxb8Qla3NBaxIY1tVWWxNN-D6rtJm5bM4SoBzSlRTA1jw0a0car44YaOLbua1JnckV4tltqhCuljJJ9HZw1MVopsurK25vggRZAXJS7C8ck>
   - Encourage your students to *register individually* here, exclusively
   for the college students: https://forms.gle/3A9XmiQbcx76LUaU6
   <https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2uNlK7ddGfMTB6yUiEqPTqJaR2L397T8Wj5jwy1-rxjEOQfRskgEo7m0K2BayFBEzyVzl8ipJGp83q5MxppZ0WxxTUeYMDZzf6lbTpdIUsCtZKX6Y_E47h8LEbqtuPjJBh0Adi88ylsrAJOQEsZSs_ipIdvj-qc-mJRx-WUv_EMYN-EgBNaP358SclcrYDoQ3YA>
   - *WAVES Summit:* https://wavesindia.org/
   <https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2of5ReGGRIaA2zI4JTkd8nAu2BJulYoCcryXohTMcJ2MQQfRskgFgf8SWsQvuIidtHftHleZ42kl8ETMJhU2PNbGvfu7vfGFJyVofNaA38cyMRBNmquaysa8ljQM_Hud_aBCf_233GeEhxWq0-Q9bTXsFQB0Ks_5LuiyyKsVvfXNJeQ>

*Incentives for Your Institution:*
Your institution can shine brighter with our incentives:

   - *100+ registrations*: The point of contact will receive a digital
   certificate of appreciation featuring the Ministry of Information &
   Broadcasting logo.
   - *200+ registrations*: Your college's logo will be displayed on our
   official event website, enhancing your institution's visibility across the
   nation.

*Why Is This Challenge Essential?*
We urge your institution to rally your students to register before the
*deadline* on *October 15, 2024*. This remote challenge is open to all
Indian citizens and offers a platform for students to develop their skills,
innovate with cutting-edge technologies, and connect with industry
professionals.

*Support for Beginners:*
To empower every student, we are offering dedicated learning sessions for
beginners during the ideation and implementation phases. The first session
on* October 11, 2024*, will unveil the latest advancements in AR and VR. We
are also open to organizing tailored sessions for your college to ensure
students have the best possible start.

Attached is an official letter from* Mrs. Neerja Sekhar, IAS, Additional
Secretary to the Government of India, Ministry Of Information &
Broadcasting*, which provides further details about our collaboration and
the significance of this event.

By partnering with *Bharat XR* and other esteemed organizations, your
institution will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of XR in India.
Join us in inspiring the next generation of XR innovators! Your support can
be the catalyst that propels your students into an exciting future.
Together, we can foster a culture of creativity and excellence in AR/VR
technology.

Letâ€™s make history together by shaping the future of XR technology!

Warm regards,
Chhavi Garg
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2nDoN2GlGs6Kq3gresiDhlG_3s7hqoFS7IVyzwvk6ltoTQfRskgFaXVYZ_f2_sRIjl6YQp6o8HLCm6u51SAYWY3__dS01-XBd7WoFN-MFx0NNZD0_7bRzjlviWgGPOS0LB5pZ-InYZAx_PFQF2yF_SqgLWoTgiWB0LgrUeCDZ1aR5EZ_TdGVO>
Founder & CEO, Bharat XR
<https://bharatxr-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2-oPCcLoPBfqN7p3leYV-v5grQ9PiGQeBieN-Bfdy6wMVQfRskgF2G8KVzAcWHgrvcg7OHicUjw3s77qeps3LFwwRuGJKHQuMcFI1h36xbWDLShDJP2OkIbAFXa1a7_oJjvnbc7sdQ4_FGPlDtew-tjkhj8WCSBj__a3y0CrZp6O3bukt295l-kvw8roq>
7678158081

October 2024











Breaking into cybersecurity

â€Œ


With so much valuable data stored online, nearly every industry is hiring 
roles to help keep our information safe. This year alone, there were 469,930 
job openings in the United States requestingcybersecurity-related skills 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/in-demand-skills-for-cybersecurity-careers/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=blog_cybersecurity_skills_text>
. This Cybersecurity Awareness Month, we're hosting 3 virtual events with 
experts in this growing field, introducing new skill paths to prepare you for 
in-demand industry certifications, and unpacking what it takes to start working 
in cybersecurity.



Hereâ€™s to staying cyber secure, 

The Codecademy Team 







COMING SOON <> 




 
<https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/cybersecurity?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_cybersecurity_course_catalog_img>




Prepare for top industry certifications with 20+ new skill paths


In competitive fields like cybersecurity, certifications can be key to career 
growth. Our new skill paths will help you build the foundation youâ€™ll need to 
pass the exam for the latest in-demand certifications. While you wait for our 
new skill paths, check out our catalog of free video-based cybersecurity 
courses.


Explore courses 
<https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/cybersecurity?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_cybersecurity_course_catalog_cta>






NEW AND UPDATED COURSES <> 



 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-git?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_2024_git_github_img>

Learn Git & GitHub


We worked with experts at GitHub to update our popular course to align with 
the GitHub Foundations Certification. Try it out and get hands-on experience 
with the GitHub Desktop and Mobile apps.


Start course 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-git?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_2024_git_github_cta>

 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/retrieval-augmented-generation-for-ai-applications?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_2024_rag_img>

Creating AI Applications using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)


Learn how to give your large language model the powers of retrieval with RAG, 
and build a RAG app with Streamlit and ChromaDB.


Start course 
<https://www.codecademy.com/learn/retrieval-augmented-generation-for-ai-applications?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=curriculum_2024_rag_cta>

October 24


Fireside Chat with Space X & United States Air Force Cybersecurity 
Professional, Garry Carman

Register now 
<https://community.codecademy.com/c/events/expert-insights-space-x-united-states-air-force-cybersecurity-with-garry-carman?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=community_events_cybersecurity_insights_cta>

Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/cybersecurity-careers/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=october_2024_monthly_newsletter&utm_content=blog_cybersecurity_skills_cta>

content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out CPI_2024_Term work Problem Statement
Here's what was received.


CPI_2024_Term work Problem Statement


This is a group exercise. Each group shall have two students (one problem  
per group).
Identify a problem that you would like to solve creatively. (The problem  
should be one that you have identified during lectures.)
You can change your problem statement in the future unlimited times.
Use your Institute Email ID only.


Your email (d24dit079@charusat.edu.in) was recorded when you submitted this  
form.


Select your Class *


DCE-1


DIT-1


DCE-2


CL


D2D CL


Full Roll Number of 1st Student in group *


D24DIT079


Full Roll Number of 2nd Student in group


D24DIT091


Full Roll Number of 3rd Student in group (Only with my permission third  
member will be allowed, based on your problem selection)


Full Name of 1st Student in group *


Chauhan Om DharmendraKumar


Full Name of 2nd Student in group


Patel AnshKumar GanshyamBhai


Full Name of 3rd Student in group (Only with my permission third member  
will be allowed, based on your problem selection)


Name of your group (Be creative!) *


Combating Corruption


Detailed Problem Statement (Must be clear, specific and without any  
grammatical errors) *


Corruption undermines public institutions, hampers economic growth, and  
erodes trust in governance. It occurs when individuals misuse their power  
for personal gain, often at the cost of public welfare.


CIA method of questioning

Answers must be of minimum 150 words and meaningful.
AI generated copy paste will impact your final marks.


Why does this problem need to be solved?
*


Solving the problem of corruption is crucial because it directly threatens  
the functioning and stability of societies. It undermines the integrity of  
public institutions, leading to poor governance, inefficiency, and mistrust  
in leaders. Corruption hinders economic growth by diverting public  
resources for private gain, discouraging foreign investment, and creating  
an uneven playing field for businesses. This leads to poverty, inequality,  
and reduced access to essential services such as education, healthcare, and  
infrastructure.


What benefits come from solving the problem?
*


Stronger Economic Growth Improved Public Services Increased Trust in  
Institutions


What don't you understand yet?
*


What remains unclear is the specific context or focus of the corruption  
issue you are addressing.


What information do you have? Is it sufficient? Is it contradictory?
*


Definition and forms of corruption Consequences Global prevalence


Put a boundary around the problem-be clear about what is not the problem.
*


General inefficiency or incompetence Legal lobbying or advocacy Cultural or  
societal practices


What are the various parts of the problem? Identify and describe the  
relationships among the parts.
*


1. Political Corruption Definition: Misuse of public office or political  
power for private gain. 2. Economic Corruption Corruption that distorts  
market mechanisms and economic policies for personal or corporate gain. 3.  
Institutional Corruption Corruption that occurs within organizations,  
including businesses, law enforcement, and other institutions.


What cannot be changed about the problem? (Don't assume something can't be  
changed when in fact it can.)
*


Human Nature and Greed Cultural Norms


Think of another case of this same problem, but perhaps in a slightly  
different form, or in a different area altogether. Can you use the same  
solution, or the method that led to that solution?
*


Misuse of Power Impact on Public Welfare Cyclical Nature


Mind map and Fishbone Diagram


Prepare and submit the Mind-map and Fishbone diagram of your selected  
problem.


You may use websites then download in pdf format or may do it on a A3 size  
paper with sketch pens.


Upload Mind map diagram *


Submitted files



PDF mind-map - D24DIT079 OM CHAUHAN.pdf


Upload Fishbone diagram *


Submitted files



PDF fishbone - D24DIT079 OM CHAUHAN.pdf


SCAMPER technique

Use SCAMPER technique for your problem statement.
You may prepare a file in Microsoft word and then upload it here in pdf  
format. You can also represent files in other form as you deem suitable.


Upload a pdf file of SCAMPER technique. *


Submitted files



PDF Combating Corruption - D24DIT079 OM CHAUHAN.pdf


Create your own Google Form

Report Abuse

subject: Fwd: Invitation to "The Idea Show 3.0" â€“ Join Us for an Exciting Innovation Challenge!
snippet: Dear Students, We are thrilled to invite you to "The Idea Show 3.0" (In It To Win It), an exciting event jointly organized by Aavishkar Club, CMPICA, and CSIC, CHARUSAT. This is your chance
content:
Dear Students,

We are thrilled to invite you to *"The Idea Show 3.0" (In It To Win It)*,
an exciting event jointly organized by *Aavishkar Club, CMPICA, and CSIC,
CHARUSAT*. This is your chance to unleash your creativity, showcase
innovative ideas, and compete with like-minded peers in the fields of
*Automation,
Artificial Intelligence, and Healthcare*!

*Event Details: " **The Idea Show 3.0 (In It To Win It) "*

   - *Date*: 15th October 2024, Tuesday
   - *Theme*: Automation / Artificial Intelligence / Healthcare
   - *Team Size*: upto 4 Members
   - *Organizers*: Aavishkar Club, CMPICA, and CSIC, CHARUSAT
   - *Registration Link*: Click Here <https://tinyurl.com/Ideashow3>

We have also attached the *QR code* for quick access to the registration
link in the brochure.

All *participants will receive certificates*, and *winners will be awarded
exciting prizes* for their outstanding ideas.

Donâ€™t miss this golden opportunity to present your ideas, innovate, and
win! We look forward to your participation in making this event a success.

For any further queries, please feel free to contact the organizing team.
Find the brochure attached herewith. Furthermore, the details like venue
and timings will be shared by the email after registrations.


*Best Regards,*












*Aavishkar Club Members,Dr. Shailesh Khant,Dr. Arpankumar Raval,Dr. Kamini
Solanki,Dr. Sagar KavaiyaDr. Amisha SinghalaCSIC, Charusat,Dr. Jaimin
Undavia,Dr. Shailesh Khant,Dr. Kamini Solanki,Dr. Mittal Desai,*

*CHARUSAT*

-- 
*Regards,*
*Dr. Arpankumar G. Raval *
(PhD, MCA) Assistant Professor,
Faculty of Computer Science and
Applications, CMPICA, CHARUSAT,
Changa, Di. Anand Gujarat, INDIA.
Mobile: 940 840 4954

[image: image.png]


-- 
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: Reg. Faculty Feedback on E-Governance (Odd 2024-25)
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Hope you are doing well and zealously preparing well for the upcoming Winter examination, AY:2024-25. Please note that you all are supposed to give feedback of
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

Hope you are doing well and zealously preparing well for the upcoming
Winter examination, AY:2024-25.

Please note that you all are supposed to give *feedback of the faculties
who conducted lab/lecture sessions in the ODD Semester of AY:2024-25. *

You are supposed to give feedback from your respective login
of e-governance.

Link: *https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/*
<https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/>

Complete the task on or before *doing submission of any subjects. The last
date for Feedback submission is 18/10/2024.*

*Kindly note that the submissions should only be considered if the student
presents the screenshot of the completely submitted feedback on
e-governance.*

*If the feedback of any of the subjects is unfilled, please ask the student

content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
2024-25 Creativity Problem Solving and Innovation DCE-1, DCE-2, DIT-1, CL,  
D2D CL  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/Njk4MTAxNDUwNTg0&Email=d24dit079@charusat.edu.in>
Due tomorrow

Term work solution
Very
Important, Read full message

Dear All,



As you are aware that we are approaching an end of the semester. Hence, you  
all
need to complete the given problem to you in due course of time before the  
end
of the semester.


You can prepare a poster, prototype, presentation, video demonstration,  
blue print, website, social media groups, or whatever suitable solution to  
address your selected problem.

Example:


    -
    - Prepare a poster (minimum A2 size) either
    digitally or by hand drawings indicating problem statement, how you have
    approached a solution you are giving and how it will help others and
    society. Its possible outcomes and what have you learned. (What is poster
    and how to prepare: https://guides.nyu.edu/posters) Attached a template  
of poster.
    - Alternatively, you can prepare a working prototype of
    your model.  (How to prepare and types:  
https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/career-development/types-of-prototyping)




The deadline to
submit this term work is October 7, 2023.

Submission link: https://forms.gle/BjyEraMfTSVojydR9
Due Oct 7

subject: Fwd: ACM India Winter Schools 2024 Announcement
snippet: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT, Changa ---------- Forwarded message
content:
Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Pritesh Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, 5 Oct 2024, 11:09 am
Subject: ACM India Winter Schools 2024 Announcement
To: <21it@charusat.edu.in>, <22it@charusat.edu.in>, <23it@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear students,

Find the email below for your reference.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: ACM India
Date: Sat, Oct 5, 2024 at 11:00â€¯AM
Subject: ACM India Winter Schools 2024 Announcement
To: Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>


[image: ACM India Logo] <https://www.acm.org>
------------------------------
****ACM India Winter Schools 2024 Announcement**** [image: to view image
click on]

We are back with "ACM India Winter Schools 2024." ACM India schools offer
self-motivated students in-depth knowledge and exposure to research in
current, advanced technology areas. Each school in this stellar lineup
covers academic and applied research in the technology topic and is taught
by the best-in-class experts from academia and industry.
Applying for the Winter Schools

The *application fee *for this school program is Rs 150 + 18% GST; you can
give first and second preference in the application form. All payments are
non-refundable. We request you to *apply*
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b85x021529>
after
careful consideration since the demand is high and the seats are limited to *40
per school*.

And last but not least, as usual, one school is reserved for women
students. This time it is on "*Algorithms for Big Data and Machine Learning*"
at Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology
(DA-IICT), Gandhinagar.

Please apply for the Winter Schools 2024 here
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b86x021529>.

Last date for application: *Monday, October 21, 2024 (midnight IST)*
Announcement of selection via email: *Tuesday, November 5, 2024*
Registration deadline: *Friday, November 15, 2024 (midnight IST)*

Here is the list of the schools planned. More details about each school are
available via the respective schoolâ€™s page below.

Data Structures and Algorithms for Strings, with applications to Search
Engines and Computational Biology
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b87x021529>
Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, Coimbatore
12/12/24 - 24/12/24

Decoding AI: Building Explainable and Robust Intelligence
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b88x021529>
SRM University, Amravati, Andhra Pradesh
12/12/24 - 24/12/24

Algorithms for Big Data and Machine Learning
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b89x021529>
*(WOMEN
only)*
Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology
(DA-IICT) Gandhinagar
16/12/24 - 24/12/24

Introduction to Modern Cryptography
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b8ax021529>
IIT Madras, Chennai (Sponsored by CYSTAR, IIT Madras)
16/12/24 - 21/12/24

Please note that you *need not be an ACM member* to attend any of these
schools, but our usual recommendation is to become one and experience all
other benefits of ACM student membership
<https://maestro.acm.org/trk/click?ref=z16l2snue3_2-31722_0x342b8bx021529>! *
ACM student member attendees of the schools will get a 20% discount * on
the registration fees.

Selection & Registration

*Selection:* ACM India will select the students based on the data provided.
Selected students will be informed via email.

*Registration:* Only the selected students will be required to pay
non-refundable school fees, no more than * INR 2500 + 18% GST*. A payment
link will be provided only to the selected students. Please note that once
selected to a school you cannot change to another school. Also note that if
selected, you should pay and register, to be fair to those who could not
get in. So choose responsibly.

Each day comprises lectures as well as tutorial sessions with hands-on
problem-solving experience. The industry partnership can expose you to the
career options in the area covered by the school; some schools may organise
sessions dedicated to this.

Top performing students in these schools may earn opportunities for
internship in industry and will be invited to an all-expense-paid trip to
the *ACM India ARCS Symposium *and * ACM India Annual Event 2025 at PSG
Tech, Coimbatore * in February-March 2025.

Please feel free to circulate this message in your academic institution and
fellow student network.

Regards,

*ACM India Schools Committee*
------------------------------

--

subject: Reg: University Elective Exam of IT283 Web designing and UI/UX - 2024-25.
snippet: Dear Students, Gentle Reminder!! Your University Elective Subject (IT283 UI/UX) exam will be conducted as per below. Kindly join the classroom by today- 4 th Oct - 2024. Exam Date: 05/10/2024, Saturday
content:
Dear Students,


Gentle Reminder!!

Your University Elective Subject (IT283 UI/UX) exam will be conducted as
per below.
*Kindly join the classroom by today- **4th Oct - 2024.*



*Exam Date: 05/10/2024, Saturday*

*Exam Time: 03:00 pm to 04:30 pm (1.5 hours)*



*Note: The Google form will be shared on Google classroom during the exam
(2:55 pm) hence it is requested to join the link of the Classroom which is
mentioned below on or before 4th Oct - 2024.*



*Link : *https://classroom.google.com/c/NzE5ODgxNTQ0NDk2?cjc=t3bt43z



*OR*



*Google Classroom Code:* *t3bt43z*



*Please find the attachment, which has a Seating arrangement with a Google
classroom code (join the Google class as early as possible).*



*Instructions for examination:*



1. Be there at the examination venue before at least 15 minutes.



2. Opening any other tab other than the exam-related tabs, you will not be
able to submit the exam.



3.  Your signature on the sign sheet must appear without fail., if you have
appeared in the examination otherwise you will be considered as ABSENT in
the examination.



*Note: Students will not be allowed to appear in the examination from
outside the charusat or at home and all students must use the charusat
email Id for accessing and submitting the Google form. The form without
charusat email Id will not be accepted or considered for the exam. *


*For any query, you can ask Prof. Dhaval Patel or me (Rajnik Katriya).*


*Thanks & Regards,*
*Mr. Rajnik S Katriya,*
*B.E.(CE), M.E.(CE), Ph.D. Scholar,*
*Assistant Professor,*
*CSPIT-IT,*
*CHARUSAT, Anand, Gujarat.*
*Website <https://sites.google.com/view/rajnikkatriya> ||  LinkedIn
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/rajnik-katriya/>*



-- 

Best Regards,
Dipika A. Damodar,
Assistant Professor ,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Fwd: Revised Date : Register for the Advanced Drone Technology (Air Taxi ) Workshops - ( Space Education & Employment) for all the Students
snippet: Dear All, Greetings for the day!!! Interested students can explore potential for technology development, more details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal
content:
Dear All,

Greetings for the day!!!

Interested students can explore potential for technology development, more
details are in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Oct 4, 2024 at 10:16â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Revised Date : Register for the Advanced Drone Technology
(Air Taxi ) Workshops - ( Space Education & Employment) for all the Students
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CHARUSAT <info@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Oct 4, 2024 at 9:47â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Revised Date : Register for the Advanced Drone Technology
(Air Taxi ) Workshops - ( Space Education & Employment) for all the Students
To: Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <
principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <info@isl.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 3, 2024 at 6:42â€¯PM
Subject: Revised Date : Register for the Advanced Drone Technology (Air
Taxi ) Workshops - ( Space Education & Employment) for all the Students
To:


Respected Authority,

 â€œThe revised date for registering for the Advanced Drone Technology (Air
Taxi) Workshops, part of the broader initiative on Space Education and
Employment for all students, has been updatedâ€-Reg


This is in continuation of our previous communication in September 2024
regarding the initiatives by India Space Lab (à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤…à¤‚à¤¤à¤°à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤· à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¶à¤¾à¤²à¤¾) to
advance space science and technology. We are delighted to invite you to
Advanced Drone Workshop, The primary goal of this workshop is to enhance
space education and explore opportunities for technological advancement.

The Government of India, under the visionary leadership of Honorable PM
Shri Narendra Modi, has initiated groundbreaking reforms in the space
sector. These initiatives are designed to enhance and promote space
education, research, and development across the nation. A key highlight of
these efforts is the celebration of India Space Week, scheduled from August
12 to August 18, along with National Space Day on August 23. This event is
organized by the Bharat Antriksh Saptah/India Space Lab(à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤…à¤‚à¤¤à¤°à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤·
à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¶à¤¾à¤²à¤¾) include with the Department of Science and Technology.
Following the successful India Space Week event held from August 12 to 18,
and National Space Day, India Space Lab is conducting an Advanced Drone
(Air Taxi) workshop.

Public Notice/ Important Update:

Who can participate?
Anyone with a background in science and technology, including students and
faculty, is welcome to join the Advanced Drone Technology workshop.

Attached to this email is the link to register the workshop:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ZrHoMC16lgB593-_uylE-7Aq_gqDVy2gdIhns_68Fy0

Website : https://isl.ac.in/workshops.html

Mode: Online

Duration : 120 min ( 2 Hrs)

Date: October (5th, 12th, 13th & 19th) at 2 pm.

Medium: English, Hindi( Opt accordingly)

Those with exams or other commitments on the 5th can attend the workshop on
Sunday, October 13th. The workshop date will be set as per the students'
schedule, either on a Saturday or Sunday, to avoid disrupting the students'
schedules. Based on student requests, Students now have the flexibility to
attend the workshop on either October 5th or October 12th, 13th and 19th,
If some students cannot attend on these dates, we will organize an
additional workshop to accommodate them. We aim to ensure minimal
disruption to the students' schedules, so the adjustments will be made
based on the students' preferences ( Saturday or Sunday).

Additionally, we have lined up a series of workshops in upcoming months:
1. Advanced Drone Technology (Air Taxi)
2. CanSat & CubeSat ( Satellite Technology)
3. Astronomy & Astrophysics (Astrophotography)
4. Rocketry ( Advanced Rocket )

We look forward to your participation and engagement in our Advanced Drone
Workshop (Air Taxi).

Affiliation Regulatory Authority
India Space Lab( à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤…à¤‚à¤¤à¤°à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤· à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¶à¤¾à¤²à¤¾)
Email: info@isl.ac.in / indiaspacelab@gmail.com
Contact No:  7042880241 / 7042788858
Website: www.isl.ac.in

subject: Fwd: Student Achievement Records
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) always believes that Achievements (Academics)/Co-curricular Activities & Extra Co-curricular
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings!!!

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) always
believes that *Achievements (Academics)/Co-curricular Activities & Extra
Co-curricular Activities/Competitive Exams* are equally important for the
holistic development of students.

We always encourage students to take participation in various activities
which are listed below:

1. *Technical *(hackathon/coding competition/web development
competition/robot fight)
*2*. *Non-Technical* (poster presentation/paper presentation/debate)
*3*. *Cultural* (dance/singing/rangoli/mehndi/music
competition/crafting/painting)
4. *Sports* (indoor games/outdoor games)
*5*. *Competitive Exams*

You all are requested to enter the details of your achievement in the
below-mentioned link.


*Note :*

Dear Students,



Your University Elective Subject (IT283 UI/UX) exam will be conducted as
per below.



*Exam Date: 05/10/2024, Saturday*

*Exam Time: 03:00 pm to 04:30 pm (1.5 hours)*



*Note: The Google form will be shared on Google classroom during the exam
(2:55 pm) hence it is requested to join the link of the Classroom which is
mentioned below on or before 4th Oct - 2024.*



*Link : *https://classroom.google.com/c/NzE5ODgxNTQ0NDk2?cjc=t3bt43z



*OR*



*Google Classroom Code:* *t3bt43z*



*Please find the attachment, which has a Seating arrangement with a Google
classroom code (join the Google class as early as possible). *



*Instructions for examination:*



1. Be there at the examination venue before at least 15 minutes.



2. Opening any other tab other than the exam-related tabs, you will not be
able to submit the exam.



3.  Your signature on the sign sheet must appear without fail., if you have
appeared in the examination otherwise you will be considered as ABSENT in
the examination.



*Note: Students will not be allowed to appear in the examination from
outside the charusat or at home and all students must use the charusat
email Id for accessing and submitting the Google form. The form without
charusat email Id will not be accepted or considered for the exam. *


*For any query, you can ask Prof. Dhaval Patel or me (Rajnik Katriya).*


*Thanks & Regards,*
*Mr. Rajnik S Katriya,*
*B.E.(CE), M.E.(CE), Ph.D. Scholar,*
*Assistant Professor,*
*CSPIT-IT,*
*CHARUSAT, Anand, Gujarat.*
*Website <https://sites.google.com/view/rajnikkatriya> ||  LinkedIn
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/rajnik-katriya/>*



* <rajnikkatriya.it@charusat.ac.in>*

To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIEC IIT Gandhinagar <iiec@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 30, 2024 at 8:01â€¯AM
Subject: ğŸŒŸ Apply Now: Boeing BUILD 2024: IIEC IIT Gandhinagar ğŸŒŸ
To:


Dear Friends,


Greetings from IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
(IIEC)!


We are excited to share that the *Boeing University Innovation Leadership
Development (BUILD 4.0) 2024* program applications are now open!



BUILD <https://iieciitgn.com/build2024/> is a unique program that
encourages young
entrepreneurial minds to develop ideas that can be converted into viable
business offerings. Interested applicants are invited to submit ideas that
can help solve real-world challenges in the fields of:

[image: BUILD 2024 sectors.jpg]


The finalist teams will get the opportunity to attend an intensive
residential boot camp organized by *IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar*, in *December
2024*. The team will get to shape and refine ideas, develop a pitch, and
compete for the *prize money worth INR 10,00,000/- (INR Ten Lakhs).* The
team will also get opportunities to engage with Boeing and its connected
ecosystem of investors, incubators, and entrepreneurs.

*Application Deadline: *October 15, 2024


*Application Eligibility: *Existing students, recent graduates, faculty
members, and early-stage startups (Pre-revenue).


*Three easy steps to apply:*


   - Go to *https://iieciitgn.com/build2024/
   <https://iieciitgn.com/build2024/>*
   - Go to Apply Now
   - Click, fill out and submit the application form!

*The benefits:*

   - Shortlisted teams will be guided by Boeing and startup experts to help
   refine ideas to be identified as potential business offerings
   - Winning teams in the National Finals stage will receive a cash prize
   worth *INR 10,00,000/- (INR Ten Lakhs)*


 *Secure Your Spotâ€”Apply Immediately!  *


Feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions.


Best regards,

Team IIEC

--

subject: Fwd: Regarding the syllabus of the Sessional Examination & Quiz-2 of MA253
snippet: Dear students, The syllabus of the Sessional Examination & Quiz-2 of MA253 (DMA) is as follows. Unit-2 Relations and Lattice 2.3 Representations of relations: graphical and matrix representation.
content:
Dear students,

The syllabus of the *Sessional Examination & Quiz-2 *of MA253 (DMA) is
as follows.

*Unit-2 Relations and Lattice*
2.3 Representations of relations: graphical and matrix representation.
2.4 Covering of a set, partition of a set.
2.5 Partially ordered sets, totally ordered sets, Hasse diagram.
2.6 Lattices, Sub lattices
2.7 Properties of lattices (without proof)
2.8 Complete lattices, bounded lattices, distributive lattices,
complemented lattices and complemented distributive lattices.
*Unit-3 Graph Theory*
3.1 Basic terminologies, Simple graphs, Types of graphs.
3.2 Degree of a vertex, matrix representations of graph
3.5 Isomorphic graphs
*Unit-5 Abstract Algebra*
5.2  Lagrangeâ€™s theorem.
5.3  Subgroup, cyclic subgroup, permutation group.
*Unit-6 Linear Algebra*
6.1 Vector space: definition and examples. Subspaces.
6.2 Linear combinations, linearly dependence and linearly independence.
6.3 Basis and dimension of a vector space.

Kindly note that *Quiz-2* will be on the *same day* in the *online mode*
 from *03:00 pm to 03:25 pm*. The Google form link for Quiz-2 will be
provided at *02:55 pm* in your *institute's email IDs only*. The link will
be closed at sharp *03.25 pm.*


Thank you.

Convenor MA253
-- 
*Dr. Pragneshkumar R. Makwana*

*M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D.*


*Assistant Professor,Department of Mathematical Sciences,P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

*Charotar University of Science & Technology,Changa, Gujarat, India.*

--

To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2024/26-Sep/AICTE1/index.html>

*Dear Principal/Director,*

It is informed that the last date for the submission of online applications
form (Degree & Diploma) under AICTE Pragati Scholarship Scheme (for girl
students), AICTE Saksham Scholarship Scheme (for specially-abled students)
and AICTE Swanath Scholarship Scheme 2024-25 has been opened through
National Scholarship Portal (NSP) till 31st October 2024.

It is further requested that to avail the benefits of scholarship schemes,
students should ensure to submit their registration and renewal application
on time.

Copy of the notification of NSP is enclosed for further information please.

subject: Fwd: Instructions and link for Online Submission of Assignment 2 (MA253 - DMA)
snippet: Dear Students, As you know, the submission of Assignment 2 for MA253 (DMA) will be conducted online. Please find below the link and instructions for submitting Assignment 2. Kindly strictly follow the
content:
Dear Students,

As you know, the submission of Assignment 2 for MA253 (DMA) will be
conducted online. Please find below the link and instructions for
submitting Assignment 2. Kindly strictly follow the instructions.

Link of submission: https://forms.gle/Fkbt2Ymi8Pr7eRYZ6

*Instructions:*

1.     The name of the file must be in the format:
23CEXXX/D24CEXXX/23DCEXXX/D24DCEXXX.

2.     Write your ID number (handwritten only) at the top of each page of
the assignment.

3.     Properly scan each page of the assignment and compile them into a
single PDF file.

4.  The submission link will remain open until 04:30 PM on 10th October
2024.


Please note that the marks for Assignment 2 will be considered as part of
continuous evaluation.

Assignment submission is mandatory for all students, so ensure it is
submitted before the deadline. Late submissions will not be accepted.
Regards,

-- 

*Dr. Jimitkumar R. Patel*

Assistant Professor, Department of Mathematical Sciences,

P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences (PDPIAS),

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT),

*CHARUSAT campus, Changa 388421, Gujarat, India*.

*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC & KCG*

subject: EKYC- Google Form
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! E-KYC of students is required to avail the Pre-Matric and Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme of Central Govt./ State Govt. and various other scholarship schemes as well. In this
content:
Dear Students,


Greetings!!!


 E-KYC of students is required to avail the Pre-Matric and Post-Matric
Scholarship Scheme of Central Govt./ State Govt. and various other scholarship
schemes as well.


In this regard, kindly note that the  E-KYC can be done through the
following means :


*1) Through My Ration mobile app, the beneficiary can do face
authentication at home.*



*2) Through web based through VCE in e-Gram Center at Gram Panchayat and*


*3) PDS+ can
be done through mobile app by Officer/Staff/ VCE/ Principal/Teachers .*


*The work of E-KYC has to be completed within 3 Days which every student
should note.*


*Important Note:*

*After doing E-KYC, it is mandatory to fill the Google form mentioned
below.*

*https://forms.gle/ZXDKwh2Nm77rXLmq7 <https://forms.gle/ZXDKwh2Nm77rXLmq7>*


*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

>

>
> For the same, TCS delages with their HR Team are going to visit our campus
> to interact with our students.
>

>
>

>

> that we will be conducting in the college premises.
>
> *PPT Date: 30 September 2024*
>
> *PPT Time: 2:30 PM *
>
> *Venue: CMPICA Auditorium, Charusat University*
>
> *Eligible qualification : B.E/ B.Tech/ MCA/ M.Sc/ M.Tech/ M.E. (All
> specialization and all semester students)*
>
> *----------------------------*
>
> *Thanks & Regards,Ashwin Makwana/Sujal Dadhaniya*
> *TPO - **Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*,
> *Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT) *

subject: Fwd: Join Us for the Blood Donation Camp â€“ Let's Make a Difference!
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Be a life saver for someone, donate blood. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Hitesh Makwana <hiteshmakwana.dit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Sep 27
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!

*Be a life saver for someone, donate blood. *

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hitesh Makwana <hiteshmakwana.dit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 27, 2024 at 12:32â€¯PM
Subject: Join Us for the Blood Donation Camp â€“ Let's Make a Difference!
To: Ritika Jani <ritikajani.dit@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

We are excited to inform you about a special event that provides an
opportunity to make a positive impact on our community. The CHRF and NSS
units of CHARUSAT, BDIPS, ARIP, and MTIN, in collaboration with the Lions
Club of Nadiad Mains and the Indian Red Cross Society, are organizing a
Blood Donation Camp. We invite each one of you to participate and
contribute to this life-saving cause.

Blood Donation Camp Details:

Date: 30/09/2024
Time: 09:30 am to 3:30 pm
Location: Physiotherapy Department, First floor, CHRF, CHARUSAT

Your participation can save lives, and we encourage you to be a part of
this noble initiative. To register, please fill out the following form by
27/09/2024:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd_asjz8lC4zZHjVyxqu8PSZdZhPSnsSu0RJpj7wDmdhFlEzg/viewform

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to the NSS Department.
Letâ€™s come together as a university community and make this event a great
success!

Looking forward to seeing you there!


-- 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Prof. Hitesh Makwana*

*Assistant Professor*

*Department of Information Technology*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (Depstar)*

*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*

*Mo: 8460752501*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

subject: Fwd: Postponement of the celebration of Vrund '24 to Monday - September 30, 2024
snippet: Dear All, Please note that looking at the weather forecasts and safety - security of the students particularly those commuting, celebration of Vrund '24 has been postponed to September 30, 2024.
content:
Dear All,

Please note that looking at the weather forecasts and safety - security of
the students particularly those commuting, celebration of Vrund '24 has
been postponed to September 30, 2024.

All other details and schedule for Vrund '24 remain intact for Monday -
September 30, 2024.

Please inform the staff, students and invitees of your Department /
Institute / Family accordingly.

Inconvenience is highly regretted.

Thanking you in anticipation of your cooperation,

With regards,

Team ULSC

--

subject: EE284 Exam Schedule
snippet: Dear Students, Your examination for University Elective subject "EE284 Python Programming" is scheduled on 30-Sep-2024 and 01-Oct-2024. All details related to the exam are attached to this
content:
Dear Students,

Your examination for University Elective subject "EE284 Python Programming"
is scheduled on 30-Sep-2024 and 01-Oct-2024.

All details related to the exam are attached to this email. Read it
carefully and follow all instructions for smooth execution of Exam.

Attachment 1: EE284_Exam Instructions (read both the pages)
Attachment 2: EE284_Viva Schedule (follow this schedule for viva, viva will
be conducted at room no. 118,EE Dept, CSPIT)

Happy Learning
--

CHARUSAT campus,
