subject: Fwd: Code Unnati Program for 2nd year students
snippet: Dear Students, I hope this mail finds you well. We are about to start Code Unnati program for the 2nd year students. Some of you have already attended the Code Unnati Orientation session and given test
content:
Dear Students,
I hope this mail finds you well.
We are about to start Code Unnati program for the 2nd year students. Some
of you have already attended the Code Unnati Orientation session and given
test also. Still if you are interested to join code unnati program we are
opening registration for them.
please fill the google form using the following link.

https://forms.gle/MPQAkBoc7t4b4tBR8

Please pass on the message to your friends also.
Once the students are finalised we will start the sessions.


*Thanks & Regards,*
*Asifiqbal Thakor*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Fwd: Job market is tougher than ever for B.Tech graduates - Set your students apart
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly grab the opportunity to enroll in a free GenAI Online Course offered by Google Cloud. Regards, Rajesh Patel ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly grab the opportunity to enroll in a free GenAI Online Course offered
by Google Cloud.

Regards,
Rajesh Patel

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 27, 2024 at 9:48â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Job market is tougher than ever for B.Tech graduates - Set
your students apart
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CHARUSAT <info@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 27, 2024 at 9:40â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Job market is tougher than ever for B.Tech graduates - Set
your students apart
To: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Principal
C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Program by Google Cloud <support.genai@talentsprint.com>
Date: Thu, Sep 26, 2024 at 2:46â€¯PM
Subject: Job market is tougher than ever for B.Tech graduates - Set your
students apart
To: <info@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

We are excited to share that *Google Cloud is offering a 100% FREE GenAI
Online Course* that can equip your students with hands-on skills in this
rapidly growing field.

*With over 26,000 students from 350+ colleges already enrolled,* this
course is quickly gaining popularity among the student community.

*5 Reasons why your Students should Enroll for this Course: *

   1. 40% of organizations are already investing hugely in Generative AI
   2. GenAI Skills are in high demand. Generative AI to become a $1.3
   trillion market by 2032
   3. Just 10% of the 1.5 million engineers graduating this year are
   expected to land a job as companies struggle with the global economic
   slump, according to the Times of India
   4. IT companies have reduced fresher hiring by 35-40% compared to last
   year, making the job market tougher than ever for B.Tech graduates
   5. This course provides practical knowledge and skills that will set
   students apart in the job market

*What are the Course Highlights?*

   - *Skill Badges:* Earn up to 24 Skill Badges by completing the 3
   learning paths.
   - *Free and Flexible:* Zero cost, self-paced learning that fits around
   regular classes.
   - *Learn from Experts:* Content created by Google Cloud professionals.

*How to Get Started?*

Share following details with your students:

   - Course Details
   <https://mc.talentsprint.com/links/KyUHaMbHDZfqbagVDGfMckaGJfwEhJMkaGvDgFMxwCBMeDkwyMsbsAenKMkfaE/1745690>
   - Enrollment Form
   <https://mc.talentsprint.com/links/KyUHaMbHDZfqbagVDGfMckaGJfwEhJMkaGvDgFMxwCBMeDkwyMsbsAenKMkfaE/1745691>

*What is the deadline to complete the course?*

   - October 31, 2024

Encourage your students to seize this one-of-a-kind opportunity.

For any doubts or questions pertaining to this course, please write to us
at support.genai@talentsprint.com

Here are the course FAQs
<https://mc.talentsprint.com/links/KyUHaMbHDZfqbagVDGfMckaGJfwEhJMkaGvDgFMxwCBMeDkwyMsbsAenKMkfaE/1745692>
if students have any questions or challenges while taking the course.

Kindly ignore this email, if you've already communicated this information
to your students.

Sincerely,
TalentSprint Team

If you wish to opt out of all type of emails, click Unsubscribe
<https://mc.talentsprint.com/un/KyUHaMbHDZfqbagVDGfMckaGJfwEhJMkaGvDgFMxwCBMeDkwyMsbsAenKMkfaE>
.
[image: open track]
. <https://mc.talentsprint.com/a/BIDXaRBaweuGFMcbAGJfwVhJ>


-- 

Charotar University of Science & Technology
Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC
Accorded with Centre of Excellence by Govt. of Gujarat

subject: Fwd: Inviting Logo Designs for Initiatives such as [AICTE iCube Innovation Council], [INDOVATION HUB] & [YUKTI Innovation and IPR Repository] by 30th April 2024- Reg.
snippet: Dear students, Those who have register in this, kindly replay in this email about your registration confirmation. Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information
content:
Dear students,
Those who have register in this, kindly replay in this email about your
registration confirmation.



*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, 15 Apr 2024 at 11:49â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Inviting Logo Designs for Initiatives such as [AICTE iCube
Innovation Council], [INDOVATION HUB] & [YUKTI Innovation and IPR
Repository] by 30th April 2024- Reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE(no-reply) <noreply4@aicte-india.org>
Date: Mon, Apr 15, 2024 at 11:29â€¯AM
Subject: Inviting Logo Designs for Initiatives such as [AICTE iCube
Innovation Council], [INDOVATION HUB] & [YUKTI Innovation and IPR
Repository] by 30th April 2024- Reg.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students, Faculty and IIC Members,

AICTE and MoEâ€™s Innovation Cell would like to invite logo designs from IIC
members for its upcoming Section 8 company with the proposed name AICTE
iCube Innovation Council. Moreover, the design of logos for two more
initiatives such as INDOVATION Centers and YUKTI Innovation and IPR
Repository are also invited.

You may refer to the logo submission guideline and brief about the above
initiatives in the attached annexure (
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1T_slxbJM3SFUYbdSWy0S56du2CX2rkl0/view?usp=sharing)
for
your better understanding and designing of logos. You can submit at least
one logo design to consider you as a participant. Furthermore, please
submit the logos through the Google form (
https://forms.gle/m7o3mkEdtSLfhX19A) positivity by 30th April 2024.
Shortlisted designs will be intimated after a careful review of designs.

For any query, please reach out to the IIC zonal in-charges for help
https://iic.mic.gov.in/about-us/contact_us

Thanks & regards.

Dipan Sahu
Assistant Innovation Director
Ministry of Education's Innovation Cell
AICTE HQ, Nelson Mandela Road, Vasant Kunj,
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Nelson+Mandela+Road,+Vasant+Kunj,+New+Delhi+110070?entry=gmail&source=g>
New Delhi 110070
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Nelson+Mandela+Road,+Vasant+Kunj,+New+Delhi+110070?entry=gmail&source=g>
Phone:
011 29581226
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Linked-in: https://www.linkedin.com/in/deepansahu/
Alternative Emails: dipan.sahu@gov.in, deepun.sahu@gmail.com
Website: https://mic.gov.in <https://mic.gov.in/startup_policy.php>

--

subject: Blood Donation Camp on 30/09/2024
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Family, We hope this message finds you well. We are excited to announce a special event that can make a significant impact on the lives of others in our community. CHRF and NSS units of
content:
*Dear CHARUSAT Family,*

We hope this message finds you well. We are excited to announce a special
event that can make a significant impact on the lives of others in our
community. CHRF and NSS units of CHARUSAT, BDIPS, ARIP and MTIN
have organized a Blood donation camp in collaboration with the Lions Club
of Nadiad Mains, and Indian Red Cross Society. We invite each one of you to
participate and contribute to this noble cause.

Blood Donation Camp details are as under:



*Date: 30/09/2024*

*Time: 09:30 am to 3:30 pm*

*Location: Physiotherapy Department, Ground floor, CHRF, CHARUSAT *



Let's come together as a university community and make
this Blood Donation Camp a resounding success. Your contribution can truly
make a life-saving difference.

If you have any questions or need further information, please feel free to
contact the NSS Department.

Thank you for your willingness to participate, we are looking forward to
seeing you at the Blood Donation Camp!

Link for registration into Blood Donation Camp: *(Fill this out on or
before 27/09/2024)*


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd_asjz8lC4zZHjVyxqu8PSZdZhPSnsSu0RJpj7wDmdhFlEzg/viewform?usp=sf_link



*Kishan Patel*

*NSS Program Coordinator *

*Charusat NSS Cell*

--

subject: Fwd: E-KYC FOR SCHOLARSHIP SCHEMES REGARDING
snippet: Dear Students, If you are availing any scholarship or willing to avail any scholarship, then E-KYC is mandatory to avail the scholarship. Kindly refer to the trailing email for the same. Without E-KYC,
content:
Dear Students,

If you are availing any scholarship or willing to avail any scholarship,
then E-KYC is mandatory to avail the scholarship. Kindly refer to the
trailing email for the same.
Without E-KYC, the scholarship amount will not be deposited in the
student's account.
All the students are hereby informed to get E-KYC done in the mentioned
timeframe in the trailing email without fail.
*If the student does not complete it within the mentioned period, then the
student will be solely responsible for any circumstances that occur.*

*Once you complete it, kindly acknowledge the same to your respective
counselor without fail.*

Regards,
Rajesh Patel

subject: Re: Promoting a Continuous Learning Environment: Clubs Management | Technical Club
snippet: Dear Students, Thank you for attending our webinar on "Blockchain Foundations: The Core of Trustless Technology" with Ms. Naina Parmar. We hope you found the session insightful and
content:
Dear Students,

Thank you for attending our webinar on *"Blockchain Foundations: The Core
of Trustless Technology"* with *Ms. Naina Parmar*. We hope you found the
session insightful and informative.

To help us improve and serve you better in future events, we kindly ask you
to take a few minutes to fill out a short feedback form. Your opinions and
suggestions are valuable to us.

*Feedback Form link:*

https://docs.google.com/forms/u/1/d/e/1FAIpQLSdQH4N4ys7e2q23Lw_25tfCxt7mbOtns4vm99yQZNxoFhnKkA/viewform?usp=send_form

We appreciate your time and look forward to hearing your thoughts!

Thank you once again for your participation and support.

Best regards,

Club Management |Technical Club

subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE
snippet: Dear All, U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or Physically Challenged. Title of the Event: "
content:
Dear All,



U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.



*Title of the Event:* " CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF
SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "



Guidelines:



1.    Students may submit their creative working project ideas on
a drawing sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.


Submission Link: https://forms.gle/GUHRx6sLvhYPatmx7


These can be further modified on the day of presentation [*05/10/2024*].

2.    Last Date of Entry Submission: 2nd October, 2024 [Ideas through
online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate entry using
the shared google form link.

3.    Students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pens or any other tools
[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the day of
presentation [Date: 05/10/2024, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building].
Participants have to remain present in MAC LAB (601) [A7 Building]
from 09:15 am to 12:00 pm on 05/10/2024, Saturday to present their
project ideas.
Students may use presentation and poster to demonstrate
their project ideas.

4.    Students may show Project Implementation

5.    Students may submit their ideas in a group of maximum 3 students.

6.    Best of the THREE Innovative Ideas will be awarded prize money &
certificate *(First prize 1500 Rs/-, Second Prize 1000 Rs/-, Third Prize
500 Rs/-)*. Others will receive a certificate of participation.



*EOC Department Coordinators are requested to encourage students for
participation.*


*For any further query you may please contact student coordinators (**23CE022
- Devam Bhaveshbhai Ghodasara *and *23CE115 - Priya Babubhai Pedhadiya* *).*

--

Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,

We are pleased to announce that a Poster Presentation Competition on
'Assistive Technology' will be held on October 5, 2024 during 10.00 am to
2.30 pm. This event is jointly organized by Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC),
CHARUSAT and  Badhir Vidhyalaya Deaf, Nadiad.

The event encourages to put forward your creative and innovative ideas for
assistive technology helping the disabled/Specially abled persons. This is
an excellent opportunity to showcase your creativity for the benefit of
society through poster presentation.

You are requested to encourage your students to participate individually or
in a group. Maximum of 5 participants are allowed per group.

Register yourself or your group by clicking on the following link or
scanning the QR code (Given in Brochure) on or before October 1, 2024.


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfIpTsI0TiHxTOI7Nff6-Tk2TJ_G5i7jVckleWXdTs7COfb2w/viewform?usp=pp_url


For more details, please refer to the attached brochure.

For any further details, please contact
Mr. Vipul Vyas (M:9727767541)
Mr. Jivanadhar Joshi (M: 9099896476)

Dr. V. R. Panchal

content:

New assignment

Term work solution
Very
Important, Read full message

Dear All,



As you are aware that we are approaching an end of the semester. Hence, you  
all
need to complete the given problem to you in due course of time before the  
end
of the semester.


You can prepare a poster, prototype, presentation, video demonstration,  
blue print, website, social media groups, or whatever suitable solution to  
address your selected problem.

Example:


    -
    - Prepare a poster (minimum A2 size) either
    digitally or by hand drawings indicating problem statement, how you have
    approached a solution you are giving and how it will help others and
    society. Its possible outcomes and what have you learned. (What is poster
    and how to prepare: https://guides.nyu.edu/posters) Attached a template  
of poster.
    - Alternatively, you can prepare a working prototype of
    your model.  (How to prepare and types:  
https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/career-development/types-of-prototyping)




The deadline to
submit this term work is October 7, 2023.

Submission link: https://forms.gle/BjyEraMfTSVojydR9

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dipika Damodar <dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 20, 2024 at 2:09â€¯PM
Subject: Promoting a Continuous Learning Environment: Clubs Management |
Technical Club
To: DEPSTAR <depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Dr Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear all,



In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, Clubs Management |
Technical Club is excited to introduce the "*Learn After College Hours*"
initiative. We believe that education extends beyond the classroom and that
collaborative learning can thrive even after formal college hours.

In this context, we are organizing a webinar on *"Blockchain Foundations:
The Core of Trustless Technology"*. This session will be delivered by *Ms.
Naina Parmar*



*Webinar Details:*

   - *Date:* 25th September,2024
   - *Time:* 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
   - *Mode:* Online (MS Teams - The joining link will be sent to registered
   participants only.)

*Why Attend?*

Blockchain technology is reshaping industries by enabling secure,
decentralized, and transparent systems. Through this session, you will:

   - Understand the core principles of blockchain and its architecture.
   - Explore the concept of a *trustless system* and how blockchain ensures
   security without intermediaries.
   - Learn about the real-world applications of blockchain in various
   sectors like finance, healthcare, and supply chain.
   - Get insights into future career opportunities in the blockchain domain.

 *Registration Process:*

To attend this insightful session, please click the link below to register:

Â·       Registration link: https://forms.gle/LfTufATSkW11wUGK6

Â·       Registration Deadline: 23rd , September 2024

Itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity to expand your technical knowledge and explore
the future of digital trust.

For any queries, please feel free to contact Ms. Dipika Damodar (Email id:
dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in | Contact: 7405862155).

We look forward to your active participation!


--
Best Regards,
Clubs Management | Technical Club

--

subject: Apply for Start-up Gujarat Seed Fund (30 Lakhs-40 Lakhs) via CIVF
snippet: Dear Start-up, As you know CIVF (CHARUSAT Innovative Ventures Foundation)- a section-8 company of Charusat University has been officially recognized as a Nodal Institute by the Industries
content:
Dear Start-up,
As you know CIVF (CHARUSAT Innovative Ventures Foundation)- a section-8
company of Charusat University has been officially recognized as a *Nodal
Institute* by the *Industries Commissionerate, Govt. of Gujarat*. We invite
you to apply for a seed grant to fuel your growth and innovation. Don't
miss this opportunity to accelerate your startup journey! (Find the scheme
document as *Ann-1*)

As a Nodal Institute, CIVF can now offer the following support:

   - Assistance up to *INR 30 lakh* as a *seed support* to the startups.
   - Sustenance allowance of *INR 20,000 per month *to the startups and *INR
   25,000 per month* to *women-led startups* for a period of one year.
   - Additional assistance up to *INR 10 lakh *for the startups generating
   significant impact on the society. Thus seed support extends to up to INR
   40 lakhs.
   - Assistance up to *INR 1 lakh* per startup for obtaining* training in
   soft skills *on a reimbursement basis.
   - Assistance up to *INR 3 lakh* to enroll and participate in
   national/international recognized *acceleration programs.*
   - Additional 1% Interest Subsidy, maximum up to* 9% on term loans* to
   applicants under the scheme's provisions for assistance to MSMEs.

The application process is as Under:

1. Read the eligibility criteria of the scheme. (Product/service should be
innovative, Company should be registered and the Start-up should be based
in Gujarat) *(*Refer to detailed eligibility criteria in* Ann-2)*

2. Fill out the form based on the benefit you want to avail. (Find all
applicable forms in the attachment as *Ann-3, Ann-4, Ann-5 & Ann-6. *Take
the pdf content of the application form in Word, enter the details in soft
copy, take print and sign and stamp on hard copy and send the original file
at CIVF- 209, IIIM)

2. Pitch deck presentation in front of CIVF Internal Committee.

3. CIVF will recommend the selected start-ups to Industries Commissionerate
for seed grant or other benefits.

4. If approved at the SLEC committee of  *Industries Commissionerate*, the
grant will be given to NI (i.e. CIVF) and be disbursed to start-up in
tranches based on your milestones.

All the Very Best and Feel free to seek further information.

*Deadline: 01/10/2024 till 12:30 PM*

Note: "Please share the above information with eligible start-up founders
to ensure that the deserving candidates can benefit from the government
scheme."
*Regards,*

*Dr. Swati Joshi, *
*Senior Executive Officer (SEO), *
*CHARUSAT Innovative Ventures Foundation (CIVF), **209, IIIM,*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) *
*CHANGA - 388 421 *
*GUJARAT - INDIA *

*Contact no.: +91- 7383491911*
*E-mail: seo@civf.co.in <http://seo@civf.co.in/swatijoshi@civf.co.in>*

--

How Context Switching Wrecks Your Focus & What to Do About It


Context switching is the pesky mental hiccup that happens when you shift your 
focus from one task to another. Between meetings, Slack messages, and projects, 
most of us constantly context switch to juggle interruptions. But research 
shows that it can take almost 10 minutes of your time to return to focus after 
switching between applications. Reclaim your time and energy with these tips 
from a Senior Software Engineer on our team.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/manage-context-switching-developers/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_september_in_development&utm_content=hero_blog_context_switching_cta>










 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/github-survey-ai-coding-tools-in-software-development/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_september_in_development&utm_content=blog1_github_survey_img>


Over 97% of Devs Use this Coding Tool & You Can Learn it for Free


A new GitHub survey asked professional developers about the tools they use in 
their coding workflow. Almost everyone in the study said using these types of 
tools improves code quality, streamlines development efficiency, and helps 
organize processes. Read how the trend is changing software development, then 
take our free courses to learn how to use the go-to tool.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/github-survey-ai-coding-tools-in-software-development/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_september_in_development&utm_content=blog1_github_survey_cta>

Yes, You Can Become a Software Engineer Without a CS Degree


Hiring managers are putting less importance on whether technical candidates 
have a computer science degree (or attended college at all). Many Software 
Engineers at Codecademy studied non-technical disciplines in school â€” like 
theater, biology, and everything in between â€” and learned programming on the 
side. Hereâ€™s how to combine your expertise with technical skills and make your 
unique life experience an asset.


Read now 
<https://www.codecademy.com/resources/blog/what-degree-do-you-need-to-be-a-software-engineer/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2024_september_in_development&utm_content=blog2_software_engineer_cta>

subject: Fwd: Promoting a Continuous Learning Environment: Clubs Management | Technical Club
snippet: Dear all, In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, Clubs Management | Technical Club is excited to introduce the "Learn After College Hours" initiative. We believe that
content:
Dear all,



In our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, Clubs Management |
Technical Club is excited to introduce the "*Learn After College Hours*"
initiative. We believe that education extends beyond the classroom and that
collaborative learning can thrive even after formal college hours.

In this context, we are organizing a webinar on *"Blockchain Foundations:
The Core of Trustless Technology"*. This session will be delivered by *Ms.
Naina Parmar*



*Webinar Details:*

   - *Date:* 25th September,2024
   - *Time:* 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
   - *Mode:* Online (MS Teams - The joining link will be sent to registered
   participants only.)

*Why Attend?*

Blockchain technology is reshaping industries by enabling secure,
decentralized, and transparent systems. Through this session, you will:

   - Understand the core principles of blockchain and its architecture.
   - Explore the concept of a *trustless system* and how blockchain ensures
   security without intermediaries.
   - Learn about the real-world applications of blockchain in various
   sectors like finance, healthcare, and supply chain.
   - Get insights into future career opportunities in the blockchain domain.

 *Registration Process:*

To attend this insightful session, please click the link below to register:

Â·       Registration link: https://forms.gle/LfTufATSkW11wUGK6

Â·       Registration Deadline: 23rd , September 2024

Itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity to expand your technical knowledge and explore
the future of digital trust.

For any queries, please feel free to contact Ms. Dipika Damodar (Email id:
dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in | Contact: 7405862155).

We look forward to your active participation!


--
Best Regards,
Clubs Management | Technical Club

--

subject: Fwd: Workshop on Theory cum Practical Energy Conservation Awareness on September, 30 2024
snippet: Thanks and Regards, Shital Sharma Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Charotar University of Science and
content:
*Thanks and Regards,*


*Shital Sharma Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Information Technology,*
*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*Changa, Anand,*
*Gujarat, India.*



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 1:11â€¯PM
Subject: Workshop on Theory cum Practical Energy Conservation Awareness on
September, 30 2024
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FCA
CHARUSAT <dean.fca@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Neeta Chudasama <neetachudasama.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Khushi Patel <
khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear all,

Greetings!!

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT in association with Gujarat Energy Development Agency (GEDA) is
going to organize a workshop on "Theory cum Practical Energy Conservation
Awareness" on September, 30 2024 from 12:00 Noon to 3:00 PM.


Venue will be communicated to registered participants.

*The workshop will cover a range of topics, including:*

1. The importance of energy conservation.

2.  Practical techniques for energy conservation in various sectors.

3. Case studies and real-world examples.

4.  Interactive sessions and hands-on activities.



*The main objectives of this workshop are:*


   1. To raise awareness about the significance of energy conservation and
   its impact on the environment.
   2. To encourage individuals to adopt energy-conserving habits and
   behaviours.

The registration is open for all the interested students and staff members
|  Last date to register for participation through below-mentioned link is
September 26, 2024

Registration Link:  https://forms.gle/kHZehVh9DweT1Yjr6

We look forward to your participation and hope to see you at the workshop.
e-certificates will be provided to all the participants who register and
attend the entire session.

For additional information or query, please feel free to contact the
coordinators of the workshop:

   1. Ms. Neeta Chudasama (neetachudasama.dce@charusat.ac.in)
   2. Dr. Khushi Patel (khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in)

Thank you

-- 
Regards:
Dr Dweepna Garg
Head Of Department & Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Contact No. : 02697-265321 (Intercom)

--

snippet: Dear Students, Greetings for the day!!! Nice opportunity to showcase your creativity. More details are in trailing mail ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings for the day!!!
Nice opportunity to showcase your creativity. More details are in trailing
mail

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 12:51â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Logo Design Contest for SHAPHARI Certification Scheme â€“ reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CHARUSAT <info@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 11:36â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Logo Design Contest for SHAPHARI Certification Scheme â€“ reg.
To: Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AQUA MPEDA <aqua@mpeda.gov.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 19, 2024 at 11:30â€¯AM
Subject: Logo Design Contest for SHAPHARI Certification Scheme â€“ reg.
To:


Dear Sir/Madam,


Greetings from MPEDA!


MPEDA has initiated a certification scheme called SHAPHARI for hatcheries
and aquaculture farms. â€˜SHAPHARIâ€™ is a Sanskrit word meaning superior
quality fishery products suitable for human consumption. To promote
SHAPHARI certification among farmers and hatchery operators, and to raise
awareness about avoiding antibiotic abuse, MPEDA is hosting a Logo Design
Contest. The winning logo will be featured on SHAPHARI certificates, with a
prize of â‚¹10,000.


We encourage students to participate and submit their designs through the
link below by 03.10.2024. Please review the attached guidelines before
submission.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe1WgYlXoPKivxOYdMnWvYhs_WweIj2as3shTTSLekDVgTh1w/viewform



Thank you,


With regards,


Neenu Peter

Deputy Director,

Aquaculture Section

Head Office

The Marine Products Export Development Authority

Govt. of India

Kochi - 36

Ph: +91 484 2311901





<https://amritmahotsav.nic.in/>



-- 

Charotar University of Science & Technology
Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC
Accorded with Centre of Excellence by Govt. of Gujarat
Web: www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

subject: Steps to access WiFi Internet on laptop and computer labs
snippet: Dear New Students... To access wifi internet, please follow under mentioned steps: 1:- open URL http://egov.charusat (Open URL within campus only) 2:- Login with your egovernance ID and Password 3:-
content:
Dear New Students...

To access wifi internet, please follow under mentioned steps:

1:-   open URL http://egov.charusat  (Open URL within campus only)
2:-   Login with your egovernance ID and Password
3:-   Top left cornet (3 horizontal bar) go to settings
4:-   Select "Internet WiFi password change"
5:-   You may set a strong password for your internet access. With the help
of your student ID and Wi-Fi password, you can access the internet from
permitted computer labs and on your laptop. (WiFI on mobile is restricted)

To access WiFi from Laptop, connect to either CHARUSAT WiFi or WINCell SSID
with password "charusat"

You may also get a better idea with the attached video.

*Best Regards*


*Ritesh Bhatt *Head Datacenter, WIN-Cell
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)
Accredited *Grade 'A+'* by NAAC

At. Changa 388 421, Ta. Petlad,
Dist. Anand
O: +912697-265106 / 07

--

2024-2027"
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Educator,

I hope you're doing well. IIT Mandi is excited to invite your students to a
*free* webinar titled *"Tested Roadmap to Get a High-Paying Job in
2024-2027: What to Learn, Build Skills, and Achieve Success at the Most
Affordable Cost."*

*Event Date*: *22nd September at 5 PM*

This webinar is open to *students from any background â€“ tech or non-tech,
any degree, and any year of study*. Itâ€™s an incredible opportunity for
students to gain valuable insights into building in-demand skills, all
while receiving direct guidance from *one of Indiaâ€™s top technical
speakers. This IIT alumnus* has helped over *6,000 students* build
successful careers.

<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Flu.ma%2Fuby737yi%3Futm_source=pro/1/01000192084f9bff-32646b02-caa9-44d3-bf35-c90400ce7ca8-000000/VjdfgxoglgIsjo_-8JjsvD80opg=392>*

Key highlights of the session:

   - The most sought-after skills for top-paying jobs
   - Affordable strategies to acquire and develop these skills
   - Exclusive support and guidance from IIT Mandi experts

subject: Fwd: An Expert Session on "Time Management" for the students of CSPIT & DEPSTAR
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Vikas Panchal <vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Sep 18, 2024 at 12:19 PM Subject: An Expert Session on "Time Management" for the
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Vikas Panchal <vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Sep 18, 2024 at 12:19â€¯PM
Subject: An Expert Session on "Time Management" for the students of CSPIT &
DEPSTAR
To:

Dear all,

We are excited to invite you to an insightful seminar on "*Time Management"*
organised by the Club "*House of Innovation"*. This session is designed to
equip you with practical tools and strategies to manage your time more
effectively, enhance productivity, and achieve your goals.

*Seminar Details:*

*Topic:* "Time Management: Master Your Day, Master Your Life"

Â·        *Date:* 20th September 2024 (Friday)

Â·        *Time:* 12:00 PM â€“ 02.00 PM

Â·        *Speaker:* Mr. Mann Solanki, JCI & ISTD Chapter

Â·        *Venue: *2nd Floor Seminar Hall, EC/EE Building

Â·        *Target Audience:* Students of FTE, CHARUSAT

In todayâ€™s fast-paced world, effective time management is a crucial skill
that can help you balance academic responsibilities, extracurricular
activities, and personal growth. This seminar will provide actionable
insights to help you optimize your time and increase efficiency.


*How to Register:*

To reserve your spot, please click on the link to register:
https://forms.gle/BrC7TjeiHABzEJAV7


Seats are limited, so be sure to register soon!

All participants will receive an *e-certificate* as a token of their
participation and engagement.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at *+91 70166
09343/+91 9913208633 or email us at **club.houseofinnovation@gmail.com*
<club.houseofinnovation@gmail.com>*.*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you unlock the power of
time management!


Best regards,
*Club House of Innovation*

--

Dear Students,

We are excited to announce the Digital Logo Making Competition for the
students of CHARUSAT. This is a unique opportunity to showcase your
creativity and design skills while contributing to an important aspect of
our student governance body.

*Competition Details:*
*Theme : *Design a logo that represents the values, vision, and mission of
the University level Central Students Council(ULSC).
*Eligibility : *Open to all students of CHARUSAT.
*Submission Format :* Logo designs must be created digitally and submitted
in .PNG or .JPEG format (high resolution).
*Submission Deadline : 22th September, 2024*

   - *VISION: - *To build an inclusive student community that fosters
   academic excellence, cultural enrichment, leadership, and holistic
   development.
   - *VALUES: - *We value inclusivity, collaboration, and excellence in all
   endeavors. Leadership, integrity, innovation, and student well-being are at
   the core of our actions.
   - MISSION: - Our mission is to provide opportunities for students to
   grow academically, culturally, and personally, promote teamwork and
   leadership, and advocate for student needs to create a supportive
   university environment.

*Google Form: *https://forms.gle/VEQhCobuiNDhT7ri8
Submit your entries here

Further details have been shared in the document attached below.

We look forward to seeing your creative submissions!

Best regards,

*Convener*


*University Level Central Students Council*

*CHARUSAT.*


-- 
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.

--

subject: CPI_2024 Lecture summary by students
snippet: Thanks for filling out CPI_2024 Lecture summary by students Here's what was received. CPI_2024 Lecture summary by students Summarize your today's learnings. Your submission will be considered
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out CPI_2024 Lecture summary by students
Here's what was received.


CPI_2024 Lecture summary by students


Summarize your today's learnings.
Your submission will be considered in your evaluation.


Your email (d24dit079@charusat.edu.in) was recorded when you submitted this  
form.


Select your Class *


DCE-1


DIT-1


DCE-2


CL


D2D CL


Full Roll Number *


D24DIT079


Full Name *


Om Chauhan


Today's date *


MM

09


/


DD

18


/


YYYY

2024


Summarize what you have learned today in 150 words (approximately at least  
750 characters) *


The lecture offered a well-rounded approach, combining theoretical  
frameworks and practical examples. Introducing the Kepner-Tregoe (KT)  
Method as a structured problem-solving tool was valuable. The method's  
step-by-step approach for issue analysis, decision-making, and potential  
problem analysis stood out as a practical guide for real-world  
applications. The explanation of the KT Method was clear and easy to  
follow. Breaking down the method into key components (Situation Analysis,  
Problem Analysis, Decision Analysis, and Potential Problem Analysis) helped  
in grasping the concept. I appreciate the focus on innovation techniques  
like brainstorming, lateral thinking, and the creative problem-solving  
process. However, some of the more abstract concepts could benefit from  
additional real-world examples.


Give feedback of todays' lecture

Best

subject: ULSC logo competition!
snippet: Dear Students, We are excited to announce the Digital Logo Making Competition for the students of CHARUSAT. This is a unique opportunity to showcase your creativity and design skills while contributing
content:
Dear Students,

We are excited to announce the Digital Logo Making Competition for the
students of CHARUSAT. This is a unique opportunity to showcase your
creativity and design skills while contributing to an important aspect of
our student governance body.

*Competition Details:*
*Theme : *Design a logo that represents the values, vision, and mission of
the University level Central Students Council(ULSC).
*Eligibility : *Open to all students of CHARUSAT.
*Submission Format :* Logo designs must be created digitally and submitted
in .PNG or .JPEG format (high resolution).
*Submission Deadline : 22th September, 2024*

   - *VISION: - *To build an inclusive student community that fosters
   academic excellence, cultural enrichment, leadership, and holistic
   development.
   - *VALUES: - *We value inclusivity, collaboration, and excellence in all
   endeavors. Leadership, integrity, innovation, and student well-being are at
   the core of our actions.
   - MISSION: - Our mission is to provide opportunities for students to
   grow academically, culturally, and personally, promote teamwork and
   leadership, and advocate for student needs to create a supportive
   university environment.

*Google Form: *https://forms.gle/VEQhCobuiNDhT7ri8
Submit your entries here

Further details have been shared in the document attached below.

We look forward to seeing your creative submissions!

Best regards,

*Convener*


*University Level Central Students Council*

*CHARUSAT.*

--

subject: Fwd: TEDx CHARUSAT 2024 :: Ingenious Creations
snippet: Dear Sir / Madam, Greetings!! We are thrilled to invite you to TEDx CHARUSAT 2024, scheduled on September 24, 2024, at the vibrant CHARUSAT Campus. This year's theme, "Ingenious Creations,
content:
Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings!!

We are thrilled to invite you to *TEDx CHARUSAT 2024*, scheduled on *September
24, 2024*, at the vibrant *CHARUSAT Campus*. This yearâ€™s theme, *"Ingenious
Creations,"* will take you on an inspiring ride through revolutionary
concepts and transformative ideas that have the power to reshape the future.

*Why to Attend TEDx CHARUSAT 2024? *

At TEDx CHARUSAT, we are curating a line-up of visionary speakers,
thinkers, and innovators who will spark your curiosity, challenge your
perceptions, and inspire your creativity. This is your chance to:

   - Explore groundbreaking innovations that are shaping the future.
   - Connect with like-minded individuals passionate about ideas that push
   boundaries.
   - Engage in thought-provoking discussions that will expand your
   worldview.

This event promises to leave you energized and enlightened, whether you are
a student, professional, or a lifelong learner. Itâ€™s not just an event â€“
itâ€™s a platform for ideas that can ignite change.

*Event Details:*

   - *Date:* September 24, 2024, Tuesday
   - *Time:* 01:00 PM Onwards

subject: Expert Session on "Untabooing Menstruation and Sanitary Pads" on 16.09.2024
snippet: Dear all, The Women Development Cell is organizing an expert session on â€œ UnTabooing Menstruation and Sanitary Pads ğŸ©¸â€ on September 16, 2024. The session is designed for university girl students,
content:
Dear all,

The Women Development Cell is organizing an expert session on â€œ UnTabooing
Menstruation and Sanitary Pads ğŸ©¸â€ on September 16, 2024.

The session is designed for university girl students, Teaching and
Non-teaching females to break the taboo around menstruation and promote
better menstrual hygiene practices.

This initiative aims to create a safe and open environment for discussing
menstrual health, combat societal taboos, and equip students with knowledge
and resources for better hygiene practices.

By fostering this understanding, I hope to encourage positive attitudes
toward menstrual health, which is crucial for young women's overall
well-being and empowerment.

Registration Link:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe7l0PF444EUiLbWDsc0wXW3SUGQtFXzSjD9SES2II1u4ztDQ/viewform?usp=sf_link

All the Female Students and faculty members are hereby requested to kindly
take the opportunity and register.


Thank you.

Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

--

subject: Fwd: Awareness Session on "UnTabooing Menstruation and Sanitary Pads "
snippet: Dear Female Students, Kindly attend ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Convener Women Development Cell CHARUSAT <convener.wdc@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Sep 13, 2024 at 1:59 PM Subject:
content:
Dear Female Students,

Kindly attend

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener Women Development Cell CHARUSAT <convener.wdc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 13, 2024 at 1:59â€¯PM
Subject: Awareness Session on "UnTabooing Menstruation and Sanitary Pads "
To: Womencell CHARUSAT <womencellmembers.charusat@charusat.ac.in>


Dear all,

The Women Development Cell  is organizing an expert session on â€œ  *UnTabooing
Menstruation and Sanitary Pads *ğŸ©¸*â€* *on September 16, 2024*. The session
is designed for university girl students, Teaching and Non-teaching females
to break the taboo around menstruation and promote better menstrual hygiene
practices.

This initiative aims to create a safe and open environment for discussing
menstrual health, combat societal taboos, and equip students with knowledge
and resources for better hygiene practices. By fostering this
understanding, I hope to encourage positive attitudes toward menstrual
health, which is crucial for young women's overall well-being and
empowerment.

 Details:


Date

*16th September, 2024*

Day

*Monday*

Time

*10:10  to 11:30*

Title of Talk

*UnTabooing Menstruation and Sanitary Pads*

Venue

*2ND Floor EE/EC building (A6)*

Invited Speaker

*Anuj Rathore*
FOUNDER and CEO of Healthy Naari

Vadodara, Gujarat, India

Objective

Understanding menstruation and its biological importance.

The myths and taboos surrounding menstruation in society.

The importance of proper menstrual hygiene and the role of sanitary pads.

Practical tips and resources for managing menstrual health.

Market product Demo

Registration link
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe7l0PF444EUiLbWDsc0wXW3SUGQtFXzSjD9SES2II1u4ztDQ/viewform?usp=sf_link


*Kindly circulate it in your respected Institute and ensure the
participation of all female participants in the event.*
*Registration is free but mandatory for all female participants.*


*Best Regards,*

*Convener, WDC*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

subject: Expert Talk on "Ethical Hacking" @ DEPSTAR â€“ Register Now!
snippet: Dear All, Greetings!!! We are going to organize an expert talk on "Ethical Hacking" by Mr. Ravikumar Paghdal. This talk is designed for anyone interested in exploring the world of ethical
content:
Dear All,

Greetings!!!

We are going to organize an expert talk on *"Ethical Hacking" *by Mr.
Ravikumar Paghdal.

This talk is designed for anyone interested in exploring the world of
ethical hacking.

The schedule is as follows:
Day and Date: *Saturday - September 21, 2024. *
Time: *09:30 am onwards*.
Venue will be communicated to registered participants.

*Why Attend?*

   1. Gain insights from an expert in the field.
   2. To keep up with the most current hacking methods, and cybersecurity
   best practices.

Registration: To participate, please register using the following link:
https://forms.gle/KXtq8ZbBxo4k2QH29

Registration is open till September 18, 2024

All registered and attendees will receive an e-certificate of participation.

We encourage all students and staff interested in this topic to join us for
this informative session. Don't miss this opportunity to broaden your
understanding and engage with cutting-edge techniques in the field.

For any queries, please feel free to contact Ms. Shital Sharma (Email id:
shitalsharma.dit@charusat.ac.in <jaypatel.dce@charusat.ac.in> | Contact:
+918140792393)

*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

--

snippet: Dear Students, Nice opportunity to showcase your ideas, more details are in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date:
content:
Dear Students,

Nice opportunity to showcase your ideas, more details are in trailing mail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 12, 2024 at 3:51â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Call to Participate in the 5th Edition of Gandhian
Engineering Idea Competition-2024
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CHARUSAT <info@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 12, 2024 at 3:35â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Call to Participate in the 5th Edition of Gandhian
Engineering Idea Competition-2024
To: Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <
principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: aiic auro <aiic@aurouniversity.edu.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 12, 2024 at 3:18â€¯PM
Subject: Call to Participate in the 5th Edition of Gandhian Engineering
Idea Competition-2024
To: aiic auro <aiic@aurouniversity.edu.in>


Respected Madam/Sir,


Greetings from AURO University, Surat, Gujarat

Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, popularly known as Mahatma Gandhi, is regarded
as the Father of Nation by Indians. The celebrations of his 155th birth
anniversary on 2nd October are less for the ceremonial significance but
more to inculcate the values, principles, patriotism and frugality in the
youth. The life and teachings of Mahatma Gandhi are still relevant today in
every sphere of life. The renowned scientist of India and a pioneer of the
Indian Innovation movement, Dr R A Mashelkar talks of a concept called
Gandhian Engineering which is basically to focus on masses from less
resources, called MLM - More from Less for More.


This concept and approach is quite important for budding entrepreneurs and
startups. Keeping this concept at the core of the heart, AURO University
has an annual event called 'Gandhian Engineering Idea Competition' open for
Sr. Secondary school students, UG, PG and Doctoral students.

AURO University is happy to announce the launch of this year's competition.
Those who want to be part of this competition can register themselves.



You have always been supportive to the startup and innovation movement in
Gujarat and India. May we request your good offices to circulate the
information about this competition to all the students/networks of your
institution/University. It is an international level competition and
participation of your institution would make a big impact.



*No Engineering or Technological background is required to participate. It
is not about competition in hard core Engineering concepts. "Engineering"
here means how do you make others' life simple and cheerful by providing
ideas which are frugal and inclusive. The ideas are accepted from any field
and from everyone (irrespective of their educational background and
certifications). *


The registration link for participation in this Competition is :


https://forms.gle/xoRZEA5iDJN2JrkU7

Last date to participate in the Competition : 25th September, 2024



Announcement of Winners : 2nd October, 2024


We will be providing cash prizes, certificates, recognition and mentoring
to the deserving ideas /innovations. We are also inviting entries for
design improvements and also in the following categories :



1. Pedagogical Innovations
2. Ideas and Innovations for implementation of NEP-2020
3. Ideas for Viksit Bharat @2047
4. Ideas and Innovations for promoting BKS (Bhartiya Knowledge System).


All students are encouraged to apply in this competition. For more details,
please refer to the attached documents.


Looking forward to your support and guidance for making this Gujarat
competition an international level competition.


with warm regards,


Team, Gandhian Engineering

AICEC

AURO University

Surat

+91 9925240386

aiic@aurouniversity.edu.in


-- 

Charotar University of Science & Technology
Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC
Accorded with Centre of Excellence by Govt. of Gujarat
Web: www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

Yuva World CafÃ© by AIESEC in VVN


The Yuva World CafÃ© is an interactive event designed to foster meaningful

subject: Re: Reg. Paperless Examination training Schedule
snippet: Dear Students, The training session for the first-semester students and third-semester D2D students will take place in Exam Hall (Block A to F) 2nd floor of the CMPICA building. Students Date Time All
content:
Dear Students,

The training session for the first-semester students and third-semester D2D
students will take place in  Exam Hall (Block  A to F)  2nd floor of the
CMPICA building.

*Students*

*Date*

*Time*

*All D2D students of 3rd semester CSPIT- DEPSTAR*

*12/09/2024*

*3:15 PM to 4:15 PM*

All first semester student of CSPIT â€“ AIML, CSPIT â€“ CE , CSPIT â€“CL,
CSPIT-CS, CSPIT-IT , CSPIT-ME and MTECH

13/09/2024

1:30 PM to 2:30 PM

*All first-semester student of DEPSTAR â€“ CE, DEPSTAR â€“ CS , DESTAR â€“IT,
CSPIT-EC and CSPIT-EE*

*13/09/2024*

*3:15 PM to 4:15 PM*

Students are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall. Mobile
phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly
prohibited within the exam hall. Bags must be left outside, and it is
mandatory to wear an ID card. Students have to take their seat in the exam
hall at least 15 minutes prior to the given time.

Please find the schedule of the training session and seating arrangement in
the attachment and let me know if you want any changes in the schedule. .


*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

*Thanks and Regards,*

*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

subject: Fwd: Participate Students for NSS Day Competitions â€“ September 16, 2024
snippet: Dear All, We are thrilled to announce that CHARUSAT will be participating in the upcoming National Service Scheme Day (NSS Day) celebrations hosted by Gujarat University, Ahmedabad. The event will take
content:
Dear All,

We are thrilled to announce that CHARUSAT will be participating in the
upcoming National Service Scheme Day (NSS Day) celebrations hosted by
Gujarat University, Ahmedabad. The event will take place from September,
22nd to 24th, 2024, with the main activities at the Senate Hall of Gujarat
University before that CHARUSAT organize competitions at university level.

*Key Details:*

   - *University Event Date:* September 16, 2024.
   - *Location:* NSS Unit, RPCP Building top floor,  CHARUSAT University.
   - *State-Level Event Dates:* September 22-23-24, 2024

To prepare for this, we will be organizing several university-level
competitions. The winners will represent CHARUSAT at the state-level event.
Below are the details and guidelines for each competition:

*Competitions:*

   1. *Essay Competition*
      - *Topics:*
         - One Nation One Election
         - Importance of Renewable Energy Source
         - National Development through Entrepreneurship
         - Srimad Bhagavad Gita â€“ The Precious Essence of Life-Making
         - Present Time Imperative Value Education
         - Clean Cyber India
      - *Rules:*
         - Duration: 1 hour
         - Essays must be written on-site.
      2. *Oratorical Competition*
      - *Topics:*
         - AI â€“ Blessing or Curse?
         - Duty of Youth for India of 2047
         - Fourth Pillar of Democracy â€“ Media
         - Character Building to Nation Building
         - Cyber Security â€“ Challenge of the Digital Age
      - *Rules:*
         - Duration: 7 minutes per speech
         - Warning bell after 5 minutes
         - Speeches can be delivered in Gujarati or Hindi or English
         - Prepare in advance, but no notes or prompts during the
         presentation.



   3. *Instrument Music Competition*
      - *Rules:*
         - Duration: 4 minutes per performance
         - Participants must provide their own instruments
         - Ensure your performance fits within the time limit.
      4. *Rangoli Competition*
      - *Themes:*
         - Sustainable Future
         - Unity in Diversity
         - National Heroes
         - Education and Empowerment
      - *Rules:*
         - Rangoli must adhere to one of the specified themes
         - Judging based on creativity and theme adherence.


*Important Notes:*

   - All competitions will be judged by expert faculty members.
   - Specific event venue details and event coordinators' contact
   information will be communicated soon.
   - Completing the participation form is mandatory for attendance. The
   deadline for submitting the form is *September 14, 2024*.
   - Mobile phones are strictly not allowed during the competition.
   - CHARUSAT ID cards must be worn at all times.


For any queries or further information, please contact:

   - *Event  Coordinator:* Mr. Kishan Patel, NSS Program Coordinator
   - *Student Coordinator:* Dhruv Rupapara (NSS EC Department) and team
   (6353933976)

Please complete the participation form via the following link:
https://forms.gle/eGEyuBYvJf4HaC6p7


prepare well and adhere to the competition rules. We look forward to your
enthusiastic participation!

Best of luck!


*Best Regards,*


*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*


Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC

www.charusat.ac.in


*P.S.* NSS Program Officers, faculty members and other staff members please
encourage students to take advantage of this opportunity. Class
coordinators and counsellors, kindly share this information with students
via WhatsApp groups and motivate them to participate.

--

snippet: Dear Students, Greetings!!! Please find the attached schedule of the Sessional Exam for the Odd semester (3rd) of AY:2024-25. You are required to : Uphold decorum in the examination hall. Keep bags
content:
*Dear Students,*

Greetings!!!

*Please find the attached schedule of the Sessional Exam for the Odd
semester (3rd) of AY:2024-25.*

*You are required to :*

   - Uphold decorum in the examination hall.
   - Keep bags outside the exam hall.
   - Wear an ID Card.
   - Report to the exam venue and take your seat 15 minutes before
   the exam time*.*
   - Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are *strictly
   prohibited *in the exam hall.

*Note*: *Seating arrangement will be shared soon*.

All the best and prepare well for your exams!


*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

--

subject: Fwd: New Schedule of WDC Expert session on "The Role of Pharmacists in Cervical Cancer Education"
snippet: Dear Female Students A Great opportunity to deepen your knowledge and make a positive impact. More details are attached in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Convener Women
content:
*Dear Female Students*

*A Great opportunity to deepen your knowledge and make a positive impact.
More details are attached in trailing mail.*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener Women Development Cell CHARUSAT <convener.wdc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Sep 10, 2024 at 11:25â€¯AM
Subject: New Schedule of WDC Expert session on "The Role of Pharmacists in
Cervical Cancer Education"
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>



The Women Development Cell (WDC) of Ramanbhai Patel College of Pharmacy
(RPCP), in collaboration with the Institutionâ€™s Innovation Council
(IIC),RPCP, CHARUSAT is organising an expert session on â€œ*The Role of
Pharmacists in Cervical Cancer Educationâ€* *on September 12, 2024*.

The *objective* of the session is to engage the students in enhancing their
knowledge and understanding of cervical cancer, promoting awareness and
advocacy, and highlighting pharmacist roles and responsibilities.

 Details:

Date

*12th September, 2024*

Day

*Thursday*

Time

*2:30 pm to 3.30 pm*

Registration link

https://forms.gle/g9U2QzTxAY2Gy2i46

Venue

*Auditorium, RPCP*

Invited Speaker

*Dr Monika Batra*
    -D.N.B ( Obstetrics and Gynaecology)
    -Fellowship in Laparoscopy
    -Fetal Medicine ( I.C.O.G)


Consultant Fetal Medicine,

Obstetrician and Gynaecologist

Batraâ€™s Hospital

Kant Arcade

Piplag Cross Road, Nadiad

Title of Talk

*The role of Pharmacists in Cervical Cancer Education*









*Registration is free but mandatory for all participants. *





*Best Regards,*

*Convener, WDC*


-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Convener ECC <convener.ecc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, 9 Sept 2024, 7:06 pm
Subject: Updated invitation to Ganesh Chaturthi Celebration 2024â€”"Vidhya
Vighnaharta".
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>, <family@charusat.edu.in
>
Cc: Pritesh Patel <priteshpatel.sports@charusat.ac.in>, Bhaskar Pandya <
bhaskarpandya.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Rasila Vala <rasilavala.gh@charusat.ac.in>,
Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>, Provost CHARUSAT <
provost@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

As we come together for the University's Ganesh Chaturthi celebration,
please find revised attached the day-wise arti schedule assigned to each
institute.

We are also pleased to invite you to join us for the *Maha Aarti* on *12th
September 2024* at *11:00 am* at the *Central Lawn, CHARUSAT University*,
followed by the *Visarjan* on *17th September 2024* from *0**4:00 pm
onwards*.

*Daily Aarti Timings*:

   - *Morning*: 8:00 am
   - *Evening*: 6:30 pm
   - *Venue*: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT University

We look forward to your active participation as we unite in prayer,
devotion, and celebration. Letâ€™s come together to invoke divine blessings
for the continued success and growth of the Charusat family.
*Note: Kindly consider the revised date of visarjan as 17th September 2024
instead of 16th September 2024 time: 04:00 pm.*

*Sorry for the inconvenience.*

Best regards,

Convener

University Level Central Students Council

CHARUSAT.

--

subject: Fwd: IBM student development program by Edunet Foundation
snippet: Thanks & Regards, Akash Patel â€‹Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research CHARUSAT, Changa. Dear Students, I hope you are
content:
Thanks & Regards,

Akash Patel
â€‹Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
CHARUSAT, Changa.




Dear Students,
I hope you are doing well  !!!!
I am writing to you on behalf of Edunet Foundation, the implementation
partner for IBMâ€™s new student developer program in India. Edunet and IBM
would like to extend an exclusive invitation to your institution to
participate in the program.
This phase of the student developer program offers your students a unique
opportunity to learn the *latest advancements in Artificial Intelligence,
through **GenAI and data science through IBM watsonx*, setting them on the
path to becoming future developers. It gives your students valuable
industry-recognized credentials and enhances their standing in an
increasingly competitive job market.

With respect to the above invitation from Edunet and IBM, we have arranged
a session on "*L**atest advancements in Artificial Intelligence,
through **GenAI and
data science through IBM Watsonx"*
*The Details of the program are as follows:*
*Date : 11/09/2024*
*Time: 1:10 AM to 4:10 PM ----3 hrs divided into*
*1. 60min of IBM-led training*
*2. 90min of self-learning on IBM SkillsBuild*
*3. 30min for further discussion and actions. *
*Topic :  1. Exploring speech-to-text using IBM watsonx.*
*2. Using generative AI for software development *
*3. Build your first chatbot.*
We believe this phase of the student developer program will greatly benefit
your students
So interested students should get registered * before 09th September 202*4
using the following link:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1oxdRuRvwn7VygxIfgzkyvT7AfSwWEwOSNr-tO2raZzg/edit


-- 
Regards:
Dr Dweepna Garg
Head Of Department & Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Contact No. : 02697-265321 (Intercom)


-- 
Regards:
Dr Dweepna Garg
Head Of Department & Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Contact No. : 02697-265321 (Intercom)

--

snippet: Dear DEPSTAR Students, It has been observed that a few students are having problems regarding Point No. F (Sahay renewal certificate from head of the institute) from your e-governance login, in that
content:
Dear DEPSTAR Students,

It has been observed that a few students are having problems regarding
Point No. F (*Sahay renewal certificate from head of the institute)* from
your e-governance login, in that regard, kindly take a note as mentioned
below.

1.  Shows less attendance in your Sahay certificate :
Please write an application to the *Respective Class Counselor *regarding
less attendance, take remarks from the class counselor as well as
*approval from
the **HOD of the Department, *and submit the hard copy at Room no. 101,
CSPIT Admin Office, EE/EC building.

2. For any problem in Sahay Certificate like -not eligible / fees not
reflected:
Please contact at Room no. 128, DEPSTAR Admin Office.


*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*

--

subject: Fwd: Samsung Prism
snippet: Dear All, Please have look of https://www.samsungprism.com/ Samsung PRISM is a program to bring together Professors, Students, and Samsung Industry experts to solve real-world problems and create
content:
Dear All,

Please have look of

https://www.samsungprism.com/

Samsung PRISM is a program to *bring together Professors, Students, and
Samsung Industry experts to solve real-world problems and create solutions
using innovative technologies*. Samsung PRISM provides an opportunity for
the students to get hands-on experience and become industry-ready. Equipped
with the learnings, the students become set to take on any challenge that
the industry has to throw at them when they join the corporate world.

*For details*
https://www.samsungprism.com/faq

Please ensure effective discussion with the students during Counselling /
Your Lab sessions about https://www.samsungprism.com/.

Internship certificate is provided by Samsung.

Input about Samsung Prism is received during a faculty board meeting from
one of the external experts.


*Thank You*

--

subject: Invitation to Ganesh Chaturthi Celebration 2024â€”"Vidhya Vighnaharta"
snippet: Dear All, We are excited to invite you all to join us in celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi, where we come together to seek Lord Ganesha's blessings for wisdom, prosperity, and success. The celebration
content:
Dear All,

We are excited to invite you all to join us in celebrating Ganesh
Chaturthi, where we come together to seek Lord Ganesha's blessings for
wisdom, prosperity, and success.

The celebration will commence with the *Aagman* (arrival) of Lord Ganesha
on *September 7th, 2024,* starting at *3:00 pm*. This year, the event is
themed "Vidhya Vighnaharta", honoring Lord Ganesha as the remover of
obstacles, especially in the journey of learning and knowledge.

*Event Details:-*

Event Date: *7th September 2024 â€“ 16th September 2024*
Arti timing:
*Morning:* 08:00 am.
*Evening:* 06:30 pm.

*Date*

*Time*

*Event*

07/09/2024

3:00 pm

Aagman (arrival) of Lord Ganesha

12/09/2024

08:00 am to 11:00 am (Katha)

11:00 am onwards (Arti)

Satyanarayan Katha & Maha Arti.

16/09/2024

04:00 pm

Visarjan

*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT University.*

We look forward to your active participation as we come together in prayer,
devotion, and celebration. Letâ€™s unite to invoke divine blessings for the
success and growth of the Charusat family.


*Registration Form:-*
Diya Decoration Form: CLICK HERE <https://forms.gle/j9ZB7hw79qSVxEhw9>

Aarti Thali Competition Form: CLICK HERE
<https://forms.gle/RPEc16dV5WALGQut5>

Poster Making Competition Form: CLICK HERE
<https://forms.gle/PLMzibKhNHvGA6SR9>

Nail art competition form: CLICK HERE
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfG6t5spnc0iS45G6BH8BsEPSe1JpBYesBQLAg-pbPSNCj-5Q/viewform?usp=sf_link>

Rangoli Competition Form: CLICK HERE
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfpvoveuOqaMXeL5-xJjfLhsdgwjzhHane3wnQoJ8d1fT9XKQ/viewform?usp=sf_link>

Dancing and Singing competition form: CLICK HERE

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Ganesh Chaturthi Celebration 2024â€”"Vidhya Vighnaharta"
snippet: Dear All, Let's Welcome Ganeshji at CHARUSAT, Join us for the celebration, more details are mentioned in trailing mail. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar
content:
*Dear All,*

*Let's Welcome Ganeshji at CHARUSAT, *

*Join us for the celebration, more details are mentioned in trailing mail.*
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 6, 2024 at 3:28â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to Ganesh Chaturthi Celebration 2024â€”"Vidhya
Vighnaharta"
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are excited to invite you all to join us in celebrating Ganesh
Chaturthi, where we come together to seek Lord Ganesha's blessings for
wisdom, prosperity, and success.

The celebration will commence with the *Aagman* (arrival) of Lord Ganesha
on *September 7th, 2024.* starting at 3:00 pm. This year, the event is
themed "Vidhya Vighnaharta", honoring Lord Ganesha as the remover of
obstacles, especially in the journey of learning and knowledge.

*Event Details:*

Event Date: *7th September 2024 â€“ 16th September 2024*
Arti timing:
*Morning:* 08:00 am.
*Evening:* 06:30 pm.

*Date*

*Time*

*Event*

07/09/2024

3:00 pm

Aagman (arrival) of Lord Ganesha

12/09/2024

08:00 am to 11:00 am (Katha)

11:00 am onwards (Arti)

Satyanarayan Katha & Maha Arti.

16/09/2024

04:00 pm

Visarjan

*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT University*

We look forward to your active participation as we come together in prayer,
devotion, and celebration. Letâ€™s unite to invoke divine blessings for the
success and growth of the Charusat family.


Regards,


*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*


Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC

www.charusat.ac.in





-- 
*Thanks and Regards,*
*RITIKA JANI.*
*Assistant Professor.*
*Department of Information Technology,*

*Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology And Research (DEPSTAR)*
*CHARUSAT, Changa.*

*"The More you Sweat in Practice the Less you Bleed in Battle"*

--

Interested students may attend the endowment chair activity.

Regards,
Rajesh Patel


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Nirav Bhatt <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 5 Sept 2024, 5:19â€¯pm
Subject: Endowment Chair Activity, AIML Department, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
To: CE <ce@charusat.ac.in>, IT <it@charusat.ac.in>, CSE CSPIT <
cse@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>, DEPSTAR IT <
depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>, AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

Greetings!!

Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Department (AIML) Department,
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT), Faculty of Technology
and Engineering (FTE), CHARUSAT is announcing *Endowment Chair*
Activity on *"Data
Science in the Age of AI: Integrating Machine Learning with Data-Driven
Decision Making"* scheduled during September 10-12, 2024. We are pleased to
host *Mr. Sanjay Vaghela, Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at IQM,
Ahmedabad. *



Mr. Sanjay Vaghela has worked as a data scientist in the renowned
industries. His area of interest is Artificial Intelligence, Machine
Learning, and Data Analytics. Participants will have the opportunity to
engage in dynamic discussions, hands-on workshops, and networking sessions
aimed at advancing our shared goals.



We invite to attend the Endowment Chair Activity as listed below. The
schedule of the Event is attached herewith, please register for interested
sessions at: *Registration Form <https://forms.gle/qDxndqNyajna3K6M7>*

--

snippet: Dear all, Interested students may participate in the competition. Regards, Rajesh Patel ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu
content:
Dear all,

Interested students may participate in the competition.

Regards,
Rajesh Patel

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 5 Sept 2024, 2:07â€¯pm
Subject: Fwd: Regarding Anveshana Competition 2024-25 for Engineering
Students through Agastya International Foundation
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Rajendra Auti <rajendra.auti@agastya.org>
Date: Thu, Sep 5, 2024 at 1:38â€¯PM
Subject: Regarding Anveshana Competition 2024-25 for Engineering Students
through Agastya International Foundation
To: raju auti <rajuauti4099@gmail.com>


Respected sir/Madam,


                  Happy to inform you Anveshana  competition for
Engineering college students, organized by Agastya International Foundation
will be held in Mumbai in jan/Feb 2025 .Maximum number of students from our
college are expected to participate in it.
                         Anveshana is one such platform where engineering
students could collaborate with high school students to create innovative
models to address real life problems.



*What Is Anveshana?*

         Anveshana, an Innovation focused initiative is organized annually
by Agastya International Foundation since 2012 in different locations.
Anveshana encourages problem-solving through innovation, fostering
creativity and critical thinking in aspiring engineers and school students.

               It engages undergraduate Engineering students and
underprivileged school students in a collaborative model to address
problems around us. It instills hands-on learning, research orientation,
and practical application of Engineering-Science concepts in addition to
fostering a spirit of mentoring.

             * Anveshana competition is completely free for all students
and registration is also free.*


*Note- 1) *The Anveshana competition is for engineering, degree and diploma
students, and the competition is free for all students.
           2) The Anveshana competition provides an opportunity for
engineering students to present their projects.
          3)The top 5 winners in the Mumbai Anveshana Competition will be
directly selected for the National Anveshana Competition to be held in
Bangalore.
          4) If there are more than 20 registrations in one of your
colleges, mini Anveshana will be conducted in your college and some
projects will be direct selection.
           5) We hope to send this information to as many engineering
students as possible.
             6) For more information be sure to call the number below.


*Last Date of Registration 30-09 2024 *


*Program Venue - Mumbai*
*About Anveshana And Registration Link-* www.agastya.org/anveshana


*About Agastya International Foundation-www.agastya.org
<http://www.agastya.org/>*


For Any Additional Info And Any queries Related Anveshana Competition Call
me.
*Mr. Rajendra Auti 7758005545.*




Thanks & Regards,
Rajendra Auti
Program Executive - Anveshana
(Maharashtra & Gujarat)
7758005545

--

subject: Tips for using your new inbox
snippet: Welcome to your inbox Find emails fast With the power of Google Search in your inbox, you can archive all your email and find it later in a flash. Your inbox stays tidy, and you never need to worry
content:
Tips for using your new inbox
[image: Gmail]

Welcome to your inbox
[image: Search]
Find emails fast
With the power of Google Search in your inbox, you can archive
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6576?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
all your email and find it
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6593?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
later in a flash. Your inbox stays tidy, and you never need to worry about
what to keep.
[image: Personalize]
Personalize Mail Server for Student of CHARUSAT Mail
Customize inbox backgrounds, email signatures, and other options in Mail
Server for Student of CHARUSAT Mail settings
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6562?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>.
Review and adjust your privacy and security settings at My Account
<https://myaccount.google.com/>.
[image: Organize]
Organize your email
You can organize email with labels
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/118708?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>,
which are like folders, but you can add more than one label to a message.
You can also use filters
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6579?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
to automatically sort and categorize messages as they come in.
[image: Social]
Chat and meet directly from your inbox
Message with contacts in Google Chat
<https://support.google.com/chat/answer/9341104?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
and start video meetings with up to 100 people in Google Meet
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/9822902?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
all without leaving Gmail.

Get training and tips
Find Gmail guides, tips, cheat sheets, help switching from MicrosoftÂ®
OutlookÂ®, and more at the Google Workspace Learning Center
<https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9259748?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
.
Visit the Learning Center
<https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9259748?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>

Happy emailing,
The Gmail Team
